full_review: So the image shows noodlers polar ink series and when I click it it still clearly says polar ink however when I got their basic brown I was confused. So I went to return it and its the basic brown image? Not sure If that's amazons fault or the seller but I'm dissapointed.For an actual review these inks are the worst for water but they work fine for copic inks. Polar inks work for both

I don’t think I have yet to write a negative review however I was in desperate need of this binder. When it arrived it was bent and ripped along one of the folds. I don’t have the time to return as I am using this to hold my 5th graders module 2 for math which if any parents knows is a huge amount of paperwork. I have used Avery in the past and it was always fine this I didn’t expect at all.

Doesn’t erase. Even after I used some elbow grease along with a microfiber cloth it’s still ‘stained’. Also, it’s fine for a flat surface but don’t try and apply to anything with an edge. It won’t stay. At all. Not even to a smooth refeidgerator surface.See pics. Very very disappointing. I agree with another reviewer that all of these can’t be legit.

Sadly I wish I had read the reviews before buying. This tape seems good, sticky, okay, but you cannot use it with any dispensers which defeats the purpose. I've tried plastic dispensers that take refills, and I've tried heavy-duty office tape dispensers, and this tape won't work with any of them. The tape will not cut with the little serrated edge of the dispensers- it stretches and stretches until it either breaks off, or you have to cut it with scissors. Don't waste your money.
The media could not be loaded.                      I am so disappointed. I bought this for my son. It came in with no ink. As you can watch in the video. For me, this is below zero for rating.

I loved the product. Easy to print on using the website and sticks well. My only reason for the low stars is because I got less than 40 labels. Couldn't return as I started using them before I realized.
This has almost no magnetic strength to to hold. Ended up gluing. Cant hold markers with its magnet either.  Have no idea how this product got a 4+ star ratings. Something fishy .
There was no ink. I had to spend more money on a better product. And I only gave it 1 star because I had to select a star In order to submit my review

Beware of hidden charges! You pay more than advertised.- I had been a customer of Phonepower for 2 years under the so called "2nd year free" plan. It's not free as advertised. You have to pay about $40 for a free service. (1st star has gone)- It says $199/year 2nd year free, but you have to pay about $240 for the first year and about $40 the second year. Do the math, you end up paying $12/mon. During 2 years, you may find better deals elsewhere.- International rates are before taxes and fees. Your final price is more than advertised. (2nd star has gone)- Had many interruptions of the service towards the end of first year. The technical service spent months to figure out the problem. Actually it was me who figured out that the adapter was defective. They blamed many other things like internet service etc. I sat down and had 3 hours long phone conversation to convince that the adapter was indeed defective. Finally got a new adapter and the service was fine thereafter.- I had a problem with a router (Asus RT-N56U); I couldn't hear inbound calls. Tech support spent hours again over the phone and finally declared the router was incompatible with their service. I figured out myself that it was a firewall setting that blocked inbound sound.- After 2 year they want me to continue with higher rate. They (also other companies) are more interested in attracting new customers than keeping the existing customer, a stupid move. (3rd star has gone)- All in all, I do not recommend this as the primary line for your house. The call quality was good with few exceptions. International call quality is not as good as local or national. Also, be aware of so many hidden charges.

Have to say I really liked the product and didn’t have any issues with the pen itself not writing correctly. I genuinely really liked the pen itself but it ended in sad day however ☹️After only about 2 weeks when I realized the pen itself was lost. I did happen to notice that the pen was extending on its own on my key chain and had to keep pushing it back together periodically throughout the day to secure it. I didn’t really think much of it because it did appear to be hanging on the cap fairly well so just assumed the pen just gets pulled down as I walk and keys are rubbing on it. Then one day I get home from work and as I’m putting my keys down I notice that just the cap of the pen is all that remains.Really sucks too, I really loved the little pen and wish I could write a better review but unfortunately I cannot do so when the pen went missing after just 2 weeks. Very disappointed and don’t recommend to buy pen when it pops off the cap so easily.

I bought these a few months ago at a retailer. But I'm leaving a review here to warn others not to buy! When I first opened the package on 3/4 markers worked. I had already thrown the receipt away an a couple of weeks had passed so I couldn't return them. Then a week after that only 2/4 worked. Now, just a few months later and with minimal use, none of them write. It's so frustrating to spend your hard-earned money on a product that's poorly made. Don't waste your money on this company's product. Other people have clearly had the same issue so it's obvious they've done nothing to address this.

I am not a fan of pens that try to recreate the beauty of a fountain pen. However,  I've been a fan of Parker ball point pens for 50+ years. In the case of the Parker Reflex Pen, I am at best luke warm. The pen writes great and more than meets my needs as a note taker and signing pen. However, the pen loses the neatness test. I've had this same problem with pens form other manufacturers. The problem is the seepage of ink from the ink cartridge around the pen tip. Please refer to the pictures I provided with this review. In this case,  I am rooting for Parker that this is a fluke and the rest of the production run was OK.

Honey- Cannot-Do. Assembled cart, no problem. Took it to the supermarket for the first time. I have a twelve step climb to my house. By the time I got there, the wheels were out of whack, the axle was bent and the cart was coming apart. I should of romer foread the reviews before I bought this piece of crap. I have been an amazon customer for years. Surprised they let this junk slip by.

I ordered this on Amazon and for some reason, my T50 3/8" staples would not come out when operating.  It made an impressive SNAP, as if it wanted to work, but it was almost like the staples were too fat to be pushed out or something (which of course is not the case, as they are within spec of the stapler, and are Arrow brand themselves).I originally started to order a replacement, but needed the stapler that day.I triple checked everything just to make sure I wasn't doing something dumb, but definitely loaded the staples properly (from the bottom of the stapler, facing outward, not on the rail (of course) like the directions say) To further reinforce not doing something boneheaded, the Bostitch stapler/brad combo I picked up at Lowe's worked flawlessly.  That particular model isn't on Amazon, or I'd link to it and review it as well.I give the product two stars as I didn't give it a second chance due to my time constraints, as I truly do conclude it was a lemon based on the reviews.  Otherwise I would give it one star.  Frankly, first time operation is part of what determines a product's rating, so a trend of "the first one didn't work" should be noted.  Of course it happens...no hard feelings toward the company.  Sort of like when GE wised up that their first-gen hybrid water heaters had some horrible quality control in China...moved production back to US.  I digress.  But you get my point.Of course, Amazon makes it fairly painless either way to obtain RMA, shove it in a box and drop off at UPS location.
I wish I could give it Zero Stars! Its a complete FAKE version of the cards, they are all the 2012 Holiday Cards duplicated on cheap paper... DO NOT BUY!
The adhesion is TERRIBLE, as other reviews have posted out. The paper is thin - don’t expect anything sturdy. Would not recommend.

Despite other reviewers mentioning the ink did not work with their HP 6310 all in one printers I decided to give this a try because it was so inexpensive. Unfortunately, same story for me. The black ink came through ok but the color was terrible.

I bought these pens for my current college quarter and have used the black ink pen the most. They write as described and I actually liked writing with them but the tip of my black pen has shortened to the point that I can no longer write with it. It actually only lasted exactly 17 pages of writing. (I wasn't expecting for the tip to shorten... I was actually thinking that It would either run out of ink or the ink might dry up after a while before anything else). Two stars for being nice pens and good for drawing and writing but ... they don't seem to last. I wish it had more black ink pens than just one.
Never got it...it was sent to the wrong address and disappeared :( Charges were reversed and an email sent to me to appologize, that's why the 2 stars. I appreciate that Amazon did what they could:)

read the review guys. the tip shakes like crazy. i bought a silver one too but the silver one shook much less but the tactility of the press was different. i geuss theres not much quality control for the price of these.
This is how bad the template is off for these labels. Not bent but they clearly aren’t reading their reviews. I thought for they would have fixed the issue.

The idea is nice, but the execution is lacking. I lost the first one because I didn't seat the cap all the way, or so I thought. I bought a second and used the cap from the first one, the second pen came off some where. I can't rule out user error could have played a part in my pens going missing, hence two stars. If you are fastidious with this you will probably be fine, but I found a small pen with a good clip is much better. Like this one:https://smile.amazon.com/Zebra-SL-F1-Ballpoint-Silver-BA55-S/dp/B003G0YWJ6/ref=pd_cart_rp_1_2?_encoding=UTF8&pd_rd_i=B003G0YWJ6&pd_rd_r=YMTBGMA19X74KN0MZBG1&pd_rd_w=xqpxm&pd_rd_wg=krDyf&pf_rd_i=cart-page-widgets&pf_rd_m=ATVPDKIKX0DER&pf_rd_p=3457867853211955575&pf_rd_r=YMTBGMA19X74KN0MZBG1&pf_rd_s=cart-page-widgets&pf_rd_t=40701&refRID=YMTBGMA19X74KN0MZBG1&th=1

I bought these pens after reading the positive reviews.  The ink in nearly HALF of my pens does not flow.  The nubs of the defective pens scratch the writing surface due to their extra fine points.  Even the pens that write reasonably well will not write at high speed because the ink skips unevenly.  I would urge anyone purchasing these pens to test each pen during the 30 day period so you won't forego the right to return them, or consider buying a regular nub vs. extra fine.  I need the extra fine point for detail work but it doesn't work for speed writers like me.

The coin is okay but not as pictured. VERY DISAPPOINTED! I thought this coin was going to come with a nice card as per reading other reviews and noticing it in the photo. I don't always base my idea of what is coming by only the photo but TWO reviews specifically stated the coin came with the card. Now, I need to have someone purchase a card to present this to my hubby for our anniversary. I am recovering at home from surgery and no way to travel. Thought this would be the solution to both a card and sweet gift. The coin came loose in a huge box buried under another item. It was in a little plastic bag. No care involved with the idea pictured or the packing. Good thing I noticed it! I would have bought more for other relatives, but after the condition it which it arrived... sorry no more purchases.

We needed to replace an X-Acto model which died after five years of service.  Decided to try AFMAT brand and now sorry that I did.  Although design is attractive, out-of-the-box our motor stopped running before the pencil was sharp so not an overheating issue.  Suspect a defective sensor, switch, and/or motor.  The variable sharpening feature with three settings is innovative, but the top mounted switch is flimsy and can easily change from one setting to another if you brush your hand anywhere close to it.  More positive "click stops" for each setting would have been better.  Returned this one and will most likely go back to using an X-Acto brand.I'm upgrading my review because the seller made a prompt and sincere effort to replace the product under warranty.  As a result, I would not hesitate to use this seller again.  In the end; however,  this product failed to meet my expectations for functionality and quality control.
The pen kept popping out of the cap that holds it to the keychain - I lost it in under a month. I would give it 1 star but it worked well as a pen, just not as a keychain.

I am disappointed in this product. While the reviews on here seem great, the folders I ordered were not what I was expecting. The print is blurry and smudged. I can't tell if these are knock-offs or not but my set was just not worth the money.Giving it 2 stars because I am still using them ( I didn't want to be wasteful) and I do like that they provide a lot of space... I just wish that the print was more clear and precise.

I really should have read the reviews.  It's junk and I can't believe I paid $20 for this piece of cr*p. It won't even hold the push pins because it's so thinly made.  There's a paper thin piece of cork board with a piece of cardboard in back. Worse thing I've ever bought.

holy moly... do not buy!!! not worth it. bought it reading at the reviews.. most of these reviews are lies... there should be no reason for this pen to cost this much and have this high of a rating,... the only thing about this pen is the durability... the ink keeps blending out... the end where you write from, the place where the ink comes out, has an opening so big that every time i lift my pen off the paper and put it down again for another letter, i get clicking sounds every 1 second.

Every single cartridge, upon opening the orange tab, leaked ink everywhere. Now it's on my hands, my clothes, my desk, and my carpet. I'll be going with OEM in the future. Gave 2 stars because, after cleanup, they actually worked in my printer.

I was looking for a clear standard size clipboard, when I happened across this one.  I wasn't sure about the "flat clip" design, but I decided to give it a try.The pros:+ Low cost, $3.99 with free shipping, when I bought mine.+ Good product reviews.+ Clear, modern looking acrylic board.+ Imprinted ruler.  Inches on the right side & centimeters on the left side.The cons:- The plastic wrapper is difficult to remove, especially around & under the clip.- No place to clip a pen or pencil, like on a traditional clipboards.- The paper isn't clipped flat to the board, but is raised about an 1/8th of an inch at the flat clip.  This is due to the design of the "flat clip"- The hanging tab hole is too small & the tab rattles when using the clipboard... very annoying!  I decided to cut it off! :(Closing thoughts:I thought this updated design would be an improvement, but I was wrong.  I've since ordered this clipboard:  Sparco Transparent Plastic Clipboard, 9 x 12-1/2 Inches, Clear (SPR01860)  It costs a bit more, but it has the traditional clip with a larger hanging hole. :)

Amazon needs to add a ZERO star rating.  The wifi/ethernet connection started to be intermittent after a year (from several different computers and operating systems).  It no longer prints reliably.  If I could return it I would as well as trying to get my money back for the number of expensive ink cartridges trying to get this piece of garbage to work.
Doesn’t work - not sure why there are so many positive reviews.  Total scam.
Misleading photo. Thought I was getting three. The more reviews like this, the more likely the seller is going to keep the 3 notebook photos in his sales gimmick as it generates sales.

I really want to love these pens. I bought a bunch of them in various colors and used them for all of my writing at school and at work. I like the line they put down and that the ink doesn't smear when my hand moves across the page (I'm left-handed).There are two issues I have with the Sharpie Pens, though. The first one is the flaking of the barrel. The silver finish on the barrel flakes off and goes everywhere. It is all over the inside of the pen pocket in my backpack, it gets on my hands and face, and it gets on my paper. This is annoying, but I am willing to live with it because the pens write nicely.The second problem is the leaking. This is the problem that takes these pens to a 1-star rating for me. I didn't have any problems in the winter, but the weather here just warmed up and all of my Sharpie Pens began to leak on the same day. The ink leaks all over my hands and my desk. I had to throw the whole lot of them away. These were my favorite pens, but I can't have pens that only work during cold months. I will be looking elsewhere for my new go-to pen.

I should have read the other reviews more closely... Love the fine tip, but no ink comes out! They worked great the first time, and now it seems they are dried out or do not work when writing horizontally on a wall. I only used the pink one a couple times and now it doesn't write at all. These were a waste of money and I will never buy again. So disappointed.

Update: B504 errorI bought these because, well, Canon ink is too expensive. I read the reviews, and I also believed, naively, the advertising that said the product had colors that would look just like the original ink. The black is reasonably dark, but the colors are washed out compared to the original cartridges. The Canon ink has a rich, organic look. The ink does not dry as fast as the original, either. Having said that, there's not a lot of chemical smell from the Kingway ink, and the colors are not as bad as some replacement cartidges I have used. So, perfectly fine, but don't expect great color.

I had previously given a similar review and the company in there attempt to console me sent me 2 more small plastic baggies with not "4-Strips" as it says but 3 and these are 1 - 3/8" long. They are the heavy duty 3M type of Velcro strip but again, who would knowingly buy 3 small strips??? Not me. And to send me 2 tiny bags of 3 and not 4 as the ad says........By the way, thank you for the additional strips and the feeble attempt change my review, I am simply being honest. Nothing wrong with selling 3 little strips but make that really clear in your advertisement and don't say "4-Strips" and then send only 3. Not ok.

I've been experiencing the dreaded symptoms of carpal tunnel & decided I needed to quickly remedy the situation.  I've just been using a regular, cheap, mouse pad without any padding.  I like to simplify, so after carefully reading over the reviews, chose this product.  It arrived today, & I'm telling you the truth, my wrist was on it for mere minutes when it began aching & burning.  The padding is just too hard, not at all soft like the advertisement said--the rolled sock I'd been using felt better.  And I was disappointed that the platform was some sort of hardwood that prevented the mouse from rolling smoothly. I'm sending it back for a refund.

These markers have bold colors and write very well, but they are not washable and have limited color palette.  I guess since they are crayola I thought they were geared towards children and therefore would be washable...but I was wrong. It will not come off of clothing, a stuffed animal, or upholstery.  Sad, because no other markers have such strong colors with low odor, but until these issues change, 2 stars.

I use the scales to weigh pen pal letters. I originally gave these scales a good review.  It has now turned totally bad.  I have not been able to use the scales after the first use.  The digital display has went crazy.  It will not zero out.

Basically painful to sit in for more than an hour after the first 10 hours of use. Backing mesh stretched and lumbar support is not padded. After one day of use, you will need to tuck a pad or foam into the seat, like other reviewers have noted, or you will have a hard plastic “lumbar” support that is sharp in your back.Within a six months all of the foam was flattened in the arm rests and then the arms themselves will start to back out of the assembly and wobble around. After six months of wobbling they break off.This is not a good product and I would not recommend it to anyone.

I very seldom write a review but I must admit I do read them on products. These print cartridges are a 50/50 crap shoot, the first ones I got worked fine the next order they would only print a very faint image of the picture and black print and before you ask no these were not used and re-boxed. I emailed GPC and got a reply telling me to clean the contacts with a eraser and send them the Amazon order #, I had already cleaned the Ink ports with their included alcohol cleaning pad.  I did all that GPC asked and still the same faint picture and letters I emailed them back and said that it was still the same, I waited for a reply for almost a week and GPC never replied again. To add salt to the wound of this order I bought them for $24.95 and Amazon only credited me $19.99. So think about the time to mess around defective ink cartridges, the GPC email failure, taking them back to UPS and loosing $5.00, do yourself a favor and by another brand.

I bought this item because it received a lot of good reviews. It is comfortable and does not generate much heat, but perhaps this item is just not for me. The way it is designed, my wrist sits higher than I'd like to. It's difficult to maneuver my mouse when my wrist sits so high. It would be nice if I could have a way to take out some of the filling to adjust the height without tearing or cutting into the fabric.

Product: The wheels are plastic, and overall it is flimsy. I didn't give it a one star because the cart DOES work as a cart.Seller: The shipping was very fast. And the seller packaged the product very well. I would buy from this seller again.

Made in China/Japan and the quality shows this time around. As an avid "pen person" I have to admit that this pen us very cheaply made, its cartridges difficult to load and when depressed to write, most of the colors don't stay down low ng enough to write and pop back up.Unfortunately I relyed on the previous rave reviews I read but I will not purchase these ever again!  (Especially since they have a "no returns" policy and don't even offer a replacement). Garbage product.

One arrived with glue between two of the felt lengths on the eraser side. It still erases but I wonder if, in time, it will end up scratching our white/chalk boards? There's no way to remove the glue, it's solid. It's a shame. They're the perfect length and erase well. However, it's pretty expensive when you end up with only one good one. As for recommending? I'd say, it's a coin toss. Maybe you'll get two good ones, or maybe you'll pay this price and only get one that's useful. Unless they're deliberately trying to get rid of a stock of errors in manufacturing, surely every order wouldn't contain one flawed & one usable eraser? I'd give it 2 1/2 stars if I could, since I got half of 2.

I should have listened to some of the other reviews. This was not worth the trouble. It did slice open envelopes well, but even with trying to shake the letter contents to the bottom of the envelope, the opener still would slice through several letters out of each morning’s mail. I spent more time taping letters back together that this was a big pain and no time saver at all. Unfortunately, I waited too late to try to return it, so it was a total waste of money!

First time buyer of Noodler's.  I have used fountain pens for 50+ years.  Not the best ink for me. Going back to my old brands.  I do want to note that customer service is excellent though.Edit: 5 months later.  I dropped the rating.  I can't live with the nib creep in my Lamys, Parker or Waterman.

I'm extremely disappointed.  I ignored the bad reviews and took a chance.  I ordered these at the end of July, 2019 and installed them approximately the first week of August.  I am NOT a heavy printer user, and have printed MAYBE 50 sheets total of mostly black ink.  Today, 10/25/19, not even 3 months later, and now the ink will NOT work.  Now the printer gave an error that said the ink cartridge has failed.  WASTE OF MY MONEY.  Never again.

When i received this bell product the size of it made me feel terrible. This bell is great for a child's tricycle or even a baby carriage! When i installed it on a metal main door it barely rang. The dog sleeping nearby never woke up! When i showed it to everyone all they did was start laughing!. The joke is on me. I should have listened to all the other 1 star reviews!

Very bad printer.  It was new just out of the box...I just inserted ink cartridges..it displayed the 2 error codes mentioned in other reviews. If you dont believe me google it.... you will realize this printer does not worth your attention.

I purchased this unit in June 2015 for light home use. Now 17 months later (out of warranty), the dreaded "0x97" printer code has started appearing on every print attempt. This printer has printed less than 1,400 sheets. Very disappointing. I've tried the various "fixes" suggested on user forums, but to no avail. The "scan-to-memory-device" function continues to work well.Prior to the "0x97" problem, I probably would have given it three stars, mostly because it never did print color very evenly and the replacement cartridges are pretty pricey.Bottom line:  This was my first and last Epson printer purchase.
Love the black ones. You can write on thin paper such as the one they use to make Bibles and it won’t bleed through. I didn’t get the green sharpie tho so 1 Star for you losers
I should have trusted the reviews.  Don't buy it.

I bought this based on a suggestion from a friend that swears by his. Setup was easy but, it works only part of the time. I insert a document and then most of the time I have to reinsert the document because I am getting the no paper detected alert. Even though that is a pain, the software is easy to use and I can work with it. The software wants you to purchase a cloud plan to backup and enable features on the iphone app. I don't care about cloud backup or iphone features, because I use the scanner to report incoming checks and record expenses at my desk in my office and backup to an external hard drive. I did not extend the paid plan support after the trial has ended. I even have to opt out of the many reminder emails from Neat which is quite annoying. Now here comes the part that makes me angry: My older macbook pro dies. I have a backup of my neat software from my external hard drive and I think I'm in the clear. I buy a new macbook and install the neat software but when I log into the new software and enter my old login info, It says my Neat plan has expired. It seems my only choice... is to purchase a cloud plan from Neat and I am unable to open the program and can't get past the log in / purchase a plan screen. I take a few breaths, let's work the problem. I go to the Neat website and guess what?!!! I can not call for support, because you have to pay for extended service nor can I live chat with someone because (you guessed it) you have to pay for extended service. I will email the support link, it is free surprisingly.I would not recommend this unless you are willing to buy an expensive scanner then continue to pay for the honor of using the Neat software and pay additionally for customer support other than by email.I am giving this 2 stars because it will work and the software is easy to use, but I am not recommending this because of the lack of unpaid customer support and seeming greediness of the Neat company. NeatDesk Desktop Scanner and Digital Filing System- Macintosh- (Certified Refurbished)

I dislike giving negative reviews, but one of the main criteria I use when deciding on a purchase are the ratings provided by other customers. So, I think it's only fair to express an honest opinion regarding the items I buy, in the event it helps someone else. The greeting cards I received after placing this order are disappointing. In the photos provided, the reindeer appears to be red. On the actual card, the color is a dull burgundy (and I realize computer monitors can affect this aspect). I missed the fact that the texture is glossy, as it looks more parchment-like in the image and this was entirely my oversight. The description indicates the cards are printed on heavy stock. At best, this is medium-grade. Overall, the impression these cards give is similar to that of some I saw recently at the local Dollar Store. And, those were priced significantly less. Just not good quality merchandise.

I was so excited about this. I ordered two, one for me and one for my husband for our home offices.  The fact that it holds so few staples wouldn't have lost any stars but the mechanism inside bent the first time I closed it. It won't staple at all. My husband tested his out immediately after, putting even less staples in and it won't even close let alone staple. These are super cute. But what we got was two non-functional dragon paper weights.  Wholely disappointed. Wasted money.

DON'T BUY THIS PRINTER!!!!  If you want to print on anything but plain paper this printer is not for you.  You *might* get it to print on other than plain paper if you get the correct paper settings.  Otherwise the printer will refuse to pickup the paper, meaning it won't load it from the tray.  Really???  It should pick up any paper from the tray regardless of settings.  Want to print photos, forget it.  I've tried every setting and it will not pick up photo paper (Kodak Ultra Premium Photo paper).  For the money this printer is garbage.  I should have tried to print all media while still within the return period.  Now I'm stuck with this piece of junk.  The would be 9 stars if I had the option.

I wish I could leave 0 stars.  When I got the pen I went to write with it and the ink cartridge pushed back into the pen so I can't write with it.  I tried to return it and it's not even returnable.  What a tip off don't get it!!

I bought these after reading a raving review online about how smoothly they write.  They do write smoothly...when they write.  The ones I purchased would just stop writing for unknown reasons.  I've gone back to using the Pilot Acroball pen for my handwriting needs.

I hate leaving negative reviews but this was completely unable to support my filing cabinet. It crumbled under the weight and this was an empty cabinet, fresh out of the box.Maybe I didn't mount the cabinet right (I had help), maybe there was a particular way to do it. If there was, it didn't come in the box with the dolly.I didn't return it because I had already gotten rid of the box and it wasn't worth the effort at that time. Still, I'm out $30 and I had to place my filing cabinet without the ability to move it easily.
Disgusting the way those rubber bands broke when used on my head. They must have been dry rated. I had to throw them out.

I am very disappointed with this purchase of this chair. The chair does not have a lot of cushion at al for the price I paid. I really feel ripped off! The assembly was a tad bit difficult due to the screws not lining up and also there’s a lot of imperfections as seen in my photos. The chair is beautiful by sight  but that’s all. The chair is not comfortable. Shame, shame shame I had high hopes even after the other bad reviews. I do not recommend any one to purchase if you don’t want to be upset and waste money.
I should have read the reviews...It is not a business card holder. It probably a soap dish or something... look elsewhere

If I could give this mounting tape zero stars I would.  First trying to get the red "label" of the tape is very difficult. Second it won't  even hold a very light weight light to the underside of a cabinet. I have used almost the whole roll trying to get it to stick but it keeps falling down.  Good thing I haven't put anything breakable on the top shelf my cabinet it would have been broken by now with how many times the lights have fallen off.

Every single pen dried up after just sitting at my desk for 4 weeks. (AC runs daily) I used them once to test the colors and they were great. The colors were very bright just like the reviews. I put them aside to save them for fall semester. I decided to take them out and use them last night (almost 5 weeks later) and every single one is completely dry. I cannot use them at all. I tried to scratch at paper with them for a while and a little color would come out of a couple of them, but then turn dry again. The opportunity to return them has passed. It's too bad because I really like this product.  I will have to shop for them somewhere else now. $12 for pens that you can only use one time is not worth it!

I am a huge fan of this product, but ever since I switched to the 2" rings, I have had nothing but trouble. Pages get ripped out trying to open and close the binder. It is not well constructed and a bit flimsy. I wanted to wait before writing a full product review, and unfortunately, these are not great. I would recommend buying the binder set, hole puncher, and all that, but definitely not these rings.

This is the only bad review I've ever had to write. The company I work for bought this printer for me. If I would have looked into it myself, I would have seen the bad reviews for this model and selected something different. Setup was easy. Printer worked for a couple months then black clogged. Cleaning solved the issue for a couple weeks, then it occurred again. I went through several cartridges while repeating cleaning cycles (which consumes a lot of ink) and it never got much better. And, ink can only be ordered online - not available at Best Buy, Office Depot, or anywhere I looked. I was then shipped a replacement machine, but continued to have the same problems. Ink constantly leaking and creating a mess. I'm now convinced I just have to throw away my hundreds of dollars of ink ($140 just for of each cartridge!) and get a different model printer, probably going to get a different brand also... Anyway, if you buy this machine, I hope you have better luck than I did.

Junk!!!  I only gave one star because I can’t give zero. They are so small. I didn’t know there would be emoji stickers stuck to the top of white push pins. All of the stickers are falling off!! So cheap Thank god I can  send them back for free. Unreal!  Not worth $9.99 at all!!!!!

Yes it is FAST.  Copy color is accurate but ink cartridges are TINY and will run out faster.  Copy quality is good but I was expecting a little more from other reviews.  Noisy as heck.  Asks too many questions  Layout?  document size?  Preview?  Has great difficulty in recognizing it's own ink cartridges, tells me to re- install.  Also tells you  'paper does not match'  meaning you have to select not only paper type on your computer but the printer as well.  I found if I use another photo printer program, I don't get that message at all.  Also get operation is invalid.  Why can't this just be easy,  make a printer with fat ink cartridges and either it's a photo or document.  I wanted fast copies,  I got it.
BEWARE. Do not buy this cart. We are returning it. Reviews are right - impossible to assemble, wrong parts likely sent. Don't waste your money and time on this total crap.

These replacement cartridges were actually very easy to install.  The printer recognizes they are not certified HP ink cartridges but with the right settings will allow you to print.  I managed to print for about 2 weeks (only a couple dozen pages) until the Magenta blocked up my printer head.  I bought a certified HP replacement cartridge to try to fix the issue, but the printer head magenta was completely blocked up.  I bought a printer head cleaning kit to fix it - managed to unblock the magenta - but the printer head isn't printing correctly.  Finally managed to get everything straightened to test again, and now the cartridges are depleted.  After only printing about a dozen pages.  Regret buying these so much...  You can save 70 dollars off a full set of certified HP ink, but then you'll have to spend 200 on a new printer head for a printer that doesn't cost much more than that to begin with.Incredibly disappointing, huge waste of money, I saw some bad reviews and took a chance anyway.  For the love of money, and your printer please heed my warning - avoid this ink.

Do not buy this printer.  I've never taken the time to write a review before, but decided to do it in this case because of how shoddy this product is.  The print quality is very low and it has constant technical problems (e.g, I just spent the past hour on the phone with Epson because the machine would only print blank pages).  Even when the product is under warranty, Epson will not allow you to return the item for a refund, so if problems start happening after Amazon's 1-month return policy, you're out of luck.  I thought about donating it to a non-profit, but I don't want to pass along the trouble that this printer has been.  Instead I'm going to just run out the ink that's left (assuming it doesn't start spitting out blank pages again) and then toss it.  This printer is a real disappointment.
I love these pens. only giving one star because 3 of my pens from a dozen pack were missing.
Bought three of these and only one will stay closed once zipped the other two are trash . What a waste of money I should have went by the other reviews that mentioned the same thing.

I am a restaurant owner, so in the years of doing business, i had a few high quality conterfeit bills saved for amusement. When iput them to the test, according to the detector, they all pretty real. I think this detector is only good for low level counterfeits, but idont even need a machine for those low quality ones, i can tell just by touching them. I am sorry but this detector is no use to me,people with no skill at all might find it useful somehow, that is why i gave it 2 stars.

This does not seem like a secure way to keep your keys. I didn't realize this until I read the directions to set the code. you can't use a number more than once in your code which really limits your ability to choose a secure code. In addition, say your code is 1-2-3-4-5... well the box opens no matter what order your put these numbers in. So if you press 5-4-3-2-1 it works... 1-4-2-5-3 it works, etc.Other than this, the box itself seems sturdy. This is the only reason I give it as much as two stars.

I really wanted to like this pen based on the reviews.The pen price is great.The pen appearance handsome.The pen feels great....has a nice weight.Why did I gave it one star?When writing, the nib lays so much ink onto the paper .....it's almost as if there isn't any flow control. Blotchy. The nib is extremely 'wet" (the feed is totally soaked.)Consequently........unusable.Nice looking paper weight.

Absolute Rubbish, totally ruined my chunky make-up pencil, I had to replace it which cost me far more than the pencil sharpener, so ended up well out of pocket ! Threw it straight in the bin. Bought one from Boots for £2 which works fine. Wouldn't even give it 1 star if that was an option

This is the worst piece of junk I ever bought.  I bought it today and it is going in the trash today.  After over an hour of trying to assemble this piece of junk, I give up and it's going in the trash.  You snap one side in and the other side comes out and the whole thing falls apart.  Would it have been so difficult for the manufacturer to drill a couple of holes in the side piping to snap the ends of the shelves into?  The makers of this piece of junk should be ashamed of themselves.  A complete waste of money.  I will never buy another Whitmor product again.  I work too hard for my money to throw it away.  The only reason this even got one star is because you can't choose zero stars, but for the record, it deserves a zero.
I should have read the reviews before I purchased.  This is a sticker and not a sign!  I can't believe I paid $9 for this thing...

They do not look at all as the photo. They are translucent green, so I cannot say it is the same product, regardless of how they perform. I cannot review if I am not sure it is the same thing, right? As promised, quick and fast.
thin and incredibly flimsy. cover is thin and more foldable than a walmart notebook. entire book is incredible thin. imported low quality product. possible fake reviews

I received it, made two adorable labels, and then the thing stopped feeding the ribbon through. It will still emboss, but it dents the whole ribbon terribly and stamps each letter upon the last. It worked for literally five minutes before it gave up the ghost. I’ve tried to coax it back to life, but my efforts have been fruitless.  I should have taken the reviews more seriously.
Does not fit HP Laser Jet P1102W. If I could give neg. stars I would

Well, I don't often leave bad reviews unless it's justified. The cards are thick stock and cute enough design, but the envelopes were creased and mangled in production. Obviously no Quality Control before shipping out.  Returned.  Lame return options.

The stitching around the gel pad busted open within 1 week.  I did not bend it or do anything to cause this, the stitching and quality was just poor.  I gave it 2 stars because while it was intact it was comfortable and I liked that it has a nonslip surface on the bottom, but yeah.... it didn't end up working out which was a bummer.

I would give this product no stars if I could. While the product came on time, the plate was glued on crooked. I was not offered a resolution to correct the situation. It’s an embarrassment to display and I would never buy this product again.

I love the paper blank notebooks.  The reason for a 1 star review is that the seller lists this product as 9.7 x 1.1 x 5.9 inches.  It is not.  It's is 7" x 5".  If you like the smaller format notebook, than this would be fine, but it is not what is advertised.

I wanted to replace my over 20 year old telephone table from back in the days when all phones were wired. I really like the look of this table, but reading the reviews I knew this was going to be a hit or miss purchase. Even some reviewers that gave positive reviews had some issues. I figured I'll take a chance and give it a shot. Well it was a miss for me. There were some minor issues with the finish but they were not that noticeable if you were not looking for them. Some people say the table is flimsy. I disagree. The wood is pretty heavy and it's sturdy. The instructions are basically just diagrams, but not too difficult to figure out. The main problem is with the workmanship. Some of the parts do not align properly. Some parts are probably not cut to the correct size. I'm the guy people come to to put stuff together so I know how to do this. Rarely do I run into something where the fit and finish is so bad. My biggest problem was that the front legs where the bottom shelf connected were too far apart. There was a gap where you could see the wood dowels between the legs and the shelf. Because of that, the drawer would not fit properly. The rails on the side panels were too far apart for the grooves on the drawer. So the drawer would just fall to the floor. I read reviews with the opposite problem of the drawer being too tight. There is no contact number for the company that sell this in the paperwork, only a fax number to order missing parts. I did find the number via Google. They were friendly but had no solutions. If for the fact that I don't want to take this thing apart and try to stuff it all back in that box, it would be going back to Amazon. And I really do like the look. So I jerry rigged it so the drawer would stay in by connecting two 24" zip ties together and pulling the side panels closer together. It doesn't look pretty and I'm disappointed I had to do it but it worked. Maybe I'll think of a better solution later on. Anyway the pictures will show how I resolved the problem. Only reason I don't give it 1 star is because it looks so much nicer than the table it replaces.
Echoing some of the other review comments: Kinda like the visual aspect of the product, but the fact having a electronic screwdriver is a must is so stupid to put it together, honestly, why??

So the product came in on time and shipping was perfect. The reason I am giving this a 1 star rating, simply that you cannot read the hours in sunny conditions.  Plus the "Open" sign is hard to read in sunny conditions as well.Please note this on the product page as you cannot read any of the display when the sun is out.Very disappointing as a store owner.

I bought this at TJMAXX today for $12.99 and plan to return it tomorrow. Seriously, it's a piece of junk. It should not be difficult to put together a tiny cart with three simple baskets, but it's a nightmare. My brother-in-law is an engineer and he's making me return it lol It's incredibly flimsy. As soon as you hang one basket another one slips off and collapses. Don't waste your $$. Like one of the other reviews mentioned - Whitmor should have drilled a few holes in order to attach the baskets. It would've been more functional that way. I wish I read these reviews before I bought it!!!! Oh well, it'll be returned :)

Great printers while they last. Expect to buy a new one every year. Disposable. Expensive ink.Update: 07/27/2017I've changed my rating from 3 stars to 1 star because I have had nothing but trouble out of this (2nd one) Epson WorkForce WF-3620. The print heads clog constantly, quality of output is unacceptable, it constantly drops off the network and for some reason it prints random lines (like an EKG) through-out the print. The reason I bought this 2nd one is because we had just bought so much new ink ($150 worth) for the 1st one in anticipation of it being around a while. That was just before that one started giving us trouble. We used up that new ink with this 2nd printer and then stupidly bought $150 more thinking the 2nd printer would last. It gave us 6 months of good use but now it is going out like the 1st one and we have new ink just sitting there. I will not buy another one of these junk printers. I will be looking at laser printers soon and this Epson inkjet will be in the trash. My advice is for everyone to stay away from these things.

I am very disappointed in this corkboard, especially considering the price. I had hoped it would be sturdier, considering it was pretty pricey for such a small board. Unfortunately for me, the most recent reviews had been positive so I missed the reviews about how poor quality it is.I cannot mount it to my wall as closely as I would like as all my pushpins simply go right through and would damage the paint. Very disappointing.
You dont have to be a genius to figure out that the video review above was written by the manufacturer. Take a look at the other reviews they have submitted. It's shameless and pitiful.

My husband has a serious disability , I bought this device for him to alert me as he cannot talk anymore or walk etc  when he needs help for when I am not in the same room as him  This terrible device is only good if you are a metre  away from the transmitter.  I feel ripped off . No stars given. But I had to give 1 other wise it would not submit.
I bought this based on reviews and it could not cut straight, paper was frayed and the little orange handle kept coming off.  It was cheap for a good reason.

Bought these for my dymo LW550.  What a disappointment.  They wouldn't even recognize when loaded into the printer.  Contacted dymo support and was informed these were old stock and don't work in the new label writers.  I'd give zero stars if I could as this was a complete waste of money.  🤬

I really like the look of these pens. I got one from a dollar store and gave it to my granddaughter. She loved it and uses it all the time. Then my grandson wanted one so I looked to amazon. I saw this set of 8. They look exactly like the one I had. Despite the multitude of negative reviews, which mostly reported gems falling out and things I felt I could fix, I made the purchase. The pens came with all gems attached and I thought all was good. I gave one to my grandson and another to my granddaughter. After a few minutes my granddaughter was asking what that was on the floor. It looked like a giant beetle, but upon closer examination, it was a blob of ink that had been stepped on. It was all over the place. On the couch, all over the floor, on my pants, and the kids feet and clothes. I found it had poured out of the bottom of the pen I gave my granddaughter - the new one from this pack. I confiscated the one I gave to my grandson and quarantined them in the bag they came in. I don't trust them and will probably discard the entire package. The good news is that the ink did come out of almost everything. The suede couch still has stains on it, but we do not have a cleaner to use on it yet. My feelings are that if you really like these pens - invest in a good brand.

It was finally time to buy a decent tape dispenser and stop relying on disposable tape rolls, so I bought this one in green. It is cute and small, and its weight made me think it would be a good quality. Unfortunately, the design is terrible. No matter how hard I try to pull the tape out as close to the blade as I can, the roll still pops out most of the time. If you're holding wrapping paper down and trying to tape, you have to let it go, reload the tape dispenser, then try again. Hugely annoying. This is what I get for buying something without reading the Amazon reviews first! ;-)

1 star because 0 wasn't an optionMy favorite part about spending $20 on a calendar thinking I'm getting 18 months, is receiving it and realizing it said July to December, not December to July. You would have to tear off 6 months in order to get to this year! How incredibly pointless! You'd think for only 12 months that are useful it wouldn't cost less.  I will be returning this!

I really didn’t love these markers. The reviews had seemed pretty good, but the bleed through paper, and the color doesn’t come out evenly at all. The paper I was using felt like a slightly heavier quality, but it didn’t seem to hold up.

Bought these bendy pencils for both of my boys.  To help with their ADD and ADHD. My one son saw that his friend had some. So he asked me to buy them for him.  I based my decision on how they were rated from customer. However, I was very disappointed with the purchase.  The penciles merily flex.  They don't bend as implied. I'm not saying they should be able to turn into a pretzel but should bendvmore then they do. So needless to say most of the pencils broke in half.

As per my review on the HP 8740, this printer is doing the same thing. It prints just fine using the Wi-Fi Direct, then nothing. The only way it will work is by running the HP Print and Scan Doctor about every 2 days of usage. If this keeps up, I'll be retuning it also. Don't know what I'll buy, been an HP user for over 15 years.

My rating is primarily for the Epson customer support.  When I purchased the WF-3620, I was looking for an all-in-one with OCR capabilities like my previous HP all-in-one.  I searched the product information on Amazon and on the Epson website and couldn't establish whether or not this new version included that software.  The previous version, WF-3520, included ABBYY FineReader OCR software.  I CALLED EPSON and their representative assured me that the WF-3620 did indeed include the ABBYY FineReader software but you have to use the downloaded software to install, not the included disk.  That is not true.  To make a very long and frustrating story filled with wrong information short, this newer version DOES NOT INCLUDE OCR SOFTWARE.SET UP--Initially set up was easy and straightforward.  We wirelessly connected a Mac desktop, a Windows desktop and a Windows laptop directly from the Epson website.  Printed fine that day and the next.  Three days later, I couldn't print from either desktop; don't know about the laptop.  And the scanner didn't work either (and I didn't try but I don't think it worked with the initial set up).  The initial response from the support fix the problem was sending me the same instructions to install that came with the unit, which I already did.  After speaking with 3 other support reps and going through some procedures that were not intuitive, I finally have the Mac printing and scanning working.  I had to delete everything from the Windows desktop and am currently trying to reinstall from the Epson website (which I'm told is down at the moment for maintenance, "Please check back in a few hours.")As for how it functions, scanning and printing are fairly fast.  The colors are a little intense (for instance a graphic with a muted pink color printed almost neon colored.)

Out of the 100+ pages that I've tried to print these last six months, I've had about five useable copies. The ink won't stop streaking and my printer cannot align the cartridges. If the seller attempts to make this right, I'll change my rating. See Print Diagnostics Report.

What's the point? Bought these b/c they look cute and should stick with the all-over adhesion. Nope. Ugly hash marks on the bottom and they weren't even evenly distributed... different color stickies had wider or thinner bands of hashmarks. And yeah, they didn't stick well. Expected not only better quality product, but also the product I actually purchased. Yuck. Wish I'd read reviews first.

Not only is the descriptor in the title wrong, as there are absolutely *no* metallic pens in this entire set, but it arrived damaged! *Several* pen lids were off of them when I opened the package. The container they came in was broken. And, to top it all off there was ink spilled from one of the pens! Don't waste your time even considering these, let alone your money! I don't typically write scathing reviews, but this product pushed me to it!

I bought these toner cartridges  after reading the rave reviews by most of the reviewers.  I got them because my printer said I'd need a replacement soon.  The printer ran on fumes for a few months, and now I need to replace the cartridge.  It doesn't work--error message "supply memory error. " The connector on the cartridge don't even look like the other cartridges that are installed-- see photo. Needless to say, it's long beyond the time I can exchanged it, and I'm out a ton of money.  Don't waste yours!

I read the reviews and they were misleading. This is way too small. Nothing close to the size of a real  phone. I’ve seen huge erasers that  kids would go crazy over. But my students won’t be thrilled with this regular size eraser. It’s too small.
It would have been nice to receive my package in one piece. But what can you do. 0 out of 5 stars for me
should of read reviews!! I as many other people thought this was 5 notebooks! 1 notebook for over $4!!! I would have never bought!

I purchased the full set and the yellow cartridge produced banding/lines on the prints. I never had that problem before. I've read other reviews that have had the same problem with the yellow toner cartridge. The others seem to be fine but I can't be sure until I replace the yellow cartridge.

Wheel stem bent after 3 weeks. Exposed ball bearings. Stool wobbles because of wheels' base out of balance. Five years ago I bought this stool from Inkbed but it was a different design and much sturdier. It has had no problems in 5 years. Don't buy this one!!!UPDATE SINCE PREVIOUS REVIEW. The wheel caster broke 😥and the chair is no longer usable. Here are pictures of the garbage chair(black) and the older better constructed chair(silver) which is 4 years old. Inkbed has fallen way down on quality. Buyer beware.🤔Signed,Disappointed and Mad
Like other reviews, I bought mine in Mar 2020, I received ‘assorted color’ refills: black, blue and red. I personally, was not happy with it, but didn’t want to return during the pandemic.

So I bought the lime green one at my local office supply super store thinking all cute dispensers were created equal.  Unfortunately, this one was a disappointment.  The biggest problem I have with it is that when you pull up to peel off tape (and I'm not even talking about a 12-noon angle here, I mean just any kind of up), the whole roll and core pop out of the dispenser and must be replaced before one can carrrrefully extract tape from this thing.  And this is not a sometimes kind of thing.  This happens every freakin time I use the dispenser.  Because I'm stubborn and refused to take it back to the store, I just taped (irony!) some pieces of cardboard over the grooves where the dispenser sits so that it can no longer come out.  Of course, I have to destroy this every time the tape runs out, but otherwise the dispenser would be almost unusable.The other issue that I have is that I don't think it's heavy enough, but that is from a preference standpoint, I think, and less of a universal issue.  Sadly, though, instead of using one hand to grab tape, pull up, and dispense as needed, one must use two hands for the dispenser, pull at a zero degree angle, and dispense as needed.  That pretty much rules out gift wrapping, poster hanging, or any other one-hand-is-holding-this-thing-together activities.  It's a shame, because this thing is really extremely adorable and looks great, enough to get it two stars even!  But I'm really disappointed with it, and until they redesign it, I wouldn't recommend buying it.
I should have paid attention to the details and reviews. I thought this was aluminum, it is a sticker!!! Worth 1/10 the listed price.

Paper seems to be ok quality, but, just like other reviewers, my grid lines are completely off. This makes the pad nearly unusable and causes a lot of grief for me as I have professors with strict presentation guidelines. Probably will not buy again.

I normally don't write product review's but this product is sooooo bad and the HP customer service support and policies are even worse that I felt that I needed to say something.  This was the 2nd printer out of the box that came DOA.  You can't even finish the setup process because the printer is delivered with a defective printhead.  HP support solution doesn't work because it assumes you have already setup the printer.  So you are left with 2 options, they will replace it (at an additional cost), or they will order a new printhead and ship it to you (at an additional cost).  If something doesn't work out of the box, huge red flag.  Won't by another HP product again.

I gave this scale a rating of 2 as it seemed easy to use if it were working correctly.  However, it arrived defective and I returned it.  The LED display did not correctly display making it impossible to get a clear reading.  The last digit only was part way illuminated.  I guess you get what you pay for.  I was unable to get a replacement through Amazon.  I will look for another manufacturer for my replacement.

Ordered these after reading the reviews, thinking I would finally have some good pens, but they did not meet expectations. May be I received a faulty batch, but the pens(G2 Extra Fine 0.5mm - 12 pack) are not super smooth at all Pilot G2 Retractable Gel Roller Ball Pen with 0.5mm Extra Fine Point, Black Ink, 12-Pieces (31002) . 5 of the 12 pens are OKAY, but I can hear all of them scratching the paper every time I write. Its like a sand particle is stuck at the ball and I feel like scratching it off. And some pens do not have constant flow of ink too.

UPDATE:  I just ordered OEM and guess what?  My printer works again and I’m not getting the B504 error.  AVOID THESE.  I just threw mine in the trash.Well I tried.  When you see printer cartridges that are 1\2 off the normal OEM price, you think "is this too good to be true"  Well yes it is my friends.My printer has been a champ over the past year, but I found these beauties on Amazon and now I'm running Print Head Cleaning all the time, and forcing my printer to print in Black and White so the color (which won't print at all) is not involved.  I"m going to have to replace all three colors and hope this clears up.  There is an off chance that my printer just happened to fail right "after" I installed the "off market" printer cartages.  If that is the case I"ll update my review.

These gel pens are so cute, fun and affordable. Unfortunately, as others reviewers have mentioned,they stop working and leak!. Artist need reliable pens. One pen leaked all over the package, in mydrawer and all over my hands. Thankfully, the ink did not ruin my art. These pen are not ready for market. I just think a manufacture has to do better.

This review is specific to FRANKLIN COVEY, not MEGA Brands America, IncBought 2, one is OK  the other is damaged. The packaging concealed the damaged, therefore the damage was not revealed until it was unwrapped. Even though this item says "Sold by Amazon" they still wanted me to pay for return shipping which cost about 90% of the value of the item. Ridiculous!!!!The damage is at the wood/cork frame - cracked, but not completely apart, but this caused the thin metal Dry Erase Board to warp/deform.Specific to the quality of the metal of the Dry Erase board (white area) - it's cheap and thin.Turning ultra strong Neodymium Magnets into regular strength magnets...do a quick google on how the thickness of the metal you are sticking the magnets to contribute to the strength of the magnet - bottom line need more metal!This review is specific to FRANKLIN COVEY, not MEGA Brands America, IncWould Not RecommendOnly pro is that is has 3 of the commonly needed items in a board in one - Cork, Magnetic Board and Dry EraseAny other brand listening out there???

Update from original review: They did send me a new color cartridge. I haven’t used yet, but did appreciate positive customer service.Original Review: Do not buy. The color cartridge printed random colors not the color it was supposed to be. Very cheap. Thought I’d try it but never again.

This product did not work well with my printer.  This was a four pack.  The first package I open when I printed with the tricolor everything turned out pink. The black cartridge would not be recognized by my printer. When I open the second package everything printed blue. The second black cartridge printed fine. Thus the one star. I will not be ordering this again.

I thoroughly enjoy writing with this pencil, but I have had the same disappointing experience regarding lifespan as has been noted by several other reviewers. Mine lasted just short of three weeks before the inner barrel shattered, leaving the pencil useless. The pencil, therefore,did not last nearly as long as one of the $ 0.99 Bic's that I can by by the Gross at Office Depot, and still come out money ahead. The plastic part which failed is very flimsy and it is no surprise to me that it failed. Why take the time and effort to design such an ergonomic and rugged exterior only to skimp so much on the interior pieces?I suppose that I will now get to see how well Rotring's warranty service works....

Would have rated this highly on the first cartridge. Installed the second one this past Friday & it is a total fail. The toner appears to be leaking across the 1/3 of the way rendering unusable copies. So much for the great buy I thought I had; turns out I paid as much as OEM since this cartridge is worthless.

Loved it for 6 months. Scanner is great, wifi features are great. Then it just starts printing huge blurry horizontal lines. I cleaned heads sooo many times. Ran horizontal and vertical adjustments, replaced cartridges. Went through every single action from Customer Support...was left with a garbage printer. Google this issue - it is insanely common with this specific printer. There is a workaround - print everything on super saturated setting which uses 2-3x the amount of ink. Strange a printing company that also makes printer cartridges would make a printer that is only usable with a setting that uses 2-3x the regular amount of ink or force the owner to purchase a new printer. There is a reason Epson has a Consumer Affairs rating of 1.1 out of 5.

I ordered this for my Lexmark X6150 which is an older printer but the website stated that it is compatible.  So, naturally, I placed an order and received it yesterday.  I went to go print something off of the computer and when I did, it asked me to install a cartridge.I did everything from cleaning the cartridge itself to cleaning the part where it holds the actual cartridge inside the printer.  Nothing happened.  I even tried to switch sides, making sure it was installed properly and what do you know, I still had the same results.Boy was I in for a surprise.  I should have read the 1-star reviews for this product before purchasing it.  The thing WILL NOT WORK, even when I tried making a copy, nothing came out but a blank piece of paper.So, for those if you thinking about getting this cartridge, beware:  It will more than likely NOT work with your printer.  Plus, there's either some Chinese/Japanese wording on the side (like in the picture above) that states "not for customer use", whatever that means.Now I'm stuck with a faulty cartridge and cannot return it seeing as how I already opened the packaging materials and tried using it in my printer.  I guess it's time to throw out my 10 year old printer and buy a newer, modern day one.

The yellow cartridge leaked toner all over the inside of my printer and when I hold it over a paper towel and jiggle it a little, yellow tower continues to sprinkle out.  Black worked with no trouble.  I have not tried the magenta or cyan but they appear to be OK.  It has been 2 months since I bought this but I don't change toner too often so I tried to contact the seller.  Amazon's seller feedback system kept giving an error so I tried calling but their phone doesn't work.  I couldn't find a way to contact Amazon about this issue so I am leaving this review in hopes that someone will respond to it.

I'm constantly mad at this printer. It's gotten to the point where I just don't print things anymore. It worked fine when I first got it, the setup was easy, and it started working quickly - there wasn't a lot of steps, basically. But then I moved. For some reason trying to connect the printer to a new network caused a huge meltdown - not only to the printer, but also to my computer. It was a disaster. For awhile any time I turned the printer on the who wifi network would go down. So I figured out how to hardwire it to stop that happening. It's definitely not as convenient as the wireless printing, but I figured it was better than no printing. Now I turn the wifi on my laptop off before I turn the printer on, then I plug in the USB cord and print. Which works about half the time. The other half of the time, my computer can't locate the printer and it refuses to do anything. Just now I successfully printed one document, moved over to the next one, only to have it be refused despite all the various efforts, workarounds and restarts I could think of, which is what prompted this review. I really wanted to like this printer, I had heard really good things about it, but so far my experience has not been pretty frustrating. I do get the feeling this is just a weird circumstance - something random went wrong somewhere and threw everything else off. All the same, I paid $100 and still don't really have printing capabilities, so that's annoying.

This product is not the same that is in the picture. Notes are in the bottom and it is an odd size. We put it on our refrigerator but it doesn’t look very nice. Very cheaply made, even for the low price. We turned the pages to put events on each month and they came undone, just by turning the pages one time...very aggravated. Not even going to bother returning this product, not worth the time. Not sure why so many people have bought this. Hardly ever leave reviews but this one was so bad I felt I had to.

I really had a lot of fun trying this out in the store.  It highlighted printed text on many surfaces great.  So I purchased it.  It glides smoothly acros the paper and has a great, bright, color.Now for the downside of the review.... I mainly use highlighters to highlight handwritten notes on notebook paper.  All it did was smear it into a smudged mess!  I even waited an hour for it to dry and it still smudged the handritten ink!  Then I tried different types of inks; ballpoint pen, gel pen, rollerball, etc.  The worst was the gel pen, TERRIBLE!!!!  The best was the ball point but it still smudged more than if I had used a traditional highlighter.As noted by other reviewers, it is somewhat like a crayon and I will agree.  With that in mind, as with a crayon, to get a good solid line you have to go over the same line twice or very heavily to get a good color transfer.  I believe that because I had to go over my notes several times to get a good bright highlight color with this "highlighter" could be the reason I had so much smearing.I guess it's a toss-up.  You can get either a fun new type of highlighter that won't dry out; but highlights only certain types of ink without smudging with a very light color application in an unpredictable location without crisp start, end, top, or bottom lines of highlight.  Or, you can have a fun new type of highlighter that won't dry out; but creates a huge smudgy mess if you want a decent color transfer without crisp start, end, top or bottom lines of highlight.The choice is up to you, but for me, I think I am going to stick with a traditional hihglighter and wait until the Gimmick is improved before I try iy again!

I bought this because I read great reviews.  The initial pens work fantastic.  They write smooth, the ink is a great color.  However, once they initial ink runs out it's all downhill.  The pens come with refills to use and they are TERRIBLE!  The ink leaks everywhere from the tip of the pen.  No matter how many times I wipe the ink off, it comes back again.  It creates a mess of splotches when you're trying to write.  Will not be reordering these again.  What a shame  :(

The ultra-fine tip is amazing for detail when drawing or writing small text, even cursive.Hopefully when I wake up tomorrow I’ll have a fresh box of these bad boys on my doorstep.

Tried coloring everything again thinking really making sure I saturated the fabric/fur and then hand washing it in cold water. This time the coloring bled everywhere turning white fur dingy and the black STILL FADED!!! I’m irate!!! This horrible marker completely destroyed this stuffed animal! This was supposed to be a “memorial” for my parents deceased dog for my 3 year old daughter who absolutely loved him. This product is literal garbage and probably is barely suitable for marking initials inside shirts DON’T BUY THIS!

This arrived today and is a really pretty Bible cover. I had been so looking forward to using it, but now I am very disappointed. My Large Print Life Application Bible measures 6" x 9" x 2".  According to the online product sizing description and the product hang-tag that came attached to the Bible cover, this size Large cover fits Bibles exactly like mine up to 6 5/8" x 9 1/2" x 2". Seemed perfect. Here are the actual measurements of the size Large Bible cover that I received: (outside measurements) 8" x 11" x 2"; (inside measurements) 7 1/4" x 10 1/2" x 2". The cover is so large that when I place my Bible inside it and open it up to reading position, the back cover of my Bible slips entirely out of the Bible protective cover. When zipped into the cover, my Bible slides up and down against the internal surface of the zipper and cover which will obviously cause wear and tear on the front and back book covers. Preventing wear and tear was the point of purchasing a Bible cover in the first place. So, this Bible cover is packed back into its box and is being returned to Amazon post haste. Although I rated this product with one star, I honestly believe even that much approval is not deserved. It would be different if I hadn't measured so carefully. But I did measure and read the description very carefully. I wanted to avoid the inconvenience and disappointment of a returned item.

(updated review)I am updating my review and downgrading my rating to one star.  Let me say that WeighMax has EXCELLENT customer service, they were polite and very fast to address my problems and gave me no arguments about sending out replacement scales.The problem is this.  WeighMax sent out a replacement scale for my original purchase.  This scale came with a battery that only had 6V and would not function, however on using a new battery or plugging it into AC power would work, however it only weighed in oz/lb - the button that should have switched it to g/kg wouldn't work.  I let WeighMax know this and although they said they  "test all scale before we ship out. Maybe something happened during the shipping", they sent me a replacement (the third scale) without any argument.  This third scale also came with a battery that only had 6V in it and would not function.  On using a fresh battery and subsequently the AC adapter, I got a variety of error codes on turning the scale on and finally the scale would turn on for an instant then immediately turn off.I have let WeighMax know that this third scale is defective and I suspect they will make things right somehow, but I must say that after all this nonsense, I've lost faith in the product.-------(original review)Can tare, weigh in kg/g or lbs/oz. has a reasonably sized platform.  I've used it mainly to weigh backpacking and climbing gear.  Obtained repeatable weights, although I did not check it against another scale to help determine accuracy.  The 10 year warranty is nice, but after about 10 months of light use, mine will no longer work on battery power (I verified battery voltage).  We'll see how the warranty service is.

(Updated July 2016): I bought this is December 2015, and by now (July 2016), the pen is leaking, so before I can use it, I have to wipe it down and clean it of the leaked ink. My other Platinums don't do that. So I did get 7-8 months' worth of use out of this, but I'm very disappointed that it's broken.Old review: I really, really like this pen. I went with the "medium" nib which is a lot finer than any European medium nib I've ever written with, but I soon got used to it. Ink flow (I'm writing with Platinum's ink) is good, on the wet side for me, but it dries quickly enough to not send this lefthander into "smudge hell". It's on the light side for what I like (I have a collection of steel pens at home because I like the weight), but I found that the longer I write with it, it "vanishes" in my hand in a good way. Using it feels quite natural, and the plastic is sturdy and can take some abuse (I don't go easy on my pens, even the nice ones). Delivery was great and fast. In terms of size, I have medium-sized hands, so I would NOT want this to get any smaller or slimmer, but the length and diameter work surprisingly well for me, even unposted. This is also my first nice Platinum pen (I do like the cheaper Preppy ones for some uses) and it's also my first gold nib.

Extremely disappointed....had an HP All In One for almost 7 years..with 3 school age kids and it served us well until it died a noble death. Enter the Epson WF 3620 All-in-One. I researched heavily and really liked it when getting it.  However, here we are just 7 months after buying it and I am extremely disappointed in it.  Lines appear on every print out and I have tried EVERY solution suggested by Epson site. I emailed my concerned a couple of weeks ago and still have NO response...my son just (8th grader) just finished a cool project in Photoshop for Math and printed it out....shame on you Epson that your printer let him down.April update....On or about March 30 I contacted Epson and went through a 20 minute routine of "do this and do that" all things I had done 10 times over....so, the "help" person, who was very polite says that Epson will send a "refurbished" printer to replace and that I will be charged $111 until I return the broken one....Here we are April 14..no printer...two days ago I get a phone call from Epson asking me to rate my experience. I reply that I would once the experience is over and I receive the printer...opps says the person!  So I wait, in the meantime my daughter who is a senior and my son who is an eighth grader cannot printer ANYTHING.  My son just did a project that we sent the items to Costco to print. You decide if you want to buy Epson.Late April...got two more calls saying if I didn't return defective they would charge me.  Second time I again told girl that I had NOT received "refurbished" printer and she paused and said "you are right, it is still in warehouse." So I finally received it....

It worked great for awhile and then it started having problems such as it going out of alignment and using ink faster than I could keep up with. I will be buying an HP again.

I've never written a review, but I must say two things...first off...Amazon.com itself has been great about making this right by immediately refunding me the entire purchase price plus shipping and is sending a return label.The problem is the cartridge.  I make sure I specifically order NEW Lexmark cartridges because I've found refurbished ones normally don't work in Lexmark printers.  My husband installed the new cartridge only for our printer to say it was missing a cartridge.  I removed it, and tried several more times.  Installed the old empty cartridge & it printed a very light page...it was almost empty & the reason we ordered a new one.  Looked at the new cartridge & notice that it has a yellow "Not for customer Use!" lable with lots of Chinese writing also....not the typical 82 Black label.  The foil package also has a computer printer generated label over 8L0220, so it's not a new original Lexmark 82 cartridge...I shook it & it sounds empty.  WHAT A RIP OFF!!!!!  I WILL NEVER PURCHASE FROM THIS SELLER AGAIN.....BEWARE!!!!!!!
