Why not on front with the Readout? After a couple seconds the scale would lock, so if I wasn't quite quick enough when I added or subtracted food from the scale it would lock. I cannot conceive of a reason that a scale was designed to quit working in the middle of weighing something. After looking at the Chinese instructions and some Chinese take-out to get me in the mood, I could not find a way to turn of that "feature". There is only two ways to turn the scale back on to a usable status. First, turn it off, and then on and then wait for it to start up, or remove what you are weighing and wait about 10 or 15 seconds and then place the item back on the scale.The size of the platform is what made me try it and that is the only reason I gave it two stars. It looks like I wasted my money because it is now going to a land fill where it can do no harm.

I saw this and immediately ordered it because of the better cable and blade, but the reason for the one star is because I just got it in the mail today and there was no blade, the unit itself has wear and tear, not what I expected from a brand new item. If I had received a new cutter, i'd give 5 stars!

I have no clue why this tape has so many stars...it's impossible to peel the tape without it ripping into a million small pieces. Very disappointed with this purchase. I'll be going back to buying tape from the dollar store. Also the dispenser doesn't work :(

My current review:This service has broken down. Technical support does not respond. Phone frequently drops calls in the middle. Can't call back after dropped call.  From their forum, many clients are suffering the same problems. I'm now going back to POTUS since I've concluded that many VOIP services are fly-by-nights. My locality now has competition for POTUS ground lines, including one provider with fiber optic cables. Phone Power was good for over three years. Now, not so hot.My review in late 2014.I have used PhonePower now for 3.5 years. Excellent quality. Outstanding Technical Support. But best of all, for my use, is the 60 free minutes/month of International calls. I am using it in conjunction with a four phone wireless system in my apartment. Works as well as landlines and much, much cheaper. They have a feature to not lose calls if your power goes off, but so far, that hasn't happened. Jam packed with bells and whistles. Would not consider changing. I bought the package on Amazon. No problems at all.

I already knew based on the photos provided that this would be a Chinese knockoff or something but I got a refund earlier this week on an item I never received so I had cash to waste. HOWEVER, on anyone looking for a WIRELESS Scanner, I recommend looking somewhere else.I purchased the scanner with the expectation that I can walk anywhere inside my building scanning many items and reviewing them later. Before I took it to my place of business, I had a quick test run down of the scanner.1. It is easy to use, plug and play type deal. Scan, Beep, you're done. I followed the instructions and did the initialization and finished.2. There's no clear instructions of what the lights mean. I see red, blue, green on but had to find out what they mean by context. Red = power, Blue = Bluetooth, green = I have no idea.3. This is where false advertising comes to play. There is not rechargeable battery. I assumed I was wrong which brings me back here (and why I'm writing a review to begin with). It's not external, it's "Built-in" yet every time I unplug it, it shuts off, there isn't even an on or off button anywhere, so there isn't a way to control that if it even had it.4. 80 meters of indoor Bluetooth?!?! I admit I had issue with turning Bluetooth on, but after appropriately activating it, I can't go 2 feet away from the receiver before the scanner annoyingly beeps trying to regain connection to the receiver.5. Manual is also trash, assuming I'm wrong on every one of these, the manual isn't clear on anything to begin with.
The media could not be loaded.                      I rarely write reviews. Wish I could give it fewer stars! Plugged it in and started stapling without any paper and goes nonstop (see video). JUNK!

It's definitely as bad as many of the reviews claim! I purchased it on Amazon in September 2016 for light home office duty, but it was having problems well before Christmas - mostly related to print head clogging. Most of the tiny toner cartridge's ink was wasted doing numerous head cleaning procedures while trying to get some sort of legible output from the printer. I've never printed a satisfying document from this printer and for the past 6 months, I've had to work on it for an hour or more every-time I wanted to print a single mailing label. It's been less than 20 months since I purchased it and I've only put 200 pages through it, but I've replaced the toner cartridges three times with OEM ink that cost twice the price of the whole printer. It's a really bad, unreliable, frustrating and amazingly expensive (to operate) printer and if for some strange reason you'd like one, mine's out on the curb in the trash today (where it should have been more than a year ago).

I bought this B/Y printhead to fix a problem with my HP OfficeJet Pro L7780 all-in-one.  It's a problem that cannot be fixed.The entire OfficeJet Pro L7700 series is a crate of lemons.  Don't take my word for it: read the USER reviews at amazon.com and cnet.com.If you have an all-in-one or printer from the HP OfficeJet Pro L7700 series, and it tells you that either of your printheads is bad, OR if you have a problem with your all-in-one and HP Support tells you to replace the printhead, DON'T DO IT.  The new printhead may fix the problem for about 50 pages, and then the problem will return -- or a new problem will arise.I'm serious.  Don't waste your money on this.  You will be throwing good money after bad.  For the price of two printheads (which is what you'll end up spending anyway, and two new printheads WILL NOT solve your problem), you can buy a brand new all-in-one from Canon or Lexmark.  And the brand new all-in-one has a better warranty than the replacement printheads.

I should have read the reviews. These DO NOT COME WITH MATCHING ENVELOPES as shown. Very dissappointing quality. Please also know that the "polka dot pattern" is of RAISED GUMMY LIKE polka dots. Horrible.

I put this item on my Wishlist and ordered it from there, but when the package arrived, I only received ONE pack, not three as advertised. I see this has happened to several other people who have left negative feedback. Oddly enough, my order history now shows only one pack ordered. Why would I pay $4 for one pack when I could (supposedly) get 3 packs for $6 ?!  Since the history shows I ordered one pack, I can't lodge a complaint. And I must admit that even at the high price of $4 for 80 sheets, this is still cheaper than paying $7 for one pack of 48 sheets from the local Office Depot. (therefore I gave two stars instead of one).

The ONLY reason I give 2 stars to this product is because it actually STICKS!  And in that... I mean... it sticks to ITSELF when trying to work with it!  Tear it off a tape dispenser and it is hard to cut, when it is cut it will bend into itself and stick there making you get another piece and have to fight to get that piece cut as well. I'm sure I am not making any sense here. Just spend a little more for better tape. One more thing, this product did not come in a neat little box like shown. It was wrapped in clear plastic wrap with a little cardboard bottom .  (See pic )  This tape is a pain in the butt to use.
As the other review states, this picture is false advertising, you only recieve one pad (100 sheets) per order, not 12 pads as pictured.

I loved this when it first arrived. Worked easy enough and finished my updated and organized pantry nicely.Just went to replace the empty roll of tape and it has now stopped worked. It won’t emboss letters at all and will not cut or advance through. Keeps getting jammed. Disappointed that I only got one role out of this product. But hey....I read countless reviews saying this exact thing before purchasing and I still bought it. Don’t make the same mistake!

I've had this printer since September 2016 and have had the printer heads clog up multiple times, exactly as the other reviews have mentioned. I've tried to clean the heads out in every way possible, but I think this time it's done for good.
I'd give it zero stars if I could as soon as I lifted it to put staples in it the head came off.

Horrible ReliabilityI am writing this review to get back at Epson. I bought the WF-2530. After a few month the wireless stopped. So I happened to have the wire type connector from a prior printer and figured out how to do that (Connector does not come with it). Then I maybe did color printing about 25 times. Now My CYAN color is clogged and no ink comes out of it. I did their nozzle check, nozzle clean - no Help. So now my printer is JUNK. THANKS EPSON FOR A TOTALLY UNRELIABLE PRINTER. I WASTED ABOUT $100 on the printer and buying new ink about $35 for the ink to see if a new CYAN cartridge would help. SO MONEY DOWN THE DRAIN. GOOD LUCK if you are getting a WF maybe they have gotten better, likely not. Oh wait the black is still working!!! FOR NOW.

While the setup of this printer was quick and easy it soon failed. In the past I have always had HP all-in-one printers and this was my first Epson unit. I wanted to down size when my 5 year old HP monster died as my home office printing needs have waned. After installing the ink cartridges, loading the paper and downloading the software to my iMac, I printed a couple of test pages and scanned a few documents. All was fine but when two days later I went to scan another document I noticed that the printer was off. After turning on it gave me an error message that it did not recognize any of the ink cartridges and that they needed to be replaced even though they were all still full. One of the things I liked about Epson was that they didn't send the usual "starter ink cartridges" that always came with the HP printers, good for only a few pages. While they were not an XL size they were all at least a standard capacity. After I worked around the ink cartridge issue I tried to scan a one page document from the control panel on the printer but the touch screen kept locking up and after a few seconds the printer would just just itself off. After several reboots, including unplugging the unit, and I kept getting the same problems I called Epson. Their tech support was knowledgeable, easy to deal with and they even spoke good English. After just a few minutes they determined, as I had, that my printer was defective and would need to be replaced. I of course opted to return the unit to Amazon and as usual I received great customer service from Amazon and the defective unit was just picked up by UPS on the day after I requested a replacement. My new printer should arrive tomorrow and I will update this review to reflect my experience with the replacement unit. Hopefully all goes well.

Bought this in August 2014.  Used lightly at my house.  Only changed the ink one time.  Got an error code 0x97 and the printer sounded like it had a mechanical failure.  Could not find error code 0x97 in the manual.  Called Epson - they said hardware failure - too bad.  The point of my review is to say that a printer should last more than a couple of hundred pages - which is all I have used it for.  I will try another brand!

Not very pleased with stamp. Ink pad was almost completely dried out. Cost me 8 dollars to buy a refill kit. Before I refilled pad you could hardly see the image when I stamped something.  1 star rating

I've ordered thousands of these over the past decade and never had a problem with them until my most recent order. I basically had the same problem as other customers who left reviews that the envelopes are so thin and flimsy that it is basically impossible to get it to attach to a package correctly. I used two of them ... will be returning them to Amazon and ordering different ones that are hopefully usable.

It did not come with anything to hang it up so I had to figure that out and it is very thin as stated in many reviews. I put regular thumbtacks in it and they went right through. If you were looking for a durable corkboard I would recommend spending a little bit more money and buying some thing a little bit better. This will work for now but I don’t expect that it will last very long.

Initially the pen it self looks nice and feels great to hold. There were two things that made me give it one star. First, the piston converter was stuck in the pen itself and it feels cheaply made. It also doesn’t work, it doesn’t suck up the ink like it’s supposed to. I haven’t tried the cartridges but at this point I don’t want to waste my money on trying to troubleshoot and to be honest the converter should work. Second, the instructions aren’t very clear. If anyone has any insight on anything that I may be doing wrong please feel free to correct it.

I was a bit hesitant purchasing this set after reading some reviews and seeing the pictures that came attached. Despite the title clearly showing "Pablo 80", it seemed as if some people got a full 80 set while others did not. I chose to take that gamble, and all I can say now is that I should have trusted my gut.The set I received only had 40 colors-- an entire tray was missing. My concern, even greater than the fact that I would have paid double what the set was worth, is the fact that the item was shrink wrapped and new, meaning that it was not a set that someone had stolen the second half from. What makes that particularly concerning is that it may suggest that the pencils are counterfeit in some way. This sounds silly, but there is actually some truth behind the idea of counterfeit art supplies. So given that, I wasn't willing to even try the pencils and see if I can purchase the full set elsewhere.So please be wary as I am not the only one to have met with this issue! If you get a set of 40 colored pencils as opposed to 80, return it right away! This is not the correct set and you are definitely overpaying for the item.

Pain to install. Not worth the extra effort for the value. You have to pull the micro chip off the original ink, transfer it to these new ones. The problem is, the printer registers the new ink as being empty, still. And will continue to give the low ink warning. If these last for a year, then I will add some stars.

I’m so disappointed that they are ugly pastel colors and they are really cheep quality. I wanted primary colors and thought that I was getting something worth the money that I spent.I started a return only to find out that to return them, I would have to pay the postage. Amazon should not do business with this company. The product is awful. Now I am stuck with an over priced item that my students will break in days. Wasn’t worth the hassle to try to pay to send them back.I would give zero stars if I could.

I love Epson printers and was very excited to receive this one. However, I have to give this product a low rating because it appears that this printer may have been used. The printer box was extensively re-taped, the ink cartridges were already installed, and another customer's work order for Office Depot was in the box! Also, I did not receive any kind of owner's manual or directions. I know enough about Epson printers to get things rolling and use it. But I did receive extensive manuals for a PC computer (which I did not purchase); I have a Mac. If this was a refurbished printer, I did not understand that from the product description. And it would be nice to have some printed documentation.

The bolts that hold the bars together have large heads that stick up on the top. So all of the weight of the file cabinet is resting on four points. After  a little use, I'm sure that the bottom of the cabinet won't be flat anymore.Also, I'm not letting this affect the rating, because this is specific to the seller, but mine arrived looking like it came from a garage sale. The box had sections cut out of it (probably where a previous purchaser's address had been) and the screws were wrapped in scratch paper and masking tape. Not terribly professional.

I made the mistake of listening to folks naysaying the naysayers-- 20/20 hindsight.  Simply put, I had sticker shock from the OEM cartridges, and was living in denial.  Disregard the negative feedback like I did at your own risk!  It seems like the quality of these is a complete craps shoot.  (Either that, or there is some technology afoot to prevent 3rd parties from feeding toner into this printer.)  Anyhow, after about 3 weeks of OEM-comparable printing, the first black cartridge started streaking and becoming lighter and lighter.  Issue was not rectified by fixing unit or ITB cleaning operations.  Tried second black cartridge, and it was printing everything crookedly, like it was somehow messing up the ability of the paper to feed.  (If I had to guess. the very sticky adhesive on the pull strip isn't helping anything-- toner gets everywhere when you pull that puppy off, and it has lines on it from inconsistent release.  And no, practice does NOT make perfect on these-- in my day I've replaced hundreds of toner cartridges.)  Ran down the block to Office Depot, got an OEM cartridge, and it worked like it was supposed to again.  Pretty hard to argue with that!Sadly, for us, we can't have horrible print quality, so these are basically landfill fodder (no, there is no recycling collection with these).  And I personally won't be bothering with the CMY cartridges, I've already lost enough time just getting black working again.  If you do the math on how much output I got out of the black cartridge, I think pro-rated, it's just about break-even with OEM cost.

Bought a large combo pack 4x each of 3 colors, small black, and large black. The first and only 2 cartrdiges I tried = printer could not recognize either cartridge.  One Star for not working.  Had no problem returning complete order for full refund - gave 2nd star for that.  (But will not buy again.)

I hate to write bad reviews, but the fact this table caused cuts on the foot triggered me writing this. I got the package and opened it immediately. The edges are very sharpe, need to be really careful. The draw doesn’t really move so I decide to keep it that way.  I’m also hurt by some hidden thorn when assembling or setting up the table to my ideal height. It could be dangerous to kids. And I think I will need to find a way to keep me safe on it.

This was the poorest thing I ever have seen for a cart.  I had a terrible time puting the thing together.  It took me over three hours.  I broke one of the pins for the wheele. I wished I had read the reviews before I bought this cart. I can not get it to close up tightly.I am the poor old woman who was almost in tears after I got it put together. The only thing good about this whole mess is that Amazon got my order right out but charged me twice.  They did credited me back before the charges were finialized.

You need supersonic hearing if you're gonna use this in a shop or store. Can't hear unless I'm right next to it. With music on, forget it. Yes, it's cute and charming, but not practical at all. I bought this because the reviews said other shop keepers liked it.

I ordered these based on the great reviews however I should have known better to trust something that was this cheap.I needed new ink to print invitations for my daughters birthday party however the first few invites had blurred colors and by invite 5 there were lines and the colors were a mess. I ended up having to order my invites online. Big disappointment.
Received in shrink wrapped plastic, no Canon manufacturer indicated. I have yet to use these. Gave one star as a warning and still deciding whether to return.

I would be giving these envelopes a 5 star rating if the glue stuck AT ALL!  Not only does the glue not stick, even tape doesn't stick very well.  I've got to tape down the flap and then hold it for a while.  Same with the stamps and return address label.  So if you want to actually mail things, go with a different envelope.

I should know, I have three of them. The 1st came from a 3rd party seller on Amazon. I started it up and then got a red screen and error 0xE8, which is accompanied by a horrible very bad noise - like gears grinding themselves into bits. It won't get past that point. I didn't even get to put ink cartridges in them. The 2nd printer came from Amazon.com itself and...did the exact same thing. When I spoke with Epson technical support  they said the print heads were irrevocably damaged do to poor packing and I needed to send them back for exchange. I am happy Amazon and the third party seller accepted the returns instead, as Epson would have taken forever. I purchased a third one from Target (I had already bought large quantities of ink for this printer, and it supposedly has the lowest per page cost of any printer, and I print a lot) and finally that one worked.I had the previous model of this printer (the 3520) and loved it. I had to give it to a family member in a printer emergency (long uninteresting story...but all I'll say is "student") so I figured I would treat myself to the upgrade. This printer is definitely bigger, and feels hollower and chintzier. Sometimes it just moves its print head around for fun, which always makes me jump, though I'm sure I'll get used to it. The menus are slightly less intuitive than the 3520.Anyway I miss my 3520 but hopefully this one will work. If you must have this printer then I recommend buying it from a physical retailer so if it doesn't work out of the box you can take it back to them without dealing with shipping and returns. If you are buying from a third party seller check their return policy first. "Circuit City" was great about it (they will get a good rating from me) but it would have been a pain if they had insisted I return it to Epson instead.

Purchased as all the product photos showed red, yellow, and lime green.  I received red, dark green, and purple. Carefully went over the entire product page.  There is no mention that you'll receive a random selection which may include colors not shown in any product image. Only part of product title that showed on my screen when ordering said "Post-it Super Sticky Notes, 4 in x 6 in, 3 Pads, 2x the Sticking Power, Marrakesh Collection, Primary Colors (Red, Yellow, Green"There were other listings for the red, dark green, purple color combination with a lower price.  I wanted the Red, yellow, lime green to match what I was already using.  Was a pain to drive in to town to the local Kohl's store to return the item.  The "Free Return" cost many times more than the product.  In preparing this review I dug deep into other comments.  Found one buried from 2 years ago that had the same issue.  The product color should have been clarified by now.

I cannot believe I am writing a review for pens, but these are so horrible, I feel compelled to warn anyone who might contemplate buying theme - LOOK ELSEWHERE!!!!!!Literally, the worst product I have ever purchased. I threw them away after struggling for months to make it work.So, what are the problems:a) The come with a wax/silicon cap on the top, which you need to peel off with your nails to make the pen work. It is not easy!b) once that top is off - the ink just leaks out of the pen. I mean, it's uncontrolled. There will be smudges on your paper, there will be ink on your hand, on your clothes, inside your bag... - it is unstoppable, until you throw it away.If I could give this product NEGATIVE 5 I would. I cannot describe my frustration with trying to write something, ink flowing all over my book, blowing for 15 minutes so I can flip the page, yet it still is not dry, so I end up with unreadable text, dirty book and extremely dirty hands.Mind you, I am in graduate school, so a few levels above where this may be acceptable.I highly advise anyone to stay away from purchasing these, and I beg the manufacturer - please pull these off the market!!!

Bought two Lexmark black ink cartridges, one printed 4 pages and ran out of ink.  The second never worked.  Like other reviewers, cartridge was labeled "not for customer use". This guy is selling defective goods.

I bought this printer 3 years ago (2016), and it never performed well.  After the first few months, the color never came out well, and no matter how many times I ran the maintenance features, it never performed well.  Now, it keeps giving me an error code, and won't print at all.  I bought this because it was rated 4+ stars by others, but now I see that it's not.  Do not purchase, total waste of money!

Imagine the effort it took me to go look up this order to leave a review on packing tape I ordered 8 months ago. This tape SUCKS. Every time you have to peel it off to start using it it strips in tiny little pieces. Even if you bend the end. So friggin' frustrating. I'm an environmentalist that doesn't like to waste anything and the rest of this garbage is going in the bin.

worked really good , like the look and that it doesn't need batteries . I made quite a few labels but didnt get through one roll of the stuff before it broke . my kids actually dropped it not hard or from far and after that wouldn't stamp a letter properly tried to fix it but failed so planned on getting another but reading the other reviews seems like they dont last that long. :(.......Update: bought a second one worked good through one roll changed the tape and just wouldn't stamp anymore.
Not the measurements listed!!! It couldn’t fit my 4.5x6 cards. Should’ve listened to that guy in the reviews. Had to cut my cards

My printer is pretty much covered in yellow ink after one day of use.  I went to go clean up the printer, and found that all of the toners had leaked...I wish that I had read the reviews before purchasing, because now I have a mess on my hands and no way of printing the materials I need for my classroom.  Ugh.

This product would be OK if it hadn't arrived broken and chipped. Other reviewers had said this as well, but I disregarded and ordered anyway. That was a mistake. I did manage to glue most of it together.

I wish I had paid more attention to the other reviews.  They are right.  The directions are ridiculous - barely in English.  If you do buy this product refer back to the finished product from the Amazon site.  The illustrations don't help.  Also, put the wheels on one at a time - not both wheels at the same time for each mandrel.The item is shaky the handle has the cheapest, tackiest plastic cover - it's super cheesy.  I haven't used it but I got it to take my laundry to the facility in my building a looonnngg way from my apartment.  I'm sure it will do for that.  If you want to use it regularly for trips to the grocery store I am doubtful this item will last very long.  At $40.00 I should have gone to the Container Store and spent a little more for a really well made cart.  Please be forewarned.

Lack of good instructions for setup and care. You can go to the Web site and review or copy the instruction manual but that is over 200 pages in length. Looking for simple how to do things like loading paper face up or down, how to use the copier or scanner was not there. A quick set up guide is provided but lacking in detail. Also I found the LED readout a little confusing when it came to selecting paper type and size. Some selections would not process unless you have the right combination. Also I could not get the ADF to work. Would only copy from the glass with a single page. Epson was contacted and they suggested a fix that did not work.  This item was purchased after reading the many positive reviews but that does not guarantee it will work for you. Subsequently item was returned to Amazon.

They look cool. But every time you open and close them, the spiral binder unwinds its self from the notebook. I use these for work in the medical field. So I need my notebooks to do the job with out falling apart! I give this product 2 stars because it does work. It is paper that I can write on. Just falls apart easily.

The cartridges did not work with my printer.  Seems the HP has a way to check if genuine cartridges are installed so I had to go spend an additional $ 400 to get HP toner.  The seller offered a refund, but I have not seen it, so the review is going back up.
Will edit review if I am sent a replacement.

Going on the high rating of these pencils, I was very excited when they arrived. I am extremely disappointed in the quality of these pencils. Any amount of pressure: soft, hard or normal, the pencil tips immediately crumbles. In order to obtain a nice sharp tip, you need to just about lose half the pencil to the sharpener. I cannot comment on the color of the pencils as I was never able to get that far with my coloring project using the pencil for the amount of breakage of the tips.I've already requested my refund request and these will be go back.

To start off what I bought was in a HP box like I had gone to a box store and bought it straight off the shelf. 5 stars for it being what they said it was.My issue came with the shipping...  It was sent UPS and took 8 days to get to me from tennesse(I live in Michigan).  I purchased another product the same day that was sent from California via snail mail and it only took 5 days to get here.The box the Item came in was 8 times the size of the HP box, with only a couple of air bags inside.  This allowed for the HP box to slide and bounce around.The cost benifit ratio just didn't add up, my printer was down for longer than expected, which cost me more than if I had paid more to another company and got the HP product sooner.

I feel so, so bad writing a not-so-great review about my beloved G2 pens, but they've failed me.  I bought a fresh 12-pack to mark the beginning of my senior year at college, and excitedly loaded my backpack with my precious new pens.  Unfortunately,I soon found that only about half of them work.  I'm a bit of a pen freak, and I expect a smooth, bold, solid, non-bleedy line.  Normally I get this from the G2 line, but 6 or 7 of these ones are skippy, scratchy, and have that "chunky" feel of a dried up or low quality pen.  So disappointing...
I wish I would have read the reviews. its a piece of cardboard with a very thin layer or cork. the ones at the dollar store are better, total garbage, don't buy this

DON'T BOTHER TO ORDER THEM.  THEY WILL PISS YOU OFF SO MUCH ESPECIALLY WHEN YOU'RE IN THE HURRY TO SHIP YOUR PACKAGES.  THEY ARE SO DIFFICULT TO PULL OFF, AND IT WILL STICK ON EVERYWHERE IN A SUPER UGLY AND UNPROFESSIONAL LOOK ONCE ITS OFF OF THE BACKING. Was defective from the start but I didn't catch it until after the date I could return it.  It's big, heavy and when scanning, half the page comesout with a big wide streak of print.  Going to their web site, it looks like this is a frequent problem so beware.  Now, I'm stuck having to sendthis big heavy thing back to HP and maybe wait forever before getting it back. Gave it a two star because the printer prints fine.  Will buy my next one from Costco.
The order was incomplete and most important card, the alphabet, was missing. Will consider changing my review if alphabet card gets delivered

I have been shopping on Amazon for years and their service and return policy is great.  The one star reviews on here are absolutley correct.  In my opinion those who had success with these ink cartridges were probably lucky.  They do indeed leak when installed and make a mess of your printer.  Those that didn't leak were not recognized by my printer as being full.  You get what you pay for.  Cheap enough to take the risk but buyer beware.

I bought these pens because I had a jetstream years and years ago (I think it was a 0.5mm tip) and I love super fine tip, smooth pens.  I was so excited to get these in the mail.  If you're familiar with Jetstream you know that when they work they REALLY WORK.  Ink comes out super smooth and dries pretty quick.  However, in the set of 5 only one was actually usable because the other four skipped so horrendously it was like they didn't have ink in them to begin with.  When I went back to read the reviews it turns out that that problem NEVER GOES AWAY.  So I guess i'll go back to my gel pens. I thought I was getting a pretty good deal but if I wanted just one jetstream to use I would have gotten it for Jet Pens for a quarter of the price + shipping.
It was the worst product I have ever purchased and returned it back. Please don't buy this product. It's not fit for the purpose. The mouse keeps getting stuck. I don't want to give it any star.

The Aeron is the first high dollar office chair I have ever purchased. Recently I have begun to work from home and in a remote part of the US and have been unable to go test chairs out in person. So I did extensive online research and looked at as many reviews about the best bang for the buck office chairs and the Herman Miller Aeron was by far at the top of the heap according to those reviews. Other notes I am 6'4" and 265lbs, have had lower back problems in the past, and work approx 10-12 hours per day in the office. With this criterion my needs are definitely custom to most office chair users. There is many Big and Tall Chairs out there to review. Most of these are for the combination of big and tall not just tall. The Aeron has a size chart that puts my height and weight into the C type chair and advertises two different lumbar options. One is stationary and the other adjustable. I chose the adjustable lumbar with my order. Once I received the chair I put it together. The chair is very simple to install only taking 10-15 mins. The chair is good looking as well. I then went through the instruction guide and adjusted the settings to my liking and begun to use the chair immediately. I have to say that I am very disappointed in the chair. The height of the back is not quite what I was expecting and when I lean back the chair top is at the middle of my shoulder blades. It is not very comfortable there and I will honestly say that I did not take a good look at the specs for the back height. All the reviews I perused were all positive on the mesh seat and back. This will be my first experience with a mesh back and seat and it was not a good one. With the mesh back is its locked and upright position it allows for my mid and upper back to sink in to the point of which there is no support at all for any part of my back except for the lumbar I ordered as an option. The mesh seat has a multitude of concerns for me. 1st of all it has no traction. This means it allows for my butt and thighs to slide forward ever so slightly every few minutes depending on how much motion I have in my normal daily tasks. 2nd the mesh seat drops all my bottom weight into the middle of the seat and strains the tailbone in a way that I have not experienced before. I feel after a few hours of sitting like I was sitting on a bench or in bleacher seating. The back and front of the seat is hard plastic, so as I put my butt back as far as I can in the seat for proper ergonomic posture I can feel the back of the plastic part of the seat under my butt and under my thighs as well. This brings me to the next point of concern. This seat is not made for anyone over 6 feet. The seat is too short for my long thighs. The seat does not come under my legs enough to support my thighs which in turn makes my posture less desired. As you can probably tell from my review I am constantly having to move and adjust and occasionally stand and walk around for a few minutes every hour or so for posture relief. I am not sure about someone of a little less weight and height but this chair was not for me and now I am on the hunt for another chair hopefully at a comparable or less price. Because to be honest the price of the chair for me was very expensive, considering it having so many drawbacks.

Frustrating!!! Although, I figured how to use this product it was not easy. If you have little or no experience with scanners and you do not wish to monkey around trying to figure out how it works DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. I foolishly thought that a real instruction manual would be sent. The booklet and video (it is not an instruction manual) is cryptic. If you love a puzzle this is the perfect product for you. Buy the way, I gave it 2 stars because it scans as advertised.

I paid for: Qty. 50 & only 30 were in bag (delivered). NOT HAPPY ABOUT THAT…Item Review: They are IDENTICAL Diameter Sz x Pin Length as Standard TACK PIN. Just add a graphic under 2mm thick clear plastic & you've got these. They're NOT flimsy & not one plastic top came off of the 30 I got. If you like to use tack pins, these are for you :)

This is a package of 39 stars. They are not peel and stick nor are they hole punched for hanging. They are very light weight and will not endure much handling. I was going to use these in our onsite day care but now will wait until I can laminate them. They are in 3 sizes. They are sort of cheap looking and the kind of thing I’d expect to find in an under 1$ bin at Target. A lot less useful than I anticipated.

I have / had a Samsung CLP-315 Laser Printer that has been running flawlessly for years (8+). I have always replaced the printer cartridges with official, Samsung replacement cartridges even though they are more expensive than generic / off-brand ones. When I went to order new ones this time, the retailers I typically used did not have official cartridges for sale. Disappointing, but not unsurprising giving the printer's age at this point, I guess. After some searching, I landed on these GREENSKY toner cartridges, noting a few negative reviews around my type of printer but generally positive reviews overall. I ordered them, received them in a timely fashion and installed them without incident.The problems started when I began printing. The first few prints (black and white) were fuzzy and blurry. No problem, I assume the new cartridges are just warming up. After that, prints start smearing a bit and I'm getting ghosted images from previous page prints on the following pages. Again, I'm willing to assume some break in period, even though I've not had these issues before and I'm about 25 prints in at this point. I tried printing a full page, color image hoping to "reset" the print heads. The print never came out and now I have error lights.Long story short (or moderately lengthy, in this case), after much work trying to find a mysteriously absent, jammed page, troubleshooting across the internet and eventually disassembling the top of the printer. Based on my research / troubleshooting / repair guides, I finally found the missing page wrapped around what I believe is the "fuser" assembly in the printer. The ink / page glued to itself / the fuser assembly. Attempted and failed to extract the paper and at this point would need to engage with Samsung customer service, a lengthy process that will probably cost me more than a replacement printer is worth to fix it, given that the printer is out of warranty and I was using off-brand toner cartridges.Is it possible this catastrophic failure was just prints away from happening anyway and it had nothing to do with the toner cartridges? I suppose its technically possible. Do I believe that these off-brand toner cartridges directly contributed to or created the issue that ultimately trashed my printer? Absolutely. Can I prove any of that in the "court of law"? Nope. So I'm just here leaving a disappointed Amazon review and returning these cartridges in hopes that I can at least recoup my $49 on top of my bricked printer.  ┐( -“-)┌
I saw reviews that the tape smells, and it does. Other reviews said it did not tear off very well, and it does not. I have good tape dispensers and I fought with it to cut. Returning it

Not sure where all the positive reviews came from, but this dispenser is bad. The clip holds the tape too tight, making it impossible use. In addition, once you do get it to put the tape down, the cut end of the tape get stuck back in the role, which means disassembling the unit to start over again.

The only reason i give 1 start is the only way I would get to write the review but it's not worth the money at all very cheaply made and broke easily I was result excited sewing that my class is an all girls I thought this would have been a lovely addition to my unicorn themed classroom but it arrived broken and the seller didn't replaced or refund😶

I got two of these easels for my wedding.  The instructions are not easy to follow, and there is no hole for the hook and chain to be attached.  As one reviewer noted, it takes a lot of ingenuity to put this thing together, and I don't know if it will last honestly.  Also one of the poles them came broken in two!  Luckily my fiance was able to glue it and paint the edges black.  Looks nice for now and I hope it holds up for the wedding.  I guess you get what you pay for with this one.

Second time purchasing. First was fine. This time arrived folded, with warping to the plastic covering. Doesn't appear to have happened during shipment, looks like somebody was comfortable sending damaged product. Cheap enough to not warrant the trouble of a return, but garbage enough to review.

My first HP printer (changed from my usual Epson WF models) because of decent reviews. If I was reviewing the printer only I would give it 5 stars. However the auto doc feeder for making copies or scanning docs is DEFECTIVE (all copies and scans are skewed) and I'm being generous with 2 stars. I ordered this on Jun 26, but was not able to use it regularly till October. So it's too late to return it unfortunately.The question about skewed ADF scans & HP8720(& similar models) has been asked again & again on support forums. The answer is always the same, scripted, stock response. The fact is that the ADF is a defective piece of hardware and no amount of reset/power down cycles, or firmware upgrade is going to fix it. I will buy more HP laptops but HP printer/scanners? Never again.

Two-Week Final Update. I tried and tried and gave it every chance. It wouldn't stay connected no matter what. What sealed the return deal was I unplugged it one last time to make it connect - buttons nor off switch would do the trick - and it didn't stay connected long enough for me to get back to my chair and print. This is NOT a printer, at least not one I would ever endorse.Day 3 8/8/19: Wouldn't wake up today to print. Had to physically go to it and bring it out of sleep. This is NOT a solution for the long term. If this cannot be fixed it will go back.Day 1 8/6/19: Functions well. Dash replenishment setup didn't work. That's probably a blessing. Too much info being shared and hacked these days anyway. It's not an important function for me, though the $20 credit would have been nice. Scans look good, though I need to do more testing. I have things setup the way I like them, just waiting for some real world situations rather than test cases.Will be using this for my home business and will likely get the secondary paper tray. I have a big dog Kyocera Mita that has it all, but just need something smaller with most of the functions it has. No need for faxing anymore so this machine should give me what I need. I have a Brother DSmobile® 920DW scanner that I love but the usb is wonky and I got tired of fixing it so the autofeed scanner on this machine will be a blessing.Brother left out the install CD, from what I can tell. Can't find it where it should be and there aren't any other places they would have put it that I can think of. Great start, have to go download all the software. I'll update this review as I get to use the machine more.

As of this writing, the picture of the Scotch Removable Mounting Squares shows that they're capable of holding up to 2 pounds. It's clearly displayed in the upper right hand corner of the box on the Amazon listing. When I received them, while everything else looked the same, the print in the upper right displayed that they only hold up to 1 pound, not 2. That's quite a difference.At any rate, since the lightweight poster board photograph that I wanted to hang on my wall weighed a mere 8 ounces, I expected no problem using these mounting squares. I was wrong. Within a matter of days, the picture fell off of the wall and was damaged. In addition, when I removed the squares from the wall, they left behind some of the gooey adhesive, making them 100% useless for the purpose intended.The bottom line is that this is a lousy product. Even though I received a different one that was pictured in the listing, it should have been capable of holding up an 8 ounce picture. Leaving adhesive on my walls was just adding insult to injury.

It has almost NO power to it.  If you hold it up against a wall, floor, corner and exert even a modicum of pressure it stops spinning.  TOTAL waste of money .. extremely disappointed.  Would not recommend to anyone !If I could give it LESS than 1 star I would.
The pens are great, but the picture implies 6 pens included. In reality, there are only two.  My review is for the misleading photo, not the product itself.

Here I am, ignoring all the reviews saying how it can't cut anything. I wasn't too worried since I was only wanting to cut single sheets of photo paper, as my printer can't do borderless printing and I print 8x10s on 8.5x11 sheets of photo paper. However, the cuts weren't clean at all. Sometimes it would take two cuts, and every time it would leave little bits of the matte side of the paper still attached.
These took a long time to arrive. A couple are unravelled and falling apart. Very cheap. Would not recommend and I will not purchase again. Wouldn't even give it a 1 star but they do write.

Print is very tiny, many islands are not exist and those that are exist, disappear after you scratch them. Doesn’t come with a frame and it’s hard to find this size. I regret ever purchasing this thing!  Where to start...I've had this printer for over a year now and it has been underwhelming from the start.I purchased this for my home office.PROS: The only redeeming quality of this printer is that I can feed multiple pages to scan or fax.  But that feature only goes but so far.CONS: Print quality is a joke.  Every single page I've printed has streaks, despite multiple cleanings, ink cartridge changes, etc.If you're printing docs with just black text you MIGHT be ok, but anything else, forget about it.The monthly fee for ink that seemed like a great economical option is awful.  You get charged for every page, but thanks to a bug it would print things that you cancelled out of the queue as well as the stuff you did want.  If you don't have internet you can't print.  Customer service while not the worst I've encountered, seem unable to fix the poor print quality issues I've had since I've received the thing.I know it's easy to gloss over a bad review especially when you see other good ones, but I promise you, save your dollars and your sanity, get another printer.

This is not a copic marker. Putting a white sticker on it that says copic does not make it copic! Also the nib is not brush tip and does not blend. This product deserves ZERO STARS. This is nothing but an expensive poorly constructed knock-off.
I can’t give this product any stars. It did not work with my printer. The printer would not recognize the cartridges. I would not order this again

Would have left 0 stars if possible. Was unacceptable quality.... very blurry- like it had been blown up from a scanned picture and printed. Could not read the text... Seller would not refund the purchase price.
I should have trusted the previous reviews that the product is very low quality, cheap material.  It might have been worth about $0.40, but certainly not several dollars.

I purchased this paper trimmer based on reviews and wish I hadn't.  The blade leaves ragged edges to any paper cut, even thin copy paper which I tried to see how it would do.  Will not cut cardstock cleanly or completely at all.  The blade is either not sharp enough or long enough to make a clean cut.Would never purchase again nor recommend.

Why design a scale that takes two hands to turn on? Yes the scale is so light and the turn on button hard to push in that one must hold one side while you push the button or the scale will slide right off the table.Why design a scale that you then must turn on every time you use it because it turns off after about 30 seconds on its own. My old scale came on when you put the package on it a much better design.Why design a very annoying beep, like a truck backing up when you have a item on the scale.Anyone that gave this scale a good review has never owned a good scale.

So glad I waited to review this. When I got it, it was super easy to assemble, was comfortable!! Then just TWO days later you can feel the bottom metal on your butt, it squeaks and is just uncomfortable. Crappy chair. Literally donating to a local Good Will and spending more on a decent chair.

Well, my intention was to get this for the metallic gel pens but there was not one metallic gel pen in the package.  I'm very disappointed.  I'm giving it a two star review only because the packaging it came in was quite nice.  I won't be buying these again.
Great idea, but over time, it'll become loose and fall off. The ink cartridges also leak. Two stars is generous.

Great pen but the connection fell apart and you lose it.  Poorly designed.  It should be a clickable pen where the connecting loop is not on a detachable part.I really wanted to like it.  Great pen until I lost the actual pen piece.1 star for bad engineering

Is so hard to use software and works only for iphone or IOS devices .NON Friendly software ever.  0 stars shame is made in USA.When is Sunny days you can not see working hoers. for $200 at least need to use better 7 Elements digit diodes. !

After going through HP's documentation and troubleshooting process and checking online forums, I concluded that I had to replace the printhead, despite the printer's being only 1.5 years old. This expensive part did not, however, correct the problem. I can't tell whether it was a defective printhead or some problem with the printer itself that HP doesn't acknowledge and so offers no help with, but at any rate, I have an unusable printer PLUS a useless $62 expense.

It is relatively good and easy to assemble. Wheels are quite well made, and all the nuts and bolts are at least decent quality. There are still few buts. Instructions easy and good enough, yet quite small.Two stars because the panel attaching to the frame where you hang the TV didn't have holes in correct place. It may be individual incidence, but practically prevents from building this thing without drilling new holes. Getting those new holes into correct place may be tricky, but doable if you know your way with tools and such.I was in impression that this would allow you to hang the TV in almost any height you want, but that was not the case. It will put the TV quite high from the ground. Again, you can drill new holes to the support booms and have it your way.That glass plate cannot handle much more than 4 lbs (roughly 2 kg). My AVR device is 4 kg (around 8 lbs) and it already bends quite much, I would not put 5 kg (10 lbs) weight on it permanently.I would rate this to 3 stars if those holes in that plate would be in correct place out of the box. And I would rate this to 4 stars if there were two more settings lower for the TV height. 5 stars if glass plate would have proper structural support.
These don’t write at all! I took a chance after reading other reviews but definitely got duds.

Girlfriend bought this due to the 4 star rating - I can only assume the majority of you received a substantially different product than we did.  Nothing fit together correctly.  The 'metal' parts on the top panel are discolored.  All surfaces were marred before being painted.  After getting the thing together, the drawer doesn't sit right - it's slightly tilted.Looking forward to ripping this piece of garbage apart, shoving it back in the box and shipping it on back!This was manufactured in Thailand - as a people, they should be ashamed.

The black was the first to be installed.  After a few pages of what I assume is the original HP ink being flushed out, the lines became less crisp, there was some smudging, and there were variations in the darkness of the print (this was all uniform text).  Strangely, if I set the printer from normal quality to best quality printing, the problem intensified.  Since these tanks are much cheaper than HP original, if you were printing a large number of review pages it would be worth it, otherwise not worth the money as I am not sending out anything printed from this ink.  Swapping in and out between quality tanks and these is not an economical option as you need to waste so much ink cleaning.I give this product 2 stars as it doesn't provide what was intended, but but it is not without use.

Loved the idea of bamboo but found this desk to be unwieldy -- very difficult to use -- and wish I'd paid more attention to the reviews. Part of the problem is the left-of-center aspect to the laptop ledge. Being CENTERED would be much more helpful! Don't really need the little shelf to the right, or the drawer. This is a BIG desk, too, and the legs are too long. I will be donating with the hope someone else will be able to use it -- maybe in bed, where there is unlimited side-to-side space. Love the bamboo, dislike the construction.

This item looked good and overall gets good reviews, but this was not what I expected. The USB did not fit well in my computer, the battery compartment was hard to open (but not if you have very tiny fingers) and, it did not advance my Power Point slides as advertised. I promptly packed it up and started a return. I'll be looking for another product.

I bought this for painting Plein air. I thought this looked great because of the chair and the cooler in the front as well as the umbrella holder. I brought it to a day painting trip to Santa Cruz Island. The cheap wheels had a lot of trouble going over the gravel paths. A rip started on top where it clasps to the body. (It was not over packed) I'm strong, but this thing is heavy and clumsy to pull. (A little bit longer handle would've been nice and I'm short!) the only reason I would even give this 1/2 star is because on one of the hottest days, the cooler pocket did keep my food cool.2nd time I used it, a rip is starting where my Plein air umbrella goes. (As a note, these umbrellas are a lot smaller than a typical beach umbrella!)3rd time used at the beach. My husband, who is a lot taller found it very hard to drag thru sand.4th time, more rips, wheel came off.5th time, just pulled it out of my car...what do you know? More rips.If you plan on using this once a year to go to the park with well-paved paths, buy it. Otherwise....forget about it! It's truly worthless.

The product design is as you would expect, simple, smart and easy to put together. It seems to be reasonable quality all things considered for its price range however I cannot recommend this product because it has clearly been used and damaged! The pen pot arrived with a large dent, a twig stuck in it and what appears to be a level of grime at the bottom. The 2 tier letter tray meanwhile had a reasonably noticable scrap on it which I do not think would have occured from rough handling in the post.As it was the 2 tier letter tray I wanted and it was still usable I have decided not to bother trying to return the set so I cannot say whether the supplier is cooperative. However I will not give it more than 2 stars as the supplier clearly did not check the products condition before sending it or even worse, did not care!

What a disappointing printer. This is my first ink-jet printer and I got attracted by the many features it offers but it has been such a let down, very quickly. Leaving aside the fact that it runs through ink at an extraordinarily high rate despite pretty light home printing use, the main issue is that the print head nozzles get clogged up very regularly and you need to run the cleaning routine just as regularly. The process consumes ink which is costly (check out the cost of replacement cartridges before you buy one, this will require a dedicated budget!) but, 2 months after I purchased it, the black ink nozzle has become chronically clogged which requires running the nozzle cleaning routine MULTIPLE times to get it fixed. I was looking for a simple home printing solution but this has become a constant headache. I simply would not recommend it.

It works. Kinda. If you don't mind the occasional 1/2 letter (numerous attempts made, but mine was unable to form the letter "T" and only creating "I". Or the fact that the letters seem to be at different heights (though if going for the Retro look, those two flaws may in fact be desirable....hence the 2 stars). But otherwise, it definitely wasn't a keeper.

Oh my goodness this is the worst paper. I had high hopes, I was really hoping it was as good as 4 stars. I tried four different sheets on two different printers. If feels nice to the touch but it prints a blur. But it sure sucks up the ink. So sorry I purchased. All of the people who used this for scrapbooking must be using it as a backer paper. Which I could rate half a star, or better yet... No stars.  After literally 2 uses (and by uses I mean 2 sheets of laminating paper) the paper rolled around into the machine and became jammed inside. WOULD NOT RECCOMEND. DO NOT BUY!!
I made a mistake - didn't see the poor reviews / rating before buying it. So hard to tear from a tape dispenser. I would pay up a little and buy 3M's Scotch tape....

I was going through some old boxes when I found a nice Monteverde pen I received as a gift over ten years ago. I couldn't remember why I left it in there until I bought these refills. They're as cheap as I now remember. They don't write smoothly, the ink fades and skips, and these newer refills must be thinner, because there's a very slight wobble with the tip. I'm only giving these two stars because they make this expensive pen work again, albeit poorly.

I'm a heavy person, and my office chair sits on a hardwood floor.  For several years I've used inexpensive bamboo mats, but these tend to start fraying and splitting and I've gotten tired of replacing them.  Felt-lined casters seemed the ideal solution!  Well...  Not so much.  They don't scratch the floor, but they also don't ROLL.  At any given time, moving the chair in any given direction, two or three of the casters simply don't turn and end up having to be dragged sideways across the floor.  I don't know if this is damaging the floor, but it certainly makes it difficult to move one's chair!  So I'm giving up and trying the higher-rated rubber version - and am not overly pleased with shelling out yet another $16 for new casters!

I am a kindergarten teacher.  What does that mean? No money.  So when I read the reviews on this product, I was so excited!  As a kindergarten teacher, I print a LOT, and a LOT in color.  We are granted 200 copies in a month and 2 (TOTAL) ink cartridges for our classroom printer A YEAR.  So needless to say, it's been 3 weeks since school started and I'm out of ink.Enter HP ink.  Way too expensive and gone way too quick.  I bet people are right when they say that HP only fills them partway so we will have to buy them sooner.  So I went looking for an alternative.Enter LD ink.  Now I have heard of remanufactured ink before and only heard terrible things.  I wanted to check it out for myself.  I read TONS of reviews.  It seemed that the only people that were having any trouble were the people who didn't know how to change the "HP Only" settings on their printers.  I do.  So I ordered them.Now, I had prepared myself for something to not be perfect, and had already accepted that it may not work out as well as I was used to.This is what actually occurred:I opened all of the inks carefully and precisely.  Pulled off any excess tabs or stickers.Cleaned the ink stalls in the printer with a cotton swab from my kit.Installed the ink into the stalls.  It fit perfectly.So far, so good.I closed the ink access door and WHAM! Problem #1......."INK CARTRIDGE IS DAMAGED OR MISSING" ((magenta square))Me: Pull magenta out, double check everything.  Make sure it looks just like the rest. Put it back in."INK CARTRIDGE IS DAMAGED OR MISSING"To myself: "Don't get upset! Just get the other one (I was so happy I bought a huge double pack!)."Open access door, Take out magenta cartridge. and WHAM!Covered in pink.  The cartridge spewed ink all over me and my clothes and my floor.No reason to elaborate and share what I did next.  I must maintain my stellar reputation. :)Put 2nd Magenta cartridge in.Close access door.No error message. Yay!So then I tried to print.......I'm going to stop now b/c I'm getting upset all over again...I wish I could show you a picture of what came out.No consistency, stripes, clumps, Lots of blue here, no blue there.  Lots of... well you get the picture.I will not tell you NOT to buy this product because I may have gotten a bad batch.  But I am feeling duped.  Makes you wonder who is writing those reviews.  Funny how something so small can RUIN your day,LG, please tell me I got a bad batch!

I really can't believe the good reviews. It said it was made out of plastic and maybe it is but it's really nothing but a sticker with maybe a plastic coating.  I assumed it was some kind of a plaque at $5 each.  I ordered two of these.  Had it been a 2 pack for $5 I might have kept them but at $5 each this is a complete scam.And to make matters worse one of them arrived damaged as they were put loosely in a box with other items.  Junk!!!

I must have received a different version of cards. There were no lines inside mine to write on, and the cards seemed kind of cheap. They came in one piece that you fold yourself, but the crease was not made well enough so the cards keep popping open to lay flat. The envelopes were thin and needed to be taped shut. I was unfortunately not happy with this product. Based on the good reviews, I was disappointed.

I wish I would have read all the reviews before I purchased these!! They are very thin, and look horrible if you are lucky enough to even get them on the package. VERY disappointed!! Buy another brand!!

I was very enthusiastic about this printer based on the outstanding reviews it has received and my generally positive experience using Epson professional printers for scientific graphics.  While this printer is indeed speedy and produces good quality photos, an apparent mechanical malfunction on roughly every third print causes it to skew the paper slightly sideways when a given print is ~75% done.  This leaves a white triangle on one side of the print and leaves the remaining 25% of the print misaligned.  This happens using the included Epson starter paper.  Additionally, I find small black ink blobs on the trailing edge of about every third photo.  I really wanted to like this printer, but I have to say that ruining more than 50% of the prints is completely unacceptable for any printer.
If the background is colored, it does not work. I should have paid a little more and got a better one. I could not find 0 star. If I could I gave 0 star, not 1 star.

I wanted to like this pen. It replaced an Inka model that I'd had for years, and which was very reliable, reasonably small, and could open into a full sized pen, comfortable to hold. But the part where it attached to the keyring eventually broke. I've seen other reviews speak to problems with the pen falling out of its holder. I never had that happen, and it's been in my pocket for a year or so. Perhaps there is manufacturing variability, and some grip tighter than others. No, the form factor is fine, it's very compact, telescopes into a reasonably useful length, seems quite sturdy, but the darn thing doesn't write consistently. I've been through all the refills it came with, and while it may write initially, it doesn't when I need it to. So it has really been pointless to carry it. I just bought a  Fisher Backpacker Space Pen, Blue (BP/BL)  to replace it. The Fisher is bigger than I'd like, but I'd rather be carrying something I can count on, and I've had Fishers in the past and know they are reliable.

cant understand WHY this thing is rated hi.It prints horrible in color.  Great it b and w.I called epson and was on the phone for and hourthey blamed it on amazon, got another onesame result.DOSENT PRINT PICTURES WELL

I have an HP 6280 printer. The ink fits fine with no error messages but I replaced all but the light cyan and everything prints faint bluish. I can't get any red tones at all. The black only even prints super light with skips resulting in unreadable documents. I took it out and shook it a little and ink splattered out of it and made a mess. I just bought this because of all the good reviews and I was out of ink but man am I sorry! DO NOT BUY THESE INK CARTRIDGES!!!!  THEY ARE HORRIBLE!!!

I would give this product zero stars if possible, but under the circumstances I gave it brownie points for letting one of my posters stay up for this month. My mother had purchased 4 packs of Scotch Removable Mounting Squares so I can put posters and decorations up without damaging the walls of my dorm room. I had put 4 mounting squares on a poster. It literally fell within the first hour. After the first month, I got sick of it and put on 8 mounting squares. Still fell.That's not the end of the story. I had purchased a corkboard that wasn't truly that heavy. I put 8 on. it fell within the hour. I put 16 on and it within the week. I just gave up and put 3M command strips and it seems to be working fine (alas, costing me some money from my broke pockets).But, everyone's different. maybe my packages were in a horrible condition or something.

I generally don't give poor reviews but seriously, I was shocked that Tape sold in 2019, could be this bad ! Sure you pay for what you get, but good grief. But it's my own fault, I read some negative reviews regarding how hard the tape is to cut & I was a non-believer. No more !

TOO BAD ZERO STARS IS NOT AN OPTION.  This cartridge is NOT compatible with HP printer and if you want to print with it you have to jump through about 5 hoops every time you want to print.  These cartridges have a chip in them and HP sees to it that if they print at all, it is a huge pain in the you know what to do it.  Don't buy these unless you like wasting money, taking hours to print a single document (every time), and just generally love being frustrated beyond belief.

Update March 22, 2014:  The blue ink stopped working on literally the first page I printed that required it. Red and yellow still work, but without blue you also can't get green or gray, so  not such a good deal after all for the color cartridge. The black is still working fine.This was a combo pack including an HP15-compatible black cartridge and an HP23-compatible tri-color cartridge, sold by New York Toner with free shipping.The black cartridge was just in a generic box that said "Remanufactured Cartridge", and the cartridge and electrical contacts looked pretty good.The color cartridge was in a box with the "Premium" brand name saying "Replacement Inkjet Cartridge." The contacts looked kind of worn.When I installed them, the printer (HP Deskjet 810C) would not recognize the color cartridge. (I put the old nearly-empty cart back in with the new black cart, and the printer recognized the old one.) Other reviewers of remanufactured color injkect carts have reported similar problems.I cleaned the contacts of the new color cart, back and bottom, with a rag and some denatured alcohol, and after letting it dry thoroughly, replaced the cart. The printer was happy, and after running the print head alignment routine and printing a test page, so was I.For the price, this is a great solution (as long as they work) and free shipping makes it even better.

I have been using Lamy writing instruments for the past three years. This white Lamy pencil was my reserve, and today when I finally got to use it, it broke! For a German made pencil and for the price that I paid, I am giving it not a very favorable rating. On the other hand, the other pencil I purchased in Germany while there is still working and I hope it will last for a while more. Disappointed with this one. Wish I could exchange it or something...

I’m trying to be committed to writing reviews, and honest ones, because I’m a review READER. But, I am cringing at my handwriting in these photos so be kind 😩🤣Well, these are your pretty basic label stickers. A good amount came in the pack. The only thing I have to say is that it is not the strongest STICK. So, I don’t think these are going to last long term. I would buy again if I needed something I have used before.However, I’m on the hunt for labels with a stronger stick so that, long-term, (more than a few weeks..because I haven’t even had these for a week yet), the label is STILL holding on..Overall, I would skip buying these and search up “strong stick label stickers” or something like that. If you REALLY need labels ASAP, these are fine..but you’ll be rubbing them down to stick again often.Good luck! Thanks for reading ☺️

I bought this set after looking at the high reviews it received and it is a trusted brand name, however, whenever I get in an automated system and have to press 1 or whatnot it does not make the proper tone according whatever system you are in; hence it keeps re-asking for the input.  It is also not as easy as some lesser name systems with finding last numbers that dialed you and calling them back.

I agree with the other reviews.  While the mesh bags are so so pretty, they are not well made.  I've used one for the past 5 days and it already ripped away from the zipper.  I don't believe it has anything to do with the stitching.  Since it is mesh, the way it is intertwined makes it easy for the horizontal threading to be pulled up with just a little bit of weight inside the bag.  What needs to be done is this.  The ends that are sewn under the zipper need to be glued (about 1/4 inch wide) so that the horizontal threading does not pull away with the slightest bit of weight.  The glue will hold the horizontal threading to the vertical threading. Then it should be sewn to the zipper.

I really loved this chair on the site. It was easy enough to assemble (took me about an hour) although I had to really force the last set of screws.The biggest complaints I have, however, is that the material is pretty cheap and not very durable (I had tears in the top of it within 2 months) and after using it for the last 3 months the suspension (that allows the chair to stay in place) weakened. Thankfully, I have a standing desk that can be moved up and down, but after adjusting my desk over the course of a couple of weeks, I realized I hadn't changed the height of my desk but that my chair was just actually lower!I kept trying to bring it back up to its highest height and it will remain there...for about a good 20 mins, then it begins to gradually shift down again (es no bueno).I also agree with other reviewers' feedback that the tilt forward can be a bit awkward and am only just now correlating the timing of me getting this chair to the back pain I've started to have in the last couple of months.All in all, it's a cute chair if you're looking for something stylish that you only need to sit in every now and again. But if you need a chair (for work/home) that you have to sit in for several hours a week, I'd pass on this one.
buy BIC don't buy these forget the other reviews. these are horrible! the tape doesn't stick to the paper and you constantly have to fix the roll as it comes unraveled.
As stated by other reviewers, these envelopes are 5" x 3.75", not the advertised size.

Just bought the full pack of color ink around $54, printed 20 flyers on Standard Vivid settingALL OF THE RED IS GONE, and the blue is down to a dribble, yellow down to about 1/2Cant print with black ink only without filling the colored. I did not read ALL reviews as others surely have reviewed

Do Not Buy! I hope this review will be helpful to someone. Save your money and buy something of better quality. The glue on these envelopes is nonexistent! The quality of the envelopes are good but they are worthless because they do no seal.

I have had these pens for about 2 weeks and am on my third one. They start out writing smooth, dark, and neat, but then the ink quickly dries up, and they start writing really lightly. Although, it appears that the pen is still full of ink, the ink won't make it to paper. I can shake the pen. Draw circles on the paper. Nothing works. Is there a secret? I rarely leave product reviews but these pens irritate me. I am switching back to G2.
No handle included even though some of the recent reviews says it comes with one, in fact one review says every tube has a cardboard handle, bait and switch beware!

I bought the 4990 to reproduce photos and slides. To steal a line fron another review, the results are suitable for refrigerator art, but just barely. Photos made from slides are particularly terrible. I would say results from any enlargement are unsatisfactory for any purpose.I don't blame Epsen. Their products are generally as good as their competitors, often better. I think the problem - at least for me - is that I believed the hype that high end scanners produce professional or near-professional results. This claim leads to unrealistic expectations for people who know what professional work looks like. The results are barely good enough to send copies of pictures to close family members. You certainly could not use one of these scanners in a professional endeavor, or even for serious hobby work.It makes great copies of text, but so do scanners that cost $100. My advise is to buy a scanner for $100 to $200 for text scanning and hire a lab to do your photo and slide work.

This board looks great but it's of poor quality. Like other reviewers I've noticed it is made from a thin film but my biggest issue is that it's hard to erase markings. I've used a variety of dry erase markers and no luck. I've had to use a pencil eraser to erase the board. It shouldn't be that difficult.

This is a box of 12 and every one of them were chipped to some degree.  Some had tiny chips and others had huge chips.  The box was undamaged and only a few of the chips were in the box.  They were put in the box, which was sealed in plastic, already damaged.  The reviews looked pretty good, so I'm returning these and going to get the same ones again only because my grandson really wants them.  I am not very optimistic that the next ones won't also need to be returned.  If it wasn't for the chips, they look pretty nice.  The replacement order just arrived.  I looked them over real close and this time all of them look good.  My grandson should be pleased with this treasure of colorful diamond.

OMG ! THERE IS NOTHING GOOD ABOUT THIS CART. IT SAYS LARGE IN THE DESCRIPTION, PROBABLY LARGE TO A BABY. THE PIECE OF CRAP CAME WRAPPED IN PLASTIC BAGS.
