I RARELY leave reviews, but I bought this about 2 years ago and it's been nothing but a big headache.  It errors out all the time.  The lines are blurry and disjointed.  The text is blurry and cheap looking.  I have this for my home office and I can hardly send stuff to customers because it looks so poorly printed.  It's weird though- When I work in word, and use clip art and designs, it prints okay... but for day to day text and graph printing, it's awful.  Paper jams occur frequently.  The settings never seem to align with my computer settings, and it errors out all the time.  My ink cartridges are brand new right now, and it will not print any text for me right now.  Just faded looking blurry blobs... soo insanely frustrating...The scanner function does not work properly either.  I can't put in a piece of paper and hit scan... I have to open the application on my computer and go through that way... a waste of time.  So anyyyyways.  It has only been 2 years and I'm already printer shopping again.  Save your money.

I rarely give something a bad review but this time I am.  I find it hard to believe there is only 22% percent return rating.  I will try to return this since it is defective, in my opinion.  I've set the combination exactly as instructed,  the buttons click, as stated in the instructions but the open button WILL NOT slide down completely to open making this product useless.  I've had two other people try to get it to work with no luck.  I will try to return this since it has to be defective.  should i be unable to return it I've wasted almost $30.00 on something that is useless.  Save your money and get a different item.

I have bought this Linkyo cartridge (replacement for Canon 128) many times in the past and had excellent results.  When I installed a new cartridge (purchased 8/7/22) the 1st and subsequent copies had a row of equally-spaced 1/8 inch dots down the left side of the paper (8 dots per page).  I then removed the faulty cartridge and installed the second cartridge from the same box.  It had the same problem with dots on the left side of the page.I was not sure if the problem was the cartridge or the Canon machine, so I ordered a new box of Linkyo cartridges.  The new cartridge worked fine.  I then called Linkin Customer Service listed on the side of the box.  Apparently the number is no longer working. I then decided to write this review to express my frustration.

I have a similar cart I use to bring packages to the post office.  I bought it at a flea market, and it lasted six or seven years before it broke.  I looked at the dimensions of this cart, and it seemed slightly bigger than the cart I was replacing, so I went ahead and ordered one.  When it arrived I discovered that the dimensions given for the width wasn't the width of the basket, it was the length of the axle.  The length wasn't from the rear of the basket to the front of the basket, it was from the back edge of the rear wheel to the front edge of the front wheel. This cart with listed dimensions of 16.8 x 36.9 x 21.2 actually had a basket with dimensions of 13.2 x 20.5 x 14.8.  My old cart, that appeared to be slightly smaller than this one, could hold tweelve 12 x 9 x 3 boxes.  This one will hold six.  I've thrown away $29.99 on a cart that won't fit my needs at all because the description was deceptive.  It's getting one star because Amazon won't let me leave any less.  Only order this if you need a small cart, because that's what you'll be getting.

The material is scratchy and rest is made of hard foam, it does not conform to your wrist at all (not anything like memory foam or gel). This makes my wrist too high for my mouse and I have to position more of my hand on it to get a straight wrist. I am giving 2 stars only because maybe someone out there wants a really high rest with material that does not compress.
The ink cartridge looks like a kid put it together, but, so far, it is working fine!!!Changed my mind on the review. after a couple of months, it completely clogged up my printer.
NOT original hp ink! Packaging is hp, but the cartridge inside is NOT. Ink exploded ruining my printer. Buyer BEWARE!!DO  NOT  BUY!! Wish I could rate negative stars.

I received this mouse pad around the beginning of December, I work from home on the computer and wanted a comfortable, gelled wrist pad when using my mouse. This one was great, a little smaller than I expected but it still worked. The gel pad was very comfortable. Unfortunately, about 2 weeks ago (just over a month of normal use) I had to throw it away because the seam at the bottom of the gel pad opened up and the gel oozed out everywhere. So, with daily use (and by use I mean simply resting my wrist on it for half of a work day every day) it couldn’t hold up for longer than about 5 weeks. But I did like it before I had to toss it, so I’ll give it 2.

After reading other reviews I agree, this is a problem. We don’t buy printers to be insulted by the company that made faulty items to begin with. I Will Not Buy From Them Again. I would give this 0 stars if I could.  I had Sanford prismacolor 30 years ago and they never broke. In fact I still have most of them. But this new set of Premiers break all the time and I have two different kinds of prismacolor sharpeners. I also have tried many other quality sharpeners to no avail. The pen works as normal, but the wrong pens were sent to me. Looking at the reviews, all the black pens seem to be the wrong ones

The reviews tell me, this may be a first paper cutter, for many of the reviewers. Not at all what was expected.It is as light as a feather and the first word that comes to mind, is "cheap".I don't like the fact that the cutting edge, sits so far from the right side and the "lift", unless you are left-handed, is annoying on the left side and unnecessary, in any event.Have been using a comparable Wescott for over 7 years, but the groove finally became worn to such a degree, had to find another one. I was disappointed at this Fellowes Mesh Partition file pocket. The sticky tape to attach the viper pin to the cubicle would not stay in place and kept falling off after a few minutes despite not having any documents inside the tray. I wanted to love this product because it would save desk space, but due to the poor tape attachment, I’m giving it a one star! This printer prints okay when the wireless connection is working, which is rarely. I can't print anything if I'm on a time crunch to get something done, because printing usually involves a lengthy phone call with Epson support to figure out why my printer isn't talking to my computer. In their defense, they always fix it (customer support is the only reason I'm giving this printer 2 stars instead of just one), but the fixes are short-lived. I'm on Amazon right now to order an extra-long USB cord so it can reach from our printer to our computer. It's a great idea to be able to print directly from phones, iPads, etc., but I'll take the reliability of good-old-fashioned USB any day.Also, I'm convinced that there's some kind of Gremlin drinking my printer ink, because as infrequently as we use it, we always seem to be short on ink. Maybe Epson cartridges are rigged to dry our or run out faster - it wouldn't surprise me. And it's asinine to require that there be ink in the color cartridges when I'm only printing Black and White. What exactly is the purpose of having both "Start B&W" and "Start color" buttons on the printer if I can't use only the Black cartridge without the colors?

I couldn’t leave a star review for value for money, print quality or longevity because when I had this ink delivered to me it had two color cartridges in it and no black so I had to return it. I ended up going with a different brand but remanufactured ink works just as well if not better than the expensive name brand ink.

I am quite baffled at the reviews for the Aeron. We've had them in our office for a few years now. Everyone was raving about how great they would be for their price. Now we have people sitting on folding metal chairs instead of their aerons because of the problems and discomfort they cause.The biggest flaw is the front edge of the chair part where your legs hang over. There is no padding. The edge is rock hard and after sitting in the chair for a couple hours, you can barely feel the back of your legs.The next design issue causes long term damage, and that seems to be the way the seat "bowls". I am 29 and have bad hip pain while walking after prolonged sitting in the aeron. You can feel it as soon as you stand up, as your hips shift back into a normal position. Out of 80 employees at my work, the only person who "loves" the aeron is the manager that was in charge of ordering them. I think people are blinded by the fact that they wasted [...] on a chair and force themselves to like it.It's a fail. I have a [...] leather office chair at home.. I can sit there for hours and relax with no joint or leg pain.Pros:- Lumbar pad (which I took off because it was annoying)- Mesh seat to avoid "sw'ass"Cons:- Uncomfortable after more than 10 min- Bowl seat causes hip problems and can't stretch your legs- Hard edge under back of legs is like sitting on bleacher seats.- Arm rests on 70% of the chairs in the office have come loose or fallen off.

The chair looks nice, but for sitting it is extremely uncomfortable. I work from home and it's almost impossible to find an office chair on Amazon that is comfortable for sitting for hours. The seat on this chair is hard (I'm 111 lbs) and was immediately uncomfortable. I have hard, plastic counter stools that are more comfortable than this. I am beyond frustrated with wasting my money on chairs that are not meant to sit on. I live in a small town with no office stores nearby so cannot try out office chairs so I'm stuck. Do yourself a favor, stay away from this chair. Far away.UPDATE: As of today (December 19, 2022) the chair no longer adjusts in height. So it lasted about six weeks. It is now a one star chair.

Ordered both black and color ink for my Canon 3122. Upon replacing the black ink, without even printing out a single page, I went in to check the levels and was disappointed to see that 1/4 of the ink level was empty! Really CMTOP? Mind to say I ordered the XL version and got skimped out for a regular version which is a misleading advertisement. Very disappointed! The only reason I gave it a two star was that the packaging was very clean and professional and my printer automatically recognized the ink level without having to reset it.

The box it came in feels cheap and poorly made. The brushes do seem alright - as well as most of the stuff it came with (so far) however, the brush stand was completely obliterated when it arrived. Overall: 2 stars for quality and broken parts.

Purchased from Allaince Gadget and apparently it's not eligible for return. All 3 ink refills don't flow ink. Major disappointment as the pen housing itself is great and seems to be well made.  The size of it retracted was exactly what I was looking for and extended works well enough. The pen locks into the cap reliably and I wouldn't think it would fall out provided that when you put away the pen you make sure it is locked in place.  I can't imagine using this to write lengthy notes but I was looking to use it to sign receipts and this would have been perfect. If the ink would actually flow as intended this would be a 5 star product for me without a doubt.
I literally opened this yesterday and there is black paint chips all over. Probably a defect but will keep at 1 star until I hear from customer service

I bought this for my 8-year-old daughter's birthday.  She loves dragons.  Here is what she told me to write for this review: "The head popped off as soon as we tried to put staples in it.  It broke my heart."You literally could not get the stapler open to put staples in it without the head coming unglued as another reviewer showed.  Do not buy this piece of junk if you expect to use it as a stapler that looks like a dragon.

I gave it a chance since it had 7 five star reviews. The black cartridge worked for 3 printings before it said I was out of ink. I opened it up and saw that it was leaking ink from the bottom onto the sensor. I tried wiping it off carefully because I direly needed to print a shipping label for my business. That's when I noticed the Canon logo crudely scratched through.  These are likely refills and poorly done. Either that or they got ahold of defective cartridges. Either way, it's not worth the gamble at 2/3 the price of the Canon cartridges.  I just wasted three days and now I have to try to return this crap. Will have to purchase the Canon cartridges before getting a refund for these.If you are the "manufacturer" reading this, don't waste your time trying to make me happy. I'm not deleting this review, nor do I want one of your replacements. Stop cheating people. You're worse than telemarketers because you waste much more of people's time and money. I'm reporting you to Amazon.

So unfortunate. I recorded my message, and when I unplugged the recording cable from the device, the little piece that connects the two broke off immediately. I was extremely careful with it, I wasn't rough with it at all and it was so easily broken. I was supposed to use it as part of a birthday surprise to my boyfriend for concert tickets to go see his favorite band, and that whole idea got ruined as soon as the device broke. I could still hear the song even after the piece broke off, but it was full of static and I couldn't even hear the song I had playing in the background. And it wasn't my surroundings or the video I recorded off of because I recorded in a quite area and the video was great quality. I hate leaving bad ratings on products, but I highly think this product is not worth it at all based on how much I paid for it and how cheaply it worked.

This is not a review of the chair itself. I have not even seen it yet. BUT...My daughter and granddaughter put it together for me in my absense and first of all there were NO INSTRUCTIONS. Second of all the tool provided broke during assembly, and third and worst of all my granddaughter hurt her finger in the process to the extent that it was "a bloody mess."All extremely frustrating and disappointing... I only hope the chair fares better than the assembly.
I used these to hang glow-in-the-dark stars on my son's wall. Within 24 hours, they were all on the floor. Those stars weigh, what, an ounce? These don't hold anything.

I can not believe the reviews, this is the worst product on the planet, I used it for 3 months with Epson ink only and the nozzles started clogging, I  used this printer for 3 more months with nothing but clogging issues, the customer service answers timely and now they are going to get me another one but it is a refurbished one and they wanted to do a hold of 101.00 on a card so i am sending it back to them first so i don't have to use a card that way? the only other option is to throw it in the dumpster... because I do not want any one else to have to deal with this. the printer is so bad that they have to send you a refurbished one...

It is well worth buying more expensive slips. These absolutely do not work. The paper won't come off the back without tearing. The plastic is so thin that you cannot easily handle it to adhere properly. I normally dont write review, but these are so bad that we have to just out a big piece of tape over them.

I should have been suspicious that these cartridges sold at a substantial discount over Brother OME parts but was swayed by the 4 star rating listed for this product. I hope this will help others as my documents are dingy and blotchy, completely unacceptable for anything but file copies.
This is some of the worst tape I've ever had! It's very difficult to tear a piece off. Impossible to tear it with one hand. See my video review for details.
Do not purchase. Didnt want to give it any stars. Crappy product. Blade just tears your paper up.

On the positive note, I like the colors, and writing itself goes well. They seem to be erasable as expected. Really the primary issue is that I purchased these for use with a Vellee smart notebook. Per some other questions and reviews, I saw that these work with other smart notebooks. Vellee ecommended using "Frixion" pens, so I thought these would work. However, the only way I can really use these is if I take my picture and clean each page each time before I can change pages. If not, the ink stays wet for long periods of time. Even hours after I finished writing I flipped the page, and when I went back to the page it had smeared due to the ink still being wet. Often I write for pages and pages. I don't really want to stop in the middle of working just to take the picture of the page and clean off the work every page. So these might work well for other needs, but they don't work for my Vellee and this is why I purchased them, so I'm definitely disappointed.

Ok I don't think the 5 star reviews on this product are honest. The set is extremely cheap. The case is flimsy and the compass is not well built. I doubt this will serve the needs of my son. I am generally very good at confirming 5 star reviews but fell for it hard this time around. Buyer beware!

Nothing wrong with the seller, this review is on the manufacture of the product only. The adhesion isn't quite sticky enough, they peel off double corrugated (raw, no ink) cardboard boxes when exposed to the AZ summer heat. The clear plastic piece is also very thin, I've torn through it while loading it. I will stick with my Sparco 41927's instead.
No  start rating . Product broke on the second day I used it. Reached out to company for a replacement.

Since the day my printer was purchased the color printing has not worked. I bought it NEW only a few months ago and I've tried everything. I thought it was the ink it came with originally, so I switched it out for new ink and it still does a poor job(see the attached pictures). I did A LOT of research for home-office printers and actually this one came very highly rated! I read reviews, I did the consumer reports research, I did it all! However, since the day I bought mine, it hasn't functioned properly! Now I am rating it with 1 star really for the COLOR PRINTING ONLY. I mean, who buys a color printer that can't print in color anyway and expects it to get over 1 star?I went online looking for a customer support phone number; I couldn't find one. So I sent a facebook message to Epson explaining the issue. I needed help quickly and I was hoping they could do it online since most of my experience with technical support for computer stuff has been bad and I'm stressed enough. Well, needless to say I think I've had my intelligence insulted by Epson more times than I can handle. The person basically told me a list of things I should try to AVOID with my Epson printer; I never knew a lot of these things. Apparently their printer works better if you download what you need to print, save it first to your computer then print it-- instead of printing directly off the screen or website.However, the worst was when the person on the phone with customer service (I wanted to avoid this) asked me to take out the ink cartridges and read her the numbers on it (making sure I had installed the right ink to begin with) and then CHECK THE BOTTOM FOR TAPE. I never said it wasn't printing ANY color by the way, I have been saying it prints color POORLY!! So by the end of my conversation she decided I'm eligible for a replacement under warranty. However, my printer arrived broken. They want to give me a refurbished one, which I politely explained angered me for a number of reasons. First, my printer still is brand new, and I didn't buy a used printer off Amazon. Second, it arrived this way, it isn't like it all the sudden broke, it's been broken the whole time. I really loved what Epson said though. Her technical support is CLEARLY not customer support because her reasoning behind me getting a refurbished one is laughable, "it's not like we can resell yours, it's defective". Well duh! However, what about the NEW ONE that I was promised when I paid money for it? That one I'm still kind of waiting for... Well my point is, BUYER BEWARE...DON'T BUY THIS PRINTER... DON'T DO IT, DON'T DO IT!

Replacement. Review downgraded after purchase. Now using these in trusty HP 6510 printer, not using photo printing (hmmm although may dedicate to Photos). HPcolor cartridges normally last 6-9 months, less than 3 months out of this set.

So worked well for short time and then printer cartridge error on my 4700. Numerous cleanings later it is just a mess ink everywhere. Hopefully it didn't ruin the printer. What a mess. definitely not an item to rely on. I usually buy HP ink but had high hopes for this because of all the positive reviews. Lesson 1 if it looks to good to be true, it probably isn't. Spend the $$ and get the HP. This product is a BIG RISK!!

Everything about this is cheap. The rollers don't fit on the bottom. It's teeny, lightweight, rickety. Unless you're petite, it would only hold one foot at a time. The one star is for actually getting here, although it is NOT worth the wait. Save yourself the aggravation.

Bought this chair a couple weeks ago, and have been sitting on it 4-8 hours per day. The padding of the seat cushion is already completely flattened, I'm sitting on hard under parts now. It doesn't tip back much at all either, which is not a deal breaker. But for $130, it should last at least a year! At this rate, I will need a new chair very quickly.
The hammock was easy to install and use under my work desk but I have had less than a month and it is already ripping at the seam. I gave 1 star because I will have to buy something different.

Worst printer I've ever owned. Let it sit idle one day and you'll have to clean the print heads before you can use it again. That cleaning by the way takes about 10 minutes and judging by how little I print uses about half the ink each time. I have gone through more print cartridges than pieces of paper.The ADF of the scanner is useless as well. If you put a piece of paper in the ADF and turn it on it pulls it half way in and gives a paper jam error. You have to turn it on, wait for it to go through the excruciatingly long boot up process, then put the paper in the ADF. Oh and you have to put them in one at a time or it thinks it's jammed.I wrote this entire review while waiting for it to finish the boot up process, and I can't type fast at all.I expected better from Epson but I know better now.After this printer I'll never buy any Epson product again.

If I could give zero stars, I would. Purchased this printer from Amazon in October 2014. Now, only 4 months later, the printer started displaying an error code and won't work. Nothing I do will clear the code. A huge waste of money and a complete disappointment.

I really liked this pencil. It looks and feels great.So, why the poor rating?It is very simple, it no longer works. It always had trouble with the lead (yes, I know, graphite) feed. Finally, it became so jammed that it can no longer be cleared. The little pin that comes with it is no match for this jam.Rotoring's website shows the tip being dissembled for clearing severe jams. The method does not work because the tip does not unscrew as shown on the website.Very simply, in less than a year, it no longer works.

This stop is not tall enough to hold most doors and it also has no bottom gripper, so it slides on hardwood floors.  It was a waste of money for me, but to be honest, my bad for not measuring before I purchased. I can't imagine that others won't have this same issue, which is the reason for writing this review. Measure first!

huge sticker with the serial number taking up all of the hand space and when removed it is incredibly uncomfortable - no other Copic dealer does that. since I cant find this marker elsewhere I was going to say deal with it, but considering how I had to re-order it because the first one never came - I feel a poor review is deserved.

I'm a professional photographer and do most of my own printing. I've always ordered Epson paper and have had bad luck with other brands in the past. I decided to give finestra a try. The paper takes ink well and is comparable to it's Epson counter part. I wish the back had some printing on it so I could more easily tell the back from the front, (minor inconvenience. I have to take 3 more seconds looking at the paper to determine which is the correct side, but for the price difference, it's worth it.) All in all, very comperable to the Epson. The reason for the 2 star review is that half of the ream had a crease in one small corner. The shipping box arrived in pristine condition, so I imagine it happened at manufacturing. Not sure what force caused such a small crease to run through so many sheets, but it was there. I had to toss the print coming though on that corner of the first 10 sheets, where the crease was biggest. I would have sent it back but I was out of paper and needed to print right away.

Unfortunately I have to write a terrible review, after install I was able to print alignment page and a few documents for my child's new school year and now my printer keeps reading cartridge error. Uninstalled and reinstalled and same error. Not quality at all in my opinion.

Reading other reviews (And trust me I hate to give bad reviews because faulty components do happen sometimes) these things seem to have missing parts like the Wireless Dongle, various kinds of packaging ranging from good to pure amateur and many fail in less than a year. Mine too has failed and is less than 6 moths old. It hasn't been used a lot because I am still setting up the planned system but while it did work it seemed fine. It has not been dropped, abused, left in high temperatures etc. It seems like something that is priced so that when it fails most people will not bother to claim or return it...  my guess is they originate from some back street assembly plant with no quality control...

Going along with a lot of the other reviewers with they installation very hard unless it's a very tiny key,  And they don't last very long wearing out really fast needing to be replaced and the color seems to fade. But all in all basically serve the purpose for a while for the money

I am an avid reader and reviewer.  I often highlight my books so that I can get back to salient passages. I was excited to get these markers as I read that they don't permeate paper and were easy to use.  They are not easy to use at all.  They feel more like a crayon or a wax stick than a highlighter and the feel of the marker on the paper is waxy as well.  Most of all, it is hard to highlight the line that you want to.  The marker is so hard to use that half the time I find myself highlighting the line below the line I'm trying to highlight.  I don't plan on getting these again or recommending them to anyone else.

If I could give no stars, I would.Installed these cartridges in my printer on July 17th. Printed exactly 12 sheets of paper- printer says toner cartridge Y is empty. The pages I printed weren't even in color.Horrible product.

The glue holding the pages together was completely cracked and it all fell apart upon removing it from the packaging. I've sent the product back for a refund. Given the other reviews on this calendar I don't trust that a replacement would have been any better.
They may only print two to three hundred then run out of life. Do not recommend buying it, doubt where the good reviews came from.

Base on the glowing reviews i purchased GS 05 black ink pens and many boxes of various G2  07 purple pens and ohter G2 colors.  All were stored in their boxes in my file cabinet.  Less than a year later the pens not used...the pens do not write.  Like the ink dried up or something.  Whatever, they half axxed write and I tossed them all.  The cheap Skilcraft pens last forever although they don't look as nice.

Fairly easy to set up, however no system confirmation that setup was successfully completed.  Draft print is almost useless as it is too light and very difficult to read.  ADF does not work with more than one sheet in the feeder.  Keeps jamming.  This unit is being returned and hopefully the replacement will work as advertised.  Reserving judgement which is why I didn't give it 1 star.

Buyer beware: This chair is ONLY adjustable for height (up/down).  I have been researching an adjustable ergonomic office chair for several weeks and came across many glowing reviews of the Herman Miller line.  Unfortunately, however, I purchased this model which does not have lumbar support, tilt adjustment, or other options available on many other models.  I will be returning this chair.  Look carefully at the item details and make sure you buy a chair that fits all of your needs, especially given the costs of the Herman Miller chairs.

This is NOT worth your money. If you’re like me you’re going to buy this thinking it’s a REGULAR so size poster but, it is NOT. They don’t mention that when you’re looking at it and allow you to just buy this MINIATURE poster banking on the fact that you don’t want to waist your time on sending it back for a refund. I gave this a one on the rating because of these things.

These are okay little books for the price but I won't be buying them again.This paper is only 80gsm so does ghost a little. I did have minor bleeding issues with a few of my pens and markers that I haven't had issues with from other companies (comparing 80gsm to 80gsm). As expected, it didn't stand up to Sharpie. Zebra and Crayola, though, really?The outside and inside covers are slick so some of my pens/markers smudged and smeared. Hindsight - I should have done a pen text on the back first but when the creative juices start flowing sometimes you don't think of these things.Also, the pages stick together. Be careful or you'll end up with wasted blank pages where you don't want them.Overall I can't give these more than 2 stars because of these issues. I've purchased quite a few bujos over the years and thought I'd give a travelers journal a go because I'm tired of redoing the beginning pages every time I start a new journal. I'll use these for scratch paper since I paid for them but will keep looking for something with better paper and end up redoing my first booklet.If you're not quite as picky as I am and don't care to decorate your covers these are okay for $2.50 each. Please don't buy these as a gift for anyone who's really into journaling, though.

This does not work on our HP M283fdw.The printer says that it does not communicate with the toner.  After requesting for a return the seller only return 80% of what we bought it for.  I then look at the reviews and saw that people had to removed the chips from the old toner and put it on the new toner.  Seriously?  I attempt this and there's not way of removing the old chip without destroying it.  Bad Product!

I do not need, and should not have had to pay for, TWO identical copies of each card! But worse, there is no identifying information on the cards!! Finally, the cards are so thick and heavy that they may be too heavy for postcard rate stamps! If I could give this negative stars, I would.

I was so inspired by the glowing reviews I bought without hesitation. Four ended up in the trash for refusing to work no matter what, those that did were substandard, never a clean cover but always sticking up, always needing to be patted down with your fingers, and just nasty. Never had a correction tape so substandard. Waste of money and environmental disaster.
Item finally arrived today, advertised 5 erasers in tube, only four. This is the first bad review I have given, but won’t buy from this source again

Seems like a nice pen. It writes well, is compact, and comes with refills. Only reason I don't the it more stars is it doesn't stay on the cap very well. It lasted a week before I lost it. Still, I ordered a new one to see if I have better luck!

Update -Sharpie has changed the design of these pens... The barrel used to be gloss black and the pens were wonderful - the new ones have a matte black barrel and they leak... I bought three boxes, and every pen in all three boxes was leaking... They leak from a spot between the nib and barrel, and it leaks enough that tipping the cap will let 1-2 drops of ink drip out... The boxes arrived undamaged, and the boxes are stored horizontally... Every pen and cap has to be wiped down before using and even still, drops and smudges of ink gets on your hands, clothes, desk, papers... Until Sharpie fixes the design, I will not be buying/using these... I’ve contacted Sharpie and am waiting to hear back...Original/old review:Love these pens for everything - the write cleanly and have a nice fine point, the ink doesn't bleed, and the nib holds it's shape... They're great for use in planners - highlighters don't smear them, for journalling (diary, art journal, traveller's notebooks), and really great for scrapbooking... They don't write on photos/smooth surfaces - Sharpie Markers will though, but these are great for everything else...

I used these stamps to mail packages to customers for a very small item. This was a big mistake. Not every sheet aligns correctly. Some sheets will show the postage amount while others will not. Despite this each stamp will have a bar code on it. So, you assume a printed bar code will be encoded with information right? Wrong. Over a period of 6 months I received about 10 packages back. Reason? Someone working at the post office didn't recognize this stamp. On some they wrote, "?" on the stamp. On others they stamped, "No Postage". These packages were retrieved from our P.O. Box. Keep in mind I'd been mailing these same envelopes with the same stamps for 6 months.I contacted Endicia. At first they stated it was something I did wrong. I reexplained the postage was printed and had been used several times from 6 months. There was no user error. I explained it was the postal service rep not being familiar with their product. They told me that I needed to complete a form, include the stamp with the envelope used and wait to get a decision on if I would get a refund. To do this it would cost about $5. The rep mentioned that there was no guarantee I would get a refund for this postage. He went further to state, "you should just let it go.". I have a hard time "letting it go" especially when I've spent money and a company has profited. So, here I am leaving this review. It is cheaper to order stamps online from the USPS website, buy them from your mail carrier, buy them at an authorized stamp retailer or buy them directly from the postal service building.Did I mention if you misprint there is no refund? If your printer jams there is no recourse? If a postal worker doesn't know this product then it is sent back to you. Bottomline, you lose; you lose twice. The first time you lose is by purchasing this paper to print stamps on. The second time you lose is when you need a refund and can not get it. This is s product not all workers at the USPS are familiar with based on our experience. You can get a refund of "real" stamps. Just go to the post office and they will give your money back. It isn't worth it to buy this product. Stay away.*I uploaded 1 image of an envelope returned so you can see for yourself.

I checked reviews before ordering this printer and it was highly rated.  When I received it the color on pictures was horrible and dark.  I was on the phone with Epson tech support for 2 hours with no satisfactory resolution.  One tech told me it was my computer.  I searched help for my computer, reset print options, etc.  Nothing made the print quality of colored pictures any better.  I was disappointed in the printer AND not receiving better support from Epson.
I have written this review two different times and each time it was rejected for reasons I am yet to understand. Therefore, I will not say more and just leave it at one star.

I bought the chair based on the review..  High back is comfortable, however the seat cushion is extremely thin, after seating down for about an hour , it does little to make you comfortable.  The design is nice, but that about it .  Its not comfortable at all

This was not worth wasting my money on! I ended up returning it, and I hate to return products! I had broken my hand, and wanted an easy packing tape dispenser. This one had good reviews and they said the tape would not stick to the roll so I tried it. There is a whole different problem... the tape didn’t stick to the roll, instead, it got trapped inside the little space between the teeth to rip it and the Top portion to hold it on! So I would have to stick my hand in the area against the metal teeth and hope not to cut myself, every time I wanted to pull tape out! To me that was worse than having to peel it off the roll occasionally! I ended up paying a little more and getting a desk/table  dispenser  for my packing tape and I am so happy I did!

One year and four months old quit working. six months ago would not print color. I am replacing this printer with anything except EPSON JUNK..Avoid them..I would give less than one star if it were available.

First cartridge worked fine, but second one had terrible smudges along one side. It appears that the condition of the cartridge itself is poor - not the toner. I didn't use this bad cartridge until recently, so I am past the time to return, although I just began using it a week or two ago. Lots of toner is still in it -- but completely unusable given the terrible quality of the printing. Used up a lot of paper trying to clean up mess and figure out what was wrong, before realizing I had a faulty cartridge that smeared and leaked toner on one edge. As soon as I put in a different brand cartridge, the printer worked just fine.If someone from the company contacts me, I will be willing to return and trade it in and give them another chance and remove this poor review.

I bought this 7 months ago but it stopped working already. (Changing battery did not do anything.) Even when it was working,  it stopped in the middle of presentation  more than several times.  I hate to leave  a bad review but I cannot recommend the product.
I gave this product a 2 star rating only because there was suppose to be 3 spiral bound notebooks and i only received 1 (the blue one).

If I could give -5 stars I would. I have fisher pens that have been in war zones that look better. The brass was discolored badly when it arrived and had scratches all over it. The ink cartridge leaks all the time so if you don’t wipe it off it globs the first 2 words, it’s a medium ball point not a fine point like the others.  I’d never buy this again

Ok, don't believe the 'dual power' as stated. This is a solar calculator only and does not have batteries as per the description.Straight out of the packet and in good daylight the display came to life.Upon entering a few numbers at random however the display suddenly returned to 00000.I tried a number of simple calculations and each time, even before I got to select the = key the display returned to a row of zeros.As a calculator it's absolutely useless and was returned for a refund.As a side note I purchased a similar sized desktop calculator which runs on solar and batteries from a local supermarket for slightly less money and that works fine.One star on the overall rating only because the review will not accept zero stars!

only two star because It was little scratch up behind. Please when you try to ship your products, protect it well enough. Apart from that, everything was there like calculator, pen, notebook. I would give 5 star if it was well protected.

It's exactly what I wanted - but came pretty damaged. The shipping was expensive and slow, but I was planning on using this journal as a teacher planner for the next academic year, so I thought it was worth it. I wanted something big and high quality, which it is. This would have been a 5-star review if it had arrived in good condition.They used a box that was the same size vertically as the journal, so any slight bend to the box during shipping would bend the journal, which it did. It doesn't lay flat now, which really bothers me. The bend will make it impossible to use a ruler on the bottom outside corner of pages because they are warped. Aesthetically, the large creases on the front look terrible.This was a splurge purchase for me after doing a lot of research into bullet journal-type notebooks, so I'm pretty disappointed.

Not happy.  Should have respected the reviews.  Paper is too thin so tears easily and falls off the walls within a short time.  Need a thicker paper and when they first came out years ago, this paper came out on a big pad and it was thicker.

Stick with a namebrand tape. I was being cheap. This does stick and that's the only reason it had a five rating but as far as the rest if I could've gave it a zero that's what it should've been. It doesn't cut off a roll it stretches it is not see-through it has a horrible smell. I wish I could get my my money back I waited too long. What a waste

I tried this paper and the lines were barely visible. I would recommend the Roaring Springs paper item ROA95182 - Engineering Pad, also sold by Amazon (unfortunately, only sold by the case). You can read my review there, its quality is excellent.

I originally gave these 5 stars, but changed it to 1. The color cartridge worked great. The printer could not recognize the black cartridge. When I took it out, the chip put on after remanufacturing was pulled loose. Completely unusable. It was great value for the money if I could have used both cartridges. I won't chance ordering it again.
Read the reviews. Have a Lexmark that is no longer in production. At $52.99 or more for cartriges, I can buy a new printer with ink and a warranty and etc. etc. WHAT IS THE POINT?????

Is being returned since we cannot get past the configuration process. Mechanical malfunction. will review the replacement assuming it is in working order when received. will also review exchange process.

I don't know what happened but this sharpener ruined my jumbo pencils.I'm 27 years old, and I'm pretty sure I've sharpened enough pencils in my life, at least 22 years. lol,but I could not get this sharpener to sharpen my pencils, and it just ruined them.I returned it, I gave two stars, since I was able to get a refund.

After seeing so many positive reviews I thought this would be worth the price. Perhaps I got a "lemon", but the ink flow and nib made the pen unusable. I have owned dozens of pens in every price range (below 300.00, not the high priced ones) and never had such problems. The pen IS beautiful, but after trying many approaches to fixing the problems, I have relegated this to the back of the case. Nice to look at but a waste of money, and although may people have had good luck with theirs, I won't 'roll the dice' on any Kaweco in future.

ZERO STARS!! Don't buy!! Horrible color and three of the cartridges didn't even work. It's shows full on the printer and then you print a test page and it shows a blank where it should show the color.

I ordered a couple of these.  Both had numerous wrinkles, creases, folds, etc. on the covers.  Most of the pages were fine, some of the corners were dinged.  I mean my two year old did a happy dance when she saw her notebook, so I gave it to her.  I guess my standards are a little higher.  I expected a nice notebook in “new” condition.  I’m sure it would work lol and the pages seem ok, but I was so shocked by what I got that I actually am taking the time to write a review and return this $2 item.

I would give zero stars if I could.The first one lasted about 4 months, printed great, then a black line started appearing when I printed.  I lived with that a couple of weeks and then it started to print with blank streaks in the black ink areas.  I thought it was the ink cartridge.  I cleaned the printer heads, without success.  I bought new ink cartridges.  It was not the ink.  Amazon was great about sending a replacement.Now the replacement, after about 1 month, had a paper jam.  I cleared the paper, however, the error message remains after several attempts to go through all the places to clear and turn off turn on.  I took out the paper whole with no torn off parts to be stuck in the rollers.  Amazon is sending out another replacement.I have never had such problems with Epson in the past. Matter of fact I went back to Epson after an HP which I had over a year broke off a very tiny plastic part which kept it from printing.  I thought that was poorly designed.  If the third Epson craps out I will try Canon.Frustrated with poor quality workmanship.  At this price point, these printers are disposable items, filling our recycle bins and landfills.  Not sure how much more to spend to get better quality or if that would guarantee quality.  The ink cost is high no matter what. Buying a repair warranty?  I don't want to spend down time with repairs on something that should last a much longer and give a lot better service. Not made in USA... (here's a job/company/manufacturing industry you can bring back)?

Similar to other reviewers...When I first got this pointer, I really liked it.  It was small, fit in my pocket and worked well.  Within a month of use, the advance buttons just stopped working.  I replace the batteries to no avail. What's interesting is that all the other buttons continued to work. I returned it.
I bought 2 chairs and both came ripped with a puncture on the seat, in the same place.  I wish i had paid attention to other customers reviews.

I purchased this item knowing that the pencil case was not removable thanks to others reviews.  That, however,  is not why I gave this item a one star.  When I opened the case I immediately realized that  the black and dark grey pens were not included in the shipment.  I can live with the pencil case....I am not happy about the missing pens!

I've received a lot of rubbish from Amazon over the years but this one wins the award for making me feel most like a sucker. It's a flimsy thin piece of plastic that is impossible to read. It shows with a clear black font in the picture but it is a very light red font in reality. Way overpriced for what you get. I should have paid more attention to the bad reviews but I was fooled by the good reviews.

I wanted a nice pen roll for my square-shaped Copic markers, round-shaped pens and pencils and this pouch seemed good based on the reviews. The construction is alright, but the elastic slots for pens are too small for my copic markers. They're even too small and close together to hold something as thick as a sharpie. I tried putting 5-6 micron pens in consecutive slots and it make the roll too thick to even roll up. Once the roll is full of pens, even alternating slots, it's too thick for the snap enclosure to snap together. The snap itself is difficult to close, too. This product could be vastly improved with bigger or more spaced out elastic slots and a belt buckle or tie style enclosure.

Would not register any weight, LCD screen just stayed at 0.00.  I removed the little foam inserts on each side, but couldn't get it to read anything, even a 9 lb weight!  Piece of junk, wish I had listened to the bad reviews...  Needed this to ship out some items I sold on Ebay, and I'm angry and frustrated that I spent the extra $$ to ship it next day.
all have scratches on them. i should have listen to the other reviews.

My main issue seems to be with the black ink, I think. Printed 2-3 pages just fine when I first installed it - HOWEVER, the product page claims it will work fine with my printer with no issues.  Boy is that not the case.  Of course HP and the printer didn't recognize it so I didn't have proper communication between devices and it wouldn't read the ink levels, etc.  Then, it stopped printing. If I would run a print head cleaning it seems to print just fine, but when I went to print a document it would skip and at the best you would see ghost writing, really faint gray-ish ink with huge blank spots. They recommended I take the cartridge out and let it set upside down for a while then re-install it.  Seems like an odd request.  Well, I decided to do that, and to my dismay, after almost NEVER using it, the cartridge appears to be completely empty. It has a clear side, and all I could see were little black moisture dots where the ink used to be. This was the worst decision ever, and after reading the reviews I thought I was doing a great thing. In my opinion these are junk and I never should have bought them.
I ordered the HP 98/95 but received the 96/97. I don't even have the opportunity to see how awful these things are! I should have read the reviews before I bought!

Very fast delivery! Looked perfect when I opened it. It was perfect size to carry with me all the time and loved the amount of coloring on each page.When I started coloring, that’s when the disappointment hit...The pages are very thin and it bleeds through the pages. This is the reason I cannot give 5 stars even though I really wanted to. If you don’t want to waste half the pages due to coloring bleeding through, then I do not recommend this planner. I will be looking for a replacement and will pay more attention to the thickness of the paper.

I really wanted to like this pen, with the good reviews and affordable cost. I think it prints out absolutely beautiful and fine text, even compared to my friend's Lamy Safari model. The pen is made of nice materials (yes it's actually metal at this price point), but does have a kind of... rattle like movement when you press on the cap (while closed). Especially awful is trying to fill/use it for an extended period. When you try to fill it, it's unable to be able to fill the entire converter, which itself has a very low capacity. Along with this low ink capacity, it tends to dry out quickly, so that if you wait one measly hour in between writing, it's annoying to get the pen's ink flowing again. I suppose you get what you pay for in this one...

This is a pretty heavy duty shopping cart.  It easily holds 5 or 6 bags of groceries.  The wheels are pretty tough.  However, a word of warning, the fumes from the plastic parts and coatings used in the manufacturing process are almost overwhelming!The covering on the handle slides around, which is a little annoying.  Also, it did take a little effort to assemble.Update:  I lowered the rating for this large cart.  After maybe a dozen uses one of the welds broke rendering it useless.  Between the smell that never went away and the broken weld I cannot recommend this item.  The unfortunate part is that I still haven't been able to find a very large, sturdy cart for hauling groceries.

Very disappointed. Firstly, the portion that tilts up and down has to be FORCED to close. It seems that there is not enough space so the wood rubs together every time with the pleasant sound of nails on a chalk board. I literally just opened the box today and there is already wear from the rubbing between the two edges. Secondly, the holes for the wooden slat that holds the laptop in place when tilted are crooked.... which results in my laptop being sideways if I try to use it. In the video review, the slats appears to fit quite snug, but if I lift my desk it falls right out. I was pretty excited about this purchase, especially after all the great reviews, but I am very disappointed.After my initial review the company shipped me a replacement and emailed me multiple times to apologize. I am adding a star for that reason. I am attaching photos of the second product as well, as I am still not satisfied with the product quality. Please note that the packaging did not appear to be damaged and the table was inside of bubble wrap so I do not believe this occurred during shipment. Also note that the drawer for this one is too small and slides around loosely.

Unfortunately there are not a lot of choices when it comes to ink jet cartridge replacements. These work fine and do a good job, but they are ridiculous we expensive.  My low rating is because they are such a poor value.  High priced and don't last very long.

I don't like to write bad reviews however this one deserves it. I was really looking forward to this planner as I've heard so much about it. However when I received it there was no wrapping over it or anything. And it was a damaged product. I am returning this product. Very disappointed.

There are SOOOO many things wrong with this printer.  I switched from an older Canon Pixma that finally died.  The Epson is completely different, and I wished I had purchased another Canon.  First off, the printer had an error message upon set-up that we couldn't fix, so back it went to Amazon.  We were able to set up printer #2, but I'm very disappointed with it.  I can't believe all the positive reviews, unless those buyers aren't heavy users.In my opinion, this Epson is not for heavy duty users, especially for color printing.  I like to print out color contact sheets of digital photos (ex. 35 mini pics per letter size paper).  The print time is tedious, the quality is poor, and it prints last page first.  I prefer my sheets to come out of the printer in numerical order, not reverse.  That's just one little thing that bugs me.Also, the ink goes fast.  I thought I'd get at least 50 pages just out of the start-up ink, but I didn't.  I replaced all the colors relatively close together, and between the first start-up tank of magenta AND the replacement tank of magenta, it only printed 44 letter size pages in color, 4 5x7 photographs, and a handful of b/w pages TOTAL.  That means the replacement tank (not a starter tank) DIDN'T even print out 44 pages in color!!!!  This is very disappointing, and not acceptable to me.  The pictures I actually printed out on photo paper looked decent, but nothing exceptional.Another complaint:  after you replace an ink tank, it takes several minutes for the machine to calibrate it and let you finish printing.  When all three colors go out close together, you lose about 15 minutes of print time.For black and white printing, I had a hard time printing on a label sheet.  It seems like I should've been able to feed the label through the top slot, but I couldn't make it take the paper no matter what.  I think you should be able to bypass a setting.  I feel, as the user, that I should be able to feed the sheet through either feed.  But no, it wouldn't print a darn thing unless I put the label sheet in the tray.  I was worried the labels would peel off and get stuck in the printer since the paper has to wind around to feed through.I haven't even had a chance to try out the scanner yet, since I've had so many problems just printing.  I'm seriously considering buying a Canon for color printing and just keeping this one around for simple b/w printing.

Did not cut cleanly on 1 sheet of cardstock the first time I used it. It had good reviews so I was surprised.  Terrible unless you are cutting computer paper and even then its just ok. It was a waste of $10.

The case is OK much like all the others on the market. Does not open to display as well as pictured. Most important in my low rating is that my medicare card does not fit without bending and so that defeated my purpose to have all my "need to carry" cards in same place

I took this to a graveside service so that I would have a guaranteed seat because I can't stand still more than 10 minutes without extreme pain.  It rolled easily behind me as I walked 2 blocks to the grave.  But while I sat on it during the service, I felt myself getting lower to the ground!  The frame was bending under my weight!  It thrust the seat downward like a slippery slide, and I'd have landed on the ground if I hadn't grabbed someone's hand and stood up. It is rated for 300 pounds.  I weighed 250 and held my 20 pound granddaughter on my lap briefly.  We were well under the maximum weight!  Perhaps the slight slope of the ground caused the frame to give way, or it can't really handle weights over 250.  This broke and was useless after one use.
I wish I went with another brand.... the reviews were a little misleading. I would rate this as below average because of the quality and it sturdiness.
Do yourself a favor and read the Play Store reviews on the app before you buy this product.  2.6 starts because its total garbage.
These are adorable however they are pretty thin compared to other polymailers I've purchased. I probably won't purchase again. Super bummed as previous reviews had said they were thick and sturdy.

At the rate I print, I can usually get a year out of a cartridge, maybe more.  This one lasted about 3 months before the black cartridge left random spots all over the page.  I used the clean function from the printer's menu to clean the fixing unit and ITB in the hopes of clearing up all the messy spots.  I must have tried 2 dozen times, but the spots remained.  Finally I went to Staples, dropped one hundred thirty on a new Canon black cartridge, problem solved.  You really do get what you pay for.  As another poster mentioned, I might still try another manufacturer or even a local supplier, but the large numbers of negative reviews for this supplier plus my own personal experience will keep me from using them again.  BUYER BEWARE!Oh, as for the color cartridges:  I don't print a LOT of color pages and so far, so good.  I'm concerned that it is only a matter of time as the page count gets higher that they'll fail as well.  But for all intents and purposes, my bad experience thus far is limited to the black cartridge.  I get the feeling from reading all the reviews that it really is a crap shoot.  Might work for you, might not.

I am writing this review from my office at 9:30pm on a Friday night. I thought this would be an easy, 30 minute project putting this thing together. But, in fact, the holes are not remotely lined up and it's missing a screw. This chair looks nice in pictures, but rest assured, it is a complete piece of garbage. Do not waste your money. I am furious. I don't even want to spend the time hauling it to the post office to return it. I'm angry I will have to. It is trash. I might just throw it in the dumpster by my office. There is literally no way to put it together bevcause it is so poorly made. It's enough to make you stop believing in global capitalism and want everything made in America. Just no.

I was completely convinced with all the positive reviews about this scale, so I ordered. It was packed well and did not appear damaged, however, upon turning on the scale. I noticed the display screen was crooked and reading 0.7. I had to go online to seeexactly HOW to reset as the printed instructions did not clearly say how to.  I tried resetting, moving the scale to assortedlevel sources, with no success in being able to clear the .7 from the scale, in either lbs or grams. In fact when the display read 88.888. it looked. like this 88.888.7.Even when I went to weigh an item in both lbs and grams, the .7 remain there.I'll be looking for different scale brand and hopefully won't have to return it.

Had an old Dell printer that printed GREAT pictures.  Apiece of plastic that held in a printer cartridge broke.  I called Dell and they told me there was no replacement part and I would need to buy a new (Dell) printer.  I researched budget color home printers with emphasis on printing color pictures.  The Epsom workforce 3620 was rated #1.  We have an old Mac but the description indicated the printer would be compatible.  I found the best price at Amazon so I ordered the printer.  Rec'd the printer promptly, inserted the installation disk, followed wireless instructions, and the computer "crashed".  Took two trips (70 mi each) to get the computer fixed, the computer person spoke with Epsom and they said that our computer had the correct specifications as listed by Epsom, but since it was older than 2010, we could nt use wireless. Bought a USB adaptor. printed pictures that had light and dark lines running through them.  Ran out of ink (very quickly), ordered new ink jets from Epsom, inserted those, got very poor quality pictures-too much green and then very washed out pictures that did not compare to what was on the computer.  Printed about 15 lousy pictures and out of ink in one cartridge.  Consequently my "budget" printer has cost me a lot of money and a bunch of pictures that I cannot frame and hang up.  As soon as I'm over my snit I will be looking to replace this and take it to Goodwill.

Was disappointed after reading the good reviews. There was no greetings inside, but the worst part was the recycled envelopes which made it look so cheap. It was cheap and the exterior wasn't bad, that's why i gave it 2 stars

Imagine my surprise when I found out that Mead would not publish a 2019 GWTW calendar. On the 80th anniversary of the movie and the years of its calendars, 2018 had been the last. Hesitant to purchase this calendar, I also cringed at the price. When it arrived I was disappointed. Much smaller than the Mead Day Dream calendar, it would better serve you very close to the desk. It's like a calendar that you would create on your own via a local office supply company. I would not recommend. I gave it two stars because I was just glad to have a GWTW calendar for 2019.

This tape is designed to be used in a dispenser and it simply is horrible to try to cut off using the serrated teeth of the dispenser.  It doesn't cut, it eventually stretches then breaks or tears.  This is a total waste of money, do not buy it.  I have never complained about anything I have ever bought until now, it's that bad.  I only denoted one star because you have to plug in something.

I bought this Gel Grip by mistake for a Uniball RETRACTABLE pen since I have used Signo Uniball black retractable pens for years and love them.  I just needed a different color.  This pen is less comfortable to hold (rubber grip is shorter) and the cap ieasily lost.  The ink blotches while writing and the flow is difficult to control.  The ink smudges easily and takes longer to dry than the black retractable kind.  When I had these problems with the first pen, I tried another but the same happened. I wish I could return them because they are unusable but the return conditions require new condition.  I've given it a 2 star only because the color is nice and the rubber grip is adequate.

If I could give zero stars I would. This is false advertising. The color is a gross light purple/grey. There is no iridescent qualities about it. On top of that Amazon will not allow it to be returned. Total waste of money!
Bought coz of  rating.Not working. Nothing came out. Nada! Nothing. Plain white paper

Wow,  DO NOT believe any positive reviews.  I printed 45 documents with my printer and 107 scans.  It took me 117 hours to do this work.  I do not remember a case where I did not have to reset the printer. Might have happened.  I did run through a full set of  the print cartridges.  Yes in 45 print jobs.  So I have spent over $100 on print cartridges for my 45 documents.  So that's about a $1 per page--good deal.  But when you consider the 117 hours, then it is mind boggling how the gross incompetence of Epson is.  I should also say that I am a programmer.  So this is ALL EPSON's FAULT for producing atrocious products.  I should sue them.  By the way, you should know that the cartridge that they say has twice the ink of the normal cartridge is incompatible.  So I spent $27 for that and it simply does not print.  Two hours later it does not print.  The good news is that unlike other cartridges, I wasted no paper.  So,  when I punted the printer across the room,  I unjured my toe.  Do yourself a favor and do not buy an Epson printer or you will end up with a black toenail.  But at least I had the pleasure of tearing this piece of junk to pieces.  DO NOT BUY AN EPSON printer

I had such high hopes for this printer when I bought it.  I specifically purchased it for printing invites at home for a party.  I need 100 copies printed, and it's going to take me days at the rate this thing prints.  So disappointed!!

These are my favorite pens and very hard to find! Imagine my surprise when opening package... Received only “1” individual pen!!!! The pictures represented a box of 12 pens and assumed “quantity 1” would be a box of 12 pens. Advertising misrepresented- I would never have ordered a single pen at that price. $8+ (after ridiculous shipping) for a single pen is outrageous!!! Would give ZERO stars but review forces at least 1.

Arrived with two trays broken as pictured. I, as a true American, wanted instant gratification and didn’t want to send back and wait for a new one.  Fixed it right up with miraculous duct tape.  Product is easy to assemble otherwise and feels sturdy.  I recommend using the foam stickers at the bottom so the smooth plastic does not slip on your desk. If it was whole, it would have gotten four stars.
I did not receive the right item.  So i am not happy with my purchase.. i hope i can get the right one! Then I'll change the review 😉

Bought this chair based on reviews, chair is extremely stiff and doesn't roll around good at all. Was pretty difficult to put together. Very dissapointed considering it will be even more difficult to return.

Our office purchased this Aztech Compatible Toner Cartridge Replacement HP 87A CF287A for our HP LaserJet Pro M501 printer. The ratings were 4 1/2 stars and the product is $79.99 for a 2-Pack compared to the authentic product HP CF287A that is $248.99 for 1-Pack. The Aztech toner smears all over each page dragging words and lines to make the document at times unreadable. I would not recommend spending the money on this toner and it could damage the printer if continued use. Do not buy.

I bought ir because other inks are overpriced but it was extremely disappointing and inaccurate for photoprinting which I never had with origibnal HP cartridges (outragiously expensive) or reasonably priced refills of them at reliable stores.I rated one star because printing in black was OK for color zero star

I purchased this for my classroom. On August 17th it was delivered, and worked for less than 30 days. I changed the battery, tried different USB ports, and 3 different computers. It looks like it connects because the blue light comes on. However it will not toggle back and forth through the slides. Buyer beware as Amazon stated they can not help me. I will have to contact the seller. Amazon was only able to provide me with an email address to contact the seller. I will try to contact and update my review if I’m able to get anything resolved.
Really cheap binding. The saying on the cover makes no sense, as sometimes happens when a product from China tries to use broken English. The one star is because it was shipped and arrived on time.

This product is horrible. Who in their right mind gives it good reviews? It slides all over the desk top. It is so uncomfortable on my wrist that is hurts. The pad is too small to use under any mouse settings. This is a poorly engineered waste of money. An all-time bad purchase.

I had high hopes for this item since the price was right and the overall reviews weren't bad. Problem is, during a presentation I accidentally dropped it from a seated position (no more than 2 ft from the floor) and after that the red pointer light stopped working. Can't return it now, but at least I can warn others that this can happen to you too. It's also very lightweight. I recommend this item:  Wireless Presenter, Laser Pointer Presenter, 2.4GHZ Presentation remote for PowerPoint and Keynote, Red Light PPT Clicker  I've used it for over a year and no matter how many times it falls or gets knocked off the desk it keeps on working.Update 11/8/18: Forget the link I posted above, they've now changed the presenter to be of similar poor quality as this one. I'll just have to go to a store in person to find a new one.

I should have read the other reviews instead of believing the misleading name of "Jetstream Bold Point..."  I would have returned the pens if the postage was less expensive.  I gave the pens one star because they are not bold points which is what I needed.

Description says it's 6 inches tall. It's not even 5 inches tall! It's also really mushy so I doubt my foot is even 3 inches off the ground when resting on it. This deception now means I've wasted my time and I have to return it. Would give negative infinity stars, if I could. Really. Wow.

The media could not be loaded.                      I have about four of these Fisher cap-o-matic pens because I love the size, color, and overall design of them. However, 3 of the 4 of them have a clicker that gets stuck constantly. I can't tell if this is just from a bad batch or something, or if that is an issue with this entire model... I don't know what the warranty period is, but I'd love to exchange them for working pens. Like I said, I would have otherwise rated this 5 stars.

I've given this item two stars based on the conflicting photo and website description. The photo shows rubber bands of three various sizes while the description shows 1/8th" bands ONLY. Unfortunately, being in a rush when placing the order, I trusted the photo alone and now have a package of too-thin rubber bands.To the seller/Amazon: please fix this discrepancy on product page. Thank you.

Bought the chair for my new home office.  It was a pain to put together and a couple pieces didn't fully match up.  I use it daily.  It creaks a lot and isn't that comfortable.Update:  I lowered the score to one star.  I've been traveling less and spending more time in my home office.  The arms are loosening up and the chair doesnt deel secure on the base.  This chair makes lots of creaking noise when sitting in it.  I'd ditch it and get a new chair but want to make sure I dont make another mistake buying a crappy chair.
Laughably unsuitable for purpose. Anyone who gives this a 5 star rating is a planted shill.

I have used ink refill kits on and off again for years so I know the procedure.  First the directions are anything but clear if you are new to refilling cartridges.  The pictures only make sense if you are refilling the same model number which I was not.  Let's fast forward.I got out newspaper for the table and gloves for me.  I carefully assembled all the materials. Carefully removing the label as indicated, I inserted the needle into the black inkbottle and drew a small amount into the needle.  Then I inserted it into the small hole on the cartridge.  I very slowly injected ink into the cartridge.  Better safe than sorry.  I repeated the process with the color cartridges.  I put the cartridge labels back in place.  Then I re-installed the cartridges in my printer.  The good news:  the printer recognized them as HP, but showed them as empty or nearly empty.  I tried removing and reinstalling, printer on and printer off.  Nothing changed.  I decided to keep using the printer hoping that the cartridges really were full.  NOPE.  Colors started stared to appear wrong.Being an optimist, I tried again today.  same thing happened.  I'm past the return date, so there is no refund in my future, but since it was only $15, I'll live,  What really hurt, though was the $103 cost of 3 color cartridges, and 1 XL black.Many reviewers had good luck.  I hope you do, too.

This thing is like highlighting with a crayon. It doesn't even deserve one star. The yellow doesn't even show up very well on paper, so you can't even see if you've highlighted anything. Just the worst.

This stapler is terrible. I wish I had read the reviews before my first purchase! Within days of getting the stapler (which I only used 2 or 3 times), it was jammed and the stapler cartridge was stuck. That's when I read the reviews, which seems to be a common issue with this stapler! But, I gave it the benefit of the doubt and exchanged it for a new one. When I received the second one, the same thing happened after owning it for maybe 3 or 4 days. Again, used it about 4 or 5 times. So, I just returned this one. For something that costs over $100, this should not be a common issue! It's a piece of junk! Spend your money on something cheaper and with better quality!

I needed refills for my home and trusted the description of this product, but it is very cheaply made and will not rip easily out of the dispenser (see photo). In fact, I have had to use my hands. I'm throwing it away and looking for another product.Update - I have adjusted my review because this seller did a good job of communicating after the fact and refunded the purchase in full.

I appreciate the design and material however mine came with a stuck door and the construction of it is poor meaning if you flip the table over you can see why it doesn’t work properly as nothing lines up. In order for me to fix it I will need to take it apart and rebuilt it.....so essentially I paid for something that is jacked up.UPDATE: so this particular seller asked that I remove this negative review with compensation however wanted me to remove review first....uh NO! How can I trust a company who sold a not so well made product in the first place to compensate me ONLY after I remove review?! Not falling for that!! Buyer beware

This was so expensive, and all the reviews made it seem like I could put it up on the wall and have a whiteboard-wall!  WRONG.  The sheets that don't fall off the wall, are wrinkly and bubbly.  And if you leave ink on them for more than a day it's set - there is no cleaning it.  Very disappointing.  I'm sending back.

I'd initially raved about this pen and given it 5 stars. It looks great and writes smoothly. It also feels solid. It does have a substantial weight that I appreciate. But next time I'll wait to write a review.I was at first a little unhappy to discover that the interior has a thin plastic sleeve (the old American Cross pens that I've had were all metal inside), but this wasn't a huge deal. What initially ruined this pen for me is that after 2 weeks of regular use, the replaceable ink refill started clicking, as many cheap roller ball pens will do. I realized I probably had a faulty tip and that this problem may be as simple as putting in an ink refill. My concern was that if I did this and consistently got clicking from refills, I'd have a $75 pen that I can't return that is far too annoying to write with. The tip was clicking pretty much every time it touched paper and I don't write in cursive. I couldn't handle the sound, so I stopped writing with it.I was hoping to return the pen, but the seller was being very pushy about me accepting a replacement refill cartridge instead. This was annoying, but in the end I got tired of arguing and accepted the replacement cartridge. It was working well for several months.Then, after about one year, the clip lost all of its tension and just hangs there. This is why I'd wanted my money back in the first place: the overall quality of the pen is mediocre. That was obvious when the first tip was clicking all the time. Next time I decide I want my money back, I'll argue longer. This was a $75 pen; it should have been basically maintenance free for more than a year in my world. I've had $10 pens last longer.

I didn't like these,Ink bleeds,What a teaseOf this warning you should take heedIt's better,I think,To just sit down and use the inkThey're trashSo much soI was motivatedTo give them a bashThey're grossAnd they made me oh so moroseOverallThe manufacturerIs just not on the ballAnd as such,I'll throw them right in the garbage,And never blink and eye at their carnage!1 star.They've gotten away with this,But only so far!

This is a remanufactured product, not a new cartridge. The photo is misleading and nowhere is it mentioned that this is not an new HP cartridge. Also, I was supposed to get 2 cartridges per box and there was only 1. I'm not the only one who had this problem, either. Lots of other reviewers found just 1 cartridge instead of 2. Stay away!

Initially this was absolutely my favorite purchase of the year. I wanted something that could carry my photography equipment (which is heavy) with ease. It seemed very sturdy and nicely built initially and I.loved the seat and the insulated front pocket, but now I have to update my review....Unfortunately, with only occasional use over the past 4 months, the mechanism (welded metal tubes) which holds the seat straight when it is down, broke and now if you try to sit on the seat you will find yourself sliding to the floor. The cart looks almost new, but I was also beginning to have a problem with the wheels falling off recently. Thank goodness they didn't fall off when I was nearly sliding to the floor. I still think it is a wonderful idea, but it is now useless after only 6 or 7 uses over the past 4 months. Total waste of $$$ ~ I'm very disappointed, and refund policy is only good for 30 days.

This board is very poorly constructed. There are sharp metal edges, dents and warps on the metal shell. The rest is just cardboard. The corkboard is just a thin laminate and is glued on crooked. This review is for a replacement board because the first was in worse condition.

I rarely write bad reviews, yet this one is warranted.  This product arrived damaged and there was no way to return it.  One of the pieces that holds the top on had broken off.  Regardless, I glued it back on and put it out in my lawn to host the documents I wanted displayed.  The "Infobox" makes claim to be an "outdoor" document holder, yet it certainly hasn't held up to weather.  After one week, I have glued it, taped it, chased it in the wind, and yanked out soggy papers.  I highly recommend ordering another product.

I must update my review of this pen.  The Fisher space pens are usually great, but the one I ordered simply would not stay assembled!  It would constantly fall to pieces when safely stowed in my backpack.  I must have fished the pieces out of the bottom of my pack a dozen times and reassembled it.  Finally, the cartridge and lower case half mysteriously disappeared.  The Fisher bullet pens are great, but this one seemed as if it was designed to spontaneously dissolve.
As the other reviews have stated, it's only a sticker... I thought this was an actual sign. For a sticker, it's a sticker but for the price it's not worth it.

I just received my AFMAT pencil sharpener and, with a pile of pencils in need of sharpening, proceeded to sharpen a pencil. The motor seemed fine until the pencil touched the blade, causing the motor to come to a dead stop. I quickly found that the slightest touch of the pencil against the blade caused the motor to stop every time. It was impossible to sharpen just one pencil. This pencil sharpener is going right back to Amazon. (Note: the one star was required to submit this review.)
I should have read the reviews more closely.  This is literally just a sticker. For $8 I was expecting something with a little more durability.  Seriously go to the dollar store and save the money!!

I wanted this product for displaying anything I needed to for my daughters online schooling. After putting her chore chart on it I see that the tacks go all the way through the VERY thin cork board and cardboard. I usually don’t leave reviews as I do not intend to be snotty or disrespectful but am disappointed that I spent $25 on this item.
