I was so excited to order this card as it got really good reviews, but after I received i was sooo disappointed.The card looks and feels cheap, I was embarrassed to give it to my friend for his wedding.
0 stars. All terrible quality cards and none with a pop up inside. Looks like a child made them. Do not buy from this seller !!

Item arrived today. Unfortunatly I'm unable to assemble the chair due to missing pre drilled screw holes on the left side of the seat cushion. Hopefully this matter will be resolved quickly so I can get to work in my new chair and do a full review of the item.

Why should I go to the trouble of buying this on line when for the same price, I can get it at Wal-Marts?  After reading some of the reviews about non-functioning ink cartridges, I would be better off buying from Wal-Mart anyway.
Cheap, but very thin. Only backed by a thin piece of cardboard. Fits the spot I needed though, so 1 star.

Print quality and speed is great and so is the scanning. However I bought this model for the duplex ability and especially the ADF for scanning documents.  I have put maybe 30 sheets of paper through the ADF and now it misfeeds every time!!  The duplex on the print side has worked great though.  I am working with Epson for a solution so I will up day my review if I receive good results.

Low quality. The board itself is flimsy and needs to be mounted on a hard board. The reason I’m giving it 3 stars is because I am still using it. The markers that come with it are cheap and they don’t wipe off without having to scour it and then I was never able to get the board completely clean.  I went to Walmart and bought the Expo brand markers and they wipe off cleanly.
Cards are made with very poor matieral, that’s why I gave two stars
Really wish I'd read the reviews.  I thought it was a wand shaped bookmark not a little piece of card.

If “zero stars” was an option, I would have chosen it. The instructions were written by someone who clearly doesn’t speak English, making them extremely difficult to understand, and very complicated. As a result I am unable to use this product, and wasted my money.

Worthless pile of junk. This is a great printer if you only need it to print clearly for about a month. After a month, all my prints had terrible streaks every couple of lines. After cleaning the printer head many times and having Epson customer support troubleshoot for an hour, they finally had me send it back and I got a replacement printer. Second printer worked great for about a month and then started printing streaked and blurred lines like the first. Called customer support and jumped through their hoops a second time but still the printer would not print clear pages. So, I thought why not try a third printer. Third printer worked for about a month and then started doing the same blurry streaky prints as the first two. At this point, I'm giving up. I think this printer has a fundamental design flaw and/or extremely high failure rate. In either case, STAY AWAY! Unless, you enjoy frustration and printing worthless garbage.

It would be very helpful if reviewers would identify their printers since this product is supposed to work with such a variety of models. Some customers are very satisfied while others had nothing but problems. Thank you for listening. Only gave it one star to be able to post.

Actually, the card stock is very high quality and beautiful, but...I didn't expect them to come unfolded.  Each card has to be manually folded to fit into the envelope.  I guess that's not a very big deal, just unexpected.  I don't know why the seller couldn't have folded them and customers could receive them 'ready-to-use' instead of 'ready-to-fold'.  If they had been pre-folded, I'd have given them 5 stars.But I was reading previous reviews and it seems they used to send them out folded and that didn't work well, because one review stated:  "Many of the cards are folded so poorly I won't be sending them out. The construction is sturdy, the picture and wording is beautiful, but they obviously had an issue with the machines and had no quality control checks before packaging and sending out."So I guess sending them unfolded was their solution...

So pardon me for saying this, but considering that I paid over $80 for this used calculator, I sort of assumed that it would at least come with a charger, or even a charge? It’s dead. And I have no way to charge it. I need this calculator for the calculus class I’m currently taking, so I’m pretty frustrated by this discovery. I don’t believe this USED calculator should be priced at $80 and come with no charging cable. It wasn’t “lightly used” either. It’s pretty dirty. I’ve had many calculators in my life, and even ones I’ve had since high school (which has been years now) aren’t this dirty. I had higher hopes when I searched through the various available conditions and found this one for $80 listed as “lightly used.” It disheartens me to write negative reviews, so don’t take this lightly. I don’t want to cause offense, but I do want to be transparent and honest.

I purchased these highlighters thinking that the "no smear" and no drying out would mean this was a good quality highlight. I couldn't have been more wrong. As advertised the marker will not smear any printed ink but the actual highlighter will NEVER DRY and feels tacky to touch. You can also wipe some of the gel highlighter off which means that it gets on your hands and clothes. What a complete waste of money, I only highlighted a couple of sentences and then threw them right in the garbage. How these even got through a marketing/research stage is beyond me. If I could give zero stars I would have!!

I must start by apollogizing to the seller. I don't like leaving negative reviews in case the items didn't meet my expectations, but in this case it's about protecting other buyers from wasting their time and money as well. The box is sturdy enough and it looks good. It comes with a rubber protection that covers it and shield it from the elements but when locked... I can open it without the use of any tools. Just with my fingers. There's a small slide of the knob when the box is locked, enough to allow me to force it open. I cannot ship it back so I'll have to trash it as it defeats the very purpuse I ordered it for.

Printer's touch screen is unintuitiveWifi issues connecting when router resetsupdates take all system resources, tons of time and always try to install bloatwareYes, it says you need "all" cartridges full to print, what it doesn't tell you is how it takes from thecolor cartridges at the same rate as black so, if you print lots of documents, you spend 4x the amount of money on ink.If you don't use it for a week be prepared to waste a ton of time cleaning it because it dry's up fast.
Zero Stars! First print and magenta cartridge leaked all over the transfer belt and drum unit.

Ordered for HP 60, but the needles are too thick for the sponge, ended up having to use one needle I had at home from a different black ink product. Also the instructions don't match this product they are for something else. Seal was also difficult to break on the bottles. Overall this product created a huge mess. But I was able to refill my cartridges, so giving it two stars.

I used these to past up color digital photos on paper. 4 total, one on each corner. Within 24 hours the pages were falling off the wall. They don’t even hold up a sheet of paper.  1 star because there is no zero star choice.

BUYER BEWARE! This seller scammed me! I ordered 4 boxes of 13x19" Epson Ultra Premium Presentation Paper (5 star grade) as it shows in the picture but when I got them, the boxes said 11x17" Premium Presentation Paper (3 star grade)!!!The 3 star grade is flimsy like normal generic paper, not stiffer cardstock like the Ultra Premium. Terrible, will never do business with again!

If I'd left a review of this product within the first few weeks of use, I would've given it 4 or 5 stars; it's lightweight, pretty, and worked like a dream, even if the side drawer tended to stick, mine never came with a baffle, and I never figured out how to lift the table like the pictures showed. However, after a month or so, the orange pieces meant to hold the screws in had fallen off -- one had snapped entirely, cracking in half like the Titanic -- and one of the screws had fallen out and was never seen again (probably hiding out under some furniture as a very inconvenient cat toy). By the time the fan itself stopped working, three screws had fallen out and none of the orange pieces were intact.Even though the legs were so damaged they wouldn't stand up on their own (and had a tendency to fall off), I still used the table because the fan was so handy. I wasn't happy with the product, but I wasn't going to throw it away while it still served its purpose. After about 4 months, even that stopped working; I tried every USB port on several computers, and the fan wouldn't turn on for any of them.Now it's a hunk of dead wood in the corner of my living room, the remnants of a very expensive good idea. I hope my product was just defective -- and most of the reviews here are extremely positive -- but I'm not going to spend another $50 to try and find out.

First of all, I am extremely angry that the price has nearly DOUBLED since the last time I purchased this item. I stopped buying these because I kept getting upset at how quickly they needed to be replaced. For a $500 pen, I shouldn't have to pay $20 for refills that last maybe three weeks tops, and god forbid you actually use it or else it goes out quicker than that. I question whether these are authentic Mont Blanc refills because they most certainly do not match the quality of the Mont Blanc name. I am so disappointed that it took me YEARS to finally be able to get a coveted Mont Blanc pen and now it just sits in a pen cup because it's totally useless thanks to the inability to purchase quality refills. Thanks for destroying the magic for me! I really appreciate it! I'll keep using my $3 pen that lasts 20 times as long and writes equally as beautifully.I saw these pop up in my "buy it again" list, saw the price and was livid enough to stop and take the time to write this review. Thanks for turning my beautiful pen into pen cup art. Such a shame!!

Really like the idea of this product. However, very cheap feeling plastic no weight to it, rates super thin and you can barely see it. One of the clips already broke and the other just hanging on. It’s a shame, I bought extra refill ink not likely to use it. Save your money look for something else.

This is "ok" toner but buyers should know that the drum will leave an image and the toner doesn't stick label stock.  I've used this product for 6 weeks in order to write a fair review.  I am not pleased with the quality, especially that it doesn't adhere Avery label stock (it smudges or completely comes off with the slightest rub).

I have to agree with all the people who left one star reviews; if I could leave a NO star review, I would. Neither I nor my husband could get any of the correction tape to dispense correctly. Tape twisted up inside and if I managed to get any out, it was barely visible and removed the print. I wanted to get my money back, but could only return it and the time and shipping cost precluded that option being a viable one. As a small business owner, every dollar counts so I just kissed off close to $10 and wasted precious time. Only buy this if you like wasting money on a defective product.

It is a fine sized nib but it is very flimsly and thin. The nib flexes a lot and scratches the paper and thus not smooth to write. Others have mentioned such writing flaws in their reviews.On the outside it looks nce, but on unscrewing the end the inside looks very cheap plastic.On the part where the writer grips the pen there is a fine plastic join line that makes it feel like a cheap pen.The positive for the pen fine nib version is that does write thin lines. But when writing at normal speed, parts of letters may not get ink.I really liked it for the first hour but on writing a lot more the above became apparent and I returned it. Maybe if the nib was made of stronger gold platted steel it might not scratch the paper.So, I would recommend the Cross Century (very thn pen and fine nib) - only a few left on Amazon or the newer but bigger Cross Century Medallist 2 with a fine nib.

I originally gave this 5 stars.  However I had a major accident with this.The cart was very heavy, which was fine..but in trying to go up the stairs, the bottom was so heavy, the big wheels in the back went flying down the stairs and me with it.  I literally flew down the stairs and landed on my full left side.  The damage was extensive.  My shoulder still is not right.This is Ok on the sidewalk but Not with stairs.

I bought these from Fed-ex for three photos I had mounted on tagboard.  Each photo was 18"x24".  Each one could have weighed a MAXIMUM of 6 ounces.  These squares are advertised to hold one pound of weight.  I mounted these on my wall by putting one square in the corner of each photo.  I stood back and admired my work, only to have two fall off the wall after I came out of the bathroom a few minutes later.  Now one corner on two of my posters is bent to hell and looks terrible.  My photos are no longer smooth in the corners, but are bent and wrinkled where the impact occurred.  I spent around $130.00 to have these photos printed, and now two of them are ruined.I have never written a negative review for ANYTHING, but this product definitely warrants it.Thanks 3M.

Buying any ink jet printer these days is tough.  Any model will have a significant number of negative reviews, so you have to pick the least bad.  The Brother MFC J5330DW lives up to the worst of the bad reviews.  I've spent ridiculous sums buying replacement Brother inkjet cartridges only to waste most of each one repeatedly running the Print Head cleaning utility.  With enough patience (and enough wasted ink) you can eventually get it to print with only minimal smudging, but within a few weeks it clogs again.  I am a computer tech and have owned many ink jet printers.  This is by far the least reliable and has one of the poorest print qualities of any printer I've owned. Do not buy this printer.  Unfortunately, I haven't found a reliable alternative to recommend.

The thing does not stay up at all. I bought this for my desk at work and I saw the reviews praising the adhesive hooks so I decided to see. The hooks aren't even wide enough to hook onto the strap so you have to hook it and hope it doesn't just fall off the hook. Then once you have it rigged to not fall the adhesive gives out and it falls anyways. I've never been more annoyed with a product. Don't waste your time and money on this trash.

I didn't even buy this product online. I bought it in stores, but it's been such a pain that I feel like I have to leave a bad review. Every poster I've tried to stick on my walls ended up falling off, usually causing creases and damage to the poster.  Don't waste your time or money on this garbage.

I bought what was advertised as 10 sleeves and they sent one. Most expensive and smallest piece of foil I have ever bought. Not happy about the conn factor here. Save yourself the frustration. I tried to warn ya! They really don't deserve even 1 star rating here.

Wow!  That I should find myself writing a review about a mouse pad is amazing!  This is the absolute most cheapest thing I've ever seen!  It's as thin as possible without falling apart.  And to think I paid $6.00 for something that should have cost .99 cents!  I was ripped off!

This wrist rest has a split down the middle with a very hard wedge just below it.  My wrist ends up on the hard wedge most of the time if I position it for use with a mouse.  There seems to be no reason for this awkward and poorly functional design except to show off the word "Kensington."  Also the foam eventually settles down and gives no support whatsoever.  If it were designed without the split and wedge area, I would give it two more stars, but it's not.  I won't buy another one now that the foam on this one has compressed.
I rated it a 2 cause I have to send it back,  all the pieces were not with it.  A leg and the screws were  not w/the product.  If everything was I would of givin it a 5..

I'll start by saying that I absolutely love copic markers. They are incredible, high-quality markers that are unfortunately both expensive and difficult to find online sometimes. My problem is not with the marker itself or the brand. My problem is that my marker arrived dry. I tried to color with it the very first day I received it, and the nib had only a stroke of ink in it before it stopped marking altogether. I tried to contact the seller or submit a claim but was unable, and I'd be willing to retract this review and post a glowing 5-star review for my money back. I understand I can't return it, and I don't want a replacement. I've already got a refill on the way. But I don't like that I've paid $8.50 for a dry marker I can't even use until the ink cartridge arrives.

I just order the 2012 and 2013 Holiday expansion packs. They are the same cards. Don't waste your money buying both. I should have read the review first. Looks like I am not the first to be fooled. Seems like in a years time they could have come up with a legitimate new set of cards. There are only 30 cards in the pack. Seriously they couldn't think of 30 new cards? Lame.

I was so happy when my new black HP 8720 arrived today. However, after adding the printer cartridges I got an error message pertaining to the printer head. Called HP and went through several steps and they determined that at least the print head was bad. I returned this to Amazon and went down to Office depot and got another identical HP OfficeJet Pro 8720 in black the very same day. Got it home and unpacked and the printer head wouldn't move into position to add the ink cartridges, tried power cycling and unplugging it a few times, tried opening and closing the access door several times, but the print head just wouldn't move into position, I finally manually moved the print head over so that I could insert the print cartridges, but after that it just gave me some error on the screen, even after more power cycling and unplugging. Took that one back to Office depot and exchanged it for an Epson WF-7620. The Epson got through its setup process just fine and dandy.P.S. This one star review actually applies to both of the black HP 8720's that were defective out of the box today.

Unfortunately this chair doesn't last or can be used as a daily desk chair. I bought it not too long ago and all the coushion is almost gone and now is super uncomfortable to seat on it. I don't write reviews in amazon, but this review I had to do it to advise other people in not invest your money if you are looking for a good desk chair. Chair looks beautiful but quality is horrible :,(

These are a great beginner pen for calligraphy but the product runs dry quickly. At first I bought 2 pens but after only a day it started running dry, I thought it may just be me so I ordered the value pack with 6 pens and 3 out of the 6 have run dry on me after only writing one word. The ratio to good and bad reviews is off. For me 5 out of 8 pens have run dry on me. For 5 and half star ratings I don't think it depicts the actual value of the product. Just beware you may not be getting good pens. The company also doesn't offer returns.

Please read the reviews. The printer is pure crap. I had it just over a month and managed to print perhaps 10 pages. It has paper jams and won't reset after removing it. It did not print correctly. Here is a good one, it does not have a setting for 4 x 6 photo paper, wtf. You have manually enter 4 x 6 and then it will default to 4 x 8. Ever seen this size photo paper? Then it will not allow highly quality printing, only standard. Rear feed is crap, not user friendly, and pusher paper through without printing and then prints from default tray, thus wasting paper. NEVER, NEVER an Epson again!

I bought these for my classroom thinking that I would use my own money to invest in a quality product for my students to use. DO NOT BUY THESE! As the other review noted, some of these will come broken! I had eight of mine arrive not being able to lock. There is a huge design flaw in these and when I took one apart to find the problem, it is obvious that they are cheap garbage. For a well known company, they missed the mark here and I can't stress enough to buy elsewhere! Even the ones that work do not function as expected and they are so cheap I expect all of them to be broken within a month. Please save your money!!

I do not write negative reviews often but this is a product that lives up to all of the negative reviews.  Received laminator and let it heat up about 10 minutes and lights were on.  Inserted an 8.5x11 sheet of paper into 3 mil pouch and it started through but caught somewhere inside and crinkled into ruin.  After cooling off I pulled out paper with great difficulty since the "release" did not work at all.  I next let it heat up and inserted a 5 mil pouch with paper inserted.  Same result - crinkled terminally.  I tried it a third time and another terminal failure.  I then notified Amazon I was shipping it back and after  they received it I received a full refund after a couple of weeks.  I would absolutely advise listening to all the negative reviews and never, never buy this product.  A much better product is Scotch TL902 and it works great for less.
This product stopped working after 1 day. No ink is coming out. I cannot print anything with this product. Not worth even 1 Star ...rating does not permit zero stars.

I always wanted to write about this pen for a long time but didn find time till now.....let me tell you straight...this was my worst pen of any kind i ever bought.....The nib is so sharp it tears off bits of paper lines when you write with it.....the ink reservoir is so small that after ever every few lines you will have to refill it......the pen is completely metal and the pen is so small that its hard to get a good grip to write with it ......i ultimately disposed away the pen because its better than to return it and wait for a refund....all in all.......pls dont buy this....and anyone who is writing a positive review is ether reviewing about a different product or or they are just bogus reviewsMy take on the product ......my biggest mistake.......there are better and cheaper ones way better that this........didnt even want to give 1 star but u cant write a review without it ....

WHen I received the tape dispenser when I bought the "Office Space" red stapler, the tape dispenser shipped was a grayish color and was cracked vertically along the cutting blade end.  It is still usable, but a far cry from what was expected.  Since it's low cost, I decided to live with the product.  99% of my dealings with Amazon have been first rate; this one just didn't live up to expectations.
A terrible product. I could have found something cheaper and better at Staples. It's just a cardboard box. Next time I should read the reviews. Total garbage.

First of all, this design is very unsophisticated, it's ok for the first 1/2 hour but the angles are wrong and the lack of tilt in the seat and the center of gravity where the leg and feet are is like sitting in a chair that has had an inch cut off the front legs.  No way to relax, it throws your center of gravity forward.  The 'leathersoft' is cheap vinyl and needs a vinyl treatment (auto parts store) for it.  This was pretty easy to put together.  I had to be careful to get the bolts lined up but it was straight forward.  I got the high back white on with chrome, surprising my wife, but it looks good.  I saw a white on in an office.  However, it didn't tilt, just rocked about 1/2 inch and not comfortable.  I searched through the reviews for the word 'tilt' and quickly saw you have to pull the lever 1/2" to unlock it.  I feel bad that so many people didn't see that.  I was going to buy this last week and put it in my shopping cart but didn't check out until the next day.  Then, that seller was out of them and a note in my cart said they expected more in about 10 days.  The other sellers had much higher prices and that's all that was available at that time.  So I just checked back a couple time and in a few days the competitive price was back, no problem.  I bought it quickly and very glad to have it, it's really nice, especially for the price.  Too bad it's so uncomfortable. after 15-20 minutes.

This product is made out of cheap foam board.  It looks like it was a child's art project.  I don't think it could stand up to anything I put on it.  Heaven forbid that I spill liquid on it.  It might disintegrate.  I should have known better when I read the details of the listing and couldn't determine what it was made of from that.  I gave it 2 stars because it was easy to put together.

Save your money. You can find a better quality pen from a dollar store. I must echo another reviewer stating that when trying to write the tip comes out/falls off. How terrible to spend $6 on a pen you cannot even write with. Also the stylus tip is not rounded or bulbous as it should be, but rather flat on one side. I have been a long time HP fan and was hoping to have a fun stylus pen to use at work, I work in a hospital and use a lot of touch screen equipment. Guess not.

Quality is good but only received a pack of 10 cards not 50 as advertised. Price not worth 10 cards. Wish i would have read the reviews before purchasing. Amazon did refund me but still an inconvenience.

update: the seller contacted me after my review,  aplogized for the cartridges not working with my printer and promptly issued a full refund!orig post:my HP photosmart printer rejected the OSIR 564XL replacement cartridges.  i could not clear the printer error which recognized these were not HP cartridges.  i had to replace with genuine HP ink yo clear to error message!

The machine was disappointing. The stop setting was difficult to set and single sheets would slide under it. The punch part was acceptable. My husband is planning on self-publishing quite a few children's books and needs a better quality and more dependable machine so he has returned it and is ordering a different one. It rated 2 star for quality and function.
HorribleLeakySpoilled favorite bagDo not by itZero star

Wow, how disappointing. I studied all the rolling carts, and selected this one for carrying around Cub Scout meeting info. Took it to the meeting and discovered it only took legal file size, so bought those... then discovered you can't put the darn lid on if you use file folder labels- they stick up higher than the lid!The folders hang with about 3" of dead space below them, so it's incredibly foolish that there isn't ANY clearance about the folder labels to squish on the lid.And I went to return it to find out that the returns window has passed. So I'm stuck with this total piece of JUNK that I can't put the lid on, unless I want to take off all the file folder labels!The construction and wheels are OK, but if you think you're going to haul labeled file folders around in this thing, think again and DO NOT BUY IT!After hundreds of purchases from Amazon, this was my first-ever attempt to return a product that totally is mis-represented. Very frustrating.For these reasons, I'd like to rate this thing a minus star, but instead will just call it a complete waste of money and plastic.

Very strange, I received the scale, tested it once and then put it away until I needed it.  Now several months later I need to use it and it does not work. I tried adding a new battery in, but it does not work?  I am mailing it back to the manufacturer today and I hope they test the replacement several times and ship one to me that works well, as I look forward to using it.  If all goes well I will certainly change my review to a much higher score.

Even the one star is much more that this chair deserves. It makes cracking sounds every time I sit on it, as if it's going to fall apart. I absolutely wouldn't recommend it. Now after installing it and throwing the box, I'm stuck with it. It's not comfortable, I had to buy a 42 $ cushion hoping it would  make it more acceptable. Moreover, the arms are too low, if I want to rest my  arms I have to lean to the side which is not  ergonomic . It's a piece of crap. And I bought two of it !

Changed my review 100% I gave 5 stars and boosted to all my fellow jewelry sellers which is THOUSANDS and we all use a lot of ink printing shipping labels and I running low on ink so I bought more from this company because I loved the last ones  but didn't install until I needed it today since I just ran out and to find out when I opened the color cartridge there was not sticker on it to keep the ink sealed and I went to print and only black is printing because the colored must be dried out from not having that sticker and now it is too late to ask for a new one. Extremely mad because ink isn't cheap and I will be notifying and warning all my fellow jewelry sellers as well not to purchase because we have to get out ink before we run out because we are constantly shipping orders we can't run out and then order so then it gets past the return period.
Wish I had read reviews to learn these have no eraser.

I haven't really tried writing upside down or in water yet, but I've been using this pen to take notes and noticed like another reviewer stated that the pen writes thin and then thick at times. Maybe good for extreme uses, but the lines this pen makes is not consistent.

I purchased this printer back in 2015. After continuing to see poor print quality over time, I'm giving up on this printer. It had positive reviews back in 2015, but I don't think enough time had passed for people to really see how this printer performs long term.Out of the box, the print quality was fine. However, time has proven not to be on this printers side. The quality has done nothing but degrade, despite following all maintenance suggestions (head cleaning and alignment) many, many times.I've used nothing but Epson 'genuine' ink.Lastly, this printer will not allow you to print without replacing all cartridges. I have installed a brand new full black cartridge and have the color cartridges reporting low. I've explicitly told it to print 'black/gray scale', however, it will not let me print. This behavior is beyond ludicrous.I'm cutting my losses, tossing this printer into the garbage, and not buying from Epson again.
This is a piece of junk. It eats the pencil insteadof sharpening it. If I could rate this zero stars,I would. Amazon certainly must offer betterpencil sharpeners than this.

Not recommended , after researching the reviews I choose these because they were recomended ,however I received empty cartridges no ink in them but worse was I didn't need to use them until after the return date so I wasn't pleased at all.

I give honest reviews. It kind of bothers me to give 2 stars to begin with but I don't like this product at all. I barely bought these pens a month ago and the black pen has already run out of in. Furthermore, the blue ink is already running out of ink....Keep in mind that I have only taken 50 pages front and back of notes. I specifically bought these pens for the wave notebook and I have only used these pens on this notebook. The pink, green, and orange is not very vibrant either. I feel like I have to press down the green pen for it to seep through the paper. It might just be my pens but just consider what I wrote.

The cartridges don't make the color yellow, or green. Anything yellow comes out blue. The other colors seem to work fine. I did not have an issue with leaking as some of the other reviewers described. Had I known I bought a complete cartridge kit that can't make certain colors I wouldn't have bought two packs. The quantity is why I decided to buy this product. Basically each order has two kits which seems like a deal. If you can handle yellow pictures coming out blue, and red images coming out pink then maybe this product will work for you. I'm a bit disappointed because I bought this product to make cards to cheer up my friends during this pandemic unfortunately I can't make bright cards with this product. I will keep the cartridge for personal use. I don't want to come out during the rioting, and pandemic to send the packages back. I won't be ordering this again.

I would give this product 0 stars if I could.  It worked great for the first month or so, and has been nothing but trouble ever since.  Not printing pages well, blurry, splotchy and horrible printing in general.  Can't even print color.  Not to mention I bought this for a business and it has completely halted productivity.  HATE IT, DO NOT BUY.  In fact, this has ruined me for Epson printers and products and I will never purchase anything from them again.  If anyone has suggestions for an affordable printer, for a small business I would appreciate it!!

The only reason this printer gets 1 star is because the print quality of photos is really nice.However, I have never hated a piece of machinery as much as I hate this printer.The paper cassette never worked. Errors constantly occur for a paper jam even when there's no paper in it.But there is still the back loader which yay I can still use it. Nope. 95% of the time it reads that the paper wasn't loaded correctly and ejects the paper. I've spent 40 mins to print two photos. And it took a half hour to print a 4 page letter.Don't waste your time.

Ordered after seeing the good reviews. Upon opening, the pieces looked beautiful, but when we started to assemble we noticed considerable size (1in) ripped in various areas of the chair. Then we noticed that the bolts did not fit on the holes which made it very hard to put together. We returned the item since the damages were too many considering the price.

The cart is not very sturdy and also made from cheap material and poor workmanship.  I put 3 normal size grocery paper bags in it and the back axel bent and broke.The cart is rated for 50 lbs.  My grocery bags were not close to that.

I ordered this cartridge as a replacement for our new M177mf. I choose this brand after researching reviews from a number if vendors, and although this specific cartridge only had one (5-star) review, the reputation of the maker seemed quite good. But even though it was less than half the price of the HP cartridge, I decided to test this one before ordering a full set of color ones.The cartridge fit fine, and the printer seemed happy with it. (There was a dialog asking to validate it as a genuine HP cartridge, but obviously that wouldn't make sense.) For the first few prints, it seemed OK. But after 10 page or so, a series of smudges appeared down the left side of every page. I tried removing, gently shaking, and replacing the cartridge a number of times, to no avail. I tried the cleaning page (although the printer cleaning process never touched the black, cyan, or magenta cartridges, which I verified with HP, who still hasn't gotten back to me about why the cleaning process doesn't match the manual and online instructions), and closely examining the cartridge for problems.In the end, I was forced to order a new HP cartridge. Using that eliminated the smudges.I don't like paying exorbitant prices for the HP cartridges, but if this is an example of the quality of the compatible cartridges, then there really isn't a choice. And even at half the price of the HP toner, they're still too expensive to experiment with different brands.

I bought 4 of these packs to distribute around my hospital during Breast Cancer Awareness Month (BCA month = October), even noting the review about the ink coming off in hot weather.  Well, there are no "hot weather" days in Missouri's October, and the hospital has AC; nevertheless, within 2-4 days of placing them at different departments around the hospital all the pens were completely white. No more printing left on them at all. The only way to tell they were the same pens was the pink end-tip formed out of solid colored plastic. If they had only lasted for a few weeks or months of wear I could somewhat rationalize it based on the cheap price. As it is, the reason for buying these pens (the BCA printing) didn't even last til the end of BCA month! They do look very beautiful, but not pretty enough to frame in a glass display -- which is the only way their printing will last.

I like this chair, but the wheels they put on it are inferior. I am a big man, so I bought this chair because it was rated as heavy duty. I like everything about it, but when I sit down on it, the wheels roll really hard. When I called and asked if I could get better wheels, they told me I would have to buy my own. Not a huge problem, but it is an inconvenience, & more cost.

I have the same issue another reviewer posted.  After about half the ink is gone (or less, it varies), a tiny piece of metal pops out of the stylus, rendering the pen unusable.  Just happened on the 4th pen in a row.  Too bad because apart from that, it writes beautifully.At the rate I use these, I get a couple of months out of a pen before it breaks, with well over half the ink left.  Too bad I can't figure a way to transfer the remaining ink to a good pen.  But since every one of them breaks, I would just end up with an excess of unusable ink.Good luck to me, I'm actually going to contact Pilot about this.

Read the other one star reviews before purchasing but took a chance anyway. BIG mistake. Inserted a cyan 271xl into printer. Initially the printer recognized it and accepted it. But a few days later the printer gave an error message 1681 saying I had two grey cartridges installed.  I didn’t of course.  Once I pulled this after market brand cyan cartridge and inserted a new Canon brand the problem corrected itself.  Apparently the chip in this cyan cartridge was mislabeled maybe?? Anyhow, thought I’d save $$ buying these, nope! As they say “buyer beware!”

I'd really like to send it back but doubt I can get it back in the box.  It took me a good half hour just to unroll it and sitting on my chair, it leaves dents in it so it can't move around easily.  Wish I would have read the review before I purchased it.  I would NOT recommend anyone to purchase it.  It's not worth the time or the money.

I assumed this was an actual planner- there is so much "other stuff" in here that if you have time to fill out all the pages and pages of anything BUT planning, then you don't need a planner. 75% of this planner will not be used because I do not have time to fill out page after page of "ideas, gratitude, victories, etc". Now I have to go out and get a real planner! I mistakenly went by the amount of positive reviews so it's my fault that I didn't read the reviews saying how the people that reviewed it bought this to focus on life balanacing stuff and not actually plan day to day activities and work. If you are looking for an actual planner because your life is hectic and need to organize meetings, events- than DO NO buy this, buy a real planner!

Yup. Heres a REAL review...they are master thieves...Ensuring a printer wont work if you dont purchase the extremely over priced Epson ink that fail even while it still has ink...WOW...Problem after problem and pay pay pay til u throw it off the balcony. WORST business ever. Youre thinking...hmmm...I just want it to be good...even ok but not bad and please not the nightmare...yup...youre considering the nightmare right now. Congratulations on reading my review!

Wish I could give ZERO stars. I Have a 3520 that has been solid now for almost 5 years. Based on this, bought the 3620 18 months ago. Liked the touch screen vs "scrolling" through commands. Unfortunately, the 3620 CRAPPED out just in time for the warranty to expire. Started printing in green. I am a Sr VP in the the tech industry. Suffice it to say, I did everything possible. Was finally left with a "helpful" Epson CSR, who "helpfully" told me there was nothing else that they could do.Wow. All I can say is that if for what ever reason you are determined to buy this POS printer, do so with American Express Platinum card. At least that will extend your warranty an additional year, which you most certainly need. Better just to avoid unless you love spending money for things that don't work.

I can't believe this has a 4 out of 5 rating. Frost King tape is terrible. I've been insulating my windows and patio door for years and every time I give Frost King tape a chance, I regret it. The tape will keep coming undone while you're trying to put it up. It will bunch up and roll up under the plastic while you're laying out the plastic, making itself useless and forcing you to redo that side. Any little bit of moisture built up between the window and the plastic will cause the tape to come undone. If you have a window that you never open and want to insulate for year round insulation, there's no way this tape would be good enough. You would have to redo the window every season, multiple times a season if it's a bathroom window due to the moisture. I've even tried doubling up on it and laying out two strips of tape on each side of a window. It seemed to work better but it still has difficultly lasting through a whole winter. I'm just not impressed with it. It's bad tape and a waste of money.If you want a less frustrating and more durable tape then I recommend DUCK double sided window tape. I never regret using it and if you have any experience at all with window and door insulation, then you'll also notice the difference. My only complaint about DUCK window tape is there's not much to a roll. 1 roll seems to be enough to do 1 and a half windows, and you'll easily go through at least 2 rolls if you're insulating just a few windows. So be sure to buy several rolls at a time. Duck Brand 281075 Double-Sided Indoor Replacement Tape for Window Kits, 0.5-Inch by 24-Feet, Single Roll

Sometimes I received some used item from Amazon-but nothing like THIS. I had a bad feeling when seeing the box so here's some pictures before/after I opened it. Looks like it's been used for months and here I bought it 'NEW' The way parts were stuffed into the box and how dirty it is I wonder if it still works at all.Returned right away. Really disappointed because I really look forward to be able to sharpen my pencil to sharp point and this sharpener has so many raving reviews.

Extremely disappointed.  One star is the minimum rating, or otherwise I would rate as a zero.  I rarely use or need a printer, but wanted a high quality printer.  After printing less than 10 pages in the first month of ownership, the printer stopped printing.  This Epson printer initially worked great.  Now it goes through the motions, but pages come out completely blank showing error code Ox9D.  After wasting valuable time with customer service and exhausting the squence of steps directed by the printer, I searched online for a remedy and followed all available instructions, but this printer is useless.  I replaced the small temporary ink cartridges as directed and discarded them - a popular recommended remedy is to re-insert the temporary ink supply cartridges and power it up.  Based on Amazon reviews, I believed I was buying an ideal printer that I could rely on for years to come so I purchased $60+ supply of ink to be well equipped for future needs.  After only 6 months, I realize this printer is only suitable as filler for a garbage dumpster.  I have an Epson label maker than works great, but proceed with extreme caution before buying an Epson printer.  I will never buy another Epson printer and will avoid all Epson products as a matter of principle.  I was frustrated at the high cost of replacement ink for my HP, but at least it is reliable.

I bought these pens under the 'new' pens description but I feel like they sent me 'used' pens instead. The ink levels between the pens is not consistent. The pens also have a plastic-y feel to them. Other than that the pens write with a fine point without smudging hence the two stars.
Cheap but hard to install. Too small to fit over the average house key. You have to really stretch it. Can snap easily. 2 stars because it was cheap

Ordered this based on the description online. On arrival I found out that it does not have adjustable arm rests. The brochure that came with the chair lists 10 possible adjustments.  Of those, 9 are 'only available on some models'. I wouldn't want all 10 adjustments, but arm rest height is one I would have wanted.The seating is comfortable and the height adjustment is good.  I had just expected more based on Aeron's good reputation. Caveat emptor still applies to good brands.This might be a product that you should buy from a store where you can see and test the different models. It is a complicated product and it may be beyond Amazon's ability to present the alternative versions.I'm giving 2 stars because I see other people have hit the same problem yet the web interface still does not adequately show what is and is not adjustable.

I wish I'd read the less than 5 star reviews first.... There is a lot of work involved in transferring all of the information from one older address book to a newer one. I'm not happy about having to do so because so many of the thin pages have torn out. The extra sheets in the new AB are just as thin, I'll have to apply reinforcement stickers before using them. I like the bold font of the letter tabs, but not the bright crayon box colors. Day Timer is my favorite brand for planner pages, but I'll look for something more durable when I have to replace these address pages.

After owning the printer for 2 months the scanner quit working. I have two other half-working Epson printers in my office, it's starting to feel like a printer graveyard in here.The phone support was an American but he was very mechanical and not much help other than replacing the printer. In order to make an exchange they require a $160 deposit. I've never had a company CHARGE me to make an exchange. They did answer the phone right away though which is unusual when calling a support line.For the malfunctioning of a new printer, their luke warm support, and the other Epson printers I've been cursed with I give the review 2 stars.
It arrived dirty and had to clean it before giving it as a present. From previous reviews it’s not the first time that this has happened...

IJust got these...either they are knock offs or the original product is crap.  I don't understand the large numbers of great reviews!I couldn't even get the chalk to fit without forcing it which--with how flimsy the plastic was-- it would break the chalk holder.I am disappointed with this product and its quality.  These will NOT stand up to children's daily use and I will be returning them and searching/buying a better product locally.

Great price but the colors are dull and they are not durable at all. Great seller, bad product, unfortunately.Edit:I received an email from someone in this company after leaving them a one-star review and they offered me a free ink cartridge in exchange for removing the review, claiming it will affect one of the employee's direct salary... Since buying this crap product, my printer hasn't been the same and I have to constantly clean and align the ink cartridges. While the seller delivered the product very quickly, it's not worth dealing with a product that will mess up your printer nor dealing with a sob story from an almost-slaved employe. Don't even bother.
Really disappointing when cases meant for display come to you extremely scratched. Should have listened to other reviews.

Very disappointed with this printer. I'm pretty sure there are NO good printers after shopping for a new one, but this one is worse than most. I bought it based on the good Wirecuttter review, but I'm pretty sure they didn't use the printer for long or on a regular basis.Here is a list of my issues:* Broke after 1 yr 1 month. Just won't power on period. And after I just bought $70 in ink.* Seems to use a ton of ink. I was constantly needing to replace the ink cartridges on this printer, and they are not cheap!* Does not have a good "low power" mode. When it goes to sleep it doesn't wake up from a wireless print job.* Does not print black when color cartridges are out of ink.* Design is just bad. Everything from how it opens to replace the print cartridges to where the ethernet cable connects - in a visible location on the side, to the esthetics of the thing - Ugly. I know it seems trivial, but I much preferred the UX of my HP ink jet I had before this one.I will say that the print quality and scan quality is pretty good. I would not recommend it on that alone though.

I originally had this as a 5-star rating with no review, but have changed the rating and am now posting a review.  I loved my Workforce printer for nine and a half months.  It was convenient and did a good enough job that for the money I was spending it was great.  However, two weeks ago it would give me an error message any time I turned it on.  The error meant nothing to me, and wasn't referenced in the manual.  I called tech support, who I've found are very responsive, but never seem to have any advice other than to turn the printer off and on again, to look to see if there's a paper jam, and to see if there is anything blocking the printer head.  They ran me through all that, and then just told me that they were sending me a new unit at no cost to me.  I would just have to return the old one using the box the new one comes in, and they would pay for the shipping.  Good deal.  Well, I got the new one yesterday, hooked it up, and printed something.  Problem solved, right?I just had a case of deja-vu.Today I tried to print again and got a new error message on the new printer.  I just called Epson tech support again, they ran me through the same stuff, and now they're saying that they'll send me another new printer.  This would literally be my third one, but I've told them I just want my money back and I'll go with another brand.  If the "new new" one still won't work and they have to send me a "new new new" one, then I'm done.

I read other reviews and this seems like a great deal. You definitely get what you pay for. The images came out odd colors and with stripes in the image. I cleaned the printer heads, and tried again. No amount of cleaning can change bad ink. Very disappointed.  I returned the opened one and the unopened one. I going for the original HP product.

I needed a cart to carry groceries from the car to my apartment on the third floor.  This looked like the ideal solution.  It folded up easily for transportation in the car, and then opened for food transportation.  I used it for about two weeks with no problems.  However, on the next trip the rear wheel rod broke.  The broken rod appears to be made of very soft metal.  Holes were drilled in it to fit cotter pins that hold the wheels in place.  The break occurred where the holes were drilled.  I replaced the broken rod with a standard steel rod that I had available.  It now works well, but I would have to rate this product as sub-standard because of the cheap material used in it's construction.

This printer lasted 9 months and a couple days. I bought it to replace a similar HP printer that last about 5 years. While it was working the Epson worked very well. Good wi-fi connectivity (better than the old HP) and good print and color. Scanning was not as good resolution as the HP. The Epson's on-screen Obituary was Printer Error 0x9D, which is "not user serviceable". Still under warranty, but who wants to pack, haul, and ship the damn thing back? It's cheaper to buy another HP. PCMag and others report that failure rates for both HP and Epson are high. That really doesn't do the environment any good -- not to mention your customers!

Pro:Very great pen, loved it. Writes great, the pen is better than a pencil and a pen.Why did I give it one star?Con:The ink ran out in less than a week. I only wrote down 6 pages of notes.Save your money and buy this pen instead.http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B001603YXI/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc=1Or better yet, this:http://www.amazon.com/dp/B0002T401Y/ref=wl_it_dp_o_pC_nS_img?_encoding=UTF8&colid=21LUQLMEVLR0J&coliid=I3LXVCWXT8KR4F&psc=1
No review

I had read the bad reviews of this thing on Amazon, but I needed a cart this size in the worst way. When I saw it at my local Ace Hardware today, I thought about it for about 30 seconds...then figured I'd take a chance on it. After all, it couldn't be as bad as the reviews on Amazon made it out to be, could it? Turns out it wasn't. It was a hundred times worse! OMG. Who in their right mind could even design a product this bad? And even if that was allowed to happen, what genius at the manufacturer decided it would be a good idea to sell this thing? Did anyone associated with the company even try to put it together or use it??? I doubt it, because if they had this cart would never have come to market. Never. Ever. It's virtually impossible to assemble. The package touts "no tool assembly." Little did I know that that meant there was literally nothing holding this thing together. No screws, no clips, not even holes for ends to stick or snap into. It's all pretty much based on gravity. I felt like a circus juggler while assembling this cart. I was holding lightweight pieces of painted steel, but they may as well have been chainsaws. That's how hard it was to get this thing together. And after it was together, and the casters were popped on? This is the painted steel version of a house of cards. Yes, it's that flimsy. Shame on you, Whitmor for even making a product like this. What were you thinking?? If someone offered to PAY me $100.00 to use this, I would emphatically say "NO!" Needless to say, I returned this travesty to the hardware store. Do yourself a favor and DO NOT order this. If you do, I guarantee you will regret it with every bone in your body. If I could have rated this zero stars, I would have.

strong  enough,  great for yard work tying small stuffBut when I trimmed my shrubs, then tied them up for city pick up I had hard time pulling the cord tight,i'm 84 yrs old and when I pulled taught the twine broke Easley, maybe every third pile the cord would breakI thought the rating on  this pretty good ? I found if you want to pull the line  good luck

I don't normally write such negative reviews, but this was an utter disappointment. I was unable to be productive with this item at all. It took me 10 minutes of disappointment after disappointment trying to cut different types of paper, etc to ultimately decide I needed to return it.The plastic is a sub-par grade, very flimsy.The blade does not cut through paper very smoothly, not one sheet, much less 3 as it claims often not at all. It tore newspaper with the blade, rather than cut it, it caught it and tore it. Not good.I was so disappointed with this purchase that I returned the item for a refund.I did end up purchasing a Swingline SmartCut EasyBlade Plus Rotary Paper Trimmer, 12 Inch, 15 Sheet Capacity (8912) it was about twice the price, but so much more worth it.Hope that helps you with your purchasing decisionThanks for Reading!

The first cartridge worked just fine.  The second cartridge, on the other hand, leaves 16 stains/smudges on the right side of every page it prints, making it basically unusable.At the moment, genuine Canon 128 toner is going for $76 apiece, so I suppose it's still economical to buy these knock-offs instead.  But a failure rate of 50% is pretty darn high.

I used this in my classroom.  It worked great for about two months then wouldn't sharpen pencils any more.  Asked for a replacement under the warranty and was sent one out in about two weeks.  This one arrived broken right out of the box.  The mechanism inside it just clunked around loose in the casing.  It didn't function at all.  Guess we'll see how the second replacement does.Update:  After about two weeks the second replacement broke in exactly the same way that the first replacement arrived broken.  I wonder how many people who gave this five stars after a week never updated their review when it broke.

My wife bought these to make our annual Christmas cards and they’re awful for that. Neither dye based nor pigment ink ever dries on their glossy finish and adhesive paper peels right back off. The only ink that stays and dries is permanent and that can’t be cleaned off of her stamps. I don’t see what possible use this gloss finish ever has. Hopefully someone else reads the description way at the bottom and/or these reviews before they make the same mistake.

I got this piece of Junk today and it turned on...but it didn't weigh anything!!!It stayed on zero and I at first thought "Well, maybe I should take the battery out and put it back in."  I did that five times then tried the cord too five times.  Still it wouldn't weigh anything.I suggest NOT buying this or any scales off the internet.  Instead go to Office Max, Staples or even your local post office.  ...At least you'll be able to return it much quicker AND get a quality product if it DOES work.Also most of the positive reviews are probably fake.  I never buy a product if it has only positive reviews...that's why I bought this.

Pretty new yet, but so far, so good.  Easy to set up.  Good print quality.  If nothing goes wrong, I'd move it up to five stars.Well, after 3 months of use it exhibits one HUGE problem.  It regularly drops the Wi-Fi connection with my computer (which is within 10 feet of it) and has to be rebooted to reconnect.  I will often bring one page, then print another, and on the third my computer can't locate the printer.  In an otherwise normal work day I have restarted this printer as many as 15 times.  By the 5th I'm cussing like a sailor.  Calling it names doesn't seem to help, however.  I have yet to discover a reasonable solution online.  Accordingly, I'm downgrading my review to one star.

I am so sad that this paper is not like the five star brand. Although the paper looks the same, when using a gel pen the ink will smear. This did not happen to me while using my FIVE STAR paper brand.
The product itself is sturdy and I would have given it 5 stars if both of the organizers came damaged. This is exactly what I was looking for and would buy again if it doesn't come damaged.

A good size but not sturdy at all.  Minimal assembly is required all you have to do is put rod and back larger wheels on.  There is an axel that is already on in the front of the cart that constantly comes off.  When you collapsed and reopen it doesn't open properly.  I order constantly from Amazon and this is the first review I have taken time to write so that will tell you how strongly I do not suggest you buy this cart.

Received the sharpener today and tried to sharpen large eye pencil and it broke with only half a turn! Would have given 0 stars but that option not available. I ordered the Avon double eye pencil sharpener today...we will see how that one works.

Broke after using twice. Did not attempt to carry any more items then in the picture. Rear axle bent, then snapped off. Also did not open and close without getting stuck. Very flimsy.Shame on me for not ready the reviews before I purchased!

Paper is a great substitute for canon's photo paper pro luster line, the only difference I really notice is that this paper is thinner and the printed area noticeably feels somewhat sticky after being printed on. This hasn't left any marks or been an issue, but you have to be careful how you hold this paper because it can bend easy. I would give 4 stars if the pack I received didnt have a small crease in the middle of every single sheet because of how there was no protection to the pack during shipping. When you're making art prints this detail is really unprofessional.

This product was awful. I hate to have to leave a negative review(and never have before)but i bought this for my husband for stocking stuffers and he said he was only able to print four 8.5x11 pieces of paper before the ink ran out on ALL the cartridges. So 4 pages total not for each cartridge. And no He wasn't printing black blocks. He was printing congratulatory certificates. Not much writing.
Not up to weight rating. Used twice and casters twisted  on legs.  Seat is nice size, though.
Great product, but my packing came partially opened and folded so now the entire notebook is creased and bent. Otherwise would have gotten 5 stars.

These bands are too small and not worth the money! They look like a box of confetti! I thought it was a joke. The description should be changed to include the actual size 1/4 inch.  Do not purchase these bands. Zero star rating!!!

I'm giving it 2 stars because it at least lasted a month. I do like the card holder, but other than that this product is not worth it. As you can see from the pictures, the little piece that holds the card holder to the lanyard is destroyed. The pattern on the lanyard is also not like the one pictured. Too bad I can't return this thing.
If I could I'd give it 0 stars.  It's advertised as a box of 12. I received a single pen.

I’m surprised these highlighters have such great reviews, I hate them!  First the tip is so blunt you can’t highlight with any precision. Then even though they say smear guard, it’s very easy to smear the print being highlighted. Finally, because of the “gel” they are made out of they get messy as the gel just clumps off the highlighter. I’ll stick to liquid highlighters. These are not for me!

First of all these are not nearly as bad as reviewers are stating. They do not soak into the paper, do not smear ink, and are difficult to see on the other side of the paper due to not soaking into it. Also even though it could have been designed better, if you turn it over to the newly sharpened point when it starts getting flat on the side you are using it works fairly well.That being said it does feel like you are using a crayon instead of having the control a normal highlighter gives you, you go though it fairly fast, and it is very expensive.Is it a decent highlighter given you aren't a complete moron? Yes. Is it worth the price? No.

This black cylinder pen is lightweight, writes about as good as a BIC pen, bought because of Seinfeld out of curiosity, and feel like it was a let down for $20If anything, this pen might be worth $5 at bestIf you want a Space Pen, buy a pen that feels good to use everyday, and looks like a Space PenThis writes at a 0.5mm rate like a BIC and thin. I will say it does work as advertised

The sharpening mechanism is located off-center.  This results in awkward rotating motion, which leads to many broken leads.  Additionally, it does not sharpen very well, creating uneven cuts.  I've wasted several brand new pencils on this thing.I'd return this product if shipping didn't cost more than the item it self.  I purchased mine based on the good reviews (fake?), stay away from this product.

Here's the thing: this is a very cool and nifty product. A mini pen to fit on your keychain to take everywhere with you without poking your leg, and you can use it to write down numbers and names and brilliant ideas as you're on the go.But here's the thing, it WOULD NOT stay in it's cap and I had trouble getting it to write sometimes. I would frequently take my keys out of my pocket and the pen would have fallen off and it was lying at the bottom of my pocket. I even tried two of these pens because I wanted it to work so bad. The first I sent back assuming it was faulty because the product has generally good reviews; but no, my second pen had similar problems. It's a shame. I really wish this was a more reliable product, but you can't have everything, I guess.

I would return this if the delivery box wasn't so big. I regret not listening to the reviews before buying.Cons:-Assembly instructions are unclear (not every detailed).-Unstable design. (the wheels are held in place by pins, cheap thin metal cage that wobbles)-Can get a better one at Costco for a cheaper price.I hope this cart will last me at least one year.Don't buy this unless it's dirt cheap. Around $10ish, which is what it's worth.

It's funny how one, two, three, and even the four star reviews all say the adhesion stinks.  It's all true. I was in a hurry and didn't read the reviews before buying, and now I'm suffering the consequences.  This product should be the poster child for how a product with a major flaw that so many people complain about but still gets 4-1/2 stars overall.  Steer clear of this product unless you're one of those folks who seal the envelops with a decorative sticker because then the lack of adhesive would not matter to you.

It has a lock feature which means it takes 10 seconds for the display to update with any weight changes.  What a waste of my time.  You can not weight out the amount you need you can only check the weight of what you have and then you get to wait 10 seconds before you are allowed to check a new weight.  One star = I hate it.

I'm actually writing a review about packing tape. That's how bad this product is. I didn't even buy it from Amazon but felt obligated to share. Stay far away from this one. I thought buying tape made by Scotch would be a slam dunk. Quite the opposite.  I'm amazed at how poorly this product performed. Main issue: very poor adhesion. I used it to seal up boxes when moving. Luckily none of the boxes were heavy. Never again.
We did not receive the quantity ordered.Better rating if order were/is fulfilled.

The media could not be loaded.                        Bought this printer on the evening of 11/26/16 at Office Depot, didn't set it up till the 1st of December. I usually do a through research before I purchase any product, however, I haven't with this one, trusted the sales guy to lead me to a great product for a replacement of my leaked ink HP PhotoSmart 8250 printer (which I've owned since 2008) by the way Thee BEST Photo printer by far. I wish I would have Read Reviews first!I installed, registered and setup everything as instructed and it worked flawlessly except from the mobile devices. I have a very wide knowledge in software troubleshooting as I am tech savvy, so I did some digging and finally found an app that works with my all of my android devices, so that was a problem solved. Now mind you, if you're not as tech savvy as I am, an average person wouldn't be able to figure it out as the Epson website does not have a solution to the problem. I have printed about 50-60 pages since 5 days ago, Today 12/05/16 I turn the printer on and it runs through it's head cleaning, then stops, shuts off, just to turn back on and do it over and over and over and over, you get the point. Ink was full, now completely gone! I cannot connect to the printer neither through wireless or usb connection at all, to manually reset it or fix. Epson has no solution and neither does internet for the problem I'm experiencing, and it won't even give me any error, NONE! Per Epson's user guide, I've disconnected printer from the outlet and pull the plug out of the printer, did a reset by holding down power and stop button for 7 seconds or more, waited 15 seconds then plug everything back to no avail! I'm attaching a video I took of the problem I'm experiencing with this printer, so you can see what I'm talking about. BTW, I had to stop the recording because it took over 4 minutes and it still wouldn't stop, very very frustrating!Thank goodness I'm still within a 14 day period so I can get a full refund, oh and I bought a 2yr warranty because the sales guy kept on with it, I now see why! I will never buy another Epson product again! I still own NX110 that I only used for scanning and fax because my HP was for printing photo and color pages. After I return this product, I'm going with possibly the HP Envy tomorrow from Best Buy!Please, save yourself heartache, aggravation and money, stay far away from Epson Products! They're not worth it!

After dealing with one piece of "junk" HP printer after another, I decided to try Epson. Didn't think things could be worse. Unfortunately, they are. It's like pulling teeth to get one envelope out of this printer. In fact, every feature on this printer - from scanning to simple printing - is problematic. It does not print on both sides of the paper even though the user manual claims that it does.I guess reluctantly be going back to HP. You know, I don't expect the moon and the stars for these inexpensive printers, but I do expect to be actually able to use them for more than two months before hitting a brick wall.I would NOT recommend this printer to anybody.

This isn't a review of the product as much as it is the ad \ marketing tactic.  The fact that 5 are shown and you actually get 1 for the price is a bit deceptive.  You can get these anywhere locally for about $1 - 1.50 per notebook.  Based on that, it would be silly to buy 1 for this price, but 5 at this price would be a good deal.  Shame on me for not reading this closer and shame on Amazon for allowing this slight of hand advertising.

One star is too generous.  If Amazon didn't have a good return policy,  I'd be furious.  The ink bleeds everywhere,  which I could get over if it actually worked. Now I have purchased many non manufacturer ink in the past with no problems.  However,  this has been the exception.  This ink is literally no good.

I can't believe this was an Amazon's choice product. This was the worst tape I have ever used.  First of all, it was stretchy and when I tried to get it out of my dispenser, it just stretched and folded over on itself.  Also, it claims to be "invisible" tape, but it showed up white on my gifts that I was wrapping.  I ended up throwing it away.  What a waste!  I would actually give it zero stars if I could.
I am so disappointed. As it states, 3 pack, I only received one. There should be a negative star or a black one to show disappointment.

I never leave reviews but this highlighter was too awful to stay quiet. I have no clue who loves this product, or why. It doesn't leave a nice line, it smears, chunks come off, it leaves weird hazy edges, its difficult to make a straight line. I honestly don't have a single pro for this. It's truly awful. I have tried it on smooth textbook paper to card stock type notecards, and it's equally awful everywhere.

This review is for the 4x6 index card box. The box is metal and the lid is almost lined up with the lower portion of the box.  The follower block does not function properly. It will not lock in place. This allows the cards to flop around in the box and not be held in place.  The box only functions as intended if you are near it's capacity of 900 index cards, if you have less cards you might as well as put them in a shoe box. The non working follower block is very disappointing, especially considering the $30 price.

i wanted 2.mm mechanical pencils for artso i bought these because i am a broke artistand i have a lot of mechanicals so i got two for that obsessive reason.. ok on with the review when received they come with the pencil and erasers,the part where u put the tip of ur fingers to hold the pencil feels shallow in hands, and they’re very light?, i guess thats ok for some people though?i did not use the sharpener but probably will end up doing it and they come with like 5 pieces of lead , kinda a plus! anyways bye!
Wish I could give 0 stars.This cork board is so thin that the tac went right through it, into the wall behind it. What's the point of a cork board if it's too thin?

Sorry, i wish i could review the product, but i paid for it & never received it. Aside from that fact, it would be better if they advertised it with just ONE pen in the picture & then when ordering on the page they let YOU pick the color. I know i should have been paying closer attention that day, but i thought when it said "assorted colors" it meant that i was going to be receiving ALL of those pens... not just one (it wasn't until AFTER i paid that i noticed it said "single pen"). If people are paying for a product, they usually prefer to have some choice over the color that they are spending their money on.
The black ink cartridge did not work. I read other reviews and this seems to be an ongoing problem with this item
one star for it arriving. tried to sharpen a pencil then threw it.

This is probably one of the worst if not worst ink yet printer I have owned from a print quality standpoint.  I have to print on high quality just to be able to read the print using up ink quickly.  I tried replacing the black ink cartridge with a high rated after market ink cartridge with terrible results, so I had to go back to the high priced Epson brand cartridges. Color printing is disappointing.  It is washed out and dull even on high quality.  Not suitable for printing photos.  It gets a 1 star for print quality.  I also don't like that I cant set the default print parameters such as print quality, double sided printing etc.  I have to reset it everytime I print.  The only good thing about this printer is that its wifi  connection is flawless so far.

TL;DR Don't buy unless you have the eyes of a hawk, the hands of a neurosurgeon and the patience of Job.I almost never write reviews but needed to here.  I was so excited to find a simple, low cost replacement toner cartridge for my HP printer.  The product description said I had to replace the chip from the HP cartridge to the new cartridge.  How hard could that be, I thought?  After all, I am a pretty handy guy. The package arrived with the tools necessary for the chip replacement.  Nice.  A piece of paper referred me to the chip replacement instructions.  Searching, I discovered that they were NOT enclosed.  Back to Amazon I went, and watched the nice video  (Watch it first if you think this is easy to do - my bad for not watching in advance!)  I opened the printer and saw the chips.  They are SMALL.  REALLY SMALL!  See the attached picture.  I tried to remove the chip per the video.  No luck.  I tried calling customer service.  No one answered.  I fiddled around some more and the chipset came loose!  I was on my way.  When I went to put it into the new cartridge, I discovered that I had to apply about 50 pounds of force to mount it properly, WITHOUT damaging the chip.  After 5-10 minutes, I succeeded.  I went to replace the cartridge, basking in my success, and, IT DID NOT FIT properly in the printer (yes, it was the right cartridge!) I tried calling customer service again.  Once again, no answer.  I jiggled the cartridge around to try and get it to fit - and the chip fell out - never to be found again.  Back to Amazon for a very convenient return.  5 stars to Amazon.  1 star for this product.

I was finally able to override the many error messages from my HP Photosmart 6520 by hitting "copy command" as soon as I loaded the cartridge (before getting an error message).  This was a trick I learned from a friend.  It is a very frustrating process and I would not buy this item again.  Also one of the cartridges (yellow) never did work, I had to replace it with a different cartridge.  I gave two stars only because the price is so much better then HP.

These are crap.  I can not get my printer to print anything with these cartridges installed!!!  This was a complete waste of money, I wish I could get a complete refund!  I wish I could give this a zero star rating, but it requires me to put at least one in order to publish.  Total scam!

I ordered these based on reviews - I should have looked more closely at the lower reviews. The color is way off in the picture - they’re brown and tan in real life with generic white envelopes, not red and gold, so they don’t really look Christmas-y except for having a reindeer. They don’t come folded - that’s not a big thing but it’s a thing. They’re shiny, not matte as as pictured. They literally look like dollar store cards. I expected a lot higher quality for the price. Not worth the price for sure.  Plus, the envelope glue was pretty much ineffective- I had to use a glue stick to seal them

The media could not be loaded.                      Edit -Amazon made it right and let me return these even though I was beyond my return date.  I still love these, but I am going to leave this review as 1 star for visibility.  I do, however, give these a 5 star rating.I love this card stock.  It's heavy and has a great look to them all around.  I ordered one box and they worked out, so I ordered 3 more boxes to use when I ran out of the first one.  Got the new boxes (in December, it's now March) and looked at them (didn't open them, just checked out that they weren't damaged).  I had a big order come in so I knew I was going to use at least 2 boxes - lucky I ordered extra to have on hand!  I grabbed one box and used those up.  Grabbed the second box, opened the box, unfolded 4 cards - the one laying on top showing the design and the next 3 cards - and the ones underneath are the wrong design!What I got was the Strathmore (105-230 Photo Mount Cards Decorative Embossed Border, White, 50 Envelopes -- which have circles embossed on the border -- not the classic straight embossed border.Obviously this is not Amazon's fault, but I'm way past my return date and I'm stuck with $70 of product I can't use.  It looked right from the top, and I never even considered opening the box to check that they were all the same.After opening the first one I decided to video myself opening the second one (but I was thinking that the next box MUST be right.... they couldn't have sent me 2 totally wrong boxes.... I was wrong.  Sorry for my terrible video shooting  and my god eating loudly in the background.

This is my out of the box, initial review.Pros:-Nice build quality. Metal body, internal mechanisms like the spring are enclosed inside, so they will not fall out if you have to tamper with the ink cartridge.-Writes well on different materials, including wet paper. This is good because I work outside when it rains, and I needed something that wouldn't smear everywhere on damp paper.Cons:-Poor ink delivery. Feels like you really have to push down on it to get it to write good, which is easier said than done when you're holding flimsy paper in your hand. Does not write very well unless basically perpendicular from the writing surface.-Loose action for deploying pen. Not as tactile or "clicky" as I would have hoped, feels like it could easily be activated while clipped to me shirt/pants. Also feels very awkward to hold in the hand and click with the thumb. You have to press it down about half an inch.-A lot thinner than I would like. If the pen is even slightly wet, you could easily loose grip. Not very meaty nor much weight. I also own the pocket-sized space pen, which is roughly the same width because it's supposed to fit in the pocket nicely, but the full-sized pen should be wider.-Clip is unnecessarily thin and hard to get a grasp on. Sharp edges pinch you while trying to lift it up.-Design (or lack thereof) is boring. Would be neat for the option of getting a Space-X type logo on the side. Black matte is easy to lose track of.I will update my review after a month or so of daily job grind. Initially, I'm not very impressed.
