The way the spiral is designed, or maybe there's not enough room within the spine, or the fact that it's metal covers with a metal spine, all of it makes it very difficult to open and close properly.  That, and the pages really stick together and practically rip apart at the spine.  I'd pass.

I have only been using this board for two months (I use the board in an office and have not subjected it to any strange temperatures or any stress of any sort) and the hard surface of the white board is coming away from the backing.  Like another reviewer stated - there are ripples forming on the board going from the top of the board to the bottom.  Pretty soon I will not be able to write on the white board and have the writing be legible - i.e. it will be useless after only minimal use and no wear and tear whatsoever.  This is not worth the money at all!

I had to give it a star just to be able to write my negitive review.I printed 25 and the cartridge quit working and the same thing happened with the 2nd cartridge. Now keep in mind each cartridge is supposed to print 100 photo's. I was so upset about the whole thing, I just went and bought a new cammera and printer...... So no I do not encourage any one to purchase this item.I do not give it a star....I give it a never....

I just received this and was able to set up the printer to copy and print, in a very short amount of time.  I have not yet tried to set up the wireless connection or fax, but at this moment I am pleased with how easy it was and how well it printed.  I will try to review again after I have owned it a few months.*Update:  I have owned this printer for about 10 months. It is currently printing fuzzy lines; I have already cleaned the printheads (at great ink cost) and it did not fix the problem.  It definitely uses a lot of ink and does not print pictures well.  I used to print pictures for projects all the time with my old printer, I almost never use this one, because the quality is bad. Currently I am experiencing a problem where my computer will not connect.  My printer is on and all cables/usb are properly connected, yet, it will not print from the computer.  I have tried all the unplug/replug, start/restart ideas and it won't connect.  I assume it was a problem that resulted from my last Epson update. I fear this printer will not last long; whereas my last printer lasted me 5-6 years.

Unfortunately, a short time after I wrote a positive review for this product, the stapler jammed and I cannot open the magazine anymore.  Also, the stapler has proven to be too noisy.  I can no longer recommend this expensive and easily breakable item.The Swingline Electric Stapler Speed Pro 45 weighs 2.6 pounds and measures 9.6 x 3.2 x 5.9 inches. It supposedly works well with either standard or high-capacity staples; the manufacturer includes five hundred Speed Pro staples and one thousand standard staples.  To eject the magazine, press the release button on top and load the staples you need.  Use standard staples (1/4") for attaching up to twenty-five sheets and high-capacity staples (3/8") for 25-45 sheets. A red light glows when the magazine is open or when you need to reload the stapler. To unblock the mechanism, unplug the stapler, release the magazine, remove the damaged staple, and push the magazine back in.

2 stars for the great labels - great cutout designs really stand out. Bit larger than expected but that's ok. No stars for the chalk marker. It ran on the bottles i had labeled and refrigerated, scrubbing is definitely not needed, just a bit of humidity! Primarily purchased for use in labeling my homemade spices, hot sauces and detergents like dish soap. Writing did not last a day and stained our hands

I wish I could give it zero stars.  I haven't been happy since day one because scan properties are not as advertised - won't scan in pdf or multiple pages in one document.  Uses color print on just black or grayscale printing which means 1) it costs you more to print because it's using color as well as black ink, and 2) it won't print with just black ink  if you're out of a color.  Cheesy trick to get you to spend more money on ink.  I'm really glad I have 11 days on the warranty period because it just quit printing with cyan, so everything I print in color comes out purple and pink.  I've never purchased anything but HP printers before again, and I never will again.

Simple review of my 0.7 I found it not to dry very well  after writing. It would smear.My brother would use the 0.5 and his words were sloppy.He is an aerospace engineer.We are at 5000 ft above altitude if that helps.

My first try at using non-HP cartridges in HP printer and it was NOT a good experience. Purchased this set of three LD cartridges, and recently replaced all three in HP 2025DN printer. The printer complained about non-HP cartridges and did finish the initial setup process. Then noticed that every color page has horizontal streaks of pink, yellow, and blue all the way down the page. The printer is basically useless now. Hoping that replacing with genuine HP cartridges will resolve the problem.5/15 update - Purchased, cleaned, & installed three genuine HP cartridges and the printer is back to working great. Updating rating to two stars since LD Products was prompt in responding to complaint and sent label to ship items back for full refund.

I bought this package of Hybrid Correction tape out of the rest of the brands I viewed because it came in a pack of 10 for what seemed to me a good deal. However, they do not work. After I used the first one possibly three times on one document it no longer worked, The tape twisted at the tip area and I could not get it to work. I tossed it and thought it may be a fluke. Now I opened the second pack and it is doing the very same thing. I do not enjoy writing and posting negative reviews, but I could find no way to contact the company prior to this writing. I wish they did work!

This is a rehash of a poster that owes a lot of children and adults an apology. I can't rate this no-stars, so the one is earned by an eye twitch that clearly admits how unnatural and uncomfortable this is for children, as well as how afraid they are of the totalitarians that would use a poster like this

I read the reviews on this pen and purchased them thinking "Finally a pen that does not smear"! Sad, smears badly for both righties and lefties -- worse for lefties as the ink ends up all over their wrist and arm! Also, when I put them in my pen and pencil holder, the ink leaked all over the bottom of the holder--Photo is from the pen holder cleanup. First Amazon product that I have been really disappointed with.  :(

Greetings ... Reviewer, DO NOT BUY the RED LED name tag unit from SOCW !!!It failed to receive the texted I tried to imported it from. I suspect it is defective.However, I purchased two (2) other Name Tags one each "Green and Blue LED Name Tag from SOCW" which when plugged in started a HDSmart software install on my PC from the units.  The software is user friendly and after some adjustments the two are working fine with the text I downloaded to the Name tags.  So some reason the Red LED name tag will not except the text.  Enjoy . . .
The one I purchased had less confetti, tooling marks on the surface, and color values inferior to the one shown.  2 stars for holding paper successfully.
Apparently, the sellers have done a good job of stacking the reviews because these are junk. The tape twists easily and they have no cover to keep them from drying out. I’m very disappointed.

I always use G2s in my work area and they are great. The reason for the 2 stars is that one of the pens somehow broke and ruined the box so i just threw it away didnt want to get ink on my hands. Should have returned it but didn't. A bit annoying but pens usually work fine

August 7, 2009 - UPDATEI have printed several pages since my first review and I am happy to report that the prints using the black inks have looked much better.  At the quality that I am receiving now, I would purchase these cartridges again.  I have used the cyan and yellow inks as well and have not had a problem with them.===============I received these in the mail.  They were individually wrapped GENERIC cartridges.  So were the colored ones that I ordered from the same company.  This is not what is pictured.  I opened one up today and the ink leaked all over my hands (Perhaps I squeezed it when I took off the plastic piece).  Anyway, I cleaned the cartridge up and placed it in my printer. (I made sure it was no longer leaking first.)  The print quality is not nearly as good as the original.  I am definitely disappointed in my purchase.

This printer broke the day I bought it.  It's slow and noisy.  It jams often and it's hard to clear.  At the time of the purchase, this item had a good rating.  I completely regret having bought this printer.

This is a P. O. S!!!! First of all, it's not a board like I thought it was. It's simply something you unroll and tape it to your wall like paper. Secondly, because it's not a board and more like paper, it gets awful creases and wrinkles in it like a pool liner so you can't even write right on it. And of course it's not eligible for return bc it's a piece of crap. DO NOT BUY unless you don't mind wasting your money trying out a new product ignoring REAL reviews.

I have had a lot of frustration with printers in my life, but this one takes the cake. Ink guzzling, error code reading, frustrating money waster.  For the positive the scanning and network setup were easy.  That's it.The printing is a nightmare.  I never go on Amazon to review, but giving me low color ink cartridge after one black & white image is beyond ridiculous.  To make matters worse, you need to have all color and B&W Cartidges full in order to print ANYTHING.  I just bought new color ink to print one colorless doc and am willing to toss this thing because of the unnecessary frustration.  Stick with HP, never buying another Epson product again.

If I could give this ZERO stars, I would.I purchased this trimmer for my wedding invites, as I screenprinted mine by hand.The very first pull of this blade wouldn't cut through my paper, dislodged the blade from the runner and started cutting into the plastic paper holder. It took me about 20 minutes to attempt to fix it, and at that point the blade was running on the metal strip it was supposed to cut beside.Eventually I fixed it, but I had to cut each invitation one by one, 200 sheets with five different cards that had to be cut one by one because this hunk of junk can't handle more than one sheet at a time. I would have been better off with an exacto blade and a ruler.None of the cut edges of the paper are sharp, they're all ragged. I am BEYOND disappointed in this product.If I could return it, I would, but unfortunately I ordered it a few months before I actually used it and have missed the return period.WOULD NOT RECOMMEND.

I learned cursive with a fountain pen so I'm no stranger to them. This one feels scratchy-exactly what I didn't want. I don't understand all the positive reviews. Plus I ordered medium nib and it writes as a fine point nib.  So just send me whatever the heck you want to, AGAIN.
The original ink cartridge failed to work.  I will update this review as I go thru the refills and if they fail to work too.

The bags and boards are good quality but the fit is so tight that there is not room to put both a comic and a board in the bag. Kinda ruins the whole purpose of ordering bags and boards. And I don't mean it's a tight fit; I mean the comic will NOT fit. I've used thousands of bags and boards before and I've never had this problem.The packaging also came ripped in multiple places and some of the boards had corner damage. Not terrible, but pretty frustrating.I'd give it one star, but at least I can use the bags until I get something new that actually works.
Does not stick well to wood. I usually don't leave bad reviews. Maybe I purchased the wrong product in order to do what I needed. Did not return it because I will eventually use it for a small craft.
Read the reviews! You need to upgrade the app to utilize all of its functions. Just buy the Rocket book!
It is so poorly constructed that the USB plug doesn't even fit on my laptop. I just read some other reviews and it seems to be a common issue. Have to return this. Such a waste of money and time.

I normally use the Pilot G2 .007 gel pen but all the reviews I read said how great this pen is.  Well I've a used several of them since I got it and I must say not impressed at all. Each pen I've used will either have very little ink when writing or a lot of ink when writing, there is no consistency. Maybe I got a bad batch or maybe this is how they are supposed to be. Either way I will return to using my Pilot G2.

I honestly had high hopes for this pen. I was pretty disappointed. It writes, but as soon as the tip of the pen touches the paper, you are greeted with an incredibly unpleasant sandy feeling, where it feels like you are writing on an abrasive pad or sandpaper. Maybe it was the 0.5 mm tip size I got, but it felt unreasonably scratchy. I’m giving this more than one star because it writes without too many problems, although there are some skips from time to time.

There's a reason ONE THIRD OF THE REVIEWS ON THIS PRINTER ARE ONE STAR.  THERE'S A REASON....ACTUALLY, SEVERAL REASONS.  Overall, it's a poorly designed piece of junk that does not perform reliably.  It's consistent, but unfortunately consistently lousy .Changing ink cartridges successfully has been a constant challenge.  It won't recognize replacement ink cartridges..Epson or clone...about half the time.  When working in a home office without other printers to turn to, that alone is reason to take a sledge hammer to this piece of junk.The default setting is for two sided printing.  I couldn't find how to change the default.  Called customer service, and through very broken English was told there was no way to change their arbitrary 2-sided default other than to manually uncheck 2-sided printing in the printer dialogue box MANUALLY FOR EVERY SINGLE DOCUMENT YOU WANT TO PRINT.  I found it hard to believe such a moronic process was the only option, so the following week I called back again with the same questions....how to set the default to one sided printing and was told the same answer I got on the prior call....in even harder to understand attempts at English language.I should have sent this loser back the first time it wouldn't recognize an Epson cartridge, which was the very first time a cartridge needed replacement....and almost every cartridge change since then.  In addition to the recognition problem, the gizmo that holds the ink cartridges is supposed to slide to the left when the machine is opened up, but it sometimes does and sometimes doesn't.  If it doesn't, it's very difficult to raise the lid over the cartridges as it's blocked by another part of the printer.  Did I mention lousy design??Bottom line:  steer clear of anything Epson.  Their poor excuse for customer service is only exceeded by the terrible design and poor quality of their products.

If you want a printer that prints poorly for a few months before it stops working completely than this is the printer for you. I've had two and they are worthless. One star is too many for this piece of junk!

OK product, but... the phone sits too flat in the charger (almost laying flat) which takes more space than standing up. Second, the menu options are not intuitive- hard to find Redial button, Flash button, or understand the "missed call" menu. There are so many engineers in Motorola working on awesome products, this one is not one of their star possessions.

I have avoided writing this review.  The first one arrived promptly and well packaged.  When I go around to setting it up, it went crunch, crunch, crunch and said ET phone home.Amazon was very prompt at sending a replacement.Figuring mass production has a few problems some times, I was disappointed but please with Amazon's usual great service.  Unfortunately, family health problems keep me focused on important things not Epson related.SO.... about 45 days later it was time to setup the Epson.  And Crunch, Crunch, Crunch..I got to call Epson customer service.  I really don't mind that we don't speak the same language, but a lousy phone connection is really not to be excused.  After many repeated question, Sherlock decided I had a hardware failure.  And I thought Epson had a hardware failure.  The replacement arrived in a few days, it appeared new but in plain packaging.  The did remove the temporary charge (full MSRP) from my credit card and it did make it through setup.The somewhat sad part of all this is it is a pretty decent printer.  Oh, it is as big as an ice chest but it prints ok.  I would have gotten about four stars (the printer driver is a little Kludgey)

I actually chose this chair for the rose gold color but it turned out to be a decent chair!  It's very pretty and the rose gold is perfect!  It's not super plush...it sits me completely upright and seems as if it will support proper posture.  There is no lumbar adjustment but I think it will be sufficient for me in my home office.  Shipping was fast and assembly was easy.  I am not sure on the longevity but I will update my review if it doesn't hold up to daily use.UPDATE: I have been using this chair for over a month now and it certainly is not meant for full-time use.  The height adjustment doesn't stay where it is set- you sink slowly over the course of the day. The lack of support means this is a good chair for a casual office but it you work full-time from home like I do- this chair won't cut it.

Unfortunately the handle broke (the metal simply bent until it no longer holds fast) after using it about 20 times. I am very disappointed that handle was made of such thing metal. Looking at other reviews I see this happens often.It works well but I would spend more money for a thicker more Durable product.

I have owned this printer for about 1 year. I have had LOTS of issues with it. Often, (usually when I am the busiest) the printer loses wifi connectivity with my computer and with my husband's tablet suggesting it's the printer rather than the device which I'm attempting to print from that is the problem. I then have to uninstall then re-install the printer. Usually this works but it is time consuming. My second issue is the cost of the ink cartridges which if I buy locally is around $50 for the set. The printer will not allow me to use anything but the Epson brand. Even when installing the Epson brand cartridges often the printer wont recognize them and continues to tell me to install more cartridges. Sometimes I have an impt work report to print and the printer just refuses to recognize the full cartridges or wont print one of the colors. I am writing this review as my only recourse to defuse my frustration. I purchased new cartridges @ $50  and couldnt get the printer to accept them, called tech support and told them the printer reads the cartridge as empty. He suggested I buy another set then call back. He had no idea what the problem could be and since Epson "assumes" it is operator error he did not offer a refund on the cartridges. So I would be paying $100 for a $89.99 printer with no guarantee it would print!! Well, so I decided to write this review instead.

The bad review is not for the quality of these Envelopes or Amazon. It is for the Ridiculous price that this particular size costs. Every other size is about 1/4 the price. It is probable because that these will take 1/4 fold cards that can be made with any printing software and computer printer to make all kinds of greeting cards. I'm sure that the card companies probably have something to do with this particular size Envelope being so overpriced because all the money being lost from people making their own cards. It is not Amazon with the bad price, but every where that these are sold, if you can even find this size, will be WAY OVER PRICED.

I use the public bus to go everywhere and I need a shopping cart to help with the heavier bags getting home.  This is a piece of junk!  As the other reviews stated, the instructions are non-existent (the pictures are not self-explanatory).  Thank goodness someone included the instructions in their review of this cart and I used those!! It took 30 minutes to assemble and 5 minutes to disassemble.The back axle for the big wheels had the hole drilled in the wrong place.  The back right wheel wobbled.  Because of this, the pin to keep the axle in place slid out.  The cart leans and doesn't open all the way as it should.  Mind you, this cart never left my living room.I immediately contacted Amazon Customer Service and was offered a replacement or an immediate refund.  I opted for the refund. The customer service representative was awesome!  UPS will arrive Monday to take this away (YAY!)If everything had worked, this would be an excellent cart--perfect height for me since I am 5'8" (it may be too tall if you are 5'4" or shorter).  It holds quite a bit and the wheels are hard plastic.I will look locally for a cart.  I guess I need to see the cart in person before making a purchase.

I wrote a positive review for this product 2 days after installing the cartridges however after 1 week the black colour cartridge was empty at 0%. I have hardly used the printer and probably printed 8 documents maximum. It was a big disappointment  . . .the black cartridge was probably almost empty upon arrival.Returned the product and got my refund.

I Read reviews stating that this could be a replacement for a carpenters pencil...NOT.It is not heavy duty, the lead is barely larger than a standard eversharp writing pencil, just a different shape. It is NOT heavy duty enough to stand up to a construction environment. immediately breaks off when marking wood or rough surface metal. Not at all what I expected from the reviews I read.If you want an eversharp type pencil to use as a Carpenter pencil on a construction job, I can only recommend theSwanson Tool CP216 Always Sharp Refillable as an option at this point in time.---  The Swanson is more expensive, and you might have trouble keeping up with it on the job, because it will be so popular, but it is definitely the tool for the job, if you can justify the cost.

I wish I had read the reviews before purchasing 2 of these cartridges.  It says they are full, but not getting any color.  It is the 1st time I don't have the paperwork to return the items.  Very disappointed.

I'd try to send this back, but it's hardly worth the trouble. But while the product itself is fine, the "4-strips" actually turns out to be TWO, half-width strips--saying "4-strips" infers you would have four complete velcro-like, stick-to-each-other strips. But of course each "strip" is useless without a mate to stick to, so "four" is really TWO. In addition, unlike the Scotch branded product this is derived from, these strips are half the normal width sold at Amazon, or brick-and-mortar stores.Since I cannot tell whether this was intentionally vague, I haven't given a one-star review. But the seller really needs to be more forthcoming, and provide more photographic information to prevent purchasers from feeling cheated.

I just went to use the black ink cartridges (2) that I ordered back in November of 2012. Both cartridges failed to pass the alignment check on my Lexmark printer. It asked me to remove the tape.  When I tried to print something in black, the page came out blank. On the side of the cartridges it has not for customer use and it looks like japanese writing. I will never order from this supplier again. I have always orderd through Amazon with no troubles in the past. I put my old cartidge back in and the printer works just fine.On review your purchase it states that I can't return the product because it's past the deadline for returns. Amazon needs to remove this seller from it's supplier list. Look at the list of complaints.
Not a good experience- my HP office jet J4680 keeps popping up error message and won't allow it to work - will not order again .  Would give a zero star rating but there isn't one .

I bought this for my wife. She liked the picture. It was badly tarnished when it came.  I polished it as she did not want to carry it due to the looks. That made it better but within a few weeks it was tranished again. It is also very light for a metal pen, the “click” mechanism is too weak so the point extends just from normal movement rolling around in her pocket book.  Two stars as the pen writes pretty well. For the money you can do better.

These are the worst sticky notes EVER!!  I don't normally take the time to write reviews but these things are driving me crazy.  I LOATHE them, we actually have to use a small piece of tape to keep them in place.  I will never buy an off brand of Post-It notes again.
These bags are only good for current comics.  None of my silver age fit into these bags.  Shame on me for not reading the negative reviews.  Shame on them for not understanding comics

I don't know how to rate this product.  The product seemed full of ink when installed, but the HP printer indicated a problem with all the cartridges.  I went through the initializing process and had the same results.  I will be honest in saying I have had this problem with other off market cartridges and HP printers.

This review is for the HandStands 55510 HandStands Add-A-Pad Wrist Cushion.I purchased two of these pads when I started having carpal tunnel symptoms in both of my hands, I work in IT and am always typing. These pads helped my symptoms a LOT, however they started leaking within a month or so. I'm always picking beads up off the floor and covering the hole with packaging tape which only lasts for a few days before it comes off and there are beads all over the floor again.These work great but have horrid quality issues. Unless you're good at sewing and don't mind patching these things very often, I'd avoid them.

Writes decently like all space pens, but the body's construction is poor. As other reviewers state, it will fall out of the cap and get lost after a few months of use. It's not long enough to be comfortable for larger hands. Also, when I twisted the body to look at how to replace the cartridge, the rubber grip twisted and oozed out some lubricant gel or something.

Amazon box was in great shape, for both shipments.  Although both shipments contained product boxes with previously used parts taped back up in a box that looked like it was thrown from a moving truck several times.  My first try there were (2) broken wheels.  So I returned the box to Amazon, who promptly shipped me a newly previously used product again!  This time the parts were wrong.  When putting this together there are 4 parts (corners with wheels).  The corners fit together where one side is larger than the other and fits into the other corner piece.  Both are then bolted together in (1) place.  This is not a sturdy design at all.  However, a drill and some extra bolts can solve this easily.My major problem with the second shipment is I was sent 3 of the same corner pieces which make this thing impossible to put together.  I say impossible, but I will make it work by drilling and adding bolts where I need to.This thing comes with some junk screw hardware so I will be drilling some extra holes for added support, and making this thing work for what I want.  I did not have time to wait for another junk shipment from this junk company.READ OTHER REVIEWS to get a clear picture you are rolling the dice on this purchase.

As I see with other reviews, our print is EXTREMELY light (unusable).  I have tried different things to see if it is fixable.  I put the old cartridge back in and it prints better than the new one. Because I bought it 60 days ago (knowing my printer was low and anticipating replacing it), it isn't returnable.  So I am out the cost of this USELESS cartridge.  Save yourself the trouble and pay a little more for a cartridge that works. I purchased from Green Apple Inc. but I see others selling this cartridge.  It did state NEW and was in HP sealed packing, but it definitely won't work.http://smile.amazon.com/gp/product/B00066ISE8?psc=1&redirect=true&ref_=od_aui_detailpages00
PRODUCT NOT AS DESCRIBED. I should have listened to the other negative reviews. I received the flat edged envelope when I clearly ordered the euro flap envelope. Extremely disappointed.
Shorter than original. Erasers are yellowed compared to the one that came in the package. Should have read the reviews.  Not sure what I was thinking paying $14 for eraser refills and non returnable.

I didn’t read the reviews nor look at the name very closely. I saw the beautiful array of 6 colorful tweezers and a price of 8.49. It is a 2 pack. I’m legit disappointed and P.Oed. ITS A 2 pack. ITS A TRAP.

This is the biggest POS I have ever owned.  I bought it to replace a reliable printer that was wired.  It has not worked properly since I got it about a year ago.  I used the reviews and etc., but I have not had ONE print job that was done the first time.  Just in case you are thinking I'm some kind of technophobe, I have a degree in robotics.  From not reading one of three computers that were grouped with it, to paper jams, to unnecessary wasting of ink, this is just a horrible, horrible printer.  I have finally put it out of my misery.  The most satisfying thing about it was the way it came apart when I threw it out the window.  BEWARE!!!!

Looks good. But the ink is too liquidity and just goes through the nozzle on to the paper when i was printing. I asked them before why is it just dripping out of the cartridge before. This has a good review so dont know. Try it if it works for you.

If I could give it zero stars I would. I hate this printer. It makes everything more complicated than it need to be. It burns through ink faster than any printer I have seen. Epson's website makes it very difficult to even email them for help, the "submit" button I was supposed to press was no where to be found. The fact that it uses colored ink to print b&w is absolutely ridiculous! The fact that I have to replace a colored ink cartridge after a ridiculously short printing life or my printer wont work is even more ridiculous. Its damn near criminal! Epson will never get another dime of mine again, ever!

The color cartridge throws a code every time. I saw on the reviews that some people had that problem and hoped that I wouldn’t get one of the “bad” ones. Well I did and now it’s useless. Spend a little more and get something that will actually be useable

I ordered 100 bags and 100 boards as advertised. It seems so simple. The bags were fine (hence, the reason for the second star) but the boards were a very big problem. Why? ...because the package only contained 89 boards! There is really no excuse for this as even seven year old children can count to a hundred. This is how you run a business? As a customer, it's like opening a wrapped burger from a restaurant only to find someone else has already taken a bite. I have ordered these same BCW products in the past in bulk at 2000ct (via another website) and no package came up short.  What has happened to you guys? 89/100 ...really? Additionally, those boards had some residue which resulted in small spot stains on 16 of the boards. What a shame. The good thing is that this serves as a very nice test of this product source. Obviously, there is no need to make another 2000ct purchase here. I would have been even more furious. Remember: It's about principle.

Materials are very cheap. Not a good value for the price of $30. The wood is thin and cheap. The entire board is held together by 6 staples and hopes and dreams. The back is a thin piece of cardboard. The cardboard in the back is so thin, as a matter of fact - the slightest pierce of a thumbtack (what it's meant to do) pierces through the back, hitting the wall you've decided to hang it on. Absolutely awful. Would rate this zero stars if it was possible.

Update 10/29/15We've had this almost a year now. How I wish I could go back in time. I had a Canon Pixma printer before I bought this Espon. Wow I wish I'd stuck with that company. Instead I was swayed by some review site to get this Epson. It's LOUDER by far, sometimes seems like it's going to throw itself off the table. I'll admit, it's faster than the Canon was. But the Epson ink is insanely expensive and runs out all the time even though we are extremely light users. Just had to order another $36 black cartridge. And they make it really hard to use remanufactured ones, which the Canon didn't seem to mind. My adice, Don't buy it.=====This isn't a printer, it's an ink selling machine.We don't print much. And we are told to change ink all the time. There's a little blinking light, bright and very annoying, and little alarms telling you to change ink long before you actually need to. The ink is expensive, unless you buy the off label brands, which Epson has kindly done everything it can to make impossible to use in its machines.I would much MUCH rather pay $20, $40, $60 more for the damned printer to NOT have to hassle with this every three weeks. I have to cover the little blinking light to work (since it blinks basically all the time, telling you to buy ink). I had a Cannon before that used ink much more slowly and wasn't such a dick about pushing you to buy... plus accepted off label brands. I hate these guys and will never buy another Epson product as a result of this. No company should create a product with such an emphasis on manipulating the customer into buying overprices accessories.

I've had this printer since July 2014. At first, it was great. I like the AIO feature & was happily printing, scanning, and copying for months. I have a Canon photo printer that prints great, but the ink can get really expensive. I sacrificed high quality printing for an every day printer that seemed to receive good reviews. However, the longevity of this printer is the problem. After a while, the print quality started failing. Prints were streaked, almost like a bad photo copier. I went through repeated head cleaning, but every nozzle check showed missing lines. I thought it might be a bad ink cartridge. I burned through almost 2 black XL cartridges trying to clean the print head. I only use Epson inks, so this is a costly venture. It wasn't worth it. Scanning (with and without the document feeder) and sending to the cloud is a great feature. I would not recommend this printer because failing print and copy quality after three years of light to moderate use is unacceptable.
Broke after less than a year of use, like many of the other reviews warned. Worked awesome up until then!

Originally I gave this product more credit. But after using it only twice I want to give it 0 stars. It lost 2 wheels in the store I was stopping. And I don't have any other way to transport my items. So not only did I lose my money on this crap product I lost everything I had just shopped for. If you're looking at this one don't waste your money you'll regret it.

It was just on my keychain and I didn't use it much and one day it just fell a part.  I am waiting for the response from the seller but for now I have to give it a low rating because it broke on me and I haven't treated it roughly what so ever.

It has been great so far. Love the large paper tray. Update: Today is September 23, 2016 so after about 16 months the printer died. Not very happy with getting such a short life span out of it. I guess we will have to go back to HP. Changing the rating to one star.
It's very hard to open and close, and there is no English manual for the safe. I should listen other reviewers complains and not purchase this one.

Hi,I hate writing bad reviews, I really do, but it needs to be said.Please read this company's policies THOROUGHLY before you do business with them.  I've found out the hard way that they don't support cancellations if, say, you're wandering around in a Best Buy not even an hour later for work related items, and find this exact same product for not only two dollars cheaper than their asking price, but obviously, in a far more convenient format (just so you know, I got on my phone and attempted to cancel my order right that minute.  At that point, less than an hour had passed since I placed my order).  They haven't even thought about shipping it yet, but I can't cancel my order.  Why?  Their rep said that the whole process is automated and therefore can't be stopped.  Words.. I don't have words to describe how fishy that sounds.So.  Now I have to wait for it to be shipped to me.  Who knows when?  Then I have to process a return because they don't do cancellations.  Do they pay for this return?  Oh... no.  You do.  For all you people out there looking for a convenient solution to your ink depletion problem, look no further than Best Buy.  Seriously.  No hassle, get what you want right then for $11 and some change (with shipping costs, this is actually a lot cheaper.  I also live in SF these days, which means if it's cheaper in stores here, it might be even cheaper at your local store).Again, I hate being that jerk, but please save yourself the headache and shop elsewhere.Original message I received from them after I sent my cancellation request:"Our apologies, but once Amazon has released an order to us we are unable to stop, edit, or to cancel it. We have totally automated the order process for Amazon orders and they are downloaded and processed before we can retrieve them to cancel them. We suggest that you contact us immediately after you receive the shipment to process the return.".

This is without a doubt, the slowest printer I have ever tried.  I just replaced an Epson WF-630 which is by far speedier than this one.  I wish Amazon allowed a video review because I would love to show just how slow it is.  A full page color print takes over a minute to print so I don't know out from where Epson pulled that 10 pages per minute statistic but it is a blatant lie!  Yes it is easy to use but everything moves slowly and it makes horrible noises while its pulling it self together to get ready for a print job.If speed is what you are looking for, this isn't it.  If you have time to kill and love to watch an inanimate object struggle to drag its ass out of bed, you'll love it!

The media could not be loaded.                      Smells like fish! I almost threw up because the smell hit me so hard. I read the reviews and I was expecting a smell but no like this. I cleaned it with Pledge lemon and now it smells like lemon fish. Other than the smell its okay. I dont like the place for the cell phone. I thought it was going to be cool but my phone doesn't fit into it. I have a 17inch laptop and it fits when flat. Doesn't leave much room for a mouse if you are going to have one. I knew my laptop wasn't going to fit, but I thought it looked so nice I didn't mind. I am unsure if I am going to keep this or not. Its nice looking,and its sturdy enough. the side drawer is tiny. Other than batteries I dont know what it can be used for. It flies open everything you move the desk. The fan is pretty much silent, which is nice.

I can't exactly rate the item, but I just wanted to make sure other buyers need to be aware that Amazon thinks that this adapter is the one that works with the KD 8000. It does not. I called to return the wrong adapter and the lady directed me to the "correct" adapter. It was the same one they sent! You need to call the manufacturer to get it: Here is the direct number to Myweigh: 602.253.2214

When I first saw these I was very excited that the customer could use the same envelope to return payment.  The envelope has a second adhesive strip to reseal the same envelope.There were a couple of issues that occurred:Envelope #1 ~ After sealing the envelope I realized the address didn't show through the window correctly.  I would have preferred the envelope didn't have any windows - so I could print on the envelope directly and the customer wouldn't have issue aligning the address to the window.Envelope #2 ~ The glue came completely; it wouldn't seal.Envelope #3 ~ Was sent out and has yet to be received by the intended recipient.  I will update the review once I get feedback.

Really thin and breaks super easily. So it can be really frustrating if you’re wrapping a lot of stuff. Just buy the more expensive stuff.  :(

UPDATE:I finally gave up on this chair mat. Even with a professional heat gun, heating it up then weighing it down on the floor, it returns to a rolled position if taken off the floor and curls at the edges when on the floor after it cools. I don't know how they managed to convince this mat that its natural state is "curled up in a useless roll" but that's how it is. I ended up filing for a return/refund on Amazon. DO NOT recommend buying this item.ORIGINAL REVIEW:Don't make the mistake I did and think that you don't need to check reviews for something as simple as a chair mat. Apparently, it's completely possible for a company to mess up such a basic product! It has a bit of a smell, though that seemed to go away after laying it out in the sun for a few hours, but that's not the real problem.It came so tightly rolled that it required the help of another person just to unbox the thing and ATTEMPT to lay it flat. But it will not lay flat, no matter what I do. Heat? Nope. Pressure? As soon as that's removed, it rolls back up again. It also isn't particularly secure on the carpeting, because the little pegs on the bottom are short and rounded - they don't GRIP the carpeting.Right now, I'm holding it down with some heavy items on all the edges, hoping to train this thing to stop rolling, but I highly doubt that'll work. If it doesn't, I might have to return this failure of a mat. Otherwise, I might relegate it to the hard floor in the workshop. It isn't useful for carpet, which I bought it for. HIGHLY disappointed.

This distinctive Moleskine ballpoint won't roll off the table! Its 1mm black ballpoint refill holds a lot of ink and writes with the smoothness of silk. It was designed to neatly clip onto the edge of a notebook.The pen has a satisfying click. Alas, it could be highly stealable.However, since I've needed a refill, to my dismay it cannot be changed because Moleskine sealed their pen at manufacturing stage. Therefore the pen had to be disposed of: Another piece of plastic to harm  our planet. I won't be buying again, especially because its price went up!2 Stars for unrefillability.

Doesn't work. My HL-2380DW printer would never detect the new cartridge.Update: At the suggestion of another reviewer, I went into the printer settings admin and switched toner replace from stop to continue and now it works. Bumped it up to two stars because it works but was still a pain in the ass.
These curl really bad even when I'm careful and fell off of the bottom of my computer screen the same day I put them on. The only reason they get two stars is I love the colors.

When I ordered it did not list it as refurbished only until it shipped did I know that I was buying a used phone. So I thought whatever and hooked them up and you cannot hear the caller at all they are junk and hears the kicker I read a review some guy wrote about the same issues not being able to hear…Did they just not take into consideration that it’s broke and send it on to the next person cause that is what seems to be happening. I wanted to like this printer. It does everything I need a printer to do and it is economical when it comes to ink. I read numerous reviews prior to purchase. My previous printer was an Epson Stylus NX115. Photos looked great and documents looked great. I had no real problems with it other than it was an ink sucker. When it finally began having issues after getting old, I tossed it and purchased the WF-3620. From day I had problems. For one, just about any photo you print will feed from the feeder instead of the rear feed slot. This is not just a matter of settings. I attempted to contact Epson customer service about this issue a few times and never once received a response. So when I want to print a 4x6 photo, I must remove the whole feeder cassette, remove the up to 250 sheets of plain white paper, and place my photo paper in the cassette. Then I reinstall the cassette and tell it I added 4x6 photo paper. Trying to do this to the rear feeder will just give an error telling you that you asking it to print on the wrong size paper and it will spit out your blank sheet of photo paper and print on plain white paper. Why the rear feeder exists, I have no clue, as I have been unsuccessful in using it in any sort of useful manner.Assuming I am not computer literate and this is just user error, you may still be tempted to press on. "It won't be like that for me" you might say. "I know how to configure these things properly". This would have been my reaction (I am one of the IT people at my work and it is my job to configure new workstations, printers, etc, while the more experienced people handle the server, access lists, etc).Print quality for photos is passable but not as good as the Stylus was. It is faster and has all the new "cloud" features, allowing you to upload scans directly to dropbox or print from some other geographic area (why people need to do this I havent quite figured out). Documents never looked real great. They always were a bit blurry and obviously not from a laser printer. Definitely not professional quality. After a few months the document printing looked so bad I was willing to spend all day aligning and cleaning heads. Finally after numerous (hours) attempts, I gave up and completely changed out the ink cartridges even though the ones I had were only about 3 weeks old. The print head had developed a smear. No setting would fix it. I tried to trick it by telling it I was using thicker paper and that didn't work either.I then went to where I bought it (Staples) and looked for a new printer. I had no intention of buying another 3620. When the salesman came by I asked about printers and eventually the story came out. He asked where I bought it. I said here.He says bring it in. I say its out of warranty and used. He says bring it in and Ill swap it out. SO I did.The replacement has not developed a smear but it does not print professional quality documents even on its finest setting. Mixed photos and text leave obvious lines in the photos and color bands. Text not dark and sharp. Using only Epson ink at first did not make it better. I switched to a different brand. Everything exactly the same. It's not a bad printer. I wouldn't call it bad. It just isn't real good.,And I'm still waiting for Epson customer service to respond to my emails from 04/2015......I'll edit if I hear from them but don't hold your breath. I uploaded a sample print on Normal quality setting black and white. Notice the banding on the photos.

I ordered the large red shopping cart with no basket and somehow managed to receive an extra large black shopping cart with a basket.I left a negative review on the seller's page and immediately received an e-mail from the seller begging to remove the feedback because it causes bad business and being Christmas is around the corner he didn't need that. Offered to refund my money or send the correct item.I told him I'd like the correct item. He verified which one I actually ordered and I removed the feedback. I got my shipment in the mail and it is the EXACT cart I shipped back to him! Although this time it's all scuffed up!Unfortunately Amazon won't let me repost negative feedback so I'm letting you all know here!Info about the actual cart. Hard as heck to assemble and it is a two person job. Never got to use it because I didn't get the right one!UPDATE: Ended up keeping the wrong cart. The cart's wheels kept falling off because the parts keeping them on kept falling off. I eventually lost the parts and just threw the whole thing in the garbage. Terrible product. Spend more money and get a good one.

I ordered this to replace another that I've had for a couple years. This obviously works a little better, as it has a new blade. I actually really like the wire, it makes cutting a lot more accurate than my old one. I can cut two-three pages at a time and it looks great, but more than that, it starts to look a little like an older blade made the cutting, with the slightly fuzzy edges. Picture paper worked well, but I'd really like to find one that has crisp, clean edges. I might need to go up in price range, and I would say for the price this is probably as good as it gets.UPDATE: Just one day after leaving the previous review, I cut two more sheets of paper, individually, and the paper tore on the second sheet. I've only cut about twenty sheets of 20 lb. paper with this, and two or three sheets of photo paper. Not enough to dull a titanium blade this badly. Also, the last half inch or so is curved instead of straight. No idea what happened in between, but, it now makes my old one look great. I'll be returning as I haven't had this a complete week yet. It's a ridiculously short amount of time for a paper trimmer to wear out...
Everyone of the markers were out of ink when they arrived. Had to throw them away. Only gave a 1 review because it wouldn’t let me finish review without selecting something. Should be a zero

This is the first time I think I must write this review. I bought this ink cartridge combination because I saw it is among the best sellers. But the fact is that they cannot be used at all. My printer is Canon MX492, which is designed for 245XL and 246XL. But these so-called "245/246XL" cartridges only generates "Error 1401: check ink". The Stop light flashed and the printer did not work. I tried to restart the printer several times, but it still did not work. I don't know how this product becomes good seller. I'd like to tell any other people who are interested in new cartridges that don't waste your time and money here.

This certainly seems like it might be a great cart, but I had no opportunity to find out because of the way it was packed. After opening Amazons absurdly large and poorly taped box, fighting through layers of torn cardboard and paper, I was confronted by the largest amount of tape I've ever sen. This tape, clear and sticky, was difficult to remove, and the little that I diod get off the product left a thick, sticky residue behind. It would've taken a few hours to clean the cart, since the tape was on every surface. (see photos) What a thoughtless way to ruin a perfectly serviceable product. And yes, it does stink too. Needless to say, I returned it. I'm not sure who has enough time and will to dedicate a whole day to cleaning of a new product, but I sure think that it ought to arrive clean.  Also, I've never seen a worse packing job from Amazon. I had to use an entire roll of packing tape to get the package back into some approximation of a box to send this thing back. I can only guess that this item used to be delivered in a more reasonable condition, given the many favorable reviews, but as of May 2011, you get an unholy, stinking mess for your money. Stay away.

I found two faults which wasted a lot of expensively printed paper - and then I looked at the critical reviews. I should have looked before ordering but I mistakenly thought that at the high price it should be the best.I confirm the design defects which have been reported by other reviewers:1) This stapler is not suitable for a brochure comprising two or three sheets of paper which are to be folded to create a 4 or 8 page booklet. The reason for this is that there is always one leg of the staple which gets folded too far, pushing it back through so that it protrudes through the spine of the booklet. If you don't mind being restricted to producing booklets with more than 12 pages then this first defect may or may not apply. However, by the time I had wasted hours printing and destroying brochures due to the staplers ineptness I had no motivation to experiment with more sheets to see how many it needed before it did what it was supposed to do.2) The guide does not hold it's position. I notice one other reviewer saying that they had to resort to gumming it up with blue-tac to stop it doing this.Either 1) or 2) on their own mean that this product is not fit for purpose.

I wish I could give this no stars, and I never comment/review. I would like ALL my money back. These cards are listed as 5 x7 which technically, end to end, they are. But I had to cut one of my 5x7 prints ALL the way down and STILL it would not slide easily into the card. When finally I ripped it, accidentally, I grew more frustrated and ripped the frame right off - revealing the flaw. The glue is so heavily, and unequally applied to the edges that there is no actual size of artwork that will fit properly. The bottom edge had hugely uneven glue, making even the trimmed card wrestle to fit. These are the WORST frame cards I have ever purchased...and they're marketed as premium. No. Stay away. You will end up either wrecking your photo or destroying the card in the process of trying to fit it in.

Terrible, terrible, I thought this should be a good choice based on the 1000+ review record, but I AM WRONG!!!The print quality is really poor , and only last one week ,there cames an error and STOP WOKING !

I was suckered into buying this by some online article raving about them. At the time I didn't know about influencers earning  commissions on sold items. This item prominently displays such a 'review' on this site, also raving about how this is no ordinary pencil sharpener but SOMETHING SPECIAL YOU NEED.No you don't need this. It is an ordinary pencil sharpener, nothing special whatsoever. The very top positive review claims its SPECIAL because its round shape prevents breakage, as long as you know as much as he does about utilizing its SPECIAL ROUNDNESS. No, it doesn't prevent breakage, no matter how you turn the device, the color pencils still break. Thats because Prismacolor pencils are known to break easily and this sharpener is no better then any other. Also, over time the blades get dull, and the duller they get the more breakage happens. I reached a point where I thought, oh look the sharpener blades have screws in them, I'll just remove them, and put in fresh blades,  like I can do with any Dollar store sharpener. But no, the screws don't come out. Who makes things with non removable screws??? Sorry but there is a kind of cynicism on the part of the manufacturer here to make it look like they can be taken out and replaced, when they  cannot, and when most other sharpeners the screws come out. In addition they have the metal sharpener itself fixed in place by the screws, so its non removable too. So now I have to toss the whole thing into the trash, adding to the waste stream. Many artists care about the environment and try to reduce adding plastic to the garbage. The manufacturer couldn't care less by making it impossible to avoid. I cannot support such a manufacturer, and the sharpener even when new was nothing special.Don't buy overhyped junk.

I was excited after I read all the reviews, but my reports appeared faded - not dark black.  Even the old (HP) cartridge that was running low with the telltale light streak did a better job. (My printer is an HP 2055dn).  I guess I'll send it back and bite the bullet on the expensive one that works.  Bummer
The reason that I give it this rating is because the toner didn't work in my printer. I guess you get what you pay for.

I rarely write reviews but I'd like you to save your money and avoid purchasing this printer. I've only had it since Nov 2016 and it died on me today (Feb 1/2017) with the random "Epson Error 0X9a". Common to this printer.  Only used it for light printing and scanning and the heads would need to be cleaned often. I've mainly owned Canon printers and will replace this with Canon.

I didn't read the reviews until after I had already received this, and then I just couldn't stop laughing. Small? Yes. Cute? Maybe. High quality? You've got to be kidding....have you never actually seen real leather in your life? good luck finding the animal that this came from, maybe they live out in the jungle with all those wild polyesters and naugaboos...this is a cheap, semi plastic lookic, chemically scented wad of bound paper, carefully stamped ever so lovingly with some totally gibberish nonsensical grammatically incorrect quote. if you have a 7 year old who can't read very well and likes to scribble it would be perfectly fine gift. or a gag gift. but a high quality journal for sharing all of your travels thoughts? Please, somebody tell me where the line is that you can sign up to get paid to write good reviews for crappy products.....if you raved about this you've got to know the answer

I purchased this product based on all the reviews and boy what a mistake. There is nothing that makes Mr. Pen better then Wite Out. The tape is thinner so you have to use more to totally cover the correction. Then tape often doesn’t dispense 100%. Only half will come out requiring another layer. Then when you write on it, even when applied totally flat and several minutes after application, the tape will get balled up on the pen and tear off. It’s possible that the problem is me. Maybe I am heavy handed. It seems like this tape has worked well for others. I will keep using it because I have seven but I won’t purchase again. On the plus side, the product is fairly inexpensive and you do get a lot of them.

I bought this thing because it was on the recommended list by The Wirecutter, and it was 4+ stars here on Amazon at the time.I'm sure I've had worse printers, but I can't remember them. I bought this thing three years ago. I've always had print quality issues with it. Never used aftermarket, always OEM ink. Always fighting with the stupid print quality and lines. Heck, I probably burned through an entire set of cartridges just printing test pages and alignment pages. It seems to burn through the ink faster than it should when it would work. When I'm VPN'ed into another network for whatever reason it breaks printing on this guy until I disconnect and then the queued job will go through. Other printers don't have this issue.I'm about ready to take a sledgehammer to it right now because I'm trying to get the driver installed on my second laptop just so I can scan some invoices to email to a client and I've been fighting with the stupid installer for an hour now. First it detects the printer, but then can't "contact" it. I finally realize it's probably my VPN. Get off of that and now it detects just fine, but during the install wants to update the firmware. Fine. Only it fails for whatever reason. Then it just won't continue finishing installing the printer and scan driver.I will never ever shop an Epson again. This thing is such a piece of $#!7...

I have ordered this product for work multiple times and decided to order for my home office.  I loved my first order, however my husband had to work from home and ended up spilling a whole cup of coffee on it. Loved the first one, so I decided to place a reorder of the same item. My first order was in December of 2020 and this order was from February 2021.  I have attached the following pictures.  The ones with the wood background are the old pad, the ones with plastic are the one I just received ant the last one with the black background is the image on the item in amazon.  As you can see the product is not the same.  The paper in the mat itself was just fine and seemed like it was the same thickness as the first order.  However, the corners appearance and quality is way different.  The first one definitely  had more contrast, was thinker (padded) and as you can see on the back pictures a complete secure back.  The 2nd one is more of a dull brown, no contrast at all, and the back of the corners are the edges flopped over and poorly glued.  They do not have an image of the back on the product listing in amazon, however as you can see from the front image the color and contrast is definitely there.  I am not one to write bad reviews but was so shocked by the difference in look and quality.  Same price, same description, same pictures on listing but definitely not the same product at all.

I have never given anything a 1 star review but I feel compelled to do so for this pencil sharpener!  I even suspect it's a fake Derwent.  It worked for about a month (I sharpen a pencil maybe 4 times a week), then it has the problem of the holder not working.  The part where it holds the pencil in for sharpening snaps back as soon as I turn the sharpening handle.  The pencil is then no longer held in place.  I tried to manually push the pencil in while turning the sharpening handle, and that does not work either.I bought the product, when it stopped working I did an exchange.  A new one came and it worked for a while.  Then just as my return window closed it stopped working, giving me the same problems as the old one!!!  It is very frustrating.I suggest avoiding this pencil sharpener.

Bought this printer less than a year ago based on the raving reviews online. In summary, when the printer is working it is a pretty good one. Prints relatively fast, easy to setup, and pictures come out fairly nicely. It is relatively large but I was concerned about the longevity of the product since it appeared to be well ummm, cheaply made. Well, after several months, an error message 0X10-Scanning error started to pop up and on start up the things shakes like crazy. It tells you to turn off the computer and turn back on for the fix just to get the same thing happening again. Called technical support and they determined it was a hardware issue like I originally thought. So basically my fears came to fruition. It appears another reviewer and probably more wrote about a similar problem. Epson said they would replace it upon receiving the defective one since it is under warranty but I'm trying to get a full refund and buy something else that will last. Luckily I kept my old cannon printer which has lasted over 1 year while I transition. Would not recommend and would not trust an epson printer again.

Just what I was looking for. Unfortunately it arrived damaged. I did not notice the damage before attempting to assemble it. After reading the other reviews, I returned it for full credit.  Rather sad performance on the companies part, as it seems to be the size many people are looking for.

I was really excited about this pen at first...even though I did notice it runs out of ink quickly. The issue is that I must leave my bookbag in my car because I leave for school right after work. One day last week I wrote my assignment (wasn't to be turned in, just needed it to work with my group so I didn't type it up). I went to grab my papers and most of the ink had disappeared :( I then read the package that the pen shouldn't be left in the heat because it is heat sensitive...but I hadn't read that before and didn't think it would mean that my ink would disappear for good from the paper! I didn't even put the two together at first because I was drawn to the erasable fact and never really read the names of pens..so "friction" is really true to the name! I think the pen is ok, but if you need to leave any documents in your car for any reason this is not a good product. So that leads to the two-star review...that fact brings it down from ok.

Have bought these pens for more than a decade as they are my favorite both for work and home.  Recently I have had both green and blue extra-fine point pens work for a couple of weeks and then the ball at the tip of the pen falls out, leaving the pen unusable with most of the ink remaining in the barrel.  I complained to Pilot and received a standard response. After my complaint I had 3 more pens fail.  I don't normally write reviews, but this failure is disappointing and frustrating.

My first original order on September 3 arrived promptly & was exactly what I wanted. I loved them so much I ordered two more sets! Those pens were not at all what I ordered! There were 5 gel pens in the second package, and included several different colored inks! I tried to order them one more time, & again I got the wrong pens! My kiddos were happy to use them, so I did not return the pens. I want to order them one more time, but to say I am a bit gun shy would be an understatement, but someone at work “borrowed” both of them & they are now gone! The few hours I did get to use them I loved them! They wrote smoothly & my daughter & I are big Wonder Woman fans! Because of all the problems in getting the correct pen, I am only giving this two stars.
I had read several reviews and thought this blackboard seemed pretty good.  It doesn't have a lower lip or tray to rest chalk on, and is almost impossible to write on or erase.

Shipped in a box for best protection however box was mishandled, smoosed, and had one corner dented with a small hole. The boards were slightly curved but not bad enough to return and wasn't attributed to mishandling. Some of the boards corners had slight indentations.  Was able to straighten out most of the curve by placing boards underneath a heavy book. They straighten out quicker by gently bending by hand individually or 5 at a time. The measurements were accurate as described on Amazon. If the bags were slightly wider and the boards completetly straight I'd up my rating to 4 because not all of the bags were clear.  Holding each bag up to a light I saw some imperfections. None of the boards were chemically treated evenly on the one side. When looking at chemical side up and tilted so when the light shined on it could see the chemical visible and it wasn't evenly distributed on the board and was uneven with patches-blotches. You would never notice just by casually looking at the bags and boards.The boards did fit the bags with space to put the comic with a little wiggle room and will accomodate  regular comics but not silver.  I will use these bags and boards for regular common comics.The price was only $22 and a couple of days later see the price went up to $37.Even though Amazon backs their products including 3rd parties, has excellent customer service, and has my back for a return and refund due to no fault of my own I plan to to purchase comic book bags and boards at my comic book store so I'll see exactly what I'm getting and have no surprises!!

I bought this chair in 2019 and it has been SO uncomfortable ever since I sat in the chair for the first time longer than 1 hour. Terrible! Wish I would of read reviews first. Missing parts.

It is my first time I am giving something less than 4 stars and there are several reasons for that.First of all, be careful about the screw cap. I was playing with the pen with the excitement of the nice thing I got for the price and the cap got stuck. How is it possible? Let me explain. Anytime you force to open the cap, the screw for the cartridge part turns open. So there was no way to open the cap unless you try something like claw like tool. Or you just pull it hard and it is no longer a screw cap. I am effectively using it as a regular clip cap right now.However, I accept that was mostly me being novice. The real problem was the writing mechanism. I bought the FP with medium nib(I don`t even know if you have any other option). But if you have the option certainly buy a fine nib or sth. That is because, it literally wastes the ink. I have heard it being a wet pen but I was not expecting it to such degree. I bought jinhao cartridges along with this pen and I finished a cartridge with like every 4-5 journal-large pages. I don`t think it is something specific to the pen I had, it is most probably the character of the pen. Medium nib combined with the wet style; you will not be using the pen for a long session.Actually it does not matter the ink is enough or not, bcs you will not be writing long sessions with this pen, anyway. It is heaviest thing I have written with so far and that includes large chalks I was using while I was in school. It is really tiring to write. Trust me, you will have extra muscle on the arm(not hand) that you write with.You can always ask why I am complaining so much for a pen that I paid so little. Actually the two stars it is getting is because I am being fair to the price. Whatever the price is, don`t waste your money if you are actually planning to write with. Because you will not. The only fair reason to buy this pen might be to break it apart so you can get associated yourself with the structure of the fountain pen.

The first dispenser was fine but the second got snarled around inside and there was no way to fix it, even though I tried. Maybe I will have better luck with the rest of the box, if so I will update this review.  But so far it is 50% wastage.5/2021  Well, it's almost 2 years later, and I'm still struggling with these things.  I switched over to a high quality more expensive brand for a while just to save my sanity, then went back to try to use these again.  They are dismal.  The tape comes off the end very easily and you have to struggle to get it back on.  The ones I have perform very poorly, very consistently.  I truly don't understand how any other reviewers could honestly say these are consistently high performers.  Mine have been anything but.  Will not purchase again.
I had previously done a review but I am here to update it.It fell apart, blade falls out all the time. It's not worth it.

None of the pens in the box I received has a pen cap that can be attached securely to the non-writing end of the pen. This is a very basic expectation for a stick pen and, as I can see no difference between the pens I received and the pens I use at work, I assume I received a box that shouldn't have made it past quality control. I refuse to spend even a second of my life keeping track of pen caps so I will be returning these. Note: if it weren't for the pen cap issue, I would have given these pens four stars. Five stars is just too much for a cheap pen. That said, these pens hold up very well to everyday use. I find that the ball point of lots of cheap fine point pens will stop working before the ink runs out. It could be that I press down too hard when I write but, regardless, I don't recall ever ruining a fine point Pilot pen.

First off I have had this printer since April 15th 2021. I bought it as an open box printer - like new. It looked new. It came with everything.Problem 1. IT HAS NOT.Problem 2. Its SUPER slow. No matter whether you print or copy its SLOW! VERY SLOW!Problem 3. You cannot copy or scan 2 sided documents automatically from the document feeder.Problem 4. The Bluetooth interface drops the job even when I am close by.Problem 5. When you chose best quality it goes HYPER-SLOW. When you use standard quality the document is washed out. I have done head cleaning g routines many times with no or little improvement.I liked the description of the printer. I liked the reviews. Unfortunately its just not working and I have had to go next door to do all my printing and copying.This machine took over one hour to print 25 pages (using best quality.) I have stopped using it.

This printer has been a NIGHTMARE! I'm a digital artist with a long history with Epson printers (I own a monster Epson printer for printing 5' color prints) and I bought this for my med student partner who needs a reliable, high-capacity, duplex color printer that can print fine anatomical detail. This seemed to be the printer (it even got a great review on wirecutter.com!).The first one I bought had to be returned. Right out of the box it would make a horrible noise then give an error message. Turns out the rail for the print head mechanism was bent. Sent it back and received another. It was great for 2 months and about 500 pages before the print heads became irretrievably clogged. Wasted at least one full set of high capacity cartridges trying to clear the clogs (this is all you have for clogged print heads, Epson?! Really?!?!). Junked. Total waste of time and money. Can't return it either. My next printer will be a different brand of color laser. I'm done with Epson and inkjets and the ridiculously overpriced inksets. If you need to print more than a couple of pages a week, DON'T BUY THIS PRINTER!!

Like a couple of other people have mentioned, these are too small to be called #0. We sell DVDs and have purchased tens of thousands of bubble mailers from various manufacturers. A DVD will barely fit in these. When we ship a DVD, we include literature with a rubber band around it. It's like torture getting these in there.And again like another reviewer said, the bubbles are very flat and there just isn't that much protection.The adhesive is another problem. It is not evenly distributed and there are often streaks or even blank areas which has required us to use tape to make sure they stay shut.To sum it up, they're pretty much useless.
