As a perpetually single, 35 year old man with a bad habit of moving all over the country every couple of years, I have never seen a reason to buy a full sized washer. When my trust Magic Chef portable washer have it on me after 4 years, I was looking for a reasonably priced alternative to a full size unit. This one advertised a .2 cu ft lower capacity for a reasonable price, so I thought I would try it out. I am now regretting that decision.The first thing I noticed was the size is significantly smaller. The advertised space is about 90% of my old washer, but I struggle to fit a weeks worth of shirts in it, while I never had a problem with my old machine. I have concerns about what would happen if I tried to put a comforter in this one.The second thing I noticed was the smell. It gives off a very industrial smell whenever I use it. I hope that this will go away in time, and I haven't noticed this small on my clothes, but it makes my laundry room stink whenever I use it.The last big thing I have noticed is the spin cycle is so weak, it is almost useless. I have taken things out, and they are still dripping wet. So wet that I can wring them out with little effort. I was accustomed to my old machine, where things came out very dry. At the end, on that machine, the spin cycle stopped working, and things came out of it only a little wetter then they come out of this one. You can see how much water is left after a normal cycle in the picture. It is a little hard to see, but there is about a a cup of water in the drum on the right. Edit 10/12/2022 I was able to solve this problem by putting the machine on top of a rack. Apparently the water drainage pump is not strong enough to lift the drain water to a standard laundry hookup height, so putting it on the rack has solved that problem. Clothes still come out wetter then I would like, but better. This is a fatal flaw in my opinion, considering I had to spend an additional $80 for a sturdy enough rack on which to put this. I really wish I had spent that extra $80 on a better machine. Dropping a three star rating to a one star.Ultimately, in another year or so I will hopefully be moving overseas for work, so this will do until then. But I will be glad to turn my back on it when that time comes.

So far, I have to rate one star.  I just received it and all looks good.  One big problem, it won't lock back up.  The latch won't complete the needed turn to lock it completely and release the key.  I have called Honeywell customer support and was quickly and rudely transferred to a voice mail that said we will call you back.  5 hours later I have not been called back.  So I called them again.  Nothing they can do except let me leave another message.  Honeywell has one of the worst customer service I have ever seen.  If the product worked, 5 stars.

I bought these when they were thirty dollars each. It looks cool and can be stacked because they have notches that keep them in place.However it's fairly easy to pull these apart accidentally because when they're assembled they're just snapped in together and they're made from fairly cheap plastic.They have multiple slots for hard plastic dividers, but only come with one. They're not even sealed.There's openings on the top and two of the four sides.I didn't have too much trouble assembling this using their YouTube video, but I can see how someone could accidentally break the plastic doing so.I have to give this one star because of the absurd amount of good reviews... You're better off with a box from Walmart.

I purchased after reading favorable reviews.  I was excited at the inexpensive price. The ink flow is spotty at best. I loaded it first and it didn’t have good ink flow.  I cleaned it and tried a different ink with the same results. The converter is a slide mechanism a only fills the cartridge 3/4 full.  I give it good marks for appearance but it really needs to function properly.
A piece of 8.5x11 paper doesn't lay flat on the bottom. It's not a huge deal but a real stupid design flaw so worth 1 star.
Several reviews mentioned good customer support but I can't find any contact information. Q & A also says this product is wi-fi compatible.  Need some contact info please and thank you.

After reading all the reviews, I decided to purchase this unit. What a mistake! It doesn't hardly shred 2 sheets of paper! It looks like it try's to shred with the pattern across the sheet.We will be returning this unit, and finding one that really crosscuts.

ALL THE PENS WILL NOT WRITE!!! It’s scratchy and the ink wears thin. I’m so so so disappointed to pay 20$ for these pens expecting the world and having all 14 brand new pens not work period!! Even my cheap 50 cent ball points worked better than these pens because at least ink would come out of the damn pen!!!!!I gave these pens my best benefit of doubt, I tried writing with it for pages waiting for the ink to flow better but despite being a brand new pen with full ink, all of them wrote scratchy and would at some points just stop having ink come out of them.I’m going to try to get my money back, will improve my rating if customer service goes well, I’ll let you all know.

Received box of staples loose in larger box with piece of unattached wrapping material floating around in there. Staple box was open, several clips of staples missing. Really, Amazon? The 2 stars are for Amazon, not Senco.
The headline for this review pretty much sums it up.

The foam inserts do not fit Morgan silver dollars. You have to cut up other inserts to make the foam fit snugly, as another reviewer suggested. Aesthetically this is not appealing. The box also has Asian characters on it that were not noted in the picture when I went to purchase it. I would not recommend.

If I had known that this binder would be full of dust and covered in scratches and tears, I would not have purchased it. It still functions, which is why I am giving it 2 stars as opposed to 1. I love Avery heavy-duty binders and the only reason I purchased this online as opposed to in the store as usual is the color. I do not have time to send it back for a replacement, so I'm stuck with it. Buyer beware, you may not get the item you're expecting.

This product is being sold as an "Epson Projector Lamp", which it is not. It is a lamp made by someone else for an Epson projector. Epson makes their own lamps, which is a primary reason I bought the Epson projector instead of a Panasonic. I had two different Panasonic projectors prior to this Epson and grew tired of the extremely high cost of replacing the lamp. I have no idea how this projector lamp will perform. The lamp which came new with the projector failed after 240 hours, so it is possible this one could actually outlast the genuine Epson lamp. That is not my objection. My objection is selling something in a misleading manner, using the product description to deceive people into believing this is an Epson product. It is not. My one star rating is based on that deception, not on actual performance, for which I have nothing to report at this point in time but will update in a few months (or less, who knows) when appropriate. Whether this vendor will still be around at that time is another unknown, and another reason to buy a genuine Epson product.UPDATE 04-05-13: Shortly after posting this review I was contacted by the seller, who offered a substantial discount if I would remove this poor review. I refused. In my opinion, selling this lamp as "Epson" is false and misleading and I will not take part in misleading others. The last projecter bulb I used, a genuine Epson purchased through an authorized Epson dealer, just failed at 1750 hours. This bulb is definitely not as bright as that one, and flickers when on anything less than the highest brightness setting. I do not recommend this bulb or doing business with this seller.Update 08-08-14: Despite a definite flicker, which has continued since it was new, this bulb has actually outlasted my last bulb, which was a genuine Epson product. This projector is used nearly every day, two to four hours per day. While not as bright as the original Epson bulb, it has significantly outlasted that bulb and at less than half the price of the genuine bulb, it may be worth the risk to some for the savings. However, a bulb explosion can do damage to your projector. Because this bulb has exceeded by expectations in terms of its life, I am revising my rating to two stars. Marketing a product in a misleading manner cost this product two stars, and the flicker and reduced brightness over the original Epson bulb cost it the final star.

Useless!Dispenser blade is so dull it won’t cut off cheap, thin tape, much less the thicker tape it comes with.While packing fo our move, it became a running joke to stick someone else with the “black tape thing”.I guess that is my review;  this product is a joke.

i receive this item nice and prompt which was good but the reason i gave it a star which it doesn't deserved is because of it's color.... this was suppose to be scented and there is no smell at all.... sad i really like the colors i had to give it away because i hate returning things
Cannot, for the life of us, get this pen to work! I know I am the one writing the review but feel free to respond with tips!

The product description says there are 12 boxes for a total of 144 clips which is a lie. I only received one box of 12 clips. I should’ve read all of the reviews before the purchase, will be returning right away.

The comfort of these pens is great, but every single time I pick one up, I have to scribble a bit to get it working. I store upright with the ink flow going down.  I am on my last few of a case of them and glad to move on to Papermate.  I only gave a 2 star because of the comfort. Otherwise, the rating would be less than one star.  Learned my lesson on trying to save a few bucks!

Pay attention to all the one stars.  I saw them and rolled the dice only to get a frame that was broken. It's true.  The frame is most likely to arrive broken based on all the feedback. Mine did.  And, it's a pain to return.  Don't do it.

Let me explain why 1 star:  this is not a bad ink, but it does NOT do what it says it will do.  If it was just advertised as a regular ink, with no anti-feather/anti-bleed guarantee, I'd give maybe 4 stars.  But its not.  The name of the ink is "X-Feather", so you'd expected it not to feather, right?  That's the whole purpose of the ink.  But it does.  I experienced feathering and bleed-through on cheap and mid-grade (but still inexpensive) paper with the noodler's black X-Feather.  AND with Noodler's bulletproof American Eel.  NOT using a flex nib, or any other hardware that may make bleeding worse.  Using the pilot metropolitan with fine nib (which is very well made and was brand-new, so not a pen problem).  Not to be a grumpy ink hater (but kind of because I AM grumpy about this), but I don't really understand everyone's hype about the Noodler's X-Feather.  All of my experience with it has still been plenty feathery with substantial bleed-through on cheap paper.  Disappointed in Noodlers:(  does anyone have any recommendations for non-feather, non-bleed ink that doesn't harm pens and require tons of cleaning/maintenance?

I just printed the first 10+ pages using this toner and there are horizontal streaks printed in the left side of the margin. I wasn't anticipating this at all given the stellar reviews coming from everyone. I'll update this review if this issue goes away, but so far the streaks keep coming back!

I'm very, very disappointed in these gel pens. They are very scratchy, don't write smooth and aren't vivid. My set came with 2 greens of the same color. I bought these based on the reviews and they were a Lightening Deal, so the price was right. I'm disappointed. I'd return them, but after shipping cost, the refund is small. I wouldn't buy these.However, the case they came in is awesome.

My unit stunk for a few days. There was a noticeable difference in brightness and color saturation and a line through the whole screen that you could notice during dark scenes. If I left a movie paused, it would burn an image in farely quickly and last for about an hour. My projector made a bit of noise while it was in as well that I don't remember hearing with the OEM bulb. Oh, and it died in 4 months. I would have given it 1 star but it did its job better than I expected an inexpensive bulb would do
Total waste of money. I bought because of so many reviews but looks like most reviews are paid one. Toal waste of money.

Need a star rating lower than 1, how about negative numbers?Finally needed to install the new cartridges. Totally screwed up. Tried to clean them, realign them and anything else I could think of to try. Went to store, purchased new Epson cartridges, reset the density and did a test copy. Works fine now. Save your money and don't scrimp on remanufactured. Not an endorsement for Epson but a thumbs down for these.

After reading so many great reviews for this table, maybe my expectation were too high. The first table? Was in pieces by the time i received it, but i notified the seller and was sent a better packaged one.I liked the light feature, though i rarely used it because i didn't use the table for reading or eating in the dark. The mouse area was really nice and i even liked the part where my netbook stood. I was able to stand my netbook as high as i wished, without having it fall on me. The legs height was really perfect for me. I recommend for those who use it on their beds to lower the legs whenever you get down from the bed or trying to find a comfortable position. Otherwise it will send your things flying to the bed or floor.The novelty of course came to an end just weeks after i bought it. When i lifted the area where i was going to place my netbook cracked almost in half. As a girl, it would have been quite amusing, had i not needed the table at that moment to work on a paper. It was not like i did anything different or used too much force (I have never won any arm-wrestling against another girl).In the end, if you do not mind that the material may come apart any day you use it, i say go for it. The price is very good and everything else works just fine. I was able to find a better one, so this one was thrown out.

I purchased this since it was an upright, looked nice, and reviews seemed fair. The first one I received was defective.  The shavings tray did not fit perfectly into the base and it would not sharpen properly because of it. It acted like it had a short. I sent it back for a replacement.  The second one I received did not have this exact problem, but after using to sharpen one day and emptying the tray, did the same thing.  The pencil sharpening capablility (point) according to my 10 year old, "sucked" as did the amount of time used to try to get a point. My husband has a Panasonic and it rocks.  I went cheaper and now have the hastle.  Don't buy this sharpener!

$9 is a lot for something that looks like it came from the dollar store. It is missing one arm which is used to keep the box closed so its useless to us. Not even sure I want to waste my time with return. Should have read all the reviews.

I normally never write reviews even though I rely on them heavily before purchasing an item. I was hoping with this item it was mostly user error. I was wrong. I followed the instructions to the letter so it is NOT user error. A previous review stated that this is like the window cling decorations you can buy. It may STICK the same way but it is by far a WAY cheaper material. It's like a cheap black trash bag. You have to be exceedingly careful when separating the "perforated" sheets because it tears EXTREMELY easily. A previous post was also correct about it letting light in at the edges. I tried to take a previous reviewers advice and cut a little extra to compensate...but it wont stick fully to the window unless all edges are ON the actual window...so you HAVE to cut it a little short. I cleaned my windows very thoroughly and cut all my pieces ahead of time. Since I cut just a little extra I had to remove the piece from the window and cut off the extra since it wouldn't work unless the whole piece was on the window. BIG mistake. This crap will absolutely NOT stick more than one time. I have no idea how people use this more than once. It's on the windows for now (thank goodness for ten sheets) but there's light peeking in everywhere. I'm sure my kids will mess with it and it will fall off...and when it does I will be going back to the aluminum foil method. MUCH less costly and MUCH more effective. Total waste of $60+ dollars.

Reading recent negative reviews makes me regret wasting my money. Replaced the original with this hunk of garbage. It was dimmer right out of the package so I cleaned the projector. Re-seated the bulb, still dim. We figured it was just part of saving a few $100 bucks... a few dozen hours later, it died. Hurray! My lack of faith in people was substantiated! Nothing like a good "I told you so" from my wife...Either the other reviews are canned, or these are seriously just a gamble and some people get lucky. I am headed to the BenQ site right now to purchase a new one, though. Save yourself the headache and frustration!

I am fairly experienced with fabric transfer sheets. I got the first one I tried to work fine, and then after that nada. Read all the reviews and tried many suggestions. Ruined so many shirts. Killed my deadlines for completing project. No thanks, Avery. Oh, and how about putting the information on which side of the transfer paper you print on in the instructions. Or even if you somehow forget to do that, how about adding that information onto your website at some point. Just a concept.

One side of the whiteboard had a gouge and rubble the entire height of the board. Contacted manufacturer, as per instructions. No reply whatsoever!!! Has me concerned about the credibility of the company, but I ordered a replacement through amazon. Will update review when it arrives.

DID WORK AT ALL!!!! WASTED 10 TEST SHEETS TRYING TO TEST THIS ON MUGS. IT MAY WORK ON SHIRTS BUT DID NOT WORK ON MUG SUBLIMATION. I NOTICED SEVERAL OTHER NEGATIVE REVIEWS WERE FOR THE SAME ISSUE. I A WASTED MONEY ON THIS PAPER AND SUPPLIES, VERY FRUSTRATING!!!

Similar experiences with what others have already commented on - I am not giving the printer a 1 star because if did perform very well for about 2 years.  But afterwards, the quality of the printing developed numerous lines and smudges first in the color printing and now in black ink / text printing.  This did  problem did not improve with the recommended online Epson maintenance suggestions.  You also cannot access the printhead because of the printer design.Most frustrating really is that the Epson Customer Service Center required me to go through their online recommendations of printhead cleaning X 3 AGAIN even though it was completed recently and they wouldn't even provide additional options for management until after this was done.  So I wasted more ink for the printhead cleaning with the final conclusion of "Hmm...needs to be repaired" from the agent before be provided the information on the closest Epson Customer Service Center or a 15% discount for a new Epson printer.This was my first Epson printer based on recommendations.  It did work well for two years.  But at the end, this was the most I've every paid for an all-in-one printer and am not happy with the price paid for how short of a period of time it has lasted before needing servicing.  What I've read, replacing the printhead (which is what I expect will be the problem) can be upwards to half the cost of a new printer so at this point, a new printer it will be.

My yellow ran out and I have only replaced that cartridge so far. Saw some good reviews online and thought I would try them out and so much cheaper that I thought it was worth a try. Unfortunately all of our Christmas letters have a yellow blotch on the left side. Could cover it up by using colored paper. Have 2 more colors running low and don’t know if I want to try my remaining cartridges or buck up and buy Canons again. Would not recommend.

What a waste of money!  I thought something was wrong with my photo printer, but after reading some of the reviews, I realized that the problem is the inferior quality of the card stock.  The printed colors  are very muted, and I had to use a paper cutter to get a sharp edge because the cards wouldn't separate completely.  I'm very dissatisfied and disappointed in Avery trying to cut corners and save money by having the card stock made in Mexico.  There is no comparison to the quality of the original note cards that were made in the USA.

I actually really like the layout and design of this planner. Perfect size/weight, it opens nicely and lays flat, lots of extra room for to-do's and notes... I'm not a fan of the "law of attraction" aspect of it, so I don't use the habit making check lists or goal planner portions (logo on the front is also super dumb). Again though - exactly what I want in terms of calendar design.SUPER POOR QUALITY. On day one the elastic band that holds the planner closed broke and the binding is clearly falling apart. I read this in other reviews before buying, but hoped mine would be different. Nope.Average of two stars, both due to the great layout/design. Zero for quality. Like it enough to bear with it until it completely falls apart, but might affect purchasing it in future years if they don't "up" the quality.

After having a chance to use the cartridges for about a month, I have to revise my initial review. After printing a few photos one day on my HP PhotoJet Pro 8100 the color cartridges started streaking at the top and bottom of the pictures. I ran the print head cleaning cycle several times to no avail. I replaced  FUZOO cartridges with new HP cartridges, again ran the print head cleaning several times and still had the streaking problem. I am retired from the Navy and local school district having worked in the capacity of an electronic/computer tech and have had plenty of experience with many types of printers, especially HP. I have never seen this type of printer problem where head cleaning or new cartridges wouldn't fix the problem. I purchased a new HP printer and HP cartridges to finally solve the problem.

I like to purchase cartridges so I have them when ink runs out.  I opened both black 902XL cartridges I had purchased in August and neither one was accepted by the printer.When I looked up my order so I could review them at the site, up came a dog with a we're sorry message.  So I am posting this here.

This is a very heavy safe, which is fine.But I ignored the cautions of other reviewers about moisture inside.I put about 100 of those tiny packets that are supposed to absorb moisture.After 2 years, the documents were smelly, and damp.  The glue on the envelopes were stuck to the papers. Two more years and I do not know what they would be like.I guess maybe you should open it often and let it air out.So I tossed this item out.Too bad.

Pen did not match up with the review of the product looks and feels like a fake.  This purchase takes a significant amount of trust away from this site. Amazon needs to a better screening of its offered products.  Very disappointed will this experience!!!!

I was home when the delivery was made so I grabbed it quickly. Set was supposed to include a box and with two sets being included, it meant two boxes. There were no boxes and the dividers do not look like two sets. I have not opened the package yet since I plan to return it unless a second package comes in the next day with the missing boxes. If they come, I'll write a revised review.

The other reviews are accurate - it DOES pick up pet hair and lint, but really not as effectively as a tape roller. It's not that sticky, so it misses things and you have to roll it back and forth several times. You also have to rinse it off and dry it frequently during use. To get the pet hair off my couch, I had to rinse it at least 7 times and I still had hairs left over, and my cat doesn't shed nearly as much as others. The product photos are definitely not accurate - there's no way it could pick up that type of thick pet dander and leave the surface below completely clean like it shows. That's blatant false advertising. It's really just not that effective, but I guess it's something you could have laying around if you just needed to take a quick swipe of something minor. The Evercare Giant Roll is really the big winner in this category.

I’m super stoked about this journal and it really was a good deal. I wanted to try something in this series of planners and this one is absolutely fabulous! Hands down, the ABSOLUTE BEST planner going imho 😇 .. however, as evidenced in the photos the first “undated month” sheet was not cut very well. This is TOTALLY NOT the sellers fault .  Although it didn’t come with the protective box, it was in the plastic wrap. Furthermore, the piece of paper was folded inside the book (see pic 1) .. I would’ve totally give this. 10/5 literally. This is a fantastic idea! Genius, really! The binding has the perfect amount of tautness and just very sturdy. This speaks of its quality. The cover feels like a super soft silicone and the teal color is fantabulous! I definitely didn’t mind paying the price but totally wish that had been disclosed to my seller and then myself. I honestly never leave less than 4 stars , mostly 5’s, and though I feel terrible about it, I do hope that people will read the review and understand there may be a few flaws but it’s undoubtedly worth the buy! Shipping was exactly what I paid for so yea, overall ecstatic to use this and appreciate the great product:)

I was completely dissatisified with this ink cartridge product, and in fact, removed it after trying to use it twice.  At first, I thought there was something wrong with the printer.  I ran diagnostics, and nothing was found, although it said the cartridge was defective.  I went out and purchased another refilled cartridge at an office supply, and had no problems with the it at all.  I would never buy another from this provider, and would not recommend anyone else doing so...this is the first time I have had problems using Amazon's recommendations. (This item was not a refill, by the way, but new.)NO STARS FOR A RATING, although review would not accept that with the review.
I would give them zero stars. All three pens do not work at all. No ink supplied from barrel in order to write. DO NOT BUY!

This product was damaged when it arrived . Do not buy!  The dry erase side had completely bubbled and was starting to peel. When tested with the dry erase marker it worked but left a dark residue and didn't erase all the way. The only thing going for it was the magnet...which is not what I bought it for. I had to give it at least one star because Amazon requires it but I would not have given it the one star even, it was such a poorly crafted product!

I purchased Neat Receipts for Mac to use with my Quicken.  I was very excited to be able to enter all my receipts with a scanner.  After spending 8 hours scanning receipts, I was finally ready to export them to Quicken.  When I exported them, they did not save to a file that could be imported to Quicken.  I spent another 6 hours trying to trouble shoot what the problem was.  Finally a found a small blurb on the support site that said Neat Receipts was no longer compatible with Quicken for Mac.  All the advertisements including the box said that it worked with Quicken.  When I emailed NeatWorks they told me that if I wanted to use Quicken, I would have to downgrade to Quicken 10.  They also told me that at this time, they have no plans to correct the software to work with other versions of Quicken.  Needless to say, I will be returning this, and I hope my review has stopped others from purchasing it.If I could have given it "0" stars, I would have!!

First of all when I opened the package, was highly disappointing. It was way to small, from what the description showed, it was supposed to be bigger than a cellphone, in which it wasn’t. Secondly, the charm is missing, so there’s a tab just dangling from the book. On the other hand, the quality of the book is good, hence the two stars. The pic is with a gold jewelry gift box to scale the size of the journal.

I was excited to use this lead with my Uni Kuru Toga pencils which I have been using for the past couple years and I was shocked to notice that the lead doesn't quite fit perfectly. My pencil uses 0.5mm lead and this lead is 0.5mm yet the lead is just a tiny too skinny. If I put even a tiny bit of pressure it starts to slowly go back in. I thought maybe it was just this one piece of lead so I used another and same problem. And it continued on.I also thought maybe my pencil somehow was broken in between last using and so I tried using my new lead in my other Uni Kuru Toga pencil but it was having the same problem. I then proceeded to test another set of 0.5mm lead that I had and both pencils worked perfectly fine. I must have gotten a bad batch and the lack of consistency is very disappointing especially considering all the other good reviews for this product.

I only gave 1 star because that's the lowest I can give.  These cartridges were supposed to be compatible with my Epson WF-2520 printer but the printer won't even recognize that they're loaded.  The cartridges are a close match to the original except for the ink outlet.  What a rip!

I ordered this and received 2 packs of stickers instead. Even worse, the packages didn't even have the same set of emojis in them. One had 4 good sheets of popular faces, animals, etc. The other package was all useless symbols and ZERO faces or animals. Don't waste your money on this.EDIT 2016/11/22: It appears the seller has started sending magnets now and not stickers; however, I am leaving my review as is because I received stickers when I purchased this in 2015.

Are all lthese great reviews written by low wage workers in 3rd world countries or what??  Just a piece of flimsy unstable garbage impossible to asssemble lousy instructions HATE it.(plus not having a youtube assembly video whould be AGAINST THE LAW) LOL

I bought these to hang some light weight things in my RV and they absolutely do not work. I read reviews from other purchasers  and bought this product based on those reviews. I’m extremely disappointed as these wasn’t cheap!

This is a great concept and mostly works as described. It's not perfect for me for two reasons. First, it will not suction to our bathroom wall. I assume that's because the wall isn't entirely smooth and, in fairness to Elmer's, the package says in small print this item may fall if attached to an uneven surface (it won't suction at all on our wall).  Second, it would be more useful if the cup was a little deeper.  My goal was to reduce bathroom countertop clutter, and I had planned on using this holder for 3 tubes of creams that are part of my teen son's acne regimen in order to get them off the counter, but still leave them in plain view (because if stored in a cabinet he won't think use them). Two tubes fit but the third is rounded and won't fit, so there's no point using it for that purpose. But what does work well is that this attaches firmly to the mirrored medicine cabinet and holds my son's toothbrush and toothpaste perfectly, so it's functional as it gets those items off the countertop. And I really appreciate that the plastic cup as well as the suction portion remove easily for washing. It's an okay product with a variety of possible uses- though it would be more practical and helpful if it was just a little deeper. I give it 3 stars.Update: I've knocked a star off because this gizmo ultimately wasn't functional enough to bother with it. The toothbrush holder idea I had wasn't as good as I thought as it gets scummy too fast, and I was constantly washing it. For holding pencils or pens, there is nowhere to adhere it to so that it was actually helpful. I put it away and it will end up in the recycle bin eventually.

Let me start by saying I am very proficient in my computer skills and office applications. These were miserable to work with. You can't download a template, you have to do it online. That would not have been an issue per se, but it did NOT save my template and colors. When I tried to mail merge my guest list to the template, it worked correctly....the first time. But I realized that I had made a mistake on my list. I corrected it and started my mail merge over. This time and the next 3 times, it wrote the field name "FIRST NAME" on my tags, plus my guests last name. I had to go in and manually type in the first name of everyone. I printed them to PDF to make sure everything stayed correct, then printed them to plain paper and held them up to the light with the blank tags in front. They looked like they aligned, but the center section of my design printed as a text box and as a different shade of blue than the rest, and it was all the same color on the screen. Then I printed them onto the sheets, it was only then that I could see the perforations and that my tags did not align to the template. They came out terrible and the texture of the paper made the color even worse looking. So why did i give it two stars instead of one?  Because I can't make it 1.5, and that 1/2 is because the perforations were well done as was the tag hole, the card stock had a decent weight to them, and the template designs look nice. Plus it drove me to have several glasses of wine, and they were delicious.  The picture below is what is was SUPPOSED to look like. This did NOT come out that way.(I whited out the persons name)

Works just as well as the OEM HP high dollar toners. (FALSE statement....see below)Revision:  I reviewed too early. I did not actually use this particular toner until January 2017 (it was a different kind of toner cartridge I was using in the meanwhile, and I inadvertently confused it with this particular toner...sorry!) Anyways, we did have problems with this cartridge. Printed pages were extremely uneven and much too light to even read. I made sure that the cartridge was properly shaken multiple times and I carefully installed the cartridge myself. I just could not get it to work properly, so I had to switch it out with a different brand of cartridge. I cannot say that if I got another cartridge just like this one that it wouldn't work great, but apparently I received a lemon. It did NOT work even close to as well as the "high dollar" OEM HP toners that I have been forced to use in the past.

I was a little more than disappointed to see the tags almost all gone from my daughter new clothes at the hospital today! Of the 4 tags I ironed on exactly as instructed, only 1 tag remained halfway on! This was apx 10 days after taking the time to apply them high heat cotton setting, warmed up iron as directed. They were snug with NO peeling the day I did them. I wasted my time $ and effort on them as they didn’t even make it through one single wash!! The only reason I gave them 2 stars is because I can baste stitch them onto the rest of the clothes I buy for her from now on since I received so many. I would’ve done that to begin with had I known. She just turned 16 with autism and feels devastated to see  her clothes worn by others and/or disappear and I thought this was the answer. It was NOT! Now the whole pile of 16th bday clothes will be up for grabs on laundry day. I’ll spend the time to stitch them on instead of sending them back so I’ll give it a star for that.
I did not have luck with this ink. Purchased because of good reviews and my prints are showing streaky just as bad as they were when the ink was low

Never believe Amazon Reviews as solid leads to quality, it's their way of earning greater sales, follow instinct of those who have actually used reviewed items. I am a Prime member, but soon will not be after almost 3 years of waste.  Do the math it's not worth it unless used at least twice a month, and some of their items like this Uni-Ball Signo 207, for a Uni-Ball pen it's second place to Promorx writing instrumemts, neither is a quality reliable pen.  I purchased both in need of pens, but next time I will buy a pack of crayons at least they are reliable without skipping.The highest quality and reliability I have found in any writing instrument is by Pilot 0.7mm; I use a lot of pens in my work, and Pilot has been the best around since 80's.  35 years should prove Pilot means quality, years before any Amazon or Google was ever around; so, actual users are the ones to depend upon for your decision making process, not an online company.  Like said, if you think Amazon cares about you, I learnt they don't, it's my $$$.

I have used a retail pricing gun for 15 years so I know how to use these. I still read the instructions to be sure though. Every time I squeeze the trigger the needle flies out across the room. I nearly punched a hole in my leather sofa with it. I changed out the needle and reloaded it with the Tag strips. When the needle didn't fly out the gun with jam and just sort of eat up the plastic tags. I would give this zero stars if I could. Absolutely horrible product. Don't take a chance like I did. Doubt if I've printed 20 copies. 2 of the cartridges read as defective and the printer will no longer operate using them. Wish I could give negative five stars.So sorry that I tried to save money by ordering these.
I bought these product but when I received these product 9 pens are available i.e. one pen is missing or retail store give me 9 pens.So, I give this type of rating.

In trying to make a pen that can also be used effectively for self defense, the manufacturer falls short.  The MTech Xtreme Tactical Pen is not a good writing instrument, which other reviews confirm, and it would not make a great defensive weapon either.  The crown is not sharp and would barely annoy a potential attacker.  You could do more damage with your fingers, and the tip end (with the point retracted) would be less effective than a standard BIC pen.  Moreover, trying to unscrew the device to expose the tip for writing usually results in the device separating with the threads becoming exposed (as noted by another reviewer).  Then you have to screw the parts together again and begin the process anew.  There are much better tactical pens available from Amazon including the two S & W varieties.
You only get one. It said be first to review and so didn't realise there were reviews on....YOU only get ONE of these not all like the picture. VERY misleading. Total price rip off.
I was somewhat disappointed. After reading all the reviews before I ordered I was expecting something more classy. It's pretty but so not worth $90!
I normally do not review many products but I just inserted this new cartridge into my HP laser printer and over half the page is smeared with black.

Colors are way too light. I can barely see the yellow on my test runs.  I thought maybe run a few times to get it all flowing but all colors seem to fade even more. Disappointed in purchase.EDIT: The supplier (MIROO) sent me another two cartridges but I had the same results. Thanks but I could not print with these as the ink was just too light.  The company kept bugging me to update this review which was annoying. I went and bought original Canon ink and they worked as advertised. Of course I am out the money spent on this ink from MIROO.Still disappointed in purchase and here is the edit you wanted MIROO.EDIT 2: (6 months later) Now they want me to delete this review so they can give me a refund claiming she will lose her job if I don't.EDIT 3: The product still sucks although they did refund the money.

I have to say I'm really disappointed. My purpose behind purchasing an A5 travelers notebook was to carry a journal and a watercolor sketchbook at the same time (I learned for the first time that you can get watercolor inserts on amazon and etsy). I was deciding between this book and one from another company, ultimately choosing this one because I know September Leather is supposed to be a decent company. I don't think I'll be able to purchase from them again because what I received, while still usable, must be a used product.The cover is extremely distressed with scratches and marking throughout, as well as the spine showing clear wear from bending. The little piece of leather around the band is extremely distressed as well. One of the three notebooks included had an unusual stain and a black, charcoal-like deposit between the first page and the cover. I ended up ripping out that first page and in turn lost the back page.On top of this, the cover is not really meant for A5 notebooks. The watercolor insert I purchased is a true A5 size (5.8x8.3 inches) however it sticks out of the cover if I have it installed with the 2 pre-installed notebooks. I should have read the reviews prior to purchasing, otherwise I would have known that "A5" refers to the size of the actual cover, not the size of the books it holds. This is rather misleading and further confirmed by the fact that the 3 notebooks inserted are not a true A5 size; the horizontal edge measurement is slightly shorter, possibly around 5.5in rather than 5.8in. Therefore, in order to use my appropriately sized watercolor insert without it being exposed, I have to remove one of the notebooks and only use a 2 notebook system. Luckily for me, I only really need 2 notebooks as my Hobonichi Techo Weeks serves as my planner/journal.Overall, I'm not too happy with this purchase. Is it usable? Absolutely. But if you're a huge notebook/journal fan like myself and have a particular love of leather journals, there are certain things you want to experience for yourself. You want every scratch on your leather to be from your own hands and actions. You want to develop that lovely, aged patina yourself. You want the binding to be weathered as a sign of your frequent use, not someone else's. Receiving a notebook in this condition is a bit disheartening because I'm thinking about all the wonderful things that I am missing out on because of my notebook's current state. I can't even take the time to return it because I desperately needed my cover for my watercolor insert. So this will have to do for now until I have the opportunity to replace it. All I can say now is that this is the last I purchase a September Leather item, unless I receive evidence that I will not be disappointed again.

This pencil works great... for the  first piece of lead.  I have 2 of these and they both stopped working after getting to the end of their first piece of lead. No both are useless.I will try buying more to see if I get a better batch.  If they work like everyone else claims they do then I will change my review.

If I could give a negative star, I would. We've had two of these sharpeners sent to us and have had to return both. They don't work. It's not that they don't sharpen well, it's that they don't even run. We tried the electric outlet, the sharpener gives one "whirr" and stops. We tried batteries. No motor action at all. It's as though the power pack in the electric adapter isn't strong enough to run the internal motor. Batteries can't run it either.I'd like to be able to charge the company for my time. It takes time out of my day to prepare the package for shipping and taking it to the post office.

I am very disappointed in this item.  It is flimsy and my laptop slides off even though I added a grip pad.  I did read the other reviews but I can only agree with the negative ones. A regular bed tray or lap pad would have worked much better. I advise you to read all the reviews carefully before buying this. The plastic is cheap and will break easily and the desk portion doesn't tilt at any suitable angle for using while sitting or in bed (and your laptop will slide off the side). A waste of money.

I read the reviews and understood people were not impressed with the quality of the pads.  I figured how bad can it be, it is just paper and printing.The ink is incomplete and faded.  It was as if they were running out of ink when they printed it.  The borders are uneven as if they did not register the printing to the edge of the paper.  The glue at the top of the page is uneven and the pages tear or have an uneven edge when removed from the pad.These pads are supposed to be for engineering work requiring precisions.  Not worth the ink they were printed with.

The calendar is nicely designed and works perfectly as a desk calendar. Our rating is based on the fact that my 10 year old was upset and disappointed that Hanukkah was left off the calendar when it includes so many other holidays including Christmas and Kwanzaa.it includes many other days including St. Nicholas, Cyber Monday and National Guard Birthday. It oils be nice to be more inclusive when the holidays are one of the things highlighted in the description.

For the cost, I thought this would be a bit nicer of a notebook. I was not expecting some flimsy cardboard folder attached to a 50ish-page small wire-bound stack of pages. I’ll use it, since it is already here, but I will not purchase again. I would have been better off just buying something from Meade or 5-Star.

Was shopping for a new metal pad for my M65 as I go through the 30$ corsair one every 30-60 days.Saw ALUMIC with nice reviews and that it is scratch resistant (M65 mouse creates tons of scratches).Well, it was not scratch resistant. After about 45 days, now the center of my pad feels all flat while the edges still glides the mouse around.Keep in mind that I also purchased a brand new M65 to replace my old one and that I used NEW MOUSE on this NEW PAD.Guess I'm on a hunt for a new pad again. My aiming getting worse with the flat level of the mouse as the smoothness is all good even spending 30minutes to clean the pad up.**I have also uploaded a picture of its current state. You can see from left (edge) to right (center) the fresh grittiness to scratched up flatness
This isn't what I expected the cover is paper back and the ink was so light! I'm sad because this was a Christmas gift I I could give 0 stars I would
The ink was all over everything.  It got on me, my desk everywhere as I opened them up.  Terrible product.  If I could give less than one star I could have.  Awful product!!!!!!
It's a dud, doesn't work at all. Wasted my money. I've never given a bad review in the 10 years that I've been an Amazon customer, well this is the first. I'm highly disappointed.

This is a lousy tagging gun.  It doesn't work.  It jams.  I though,  because it had so many good review, it had to work...NOT!  I even ordered different attachments from another company and it didn't work.

My initial review was positive, but after using these claim forms, I have found many to have dark red blotches of ink on the lower right back side of the paper.  I was able to use some of those for billing.  However, now that I've had them longer, the unused ones are bleeding through onto the claim form next to it (which may have been unblemished as not all were) and therefore rendered them unusable.  I've never had this problem with any claim forms from other sources in the past and would not order from this company again.

I've used this to frame your typical poster of this size and the frame simply falls apart with time. As the weeks pass, the poster slips further and further down until bottom and side pieces of the frame let loose and fall off. I've had to take the poster out and put it back in, and it happens repeatedly. Since originally writing this review, the frame has fallen apart yet again and broke on the ground. If you have the same experience I'm having, you'll have to glue or tape the corners to keep it all together.I haven't had this issue with any other size frame of the same style. Perhaps it's just the weight of the bigger poster, but I think it's reasonable to expect a poster frame of any size to properly hold the poster it is intended for. I wouldn't recommend this unless you're content with taping it together.

I had previously bought two of these and loved them.  I needed more so I purchased 2 more of them.  I only gave it a 2 rating because of the carelessness of whoever packed the product.  There were two boxes but ONE lid!!!  I'd really love to have the other lid but I'm not going through the hassle of returning it just for a missing lid.

well, if i would have received the entire product I am sure i would rate the product better the metal bars that connect the two ends together that stabilize the unit weren't in the package.. therefor making it useless. Please send me the connector bars.

Very disappointed in this product.  It's description says that it is old travel picture postcards and the pictures show photo postcards of places like Rome and Paris, etc. What was received was a number of cards with old advertisements.  I thought for sure that I had received the wrong package, so I sent it back.  But no, I received the exact same group of advertisement.  So if you are interested in SOS, Jantzen Sweaters, Martini Vermouth, 7up, Kohler, these are for you.  If you want "old travel picture postcards" don't bother.  I would have given this 0 stars.

I purchased this a few years ago but never left a review.  I always used LD Compatible cartridges in my ancient HP laser printer; however, I was not so lucky with this one. I regret not requesting a refund back then because this is not compatible with my Dell E515DW.  After changing the toner and following the reset steps, I kept receiving a replace toner error.  My printer was useless while this toner cartridge was in because it would not let me copy/scan/print due to the error. When I removed this cartridge and placed the old Dell OEM cartridge back in the machine, I was able to use all functions, even with the replace toner message.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:  So far so good.  These work fine in our printer once we acknowledge HP's warning about non-genuine cartridges.  Time will tell how well they do.UNFORTUNATE UPDATE:  I initially just swapped a couple of the cartridges, waiting on the originals to be empty before swapping.  The first couple cartridges worked fine (hence the original review).  Then we swapped the old Magenta with this one, and it leaked ink all over the inside of the printer.  Had to spend a lot of time cleaning up the printer.  Tried a different brand of generics, and they were junk too.  Sadly, I had ordered my mother a set of these for her printer, and she had problems as well (thankfully no leaks causing a mess).I finally gave up on these generics and opted to subscribe to HP Instant Ink, and we have a mostly reliable printer again.  I get occasional print defects, but I believe they are the result of damage to the printhead by these junk cartridges (or quite possibly damage resulting from us fiddling around so much trying to get these to work)

Based on the description, and some of the reviews, I went ahead and decided to get this desk to work while I am in bed.BAD CHOICE!!! If you want to scoot the desk,even just a tiny bit, the legs will collapse. The positions to prop up the mouse pad or book/laptop you are working with seems to be made for people with very long torsos. Just to use this desk, I still have to sit straight up in bed and the little light n the side doesn't do anything to help you see. I would never recommend this product to anyone.Of course, to return it would have cost nearly as much as the item did originally, so I just have one more item to add clutter until my next garage sale. Its aggravating me while not even being used anymore! Great!
They were rated for left hand.  Package said used for either hand.  Picture shows 4 pair and received only 1 pair.
Junk... Am very disappointed with other reviews.  I bought almost 9 bundles for different denominations, all of them do not work.  The adhesive is garbage.  Don't buy this product, it does not work.

I thought this seemed like a good brand. I wished I'd read the reviews first! Right away, I took the cart out and the pins came out and the wheel fell off! It was unbelievable! I followed instructions to the tee. I don't have time for this type of thing, particularly cuz I also walk and use public transportation. I bought a off brand once under $30 that that was great! I'm returning this cuz the last few I had just snapped in place MINUS any type of pins! Don't waste your time or money on this!

I have an Epson 8350 and the oem lamp lasted about 1000 hours and I was shocked to see that a replacement was over $200 from Epson directly. Checking Amazon I saw all kinds of lamps with reviews and bought this lamp for about $50 since  it had the best average reviews compared to some of the $20 lamps. Unfortunately this lamp was a dud out of the box it was nice and bright but made a very high-pitched oscillating wine whistle type of sound.  I just installed a $25 lamp and all seems fine I'll try to post up on that particular lamp how the life last but I'm sitting here as I type this in watching NFL football game everything is nice and bright no noise.

The idea was good, the execution impossibly bad.Don't waste your time. Seriously. Just don't. If you need more evidence, go check the reviews at the Home Depot website.Let me explain the problem: The "smaller" problem is that the pin is built to work by hitting the molding. Since I bought the product specifically to avoid hitting the molding, we already have not met the goal. But the bigger problem is the fact that the pin doesn't stop the door. Unless I want a 45 degree opening in my hallway. This is ideal for a cat, ferret, Dachshund, or Bichon. It barely big enough for my Labrador.As for me, I'd prefer that my hallway door open to a 90 degree angle. Just sayin'. But when I select that setup, the door opens at least 100 degrees, probably 110, possibly 115, but I can't say for sure because the doorknob has already hit the wall (hard) and I'd prefer not to push the knob all the way into the wall just to get a good measurement with my protractor. I do own one. I wish the manufacturers of this product owned one, too.Do. Not. Buy.

I love how fine the pen is and I love my handwriting with them, but they skip A LOT. As a reviewer mentioned before, it is a very frustrating pen, to say the least. I am currently on the search for 0.25 tip pens that won't skip. RIP to the Muji ones because those ones were discontinued.

If you look at the photos I have attached to this review you can see:Scrapes in paintDents in topRust along the edgePaint scraped off the cornersAnother photo showing both the dents and scrapesIt looks like it would have been a pretty nice box if it had been new. However, buying a new box and receiving a box that is both used and beat up is not the usual customer service I expect from Amazon. I don't blame Amazon, but I will stay far away from this manufacturer going forward.

I gave this security chest to my dad. He accidentally drop the chest from a 5' tall height and the content just came out. It's easy to lock but I don't see a great use of it when it's supposed to be a secured but it can opened easily. It's a bust buy... I gave it 2 stars for easy to use.

Original rating: Great replacement for my HP printer and a fraction of the cost of regular cartridges.No issues with not using non HP cartridgeUpdate:  On my second order Downgraded - after two month the magenta cartridge today starting smearing on all pages. It is clearly showing ink on the drum where it shouldn'tOne more update: I just needed to use the last cartridge of this pack, the blue one because the printer was very low on cyan. Right from the first page I get 4 lines of blue on all printed color pages, no cleaning / calibration or anything else helps. I swapped with another brand blue cartridge and that fixed the issue !!! DO NOT BUYDefective cartridgeTHIRD ORDER - the magenta cartidge bled over 150 pages of printouts, making a mess a to clear up - will not order those again

Update...this stapler now jams half the time. Reduced to 2 stars from 4 stars. Bought this to replace a cheap similar stapler that I hated for years because it jammed 9 times out of 10. Well, this one jams about 1 time out of 10. So, that's good, but not great.

I should have listened to previous reviews.  These pens do not write long enough for me to get through my whole signature.  None of the pens in this box had the wax cap on the tip, which leads me to belive that these were already tried and returned.

Piece of crap hammer jammed and then just fell out after one use.  Made in China. I should have expected this.Update review - Bought a second one a day later to see if maybe I was the problem.  The second one tagged about 20 items and then the trigger/hammer hammed and I am unable to tag yet again.  That's $22.00 down the drain. Amazon should really remove this item. Maybe buying a tagging gun NOT made in China might work?

After a few writes with one of these pens, the ink started to run out on me and get terribly scratchy. When I replaced the one that ran out (still with full, new ink inside) with a new one from the box, the new one did the exact same thing in the same day of using it for the first time. I ran through several more to only be extremely frustrated that all of pens did the same thing. My friend owns a box of the Hi-tec-c 0.25mm pens, but she bought them for $10 more than this box of G-tec-c's. Before buying these, I briefly looked up reviews, worried that the Hi-tec-c was different than the G-tec-c. I remember seeing people say that there was no difference except that the G-tec-c was the American version of the Hi-tec-c. THERE IS MOST DEFINITELY A DIFFERENCE. My friend gave me four of her hi-tec-c pens and I have run through 3/4 of them with no problem at all and they have become one of my favorite and go-to pens to use. You can see the difference between the G-tec-c and the hi-tec-c in the pictures and how scratchy the G-tec-c is. It is worth paying the extra money to get a box of great, working hi-tec-c pens instead of ending up with a cheaper box of poor quality, runs-out-basically-within-the-hour, G-tec-c pens. Do not buy. You can have my leftover pens.
I would have given this product zero stars if the review system would let me.  This is not compatible with the Brother HL-2270DW printer.  A complete piece of garbage.

As another reviewer noted, this is a SCAM. DO NOT BUY:1) The box itself arrived in tatters. My security footage shows the UPS driver delivering it with extra care precisely to avoid the box falling apart altogether. You can see all corners completely exposed and a piece of cardboard laying next to the box.2) The box is incredibly worn from many closings, openings, and reclosings. This is NOT a new box that was rough handled, this is an old and worn box that has gone through many hands (one can't help but suspect that this same damaged safe, in the same damaged box, is just sent out to another customer once it's returned).3) The substantial damage to the safe likewise suggests that it occurred over many different instances: the safe is covered all over in scratches that are as various and different as they are numerous. The corners are particularly worn, both latches are completely busted, it is covered in various dents, and one large dent right on the top is so severe that the encasing is actually partially cracked.

When I bought the whiteboard I saw the "frequently bought together" suggestion, so I thought "great, will do". I should have read the reviews instead, which is what I normally do and the reason why it takes me days to buy anything on Amazon. And turns out it is the right thing to do.Wipe clean? How do you define "clean"? As many other reviewers have mentioned (now I have bothered to read the reviews) it is a pain to clean with a wipe or kitchen towel. You would expect that since it is for children it would be easy to remove. The only chance is to apply yourself for a few minutes rubbing intensely, which makes it useless because let's face it, the point is to draw and remove constantly, not to paint a masterpiece and let it there for family and friends to see for the rest of eternity. No use in expecting the child to wipe it clean.As for the drawing itself, it is faint and the colour lacks consistency.My son could not have enough of it when we put the whiteboard up. Now he does not even look at it because he is frustrated. Luckily there is a blackboard behind the whiteboard which he uses every day, because he can wipe it himself.I am buying a new set of markers and binning the Crayola. Waste of money.

I've owned dozens of these over the years. They really are comfortable to hold and I like the multi function. I'm giving a low rating because the quality has gone downhill over the past year or two. The plastic of the barrel simply cracks after a month or two and the pen falls apart. For almost $10, I'd expect better.

I bought two of these cartridges for my MFC 7860DW.  Here's what works well:  printing!  However, the "replace toner" message never goes away, even though I have used both cartridges.  This affects scanning - you can't scan if this message appears. But you can still print and probably can still fax (I don't use the fax).  I called Brother...of course, no help; they insist you buy their products.  I reviewed the other reviews and tried the fixes offered (entering the IP address in your browser and changing the settings seemed most promising, but it didn't work either).  I am out of ideas and, unfortunately, outside the return window.  Oh, and this merchant doesn't provide anyway to return the used cartrridges, which is really a bummer.

The ones that came with my pencil did an amazing job, these are...awful.  I put two stars because I am understanding of the possibility that maybe they are just aged and dried out but still...if I order erasers (which I was excited about as the Zebra M-301 0.5 is my absolute favourite pencil) I kind of expect them to work the same as the originals that came with my pencil.

I only did not give this one star because I do not agree with the word "hate".  This product does not work.  The small travel one falls apart every time I tried to use it so it went to the garbage just 3 days after purchasing it.  The large one does not clean hair off clothes well and once you run water over it to clean off whatever it did pick up, it becomes basically worthless.  We have four cats and I was really hoping this would cut down on our furniture vacuum time before guests come over, but back to the trusty vacuum it is!!!
2 stars for the cute faces and colors but 1 star for the flimsiness. Can barely erase anything because it's too soft.

I needed boxes to store hanging files, and the description says that they are the right size for hanging files.  That much is true - the hanging files fit nicely, so long as you don't want to use the lids. . Once the files are hanging, you cannot put the lid on.Putting the boxes together is easy and for the most part the box itself stays in place.  The upper lip of the box has to be taped down - they don't stay in place.  If you don't tape them down, the 4 lips of the boxes block the opening to the box.The lids have to be taped together because the tabs that go into the slots are not long enough to lock the lid in place.  Without tape, all you will have will be a flat piece of cardboard.The yellow box is completely scratched up and gauged on one of the sides.  Of course I didn't notice it until I had already put together (and taped together) several of the other colors, so returning them isn't an option.On a positive note, the colors are vibrant and the boxes are sturdy.It is always a gamble buying a product when there aren't any reviews written about it, and if I had it to do all over again, I'd pass on this product.After several days I am marking this down to 2 stars.  Even with packing tape,the sides are popping up and not staying in place. I will most likely have to use duct tape to secure the sides in place.
Bought these for an HP printer.  They petered out after a couple dozen printed sheets.  These are not good quality remanufactured cartridges.  Look for others with better ratings.
Absolute JUNK!  Ordered package of three & two do not print properly.  Didn't even waste my time trying #3.  COMPLETE WASTE OF $$$.  If I could post negative stars I'd give it a negative 5.

I rarely write reviews.  Occasionally when a product is really, really good, I write a review; and rarely, when I am completely unsatisfied with a product I will write a review like this one.  I haven't tried every pen yet, but most of the ones that I have tried are so dried up that no ink comes out at all.  Sometimes they write...but aren't smooth at all.  The first thing I do after getting news pens is to separate and merge the new pens with my "old" pens by color.....which is why I can't return them .  Don't buy them!!  I think dates should be added to oackages which would give the buyer a clue why the pens mght not be working!!

When you have a plastic bag of trash in the basket of the cart, the cart basket is so small plastic bag will tear when you try to pull it out. 4. One star or shipping.

I was very excited about adding a spot to mount my Apple Pencil to my current iPad Pro case. Unfortunately, this product is not a great solution. The first issue I noticed was that after I attached two of these to my iPad case, my pencil was sticky. Apparently, there was excess adhesive inside the elastic strap that got all over my pencil. This made me very sad. Eventually, the excess adhesive transferred out of there and stopped being an issue. After a couple of weeks the elastic started getting stretched out from what I'd consider pretty mild use. Then a few weeks later the elastic started fraying and fell apart.I really don't like to write a bad review, but this product is not worth purchasing.If you found this review helpful please click that button and make my sacrifice of wasting time buying this and writing about it worth something. Thank you.
If I could give ZERO stars, I would. Nice idea except the glue is worthless. Put them up, they fall down two days later. Please stop making garbage!

This notebook is perfect size but the paper quality is not tomoe river paper like most of the midori inserts. I was disappointed to find this out and there was no reviews saying it was or wasn't. If you are looking for ok quality paper this is it but if you are looking for great quality paper for water colors and fountain pens don't buy this as ghosting is bad.
As always with these reman carts (regardless of the company), expect a 33% percent out of the box failure rate.

Edit:  The print head had to be replaced because these cartridges ruined it.  Very expensive lesson. Wasn't able to return because the return date had passed.I know that reviews can be difficult, especially when a person receives a (probable) defective product.  I purchased this in anticipation of my "starter" cartridges going quickly on my new HP Officejet Pro 8610.  When I finally needed to replace the cartridges, I did not anticipate any problems.  I've had a similar machine and have used compatible cartridges without a problem.  NOT this time!  The 3 colors were installed fairly straight forward.  Not quite as easily as they should have - but they clicked into place.The Black cartridges were another story.  The first one did not install easily at all.  When I finally got it in, it did not click into place as it should have - it moved back and forth if touched.  I printed a sample.  The black did not work.  I then installed the second black cartridge.  It was difficult and did not click into place, but it did print ONE page.  The next morning, I went to print more and it said the cartridge had failed.  Since it was new, I tried several times to remove and install.  It would go back and forth between accepting the cartridge or saying they were not installed or that there was a failure with the cartridge.After doing this 3 times, I give up.

See Photo.  Streaking on every page.  Always the magenta color.  Would like to have a replacement for this toner.  Unfortunately, I purchased it some time ago and didnt need it until now.Update 9-14-2018:I was contacted by the vendor who offered to replace my product even though I had purchased it over one year ago. (They offer a 2 year warranty.)I agreed to the replacement and am updating my review.  If I have issues with the next batch, I will again update this reviewUpdate:  I replaced the magenta toner, and after about 3 months, the new toner began streaking just as the old one does.  I wont buy these anymore.  Have decided to go with an ecotank printer from Epson.

BE AWARE that these pages are NOT 9.25 inches wide as another reviewer says. They are slightly wider, 9 3/8, or 9.375 inches, which may not seem like much, but for my purposes it was too big of a difference. I wanted to intersperse these in my scrapbooking binder, which is a large heavy duty D-ring binder with standard sheet protectors in it. When I was researching which picture sleeves would be a similar size, these 4x6 sleeves seemed like a very good fit. Not perfect, but close enough to not stand out from the sheet protectors. WRONG. They stick out between the protectors AND stick out from the edge of the binder. It would look terrible, so I can't use these after all. I will probably return them, though I hate doing that for the waste of shipping back. But $16 for something that was misadvertised (it was almost impossible to get the exact measurements from the item description in the first place!) and is useless?? Nah. Bad deal.The quality seems okay, though I am not going to be using them, hence the two stars. If you're not picky about size, and you have a SUPER OVERSIZED binder to put them in, go for it.

Update:  Lowered to 2 stars.  I don't print color very often, but after less than 250 pages the magenta toner began streaking color on all of the printouts.  I paid over $100 for this set of toners so that comes out to 40 cents per page.  The original HP toners would have been cheaper on a per page basis.Original post:Works fine. A little noisier than the original HP toners, but color is fine.

Poor quality ink. I purchased this in the hopes that it would be good ink (according to reviews) the cartridge is half empty according to my printer and it’s not printing the correct color scheme. For dark blue I’m getting baby blue, black is gray and so forth. I can not recommend this printer ink.
I should have read the customer reviews before purchasing, because they're full of warnings. These are NOT purple markers. They are lilac. Returning immediately.

Horrible.  With all the options out there, how did this thing ever make it past the drawing board? Don't be fooled.  I have several damaged door moulds thanks to these things.  Uninstalled. Zero Stars

Unfortunately all of that was necessary because the ink from both sets was never recognized by the printer. Leaving a bad review because I ordered black and got wood, I also paid extra for the light and it was missing... bought this as a gift for my boyfriend who's bday is tomorrow... very dissapointed...
