I gave it 2 stars because when the printer works, it prints great quality photos, and did it in a very timely manner.  Unfortunately, I am returning my third machine today.  I am a photographer by trade, and have only used it for onsite holiday events.  It is not a reliable machine.  I am sad.

Bought this at Office Depot. I came here to see if perhaps I had a defective cart because the drawers constantly fall off track. Now reading the reviews, I see they're all defective... and, no, it has nothing to do with the weight of the items in the drawer, they fall off track even when empty!!Do NOT waste your money!

All the 96 color cartridges are used up so quickly that it's hard to give a positive rating.  I use these in conjunction with my Epson R2880.  The magentas, yellow and cyans are particularly poor.  Image quality has been great though.

Valuetoner:You sent me a replacement cartridge for the one that was not 'compatible' with my printer, great service. But the original cartridge that did print, barely gave me 10 copies before it went dry. The one star that I gave you, I raised it to 5 stars for the replacement cartridge, but now I'm forced to drop it back down to a one star for the cartridge that did work, but only gave me maybe 10 copies. What do we do now?_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________The first cartridge did not work, (incompatible window keeps popping up). The second one so far is working very nicely.* I've upgraded my original 1 star to 5. When I notified Value Toner of this, they were kind enough to send me another cartridge quickly and with no additional cost to me. They have my business for life!

Product works fine after I got the right customer service person to resolve my problems, which took a while. The instructions that came with it were wrong. I tried the service and figured out that was not for me; but then I had a very hard time cancelling the service. To understand what some of the problems are, I suggest that you google "how to cancel service for ooma" to see what kind of problems people have and that this is a problem for a number of people.  In general, the bad parts are:1. you cannot cancel on-line.2. You get a runaround when you call.3. It takes a long time on the phone to cancel.4. They push this idea of giving you a transfer number so that if you sell the device, the person will not have to pay activation fees.  The catch is, if you don't sell it, you get charged for all those months.  They are not very clear about that part.I'd give it a higher rating, as the service seems fine, but I felt like they were trying to trick me and cheat me.Also for the price that has standard features, you might as well get a cell phone from someplace like Republic Wireless that uses WiFi when you are connected, but uses the sprint network otherwise.  Its about $20 a month, including a gig of data on the wireless network.  Its less money and you can take your phone with you!

I much prefer the other water brushes I've tried, which are Derwent and Pentel.  They work well and the mechanism is intuitive.  Simply squeeze the soft ergonomic barrel to release water to clean the brush or paint.  The more you squeeze the more water comes out.  it's child's play.  It takes seconds to figure out how much squeezing is necessary.  Filling is a doddle too as you simply unscrew the brush on top and pour water into the barrel, very convenient for filling when out and about plus they hold lots of water so filling is not required often.  With the caps on I've carried these things here and there in a pencil case in my bag for years and never once had an issue with leaking.This Caran D'Ache water pen is a totally different animal.  It looks much more stylish granted and the brand name is known for high end quality so you might be fooled into thinking the product would be better, but think again.The filling mechanism is more trouble than it's worth and the click click method of applying water is a hassle. It's a case of click click click this will take me forever with the amount I need, click oh no, too much and then  I'm trying desperately to get rid of a big blog before it drops on my painting, too late!You literally have to stop painting while you do this clicking process with thumb and index finger also, and the buttons aren't necessarily in the position you would normally be holding the brush either so you have to rearrange your hand each time or permanently paint in an uncomfortable position.Cleaning between colours is an issue also.  With the other brands you can squeeze water out with one or two squeezes that will flush the paint out of the brush, so you have a clean brush between washes.  The Caran D'Ache is not so simple.  With the click click click method of drips you don't get the flush that cleans, instead you get drips that leave you with a dirty brush to use for the next wash.All in all, I would love to give a good review for such an ordinarily high quality brand, but this product has no redeeming features.  Buy the other items and steer clear of this one. It's not fit for purpose in my opinion.

I bought these because they had good reviews. But the first time people using them in the office that I work in they took chunks of paper off instead of making a clean cut opening a letter.  I am returning this product and finding something new.

This is is not working properly in my printer. I have changed all of the cartridges and everything repeatedly prints blue or blue and yellow.  I emailed the seller and did not receive a response.  I read the reviews before purchasing and thought that the ink would be fine. However,  I am extremely disappointed. This was not a cheap purchase

Product arrived quickly; folds flat very easily. However, there is a sticker on the front of the turquoise colored stool that very clearly says for up to 320 lbs, NOT 400 as advertised.  NOTE THIS IS FOR SITTING, not for standing on the stool. I wouldn't even let a child stand on this stool!  The "hinges" are not held with any kind of plastic or metal pins. Instead, they just snap together and hold with small plastic "bumps." Therefore, the stool can completely come apart under weight - and will collapse if you are sitting, or, heaven forbid, standing on it when this happens - very dangerous!  Also, the "non-skid" foam dots on the top surface are not especially effective because they are recessed slightly, so although they might provide some slip protection, this would only work if they were exposed so they would make contact with whatever is on top of the stool.  We will not be able to use these as intended at all.  Maybe for a small side table?????  If you are looking for a sturdy, 400-lb rated stool for a person to sit on, I would recommend you look elsewhere.

The cartridge did print, so I have to give it more than one star, but it prints extra stuff down the  right side of every page.  Printed pages are not presentable. Wouldn't buy a recycled printer cartridge from RT again based on this first purchase.
Just like every other review states, the bottom is bowed so the sticky pads dont touch the desk. I had to rip the sticky pads off and glue them to the edge of the product to make it functional.
Disappointed.  Looks like a kid drew these.  If you like simple, this is for you.  The best part is that it is hard back and spiral, that’s what the two stars are for.

I don’t give bad reviews like some people do as a hobby but everything about this pad is grade A crap. Terrible for any kind of mouse. Pad is tiny, wrist pad is not that soft, too high, and takes up a third of the mousepad. The sticky adhesive back is unnecessary and leaves a big bubble in it. Got a steelseries stitched pad for my magic mouse and gaming mouse, transportable, great grip and surface area for any mouse. 1000% better. There is no need for adhesive. I have no idea how this is top rated. I expected better from 3M. Stay away no matter what your setup is. Amazon top rated products are not reliable. Sometimes they are but this was not. Read other reviews and they will say the same thing.

Product would be amazing if it actually stuck on the wall. I should've heeded another reviewer's warning about it not sticking, but didn't. I'll be taking this off my wall, rolling it up and thankfully it's free to return it. Don't waste your money on this product.
The pen is a fake. I bought it to replace a real star walker I lost. Wrong weight, metal color and documentation. Also has a deep scratch.
This does not even deserve a star... you get one pen when the description clearly says 12 pens, if I'd known this when ordering I would've spent my money elsewhere!
Very cheap plastic sleeves that would rip in less than a month. Shouldn't even get 1 star.

I like the questions (hence 2 stars instead of 1), but this book is ineffective for me.  As an executive, frequently referencing my calendar of appointments is essential.  I could not have a book (especially one of this size) displayed on my desk with such personal information on its pages.It's unnecessarily large.  Not sure if there's a point to be made with having such a large book, but it doesn't work for me.I absolutely would not buy 6 of these, especially with the pitchy introduction.  I have to say that Mr. Buchard's hubris was annoying if not humorous.  In these pages he refers to himself as "the world's leading high performance coach."  Really?!?!I also question Mr. Buchard's testing of the product.  Clearly the sample size was not large or varied enough.  I'd also be curious to know if any of those people are still schlepping this huge book around?  Honestly, if Mr. Buchard was less full of himself and acknowledged that the idea of journaling and self-reflection (yes, that's all this is) (1) is not new or novel and (2) has already proven itself to be valuable over the course of decades (or longer).  One cannot honestly give all the credit to this planner.  Now, to say that this planner may have inspired someone (or compelled them) to commit to actually journaling daily may be a fair statement, but anything more is far too grandiose for a product so simple and poorly executed.Don't waste your money.  Google morning and evening reflection questions, find a few you like and print them out as a reference to guide your daily journaling.

The one star, is only because it has a space pen refill in it. As for using this pen as a stylus, that's not going to happen. I'm not sure what was used in place of the conductive rubber, but it sucks!! I would not recommend this item to anyone. This has a POS rating.

So I bought these originally to use with my Rocketbook and for my planner and I've been using them for 2 weeks now.First I tried it in my Rocketbook and found that they dry in a thick film.  Not really a big problem until I tried to erase the color.  I did wait a full 5 minutes for the color to dry then I tried erasing with the highlighter eraser and it was gummy and thick and difficult to remove.  I was able to take my damp Rocketbook cloth to wipe it clean away (all of it) but I find it difficult to lift the color off if I only make a small mistake vs erasing the whole page or larger section with a damp cloth.I thought maybe it was maybe the Rocketbook paper so I figured that I could still use them for my disk planner since I use highlighters in it often and if appointments got canceled or rescheduled then I could just erase the highlighter and pens (I use the FriXion gel pens for my planner) and erase it all.  I had the same issue in my disk planner.  tried it on a variety of different types of paper (notebook, printer, cardstock, heavy) and I found I have the same problem with all of them which is disappointing.  On top of that, some of the color doesn't lift out and leaves a faint coloring on the paper (not in my Rocketbook).  I really wish I knew what type of paper the users used in the review videos where they lifted the color off easily because I did not have that ease of use.  I still have them and I do use them, just only as regular highlighters.
I can't give it 0 stars, but that's what it deserves because of the condition it arrived it. The box is absolutely destroyed, covered in shipping labels, and to top it off it's broken!

Very much unlike Brendon Burchard to put out an incomplete/inefficient product. Brendon usually puts out super high quality stuff. I was surprised by this planner.  The first thing is that there was nothing mentioned on morning ritual. This is a very high priority for Brendon, yet it is absent here. I would have expected at least one page of morning ritual suggestions and guidelines and a spot to put these in the planner. Next I see a weekly review and a monthly review. You see these a lot with all kinds of productivity mavens.  Don't plan weekly AND monthly. Then you end up spending a lot of time doing two review session near the end of the month. It is way more productive to only do weekly reviews. Then when you want to summarize how you are progressing you can choose to take a 4 or 8 or 12 week period or any other period that works for you and review that and see your trends in the categories that matter to you. I changed the whole thing around to fit for me and put it all on a google sheet going forwards week by week for years to come.The main thing is intent (clarity) and the the follow up on that intent by producing on that intent and not other stuff. You can get that from the planner but you do not need this many questions at the beginning and at the end of the day.So while it is not necessarily a 1 star it just took me by surprise that this planner is far less informational and usable than I would have expected coming from BB. his fans will give it an unconditional 5 star but it is not up to par. BB sorry you need to get back to the drawing board on this one despite three years of working on it. I understand it needs to be generic for it to work for everybody but it could be more streamlined and more time efficient. You have to get to the key point fast and drive those. You also need a way to set aside all the distractions.  I keep an area to write down a one or two word note about a distraction item and then I put is away knowing it is written down and I can forget about it until I have excess time to go after some of the minor unimportant non-time sensitive details. LATER is powerful. NOW is even more powerful but only if these are your MAIN priorities. This planner won't get you there efficiently.

Very seldom do I purchase a product so poorly made that I feel the need to write a review. This is the cheapest, flimsiest, overpriced piece of junk I have ever purchased. If not for my need of it, I would return it. I purchased a similar product (different brand) a couple of months ago that was much more sturdy and cost less. I am very disappointed in the quality of this item.

I read a lot and follow habit trackers and other planner books/diaries. Based on the reviews I thought this will be a good choice. But I was disappointed when deliveredProblem with this plannerfront cover torn off - Please pictures two corners at left, I can see white inside cover coming from from black cardboard. Right side bottom cardboard is bent ( about the break).  I just opened the pack and found its not worth spending too much money and at the end we get defective piece.After looking at the cover (cardboard) in bad condition. I opened the planner. Pages quality is really low. Join threads will be broken anytime if page is turned.When we spend more than Rs 1400-1500 we expect product delivered with care but this time I feel its not worth buying by looking at the condition it was delivered.It looked like someone has kept it for 4-5 years and than uploaded on Amazon for selling.Very disappointing with seller and delivery
My pen didn't work after I refilled it. I bought three refills and none of them worked. So you get a rating of P.P. that stands for piss poor

201 Pages of black ink printing is what was paid for.ZERO pages printed is what I received because ink cartridge is empty.These are expensive enough and yet a so called genuine company fails quality control.I am buying looky likies from now on. Cheap Yes, Work yes, Value for money Definitely.If I could give nil stars I would.Absolutely fuming causing further delays in work submission's.Thank You very much Epsom.

The wobbly collapsing legs at a fraction of movement make this bed table useless. There should be a locking mechanism for the legs. I wouldn't recommend buying this product, but I ignored the legs complaints in other reviews myself, so if you're like me you'll probably waste your money anyway because of the design.To be fair, the design is the only reason why this didn't get a one star rating. Great design concept, if you need a photograph prop for a Living & Home bedroom shoot. If you need a useable bed table--good luck with that!

I ignored the reviews that warned that cartridges weren’t recognized by the printer and bought them anyway. I was pleased when I replaced the cartridges and they worked well, but then after about a month, out of nowhere, my printer stopped printing and the message noted was “ink cartridge not recognized”. Back to square one (buying all new ink cartridges). The lower price is not worth the hassle. I should have just paid full price for name brand.

Believe the one star reviews when they tell you that this product is barely usable. The edges of the mouse pad curl up and make the mouse pad unusable at the corners and top edge. The mouse pad area is also relatively small compared to a standard to full-size mouse.

My review is not for the product but for the company. Description seems off. Product can comfortably hold about 10 pages which makes its useless for my needs. Attempted to return but company wants me to cover shipping cost. I highly suggest buying from amazon and not a third party or buying from staples or something. Returning is pointless as it will cost me around the same amount as the product itself. So now I have a bunch of useless combs.

I recently purchased two of these toner cartridges as they came recommended from a friend.  Neither of these worked.  The "reset" instructions posted on here and that came with the toner cartridges did nothing except waste my time!  I would have given zero stars, but that was not an option.Save yourself the headache!  Purchase OEM and do not waste your time with this GARBAGE!Steve M. Windham, LLM, MBA, EA

Similar to my other review of the black ink XL, this ink ran out FAST. I rarely even use my printer and was expecting to get a long time out of this cartridge but I barely got 20 prints before striping and other problems started occurring. I have worked with print well over 4 years now so I know these are definitely not brand new. I would NOT recommend buying these on Amazon. I love Amazon but this was just ridiculous.

When I first got the dry erase board, I wasn't impressed.  The letters on the days were already faded and the cork board had several "bubbles" in it where it looked like it hadn't been glued to the backing.  Also, one of the round magnets (with the plastic covering you use on the board) did not stick to its plastic backing.  But whatever, I was going to use it anyways.After reading all the other reviews about the poor adhesive on the backing magnets (to stick to your fridge), I decided to super glue the magnets to the back.  HUGE MISTAKE!!!  Now, I'm not blaming anyone but myself for this error - I should have researched a proper glue to use on the back.  I just want to share my experience so it doesn't happen to anyone else.  Well I must have put too much glue or should have used a different glue, because the glue had a chemical reaction to my refrigerator.  Seriously!?!?  I had let the glue dry for at least an hour before putting the board on my fridge. I don't know, I had cleaned the fridge before putting the board on - maybe the glue had a reaction to the chemicals in the cleaner - even though I let both of them dry first?  I'm not sure.  Anyways, my black fridge now has 4 areas where the magnets were that are white (the magnets left rectangle markings).  It looks horrible!  Again, not blaming anyone but myself.  If you are going to glue the magnets to the back, DON'T USE SUPERGLUE.  Find another adhesive.  Anyways, all is not lost - we were planning on replacing the refrigerator this fall anyway and my husband jokes that I sabotaged our fridge on purpose to ensure I would get a new one...lol.Because I glued the magnets on the back and had that horrible reaction, into the garbage it went.  It didn't even last 1 day.

Scale a little difficult to set up.  Had problem with downloading rates from internet.  Called for support help.  Phone number in instr. manual was wrong,not toll free, long wait to talk with someone.  Gave me another phone number.  No one answers and no way to leave message at second phone number. Called back first number said he couldn't help me. Very frustrating. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. Finally got it set up. Very complicated for mailing regular daily letters.  Must push several buttons to get weight and postage for one letter. After you get postage for one letter you have to push five buttons to get back to the starting point.  Tried pushing buttons as suggested, it does not work.  I am sending this scale back.  Mainly due to lack of support in getting familiar with the use of this product.

Card is not bad, but the color is a cross between a dull burgundy and brown. They are not the vivant red color that is pictured on website. Gave it a 1 because color not as pictured. I'm usually a 5 star man.

The “spiral” binding is not a complete spiral, so the folders and covers pop off of it and it is really frustrating to try to fix.  The price was reasonable, but obviously cheaper is not better in this case.  Only reason I even gave it a two star rating is because the packets work. Do yourself a favor, spend a little more on a different product!

We purchased this for my elderly mom who is staying with us so she could alert us if she needed help during the night while we sleep.  I am pleased with the product as it works exactly how I intended it to.  Easy!  We placed one button in her room and one in her bathroom.  We plugged the receiver in an outlet in our bedroom.  Works perfect!However, the product we received appeared to be used.  My first inclination was that the box was ripped and taped.  Then after opening, the buttons had residual sticky back on them and there was greasy fingerprints on everything.  Clearly we had received a returned item.  It kind of disturbed me when I ordered “new” and we received “used” when we are in the middle of a pandemic.  I disinfected everything, so that’s why I gave it one star.

DO NOT BUY the cartridge from this vendor - "E-Z Ink". I am so sorry to not trusting the previous user comment.I bought two cartridges; 901XL for my HP Officejet 4500. It is a match and price is the best.I received them, and use the first one almost immediately. Printer displayed "Cartridge problem, see user guide for detail". No resolution but re-installing a couple times; clean the circuit board (not the printer head, I follow the instruction) and re-boot the printer several times. No good, open the second one, this time, printer displayed "Cartridge not compactable".Finally gave up; filed a claim to return. Yes, they replied wih a RMA# but no shipping label.What? These are defective items, not I changed my mind or something, why I need to pay for a shipback for something that are not working?A terrible experience on the purchase. Especially when you found out the trouble while you are out of the ink and you are reqired to use the printer.So, I will suggest to stay away from this vendor and their cartridge. Check other user's review. The bad one are real story.Thanks,

I would give the Arteza Brush Pens zero stars if I could. I don’t understand the good reviews. Most of mine are dried out and leave very little if any color.  Being an artist I have used many different types of media and this is one of the worse.  These are terrible and frustrating to use. I definitely do NOT recommend.

If not for this one big thing, it would be 5 stars++.Be advised. This printer seems like it is a good deal because it comes with a 3000 page ink supply. But BEWARE this ink EXPIRES and is extremely expensive. There is no warning or indication that the included inks EXPIRE.Make no mistake. This printer makes amazing prints. But I am a low volume home user. The printer comes with a '3000' page supply of ink. We print maybe 500 pages / year. We have now owned this printer for about 2 years and have partially consumed about 3/4 of a block of each ink. However, the printer has recently started complaining that there is incompatible ink. I checked this out and was advised that it expired. I spent $600 and bought a set of new ink blocks. I removed the unused blocks (all 4 colors). These cannot be reinserted as is complains that they are expired. Looking at the blocks, there is a different pattern in the 'bumps' that seem to be labeled A thru D.Not to mention that I now have to dispose of my unused ink blocks (4 of them - about $200 worth). And not exactly environmentally friendly and no waste.I hope the new blocks do not 'expire'.If you print >3000 pages/year this is a great deal. For a low volume home user, this is expensive, especially if the regular bought ink also expires. But, if you want the absolutely best print quality you can get. Go for it. Just be aware that it is going to cost.

I have no idea how this stool has a 4.5 star rating. I've gone through TWO now in 6 weeks and both cracked in exactly the same manner. I weigh 190lbs and use it around the house/kitchen. It doesn't seem to lock into place well and when you put any pressure on them, they crack. They claim they support 300lbs, which I am nowhere near. The price is affordable, but extremely disappointed with this product. Again, this is my 2nd stool in 6 weeks!

I have to agree with the other reviewers that said these are too big for a standard pencil and slid up and down. They were very loose. Sure I could add tape underneath, but I shouldn’t have to do that. Unfortunately very disappointed with these.

*Had this mat for a couple months before it cracked.  it has been treated normally, I weigh 150 pounds and use a lightweight office chair.  Looks nice but not durable at all.**I was promptly refunded the full purchase price for this product after this review,  The seller contacted me and quickly pursued getting the refund to me. If you are not satisfied, they will make it right. I had already purchased another mat locally.  I would buy from this seller again knowing they ensure product satisfaction.

So disappointing!  I understand that I didn't read the discription carefully, or read the reviews... but this is a front/ back poster that makes no sense.  It would be exactly what I wanted if it was two seperate pieces.  As it is it is useless.  Very poorly designed.
Wish I could rate these a 0. Put these brand new cartridges in my printer and the printer gave me a “Defective cartridge” error.  Should have known I was possibly getting a counterfeit item.

Garbage!! JAMS, JAMS, JAMS!!!!  Ridiculous, Don't waste your money!!  I should have listened to the other poor reviews.  I am sending this garbage back.  It looks nice but doesn't work---very poor design!

Too much money for cheap plastic, it came broken with missing pieces of the lock so if you are buying this for the lock, DO NOT DO IT. I read a review regarding the lock being broken on another customers Drawer and I disregarded it. Believe me, not worth it. I returned it the same day I received it. I'd give it no stars but thats not an option unfortunately. High way robbery for such garbage.

This product is honestly really hard to like. I expected it to be a little difficult to put together, considering how small the letters are it is understandable. What really seal the deal for a one star review for me is the fact that after struggling for a good hour to install the ink pad and letters, the stamp doesn't even come out clear. I tried everything from being tougher on it, gentle, and pressed harder so that the letters would make strong indentation into the ink pad, but nothing works. If they had made the ink pad thicker perhaps this wouldn't be a problem? Who knows. But i already opened the package, already spent a great deal of time on it, got ink all over my hands so what's the point of trying to return this crap.Conclusion: Ink comes out uneven and there's nothing you can do about it. Save your pennies and get something with more quality.

I needed warranty service on my old My Weigh scale. It was duly sent to the address given on the warranty paper included with the scale. The package was returned after having traveled to Phoenix, AZ, then to Bell Gardens, CA, Jacksonville, FL, Pensacola, FL, and finally to my residence. It was marked "UNDELIVERABLE AT THIS ADDRESS". After finding the companies web site, I sent an inquiry (and  complaint) by e-mail. The answer received was that I should send the scale in for service without any mention of a changed address or offer of compensation for the wasted postage. If I were to do as suggested I would then be at the point of spending as much as a new scale's cost with no guarantee of the old scale being repaired or replaced. The attitude appears to be total indifference to customer satisfaction. I noticed the request for ratings above has this item listed as a toy. That may be where I have gone wrong. I thought it was a tool and bought another one while expecting the old one to be repaired and returned.
I actually liked it the 1st time I used it the 2nd time I used to rate in the middle it just shut down quit working and never worked again it is not worth the money

Love my MFC 9970CDW but when it's come to getting replacement toner there's a real problem.  I ordered this toner (gts value pack) based on other reviews but three of the four cartridges leaked and have totally messed up my printer.  (Also, the cleanup is messy and if you're not careful you'll end up breathing in toner ink dust.) I was hoping that these would be as good as Brother toner, which is very expensive. But the replacement toner sold by "great toners" is no solution. No reputable company would have such poor quality control and I don't know why Amazon would continue to give this company access to their customer base. After many many orders to Amazon over the years, this is my FIRST negative experience.Note another problem with replacement toner in general:  the MFC is programmed to constantly display a "low toner" message if you've installed a non-Brother toner - a real irritant and bad business practice.  This programmed feature is to  force MFC owners to give up on non-Brother toners and just buy Big Brother.  But there is an easy way around that, as other reviews on this page tell you about.[ASIN:B0019WI3NO 3 Pack Of HP Remanufactured Q2612A Toner Cartridges]]

I am rating this product 1 star because it is a piece of junk. It's supposed to be a "heavy duty" card reel, but it comes nowhere close. The reel itself weighs about a half pound. The first time I used it, the retractable cord did not feel smooth on the return. I used it one day and it barely retracted. Now I am using it the second day and the cord is unreeled and won't retract at all. Save your money and purchase another reel.The item did arrive quickly, so nothing to worry about there, but the fact it doesn't work overshadows everything else.
Originally I gave this a 2 Star but changed it to 1.  This was very very stiff and not usable.  I needed up getting a replacement

I have had it a couple of months, ordered it with a bunch of other stuff, and couldn't figure out what it was when it arrived... two stars since it might work but looks like a tool in search of a job.

As some other reviews stated the cartridges did not work with my XP-446. After installing in the printer an error screen comes up saying the cartridge is not recognized and to replace it. There is no way to clear this screen and after shutting the printer down, upon start up the error screen comes back up. The description and packaging both say they work with XP-446. Installed actual Epson cartridge and everything works as it should.

I've always known Bostitch as a good brand to say the least. I have to say they really disappoint with this product. First of all when I opened the box and inspected the sharpener I saw wood filings in the cutter. I don't know if they test them first or this was a used and returned item. I'm not giving to stars based on that issue. I'm being generous with two stars based on the price. This sharpener bogs down with the slightest pressure. You have to barely push down to keep it going otherwise it will stop. It also sharpens one side of the pencil leaving the other side covered with wood. As a mechanical person I can tell you it has a cheap weak motor similar to the ones found in cheap toys. I will keep this for now because I really can't be bothered returning things. Please trust me don't go by these other 5 star reviews. Save your money buy a better one.

I purchased this scale to help with eBay and also for those letters that you aren't sure if they need extra postage or not. So the first time I used this scale it told me that my letter was 1.5 oz. So that meant I needed more postage. Rather than put on a full stamp I stopped by the post office to add 20 cents. Well! They weighed it and said it was fine with one stamp. It weighed 0.7 oz and I didn't need extra postage! What good is this scale if I still have to go to the post office to verify the weight.So I pulled out the instructions and I was relieved (for a short while) that there was a way to calibrate it. You push some button combinations and then put on the 30 lb 0.1 oz weight. That will calibrate it. But wait. Where do I get a 30lb 0.1 oz weight?!? I read another review here on Amazon and he did calibrate it and it didn't work properly. I guess this will be going back to Amazon.And of course the instructions evidently were translated from Chinese into English, but NOT by an English speaker. Frustrating!
I will keep these because of the hassle to return them. But only 2 of 3 work. It’s loud.  Seems to do what I intended. But as others have reviewed, not all of them work.

I have an old 3M tape machine which this company seemed to copy. When I read some reviews of people complaining of the tape sticking to the unit during operation, I thought they were ridiculous and just didn't understand how to use this machine because once in a while, the tape will  stick to my 3M machine. BUT.... the tape does something much different in the way it sticks to this unit. It is so frustrating when it happens, somewhat difficult to pull off and  very time consuming to un-stick it.  I tried using different name brand tape too. The tape seems to want to come  off the holder which sometime causes the tape to tear along the outer edge as it comes off the cutter. Overall, not happy with this purchase

I love Moleskine products. The low rating is due to packaging/seller issues. I ordered this thinking it was the 8.25 x 5.5 inch size, as indicated in the title. I see now that the product dimensions do state this is the smaller sized, 3.5 x 5 inch planner. Will be returning it since I need the larger size.

Edit: after attempting to do a full piece with these, I'm taking the 4 star review down to a one. They swatch beautifully, almost deceptively so, but once you start to use them as you would markers or watercolors they disappoint. Not quite a marker because they're not that juicy, not watercolors at all because they just bleed everywhere and if you try to use them on wet paper you end up getting no pigment out of them. Will be requesting a refund for these, really sad because the brush tips themselves are really good quality.Love the markers themselves, the colors are vibrant and the ink flow with the brushes is fantastic, however... The actual box they come in, the plastic one for storage? Mine was cracked on both sides during shipping, so now I've got a load of scotch tape holding it together. Hate to leave anything less than a 5 star review because the markers themselves are great, but man I wish the boxes they came in were better quality :(

I have loved and purchased the Pilot G-2 07 Fine point pens for years and wanted a medium point ink for more boldness.  After reading the reviews for these Pilot Easy Touch Medium point pens I ordered them and tried writing a few lines.  I can say that they are HORRIBLE.  I ordered them in purple and red; BOTH sets I returned.  They required an enormous amount of pressure, the ink skipped on the page and just felt very uncomfortable in my hand. I reordered the Fine point Pilot G-2 07 pens and won't ever change!
I gave 2 stars due the two that work out of the set. Not impressed. Perhaps this is why it's an add-on item? Returns not accepted either, and cannot contact seller.

I would give these envelopes no stars if possible. They are extremely thin and flimsy. The adhesive strips don't even work! Almost every envelope we have used so far has come open! Total JUNK. We are throwing them away and buying new ones. Its a shame that amazon is starting to get nothing but junk products anymore.

I give this one star only because zero stars is not an option.  The toner does not apply evenly to the paper, does not stick to it, and smears unexpectedly.  DO NOT buy this toner - even for a printer used for unimportant papers (which is what I bought it for) it makes your life awful trying to print anything - and toner gets EVERYWHERE.  Run away.

This is a basic calendar board that is well-laid-out and functional, with designated spaces for all the essential elements of information one would expect from a wall calendar board. The marker and eraser work great, and the corkboard and magnets do their jobs.Why two stars? Because the adhesive pads didn't hold to my wall at all; the board fell several times, and I ended up taping it to the wall to avoid further falls. Based on other reviews, it seems I may simply have gotten a bad batch of pads, but it's something to note for prospective buyers nonetheless.
Wish I would have read the reviews. :( over 5 dollars for 1 folder. Wish I didn't have to give 1 star but it's required.

I am cursed when it comes to postage scales! I had bought one before this that would not register any of my light weight stuff, returned that one and then finally thought I'd try another one. I carefully read all the reviews for this item and although there were a few that said it did not work most raved that it was perfect for there home business shipping needs. I have a growing home business and NEED a scale to better be able to determine accurate shipping. I was excited when I got it but upon putting the batteries in I found it to do NOTHING!! It wouldn't even turn on...NOTHING! The good news is I was able to return it and I am going to brave it one more time and order a different scale, different brand and try it one more time... if the next one doesn't work I am going to resort to a mechanical scale.

I am amazed there are any reviews better than one star.  I must wonder HOW that happened!  I could tell NO improvement in my scissors from using this sharpener. A waste of money, of time, and of good emotion! (and yes, there are other kinds of sharpeners that do work!)

The cartridge I replaced made darker copies than this new one.  I will be putting the old one back in.  A total waste of money!  Bought it because it was a genuine Canon product.  If I could give a 'no star' rating I would.

I have purchased this item  SIX times before and always gave 5 star reviews.  This time, I'm changing it to 1 star because the notebooks received are not the ones pictured.  I wanted the solid coloured notebooks.  The one that arrived are black with a gold pattern and white with a gold pattern.  The quality also feels different. After purchasing this item 6 times previously, I am very disappointed.

This was a great replacement cylinder for my frame, 6'4" 300lbs, until it wasn't.  After 4-5 months it will no longer hold me up.  Very disappointing, the original cylinder for my chair which was only rated for 300 lbs lasted longer.

when I loaded the cartridge into my printer the error light continued to blink as if it was not in there.  I put the old one back in and it worked fine.  This is not a compatible cartridge.  upon further review I noticed there was a definite difference in construction.  It was not sitting all the way into the printer because of this.

the board came bent and the magnets are not strong enough to hold onto the fridge.  I thought there would be enough reward magnets for the kids to put one for each chore throughout the week, there are only 2!  Overall it was the right concept for me, but the fact that the magnets are not that strong and the reward magnets are not plentiful enough made me give it a low rating.

US Postal rate changes went into effect today, 5/14/07 and Royal has not provided updated rates for download onto this scale.A call to customer support revealed there was no definitive date when the rates would be available. "Try again in a couple of days."This is an unbelievable failure of customer support.This equals lost $ for you as you tediously look up rates on a chart or on the internet, and wait for the rate update that is coming who knows when.The RC40's value is its ability to quickly look up rates. Not having current rates available makes the RC40 no better than a scale costing $5.Although I must admit the RC40 makes a very nice (although expensive) paperweight.

7/25/19 Updated Review:  After using these cartridges, print quality decreased significantly!  See below original review.  I had to revert to using the brand name cartridges for my printer and still print quality did not improve to what it was before using them.  Now my printhead has failed and I have to purchase a new printer!  Please beware of using these types of cartridges.These print cartridges are suited for my HP which the website said they were.  Print quality is horrible.  Im beyond my return window as my previous HP cartridges lasted longer than expected.  I just threw them away after only a few printings.  Total waste of money.
It broke as I stood on it, not 300lbs rated.

While this is a stylish device and the reviews were great, mine has broken within 3 days of use.Now going back online I have no way to return it, even though I just purchased it.  Buyers beware!  Spend more money and buy a stapler that takes regular stapler too not these small staples that you can't just buy at the store.

I was so excited about this beautiful stamp but unfortunately it doesn’t make impressions as pictured.  Mine NEVER stamps the complete name / address despite always being on a flat & solid surface. I’m so disappointed as there are many gorgeous options in this price range and I chose the one that doesn’t actually do what’s it’s made to do. Giving 2 stars only because the plastic portion is solid and the mechanism works well... just lost the other 3 for the stamp that doesn’t actually stamp.I would submit a photo as an example but with it being an address stamp and all... I won’t.
I ordered the 6 colored pack of five star notebook spiral college notebook size 9.5x6I received 6 black Cambridge limited planners 11inch x8.4I'm so disappointed

I bought this cart for the film industry, and I have to push this thing through all kinds of terrain, including grass/dirt. I bought this specific item on the sheer belief that it would come with the wheels pictured. They are small rubber wheels instead of the bigger ones with treads. Now I have to go on a wild goose chase for better wheels and my job starts in less than a week. I really wish they would send me the other wheels considering I bought them based on the photo. I searched and couldn't find any written explanation of what the wheels were like. I've read other low star reviews and they too say they were somewhat mislead by the images.

Just wrote a review and wanted to quickly update.  The Parker Jotter Bond Street is still $14.  from Jet Pens.  (Other Parkers are $18.50) .  I just placed my order for a Black,  Bond Street, along with  Pilot Hi-Tech- C Maica,  Pilot Mini fountain pen, ( I already have the Pilot Metropolitan)  a few Global art handbooks Quattro  +++ more stuff)  I write this so you have an idea my preferences.  I have no affiliation with Jet Pens--just discovered them recently.  (PS-  Re: Jet Pens, The Parker Jotter comes with blue ink.)  Really guys,  do yourself a favor... Buy a REAL pen......not one that runs out of ink in less than a month!!!!!!

I ordered this HP combo ink, never expecting any issues because it is HP brand, right?  Well, I installed the new color ink and only a trace of the yellow showed up on the first page I was trying to print. No other colors worked at all.  I went in to look at reviews and sure enough, everyone was having the problem.  So, I decided to ask for a refund and find somewhere else to buy new ink from.  I went to Walmart and still leary that the ink cartridges might be defective based on reviews I had read on Amazon, Walmart and Office Depot sites.  Bought the new ink from Walmart anyways.  Came home, installed them and a message came up telling me I had just installed genuine HP cartridges.  I did not get that message when I installed the ink cartridges I purchased from Amazon.  Not sure who HP used to manufacture these cartridges but they are either bootlegged or made at an inferior manufacturing plant.  Just saying.

Not at all impressed. I purchased this due to the overwhelming positive reviews on Amazon. Took it out of the box, loaded the included staples (made sure none were loose) and attempted to staple a stack of 40 sheets of paper. 5 out of 7 attempts resulted in bent staples that didn't go all the way through the 40 sheets. Part of the staple would be jammed in the stapler and part would be jammed in the stack of paper, leaving me trying to separate the stack of papers from the stapler.Not sure if I got a dud or how so many other people had a positive experience, but I've had it less than 10 minutes and it's frustrated me enough to prompt this review. Back in the box it goes.

I wish I would have read the reviews and the measurements. This is not a standing desk unless you're 5 ft nothing. The top part is not flush together because of how the metal is prethreaded. I wanted something cheap to roll my laptop around on for assessments at work. I guess I can get an 18 inch tall box to put on top to make it work lmao.

original review: works well, no problems at all installing or running. Nice dark print.revised review:  after a month, started leaking badly, to the point where it made a total mess n the inside of mt printer, let alone the printings had terrible dark smudges. Finally had to throw it away.  A shame, as previously I had bought this brand 3 times with no issues, so perhaps a quality control issue has developed with this brand.

Pillow feels hard and can't determine exactly how to sit in it. When sitting all the way back it cups the glutes in weird way and when move more to the center of the pillow it doesn't allow lumbar spine to be protected by a chair. Coccyx pain a little better when sit in center though not as helpful when sit towards back of cushion. I find it rather high as well. Experiencing a significant increase in T-spine pain perhaps due to alignment/cushion design.  Orthopedic Surgeon recommended a memory foam cut out pillow and that seemed too hard so returned it for this one. My Physical Therapist suggested a donut hole, however most reviews on that indicate they are too wobbly and I need stability. Oh my tushie woes. Sitting for any length of time is excruciating on coccyx and I need to start sitting to build back some lumbar and T-spine muscles following surgery on sacroiliac I had 6 months ago. I am going to bring this pillow to my PT and get her thoughts. As far as helping coccyx, I feel it does help take pressure off, it just feels weird to have to sit in the middle with back unsupported. I'm very small by the way, under 100 lbs. Will write back if PT has any insights to share. Good luck.
Was hopeful based on the reviews. But I shouldn’t have purchased. And unfortunately cannot get a refund as I purchased over summer for my classroom and am just getting to use them. Buyer beware.

The small black pulleys as shown are perfect for in-class pulley demonstrations and exploring simple machines.  I ordered 6 bags of these.  However, what I received was two bags of the pulleys pictured and 4 bags of cheaper, crappy blue pulleys.  I've requested replacement pulleys...I'll adjust my rating when I get what I actually wanted.
Why is this a 2 sided poster?  It really makes no sense. Misleading... I really should have read the reviews.

Long time customer, very happy with 99% of all products purchased. We package a lot of products for the recreational cannabis market and needed a waterproof flexible label for a line of beverages. We ordered the 2.5" vinyl labels and they printed great on a HP Color Laser Jet Pro on the label setting.I can't rate something higher than 1 if we cannot use it regardless of how cleanly it prints, looks, or even how fast it arrived. Sorry to say these are a waste of money or extremely old product. If you have to spend 2 mins removing a single label which we have yet to be able to accomplish then it FAILS all categories. Labels should peal off without effort otherwise hand application is totally a waste of employee time. It shouldn't take an hour to label 30 beverages when it can be done in 2 minutes with regular high gloss labels.
Didn't work at all!  Waste of money, was dirty like they just poured ink in an old, used cartridge, don't order.  Would give 0 stars if possible.

I should have paid more attention to the reviews of other customers.I have had other laptop stands in the past.  This is the first one that I've seen, where the lowest setting is at such a steep angle that it's impossible to type with any degree of comfort.  I realize that some people just use such stands to raise the screen to a more comfortable eye level, but there should still be at least one setting where the keyboard can actually be used, without having to bend one's wrists at an extremely unnatural angle.  (I realize that an external keyboard can be used, but that sort of defeats the compact nature of the laptop, at least for me).I'm giving it two stars, rather than one, because I really like everything else about it.  If they would modify this and add one or two 'notches' with a smaller angle, I'd buy it again immediately.  However, I'm returning this one.

I reluctantly bought these toners and looked through the reviews before my purchase.  These toners were a mistake, I have blue streaks over all of my pages.  I ended up buying HP toners to replace these before they were used up and will likely have to take my printer in to be cleaned.  Very frustrating.

I love the concept! But you can’t move it from surface to surface and if it peels off it looses it’s sticky. You get one shot to place it, because if you mess up, it’s not sticking back up. I gave adhesion 2 stars as it will stick, just not a 2nd time.

I didn't have any problems at all with the Internet-based rate update, unlike others reporting problems here. Unfortunately, though, the scale is a huge pain to use: you place an item to be weighed, hit HOLD, then the "shipper" button to select the carrier, then the "service" button to indicate delivery type. Only then do you see the rate. It then requires three keystrokes to prepare to weigh another item, after which EACH of the steps above must be repeated since the settings aren't persistent from one weighing to the next. Bottom line: this scale is functional but not really useful; it's clear that the people who designed this don't actually ship packages very often, and that they didn't solicit feedback from anyone who does.

I use amazon for the fact inks/toners/drums are always significantly less. When I opened this item, it was in a brightly colored box that says "Laser toner cartridge". The model number is DR-350 (which is a Brother Drum Unit) but the description beneath it says Black Toner Cartridge. I will have to be more careful next time because once it arrived and wasnt in the original brother packaging I went back to my order and realized it said "brother compatible". I havent used this item yet, so I do not have a review on its performance. I am hoping to have good results like some of the reviews I read. It was priced right, so I hope to get good use out of it for my companies fax machine.

The blade on these letter openers are exposed way too much and it is too easy for a fingertip to slip in there.  I've almost sliced my finger a few times reaching for one of these in a drawer.  Surprised at all the 5-star reviews.  These don't work well enough to justify the risk of injury.
As several other reviews mentioned, the moment you put fresh batteries it reads low battery. I thought I'd try and see if I'd get a good one. Nope. Returned it.

I have absolutely no idea how these pens have such fantastic reviews. I've received two different free samples of these pens and they didn't work either time.  Personally, I enjoy pens that work and write smoothly. To get the BIC 4-Color Ball Pen to release any ink whatsoever, I had to scribble all over the paper I was using. Not only did it ruin the appearance of what I was attempting to write on, but it also stopped releasing the ink about ten seconds after it had finally started. I wouldn't recommend these pens to anybody. I'm sure there must be a better multi-color pen in the world, and if there's not, you can always just buy a bunch of different colored pens that actually work. Trust me, you don't want to buy these. They're nothing but an absolute pain.

I usually never do reviews on items but to help give back on deciding what fooor May to purchase I caution to whoever is considering. Although this mat seems to be durable, it lacks the stiffness of being a “hard” mat for the chair to easily roll on. I would not recommend this product for carpeted floors.

I bought this for my Calais pen. When I put it in, it would not fit. The converter is too long and the pen would not screw closed at all. The pieces in the photo are pushed together as much as I possibly could without damaging the pen or converter. And to make matters worse, I had to pay more money to send it back than the converter cost! So now, I'm stuck with a pen converter that I cannot use, and a pen that has no ink(the ink for a cross pen is way too expensive. I will not pay over a dollar for a single cartridge that isn't even filled all the way). Listen to the negative reviews! If you can't find a positive review listing your pen and sating specifically that it works and that they like it, DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!!!

I think I have already submitted this review but will do so again.  The 18C1523 Lexmark Black Ink Cartridge is fine and working well in our printer at this time.  The 18C1524 Color cartridge was not fine.  Although I had, in the past, ordered an ink cartridge in damaged packaging with good luck (the cartridge worked in my printer), this time that was not the case.  Amazon has approved the return of the cartridge for credit, and that transaction is still in the works.

I'd give this five stars because a friend finally figured out how to install the needle correctly...it came with zero instructions...nothing..not even a product id...empty package...just tag gun...how rude.

I want to say this product is great, however, while installing one of the locking wheel broke. I spoke to the manufacturer and they said for me to contact Amazon. I've searched and I don't know how I can "contact" Amazon about this unless I basically take it apart and return it so I can receive another one. I don't want to take it apart. It is for work and all I need is that locking wheel replacement. I just need that locking wheel replacement. So I'm writing a review to see if I can get a response back. HELP!
This did not hold items as the reviews and description stated.  I was disappointed when I took these on a cruise and could only hang bathing suits on.

Like others have said, the headphone amp is poor quality.The belt connects to bluetooth, but you have to plug your regular headphones into the woojer itself, in order to use it.When you do this, the quality of the sound that you are used to hearing in your headphones will drop.  To me it sounds like some of the bass is filtered out, to be used by the woojer, rather than your headphones.  There's no reason engineers shouldn't be able to figure out a way around this.Cool, fun, but needs some improvement before I could use it as a producer.  I suspect the backpack version has similar issues.On high power it heats up for about 3 hours before the battery is done.The comfort is the only thing they got right.  Nice strap and shape.  So, 2 stars instead of 1.Hope a competitor makes a better version of this!

The desk is easy to assemble. Ok for the price, but I feel I can easily find better with the same price elsewhere. The base structure is solid, the board on top is questionable. I wouldn't put too much weight on there. Metal is very soft, I stripped most of the screws when putting it together. I did not use much force, was also very carful. The locking mechanism for adjusting height is also poorly designed. They could have put some holes in the bar to support the locking but nope, just a screw tightly pushing against the bar and hoping that it won't slide down. Given that most screws are stripped, I won't be able to take it apart to return it. Will see how long it'll last.Update: it’s been under a month and the right side of the table table already snapped off. I did not put much weight on there just a plate of snacks. Changing the rating from 3 stars to 1.

Edited opinion: My first response was that these were great... I used these cartridges for about a year, then I turned up the volume on color prints. At which time I started getting blue and yellow lines down every page. (Even black and white only) It became a mess. I spent hours cleaning every nook and crannie with q-tips and a vacuum.  I could not get it to stop. I read a lot of reviews about not using off brand toners. I finally caved and paid for the Brother cartridges. But before I did, I did another massive and thorough cleaning. (More q-tips and a vacuum)It has been a year since I converted to name brand cartridges and my prints have been perfect. I don't think these machines were built for the generic refills, or the generic refill companies don't care about the life span of the machines. You decide.

Not like the picture the paintjob is scratched off and looks like it's been previously used and likely returned and then sent to me, this was intended as a xmas gift but due to the rubbish quality I can hardly give it away too close for a replacement however I'll be requesting my money returned looking at other reviews its a common problem with the writing being missing on delivery and shoddy paintjob elsewhere, avoid no quality control and it could be nothing but the box has a space on the back which reads "apply official sticker here"

I have never left a review, positive or negative, regardless of how happy or pissed I was, but this prompted me.
