I tried rolling left to right, up to down, and vice versa....could not get the full stamp to stamp on an egg. Looks like an ink blob that a few might resemble a chicken, but forget having our farm name on it.....absolutely awful!

I didn't think I needed to read the reviews on a Sharpie but here I am wishing I had.  Doesn't work. Dried out.  No refunds so I'm stuck with it. Don't purchase from this vendor. It's bad karma to take people's money and sell a bad product.
I wish I would have read the reviews before purchasing these. Because they were completely dried out and none of them worked. Super bummed!

Well, I should have read the reviews first but I purchased this at the store and didn't go online.  ALL of our Save the Dates for our **WEDDING** are falling apart and now we need to redo them.  Thanks a lot Elmer's.  Paper doesn't stick to paper and ribbon won't stick to paper. How on EARTH did this pass quality control. How did they not check this?  Do not buy this product. You will regret it.
This product does a good job weighing packages, but the calculator for determining rates to foreign countries does not work.  It's a frustrating machine.  I would not buy another one.
This product is very cheaply made. Looks like a product I saw at the dollar store. Would not buy again. If I could use a negative star I would
Some pages missing. months are out of order, binding coming undone. Only gave it one star because I had too... VERY poor quality!

February 2021 Update:These didn’t last more than a few times and completely dried up.  I was very happy with them initially but unfortunately they didn’t hold up for too long.  I would not purchase again. I changed my rating to 1.June 2020:Bought these pastel colored highlighters, they work really well until now, I have not had them for long enough to know when they will dry out but they seem to be working fine as of now.The eraser  does not work as well on all types of paper.  On some paper it eats away from the page itself so it becomes a little rough. On the very smooth and shiny paper it smudges a little.So it really depends on the type of paper but overall I liked the product and I like the shade of each one.

The contents of the quill kit lacked no less than three of the six presented quill tips. instead they were replaced with, in my opinion, inferior tips. I don't expect to receive any sort of remedy to this marketing error but i would like the various customers to know that what is presented may not be what you are getting. I have taken the liberty of taking a photo and attaching it to my review. the overall condition of the pen, box, ink and wax was as displayed but that is really thing preventing me from marking this as a 1 star review.
Staples constantly get jammed. Hasn’t worked from the start. I threw it away. Next time I’ll listen to the reviews

I was looking to save money and purchased this toner cartridge after reading some reviews. when I loaded the cartridge into my printer the orange error light continued to blink. When I put the original HP toner cartridge one back in the error went away. This is not a compatible cartridge. My LaserJet pro M15W printer does not recognize this cartridge so I will be returning this product. I should have purchased the HP cartridge for little more money.

Many years ago, an earlier version with the same stock number was my go-to notebook, but then it went out of production.  The chief selling point was the combo of light green, smooth paper and light blue lines - very pleasing to use.  However, the new version SUCKS.  As other reviewers have noted, the grid lines are VERY heavy, to the point where it's visually distracting and irritating.  I'll use this one for scrap paper.  The manufacturer should get a clue.
This product broke about a week after purchase. Not nearly as strong as advertised.However customer service was incredible, gave me a full refund after leaving this review

Impossible to use. Not sure if mine is defective, or if they are all like this… but I’ve never worked with such a frustrating double-sided tape before. I literally cannot peel back the protective film to expose the other sticky side. I tried for 15 minutes, trying to be hella zen about it, and ended up having to resist the urge to hurl it at a nearby wall. Needs a backing paper, or just a better overall design or something. Also. Negative points for adhesion on the one exposed sticky side actually being super weak. Seriously unsure how it got all these positive reviews! Complete garbage. Back it goes!!

I read the review that stated that it did not print the amount of pages as promised, however I decided to run the risk and have my own experience. Well it did not hold up to its promise. I had to change the in a about a month. I just when ahead and purchase the brother drum unit.

I purchased this and superman and while this one worked for longer the button that turns the light on got stuck. Very sad cause I love the pen otherwise but it if doesn't work I can't give it a good review

For the cost I find it very cheaply made. Two stars for the fast shipping but the top lock came broken and I had to turn it upside down to get the latch to push back in as the keys were in the top drawer

Let me just start by saying that i don't usually complain, or leave negative reviews, but in this case i don't have a choice. My first pen lasted 1 week and then the black ink started leaking. It messed up my uniform, and I had to throw it away. My second pen lasted half a day- the ink was dry, I guess.. It ' s very annoying, when you are in the middle of writing  something important at work, and you have to switch from black to blue, from blue to green, etc. simply because there is not enough ink in any of them. So now I am left just with one pen, and I don't think it' s going to be any different from the other two. The product is defective, the seller is not too accommodating, will never purchase anything from his company again. I wouldn't  recommend it  to anyone.

Love the colors and multiple options in sizes, also comes in a small, tidy package.  However, it has a deceptively slick surface that makes writing on it a challenge.  Ink pens do not work, and Sharpies rub right off unless you let it sit for several minutes to air dry.  Even then it can smudge.  Last, the super thin ones are too flimsy so writing on towards the outer edge makes the tab move and the ink smear.  If these had a matte surface, they would be a 5 star hit all the way!

I went ahead with an order for these peanuts though I was a bit concerned about one reviewer indicating he had received considerably less than advertised.  The order arrived quickly and I was very pleasantly surprised about the shipping.  Rather than being in a bag they were in a sturdy cardboard box.  The external size of the box was four cubic feet and it was jammed packed full of the peanuts.  Making allowance for the inside dimensions of the box, I still received a bit more than the 3.5 cubic feet indicated - there was definitely not a shortage.  Although the order said the seller's name was Bubblefast, the return address on the shipping label said TheBoxery.  Not sure what that means, but it might mean some regional affiliations to reduce shipping costs.  I live near Philadelphia and the shipping point was Ridgewood, NY.  Others in different regions may not receive the same type of package.Incidentally, I priced peanuts at a local office products store and they were over 2.5 times the cost.The above order was placed Nov-2013 and was definitely a five star experience, which is what I rated it at the time.  I placed a second order April-2014 supposedly for the same thing.  However, things were not the same.  This time a company called Starboxes filled the order from somewhere in Florida.  The package only contained 2-1/2 cubic feet instead of the 3-1/2 that was ordered.  And, that package was a flimsy bag instead of a sturdy box.  Because of the shortage, I changed the rating from five stars to one star.  I find it totally unacceptable for the order to be short by almost 30%.As a follow up note to the second purchase, I complained to the seller.  It took a several emails back and forth plus a picture of the bag as received, but they agreed to refund the prorata share for the missing amount.  The person I exchanged emails with stated that the picture showed the bag had come open at the top and some had spilled out.  I am a bit doubtful about that because adding another cubic foot to that bag probably would not allow it to be closed.As a result of the refund, I have upgraded my rating to two stars.  I at least got what I paid for on a unit basis, but the process of getting there was unsatisfactory.

I will need to follow up on this review, it seemed to work okay.; my issue was that it made a loud clicking sound so I returned it not knowing if this is normal. When I receive the next I’ll have a better opinion

I bought several of these green and pink pens. I loved the colors and the ratings were good. I hoped to be able to gift them. When I received the pens, I loved the cushioning, the heft, the balance and the feel in my hand. The ink is a big disappointment. I have kept them but will not gift them. I will also try to find non-Pilot refills whose ink won't blot or bleed.

1) Puts all pennies & nickels in the "Nickels" tube, and nothing in the "Pennies" tube..2) Every 15 - 20 seconds it jams so hard it can't clear itself . Requires digging coins out of front of machine with a probe.3) Cannot even retrieve coins rattling around inside, so I'm returning my coins with the machine.This is the worst thing I've ever bought from Amazon; sorry I can't give it zero stars. Should be discontinued.

Upon arrival, one was already broken. But they are very pretty, and have a firm hold on then. Their width is perfect for closing chip bags and so on. Only reason I'm giving them a bad rating is because, in the couple weeks we've had them, using them gently/normally, three have broke. And one has rusted or something. So, not really worth the money. Sort of a waste.

I only give it 1 star because it is impossible to write a review with zero stars.  Purchased in January along with a Brother printer.  The original just ran out so I pulled out this toner and installed it.  The Brother printer prints 1 page then the error light comes on that indicates an open door or jammed page in the paper path. Neither of those is true.  After various attempts to turn off the light it seems that if all of the levers are moved on the toner and then it is reinserted that another single page will print before the error light comes on.  This is not compatible.Opened up the brand new BROTHER BRAND TN-420 that we also purchased and installed it. That worked immediately and has printed numerous pages so it is very obvious this Cool Toner Compatible is defective in some way or the Brother printer just does not like it which means it is not really compatible.  Purchased from  Compatible Brother TN450/420 Toner Cartridge HL 2240D/ 2270DW High Yield Toner (2,600 Yield) -Sold by: Top Dog Inc

Over the past 25 years I have used a number of different kinds of staplers. When Covid hit, I needed a high capacity stapler for home office use.  I chose the Swingline 70 sheet capacity one, and for about 9 months it worked fine.  I would say 70 sheets is pushing it, it prefers more like 50 - 60, and starts to show its less than robust design as you move towards its claimed capacity.  Setting that aside, the real flaw in the design relates to the impact plate which creates the fold in the staple after it drives through the paper to be stapled.  At some point about 9 months in, it just stopped  bending the staples correctly, and each and every staple was a jam, not in the usual sense.  The staple would be driven through, but then on the backside, the staple would not be folded in on itself. Instead it was just jammed straight back, usually breaking the staples in half.  Basically the stapler no longer works at all.  I am using the Swingline Optima staples.  I reached out to Swingline Customer support.  After week of not hearing back from them, I have decided to simply post this review.  Swingline had the opportunity to reply, but chose not to, after all it's a $33 item, and I am but a single customer.  Poorly designed stapler, combined with nonexistent customer support equates to a company not worth remembering.

Have bought many carts from Inkjetcorner over the years.  Good prices but I have finally had it with the defect rate.  Usually 1-2 are defective in each shipment- leaking, not recognized, etc.  But in the last batch all were defective.  Will not seat- not recognized.  Using tape to hold them down- still 1/2 won't work.The "good prices" evaporate when 1/2 of them or more are defective and have to be thrown away.Just one person's opinion, but I wouldn't buy from them.  And I won't again.  Check Amazon.  There are other choices.

Well I read the reviews and took a chance and ordered one.  Not sorry I did; but mot entirely happy either.  First:  unit arrived earlier than expected...thats a plus.  When I took it out of the box I heard ‘rattling ‘ inside the counter.  The online description said ‘starter pack’ of coin wrappers.  If by starter pack they meant 4-pennies wrappers, then yeah, mission accomplished.  On to the machine itself:  its easy to set up, rather ‘quiet’ for a coin counter.....and yes; it jams....a lot.  I opened the back of the machine to clear a jam and found ‘small chunks of hard plastic’ in with the stuck coins.  Something on the inside broke off and had been spinning around with the coins.  The machine runs ‘ok’, but I have to only put small amonts of coins in the hopper at a time.  Definitely not worth the money.  Would have been better off with a manual counter.

Pros:  I was impressed with the ease of putting the stand together.  All parts were well marked with small ABC labels - and the labels were either on the underside or in a place where you wouldn’t see them if you didn’t remove them once the unit was put together.  I think I checked every assembly point and from what I could tell, the stand only goes together one way and I really liked that.  There was very little verbiage on the instructions and it was almost all pictures (which isn’t really a pro or con).  The cart rolls really nicely.Cons:  The top is actually in 3 pieces and they do not completely meet because of the underneath supporting bracket.  More importantly, the supporting bracket does NOT hold the top level at all.  I saw that another reviewer suggested using washers and I tried that, but it’s still not level and I’m afraid that it I add more, the screws won't support the top.

Don't buy if you're taller than 5' 2".  The handle is just too short.I'm 5' 5", & if I use it for as little as 30 min, my back stars aching.  Of course you can pull it behind you, but then what's the point of swivel wheels,?

I read all the reviews about how it's super difficult to load, but a reviewer posted instructions. And, since it's the #1 seller and their were thorough instructions, I gave it a whirl. I received the gun and went to the reviews to get the instructions, and nothing. It just didn't work. I youtubed it, nothing. It's a piece of junk, basically. Maybe I just got a bad one, but what a waste of time!

The first 10-15 pages printed great, then the print got all blotchy and faded throughout the pages.VERY DISAPPOINTED!! After reading the reviews I though I would give it a try and save some money, instead I just wasted my money big time!!

This is rated for 300lbs I weigh 150.  I just had knee surgery two days ago and am finally able to shower. Thought I would use this to sit on in the shower to prevent slipping or falling. Jokes on me! Thing completely gave out from under me. Luckily I felt it giving and was able to catch myself from falling completely in my butt. Hunk of junk don’t waste money on it!
The lead and the metal point won't stay put when you try to screw them in, rendering this thing useless.  Would give zero stars if possible - returning and shopping for a different one now.

I finally found a compass that does not move when making the arch.  If you are looking for one that actually works, this is it.  Extra lead is awesome.Above is my original review.  After using this for a couple of weeks I have found some serious issues with it.  The "C" clamp that holds the compass together gets looser the more you use it and this causes the compass to become unstable when it is opened more than half way.  I was able to tighten the "C" clamp for now but this will be an issue throughout the life of the item.  The little screws that hold the the lead and needle in place also come undone very easily.  I am assuming this is why they give you extra dials.  They, however, do not give you extra screws for the dials.  I can no longer recommend this item after experiencing these flaws.

1 star because 0 stars is not an option!I purchased these for the purpose of printing CPD certificates for personal records so they were printed using standard/basic quality NOT for photos or high quality documentation, no graphics just a header and the the certificate information.Firstly the inks were not full, the black showed approx 25% full while the colours were 60-70% full after loading, consequently I’ve managed to print 30 pages and now they need changing again- that’s £1.20 per sheet…..Don’t buy these!
Doesn't deserve 1 star. stool came cracked. DO NOT BUY! TJE PRODUCT SPECIFICALLY TELLS YOU NOT TO USE IF CRACKED

I never write reviews, but felt the need to warn others before they waste their money. I’m a teacher & bought these as a Valentine’s gift for my students. You can barely smell anything. However, I DID smell the rubber erasers, but not any of the flavors; “dandy candy apple, sour drink fizzy lemonade, jazzy razzy cotton candy, fudgie-wudgie ice cream sandwich, strawberry cupcake sprinkles, & groovy grape lollipop.” I am EXTREMELY disappointed with this purchase & will NOT be wasting my money on future purchases.

Thick and stable feeling, but like other reviewers mentioned, it does NOT lay flat on the table even with the sticky bottom. Surprisingly the slopes on corners did not cause any problem in terms of movement, however if you rest your mouse on the leveled edge and click on it the pointer moves (this was going to be a 5 star review until i realized this)! Wrist rest is not as soft as some other brands but definitely have the quality feel to it. Overall okay purchase, will not return but will not recommend to someone who needs "precision" as much as I was hoping to get.
I tried to make a large circle, spun the wheel, and poof, it came apart and is impossible to put back together,  I don;t know how it got such a high rating.

The bearing on one of the wheels in this order messed up within 6 months. Purchased on August 4,2019. I sent an email to their contact number about a week ago and I got no response at all. I even sent a picture of the wheel showing the problem. No response from them at all. That is why I gave the rating I gave. I will change the rating only if they make good on their warranty. This review is dated 2/24/2020.

I replaced all the ink at the same time and 2/4 colors were not recognized by the printer..I reinstalled everything 20 times and still doesn't work. Can't print.Maybe if it works or the seller responds, I'll update this review.
1 Star - due to the fact that the "Replace Drum" light indicator is still on.  No information on how to contact E-Z Link to assess the problem.

I got this to replace an old thrift store Boston sharpener that finally stopped working, after allowing me to dissemble and service it a few times before it gave up the ghost.  This vertical Bostitch worked well for several months and could sharpen both standard and colored pencils. And the primary users were my kids. But then one day it quit working. And I tried to take it apart to service it for clogs, wax buildup, or whatever the problem was, but this thing was not made to be serviced or troubleshooted. It is what companies would call disposable. That was disappointing for me. I was hoping that with a little TLC, it would work again, but it's design makes that impossible. To replace it, today I paid about 30 for the X-acto School Pro. While it is not supposed to sharpen colored pencils, this model can handle different sizes of pencils AND is the company made it serviceable and refurbishable with replacement cutters. There are a couple of versions from Bostitch that have the option of having a replacement cutter that I seriously considered, including EPS10HC and EPS11HC. But based on reviews, I went with X-acto for a replacement for this vertical Bostitch. And after visiting with X-acto on the phone I learned that they will be releasing a new version of the School Pro and Teacher Pro that can handle colored pencils too.To get back to this sharpener it is inexpensive and works great UNTIL it doesn't work at all. If you have no qualms about not being able to unclog or service it on your own and are fine with buying a new one every so often, then this is good choice. But if you want to do some basic troubleshooting and have the option of replacement cutters, look elsewhere.

Been looking for planners and it is hard to find the right planner. Gave this one a try based on reviews I read. It definitely has structure to it and questions daily to make you think. I found this to be helpful to structure and prioritize my day. The issue was the size of this planner. It is big and online pictures did not really do justice on the size of the binder. I carry a small book bag and could not fit this in. I switched over to Panda Planner and like the flow, size, and structure of this better

i was looking for red .5 pencil lead and this was one of the first things that show up. first off the search and title is misleading, i was led to believe that the stuff would be red. when it was time to use it thats when i realized that i should have looked at the reviews first. lead is a normal color its the case that makes it look red :/
So I bought these in advance as I need to replace each color.  Well, the yellow is not recognized by my HP8600 pro, so I can only give partial good rating.

I had high hopes for these pens as there are many good reviews. So when I saw them in a lightning deal for less than $30 I decided to give them a try. I'm pretty disappointed. I have not used all 48 colors yet but I've probably used about 20 or so of them. Of the one's I've used, 2 of them were dried out (or nearly dried out) and as such, the tips frayed when I tried to use them. And one of the green ones arrived with a frayed tip. So while that one has enough ink, I can't make smooth or thin lines. Then two more have dried up after using them a few times (so they weren't full). There are so many good reviews that I'm tempted to think maybe I just got a rare, bad batch. But since they're so pricey, I won't be buying them again.

The stand does not like to stay up or locked in. It slides when just putting your hand on it. It doesn't stay in one place other than in the lowest place possible! The worse product i have brought from amazon ever! If I could rate it 0 stars i would

If I could give less stars I would, my printer would not print once I change the ink cartridge to this, I also purchased a color one I didn’t need yet and now I can’t retuen either so I’m out the money for this purchase that doesn’t work

I actually hate that I can only give this product 2 Stars. I have ordered 4 total of these planners. I have received 2 in perfect condition and 2 missing multiple pages and important parts of the planner. For example, one was missing the monthly calendar pages. WHAT THE HECK? This is a planner - I need monthly pages. Another was missing the weekly planning pages - which to me, is an important part of the planner. The inconsistency is so frustrating that I likely won’t continue using this planner. I’m quite bummed about it as I have really gotten in the routine of this planner (I’ve also read Brendons book “High Performance Habits” that goes hand in hand with this planner.) Overall the idea is good - execution is not! 50% error rate is NOT GOOD.

I ADORE Peel-Away stripper.  It's fantastic.  I reviewed it separately.Peel-Away PAPER is a giant rip-off in my opinion.  Plastic wrap, or painter's masking plastic, or thin gauge wastebasket liners work better.  And they're a lot cheaper.
As mentioned in earlier reviews - cheap dollar store item. You can get it at half the price at the dollar store. Do not buy it - you will only be dissapointed.

The design, size, shape, personal lock use all made me purchase this item. Mixed reviews and price along with arrival during this virus pandemic made me choose this item, however.... while I love the design the construction is mediocre. I purchased for my mother to take her medicine from her pharmacy, home. Even for that use, I will have to modify for her to use comfortably. The seams on the lid are all open and not sealed, which makes the corners super sharp. If you're using for a kids bake sale money drawer, a medicine box to keep away from kids, this is fine. If you're actually trying to keep someone out, vs a minimal deterrent this would not be a good item for you.

I see there are a number of positive reviews for this sharpener. My experience has been just the opposite. Perhaps it's a matter of quality control, because I've tried using the Friskars for sharpening a variety of scissors with little or no success. My unit was USELESS!  Dull in, dull out.  Find another way, even if it costs more.

If I had written about the Tdbest Highback Mesh Office Chair while I was attempting to assemble it or trying to decipher its operation I would tell any interested buyer to find another chair.  In fact I am still not certain that I have correctly attached the back to the seat or the headrest to the back,  or if I have the armrests on backwards – for some reason they wobble but they do that even if you reverse them.The horrible instruction sheet is good for a laugh and thankfully not representative of the overall engineering and workmanship.  The instructions consist of a single 12 x 8 inch sheet,  which is blank on the back.  The instructions are not so much written directions as crudely drawn illustrations each of which would need little reduction to be fit on a microdot.  The tiny font with part's names is too small to read without magnification.  Yet when you magnify the parts list you get the bad news that two washers on the list are missing,  there is an open spot in the shrink wrapped panel containing the other washers and bolts.  This is cause for alarm until you magnify the other six images and realize that it is impossible from the crude drawing to be sure exactly where these should be placed.The missing washers are easy to miss because they are simply taped inside the flap of the chair's cardboard box,  with no effort made to indicate that they can be found there.  If you logically concluded that they were purposely not included and assembled the chair without them you will later be faced with the exciting chore of using a rubber mallet to pound out the gas cylinder that fuses to the base when inserted.All that said,  the materials and craftsmanship appear first rate and the value is probably comparable to other chairs in this price range.  But I would check out the alternatives until they put some effort into improving the instructions and adopt a better packaging fix for the washers.

I agree with other reviewers that this product is misrepresented and overpriced. It is a very small white board with colored columns, a dry erase pen, and 2 magnets. I'm not sure why they even bothered including the magnets. This product would be much better with several magnets because the dry erase stamp stinks for marking chores completed--it's so difficult to make a perfect star that it frustrates my children (who erase-stamp-erase, etc. because they want a star to appear). And lastly, the magnets supplied with the board are not strong enough to hang this on the fridge.
The first one I ordered arrived DOA and so did the replacement, I would give zero stars but you have to pick at leaset one star

Never could get beyond the set up---won't calibrate.  Eternal online help with hp, has resulted in me having this for months with all the given paper used up still trying to calibrate.  Now that I see how much I'll spend in ink, I am hoping to unload this worthless item somewhere.BTW---should be a 0 star rating.
Not sure where all the great reviews came from, but this tape is quite weak. If you need to hold a metal paper clip, then this tape is for you. Anything else, good luck.

I think this thing is a piece of junk. Seriously save your money. It was okay at scanning slides... just OK. The images Are just as good as the light bulb in this box which isn’t very good. I will post the pictures I scanned versus having the same scanned at Costco which is what I ended up doing. It would take years for me to scan all my slides with this device. Way too much work to make this worthwhile.  The scans of prints were simply not acceptable and my $50 printer by HP does a better job.The reviews of this thing make me question the validity of any reviews on Amazon. I find it hard to believe any of the 5 star reviews could be true.

Normally I don't write reviews if I agree with most other shoppers, but I just had to this time.These got enough good reviews that I decided to take a chance. DON'T! Every bad thing someone has said about these is true!They are mangled and bent.Yes, they are cardboard, but I have some that are and they have been around since the '80's. Not sure they even qualify to be called cardboard.Yes, I can return them, but ugh, wish I had never seen them!

I'm astounded that Amazon continues to sell this brand of rubber bands.  As many reviewers have noted over SEVERAL YEARS, far too many batches deteriorate within months.  They turn hard and brittle, and they snap apart in no time.  Many people give it good reviews because it just got delivered, they haven't seen what happens in just 2-3 months down the road.  AVOID THIS CHEAP JUNK!!!

At most 300 dpi printing, this cartridge went light after a few hundred copies. After that, it seems to run toward what's expected, but light, even at 600 dpi (no difference).  No warning light at any point. Fortunately or unfortunately, I bought two, and finally gave in today and installed the second.  Will see.  For now, this is the worst of the aftermarket versions I've purchased.  The one-star is to warn others.

Looks great, Fair quality. TERRIBLE ADHESION!!I would have given this 0 stars on adhesion if I could. We have plaster walls and one sheet completely fell off of the wall in a few hours. The edges lift up and do not stay stuck.I did read the reviews and one suggested to lay the paper flat for a while for “maximum stickyness”, well I did that and it still fell off.Don’t recommend for plaster walls.

Weekly reviews are so important for high performance. The main weekly review has 30 questions.Almost all of these talk about the 'day'.e.g... rate the followingI was intentional in how I acted today 1-5I knew the feelings I wanted to generate today.and on and on...This is a daily review... not a weekly review. Very badly put together. I would be very suprised if this is what Brendon Burchard uses. More likely to be a company asking him to promote it.

Fast delivery and everything works great.** Update **  Initially the Cool Toner Compatible Toner Cartridge worked great.  Print quality was good and no problems.  However, after using about half the toner contents, we started to see severe striping on multi-page print jobs.  It has gotten progressively worse the past week and we finally replaced the cartridge.  Still, at $22.50 per cartridge, it was better than the OEM cartridge.  Just don't plan on getting the number of print jobs you would expect.  I am dropping my rating from 5 stars to 2 stars.  Sorry, but the proof is in the pudding.  Looked good initially, but the taste diminished rapidly. I would probably try another brand before I came back to these.
after reading the overall good reviews i purchased this item. after using it 1 day the product broke into pieces. it is made of cheap hollow plastic. very flimsy. not recommended for purchase

Works very well and rounds up the staple legs, but the following stapler - also by Swingline - is much easier to use. On  that one, the handle moves further, so you don't have to press as hard - it somehow swings down ('er pun intended!) and the larger leverage seems to get the staple in with less force needed. (But maybe this one has an advantage that you get more exercise! It's like the gas prices; some say cheaper is better; some say worse - because more driving = more pollution!!! Gotta see the positive!) Swingline Stapler, Optima 70, 70 Sheet Capacity, Reduced Effort, Silver (87875) It goes up to about 60 sheets then starts hiccuping.If you need even higher capacity this is the one: This one: https://smile.amazon.com/Swingline-Heavy-Stapler-Capacity-39005/dp/B0006HUPU2/ref=sr_1_38?keywords=swingline+staple+remover&qid=1564720745&s=apparel&sr=8-38Both work well. (Note: Although the larger one has a significant amount of one-star reviews, I believe it's just becasue people were not using the correct staples. You cannot use regular High capacity staples with the 39005; you need special Heavy Duty staples which are even thicker than the ones for this stapler.

Didn't have as much toner in it as I was led to believe.  After minimal printing ( and just text without graphics) iI'm already having to order a new one but will buy from another vendor. Please let me know if you found this review helpful.
i did not read reviews for before purchasing. what a rip off. 1 folder for $8.

My first model didn't work.  OK, that happens.  I called DYMO for support and they FedEx'd me a new one.  It works but only with USPS.  The ad for this model says it works with UPS.  But that's only partially true.  It weighs and you can manually input the weight into UPS Worldship.  However, it does not activate with UPS Worldship and allow you to place your package on it to be weighed and then transfer that weight automatically into Worldship. I already had a scale that would do that much.  But I thought I was upgrading to this one because it had a USB connection and the ad said it was compatible with UPS.  I'll be happy to change my rating of this if someone can show me how it works.  DYMO support sent me a configuration file to add to the UPS .txt file in the UPS Worldship software but even after doing that, it won't work.  I've been on tech chat support with UPS for over and hour now and am getting frustrated.  He's pretty much telling me it isn't compatible. I'm tired now and sadly disappointed.

I think the idea of this is absolutely awesome so don't hesitate to buy based on my review. I imagined it would have an itemized approach to planning, instead this is goal oriented and broad scope based. Very reflective. I will use this congruent to my daily planner which I believe will prove to be more effective to me personally.
The price I paid I should have gotten 5 folders...the product title implies more than 1 folder. If I could give this zero stars I would...total rip off.

I bought this board because it had so high reviews and seemed to be on the bell-curve for money-value. This is one of the worst purchases I've ever made on Amazon.Platform:The pictures are very careful not to show the backside of the board - because there isn't one! The inside is completely hollow, there is no back, and the metal feels just barely sturdy enough.Feet:The rubber feet cannot be put back in once they come out. Mine came with a foot out of place so my board will forever teeter-totter.Blade Lip:It does nothing except keep your fingers away from the blade, and I feel it makes it harder to line up your items by eyesight. This reduces the function of the cutting board to only cutting by precise pre-measurements using the guides printed on the board. More often than not, this lip actually gets in the way of the blade.Blade Lock:Perhaps the only thing on this board that works as intended.Blade:DULL, DULL, DULL. It could not cut through a single sheet of paper! A cutting board is supposed to cut through stuff and since it can't actually do that, the only thing it's good at is warping/folding paper in strange ways and with a lot of annoyance.SUMMARY:If you just want to play with your divorce papers, and fire doesn't bring you enough satisfaction, you can bend the pieces of individual paper to your exhausting pleasure, because it can't actually do anything else.

This stamp looks more like a ransom note erratic letters than a professional stamp.Going for an artsy look? Only need to stamp a few things? Ok- this may work for you.Want to do business level professional looking stuff? Get something else.The letters are TINY and tedious to install. They are easy to loose.  They aren't easy to line up.I can only get 22 letters on 1 line even though I read higher in other reviews. I need 24 on one line and it won't fit.  There aren't enough larger letters to do 3 lines I needed either.The larger font doesn't include ( ) or - for a phone #.  The smaller font is just to small in my opinion for some people to read clearly.The quality of the stamp is awful as it won't stamp several spots, no matter how hard or light I press.I was looking at a quick and cheap option for a business stamp and it won't work for that. Because it won't stamp clearly, I can't even keep it as a home address stamp. I've wasted over an hour trying to set it up and make it work properly.

Tried gluing thick paper to cardboard.  It couldn't be smoothed to get rid of air pockets.  Didn't work on thinner paper at all.  Completely soaked through and smudged ink.  DO NOT USE FOR SCIENCE FAIR PRESENTATIONS!I'm giving it two stars because it does make my hand sticky enough to be annoying while typing.
Got maybe 25 copies out of this cartridge - not very close to 2600 is it???  If I could, I would have put minus star.  First time I've received unacceptable item from Amazon.

I was excited about this. Fairly good reviews, fast shipping, fairly easy to put together. Got it in my office all set up. I noticed one side being a little flimsy so I turned it upside down and tightened it. I tried lifting it back over and it broke. All of the nails came out. Returning. Piece of junk!
Zero stars. My printer rejected this ink HP63XL color saying it can only be used for older generation printers that use HP63 ink. It doesn’t match up correctly. Cheap knockoff. Don’t waste your $$.

I've had this trimmer for about two weeks now and used it quite a bit.  No problems so far, and when I cut thinner paper with punched edges I start from the middle on out to avoid ripping the delicate edges.  The knife is still sharp and cuts easy, and the trimmer feels solid for the size.  Pleased with it, hopefully it'll be easy to purchase replacement blades.Update, 4-28-11:I've had to severely downgrade my rating based on the terrible replacement blades:  they shred the paper rather than cutting it, the posts don't fit into the opening without force, and last night the blade protector slipped off while I was trying to get the ill fitting replacement blade out again and deeply cut the side of my index finger.  None of the thus far six replacement blades have worked smoothly as did the original one.  I bought the replacement blades at Michaels, and the package says "for the paper trimmer".Since I'll be looking for a new trimmer I have to say this one is a waste of money based on its short life.

So bought these and installed them.  The back seat belt exploded and broke when we hit a bump while my kid was starapped in.  Then a couple days later I went to strap him in again on the other seatbelt in the back and it exploded and broke.  So now within a month of use 2 of 4 are totally broken.  I messaged them to get replacements and have heard nothing back.  If they would have handled this correctly I would have not left this review.  I am very upset as this is an expensive item.  I will be contacting amazon about a replacement or a refund.  DO NOT BUY this product .

I don't write a ton of reviews, but I do read them. Now, I wish I'd paid more attention to the warnings. (Also, I'm going to start writing more reviews, because they really are my basis for ultimately purchasing or not purchasing!) I've tried EVERY way and still cannot get the wheels on the base of this stand to be level! I plan on returning it as soon as I have the time to disassemble it- yet AGAIN!

I don’t think I have ever written a review before. Normally I don’t complain because I am in customer service. PLEASE Do not buy this. I get it, it’s cheap. I should have known what I was getting into. Legit it is so unstable in the tip option that my laptop has fallen off three times in a week. Not cool. It does not tighten enough to actually ensure the table is solidly still.

**UPDATE - September 2016** Just threw away 4 more pens for leakage and lowered my rating to one star.Sorry but these are pure JUNK!I've purchased several sets of gel pens over the last few years and these performed the worst out of all of the those sets.  A lot of the colors skipped or didn't color at all.  A few of the caps would not stay on and fell off inside the little bag I kept them in and a few exploded. Having said that my purchase was not a complete loss.  Some actually managed to do a good job and performed beautifully but not enough of them for me to make another purchase or even recommend.  From the amount of 4 and 5 stars this product received I would have expected a far better product.

I’ve never had this happen to any high end ballpoint let alone a Mont Blanc. I realized it must have started to crack after 7 months as it was not writing as smoothly. But just today I couldn’t twist it shut and it just fell apart. Never getting again unless it’s Amazon Prime. Very bad quality. I just ordered from a genuine seller authorized by Mont Blanc that offer a 2 year Warranty and serial # with certificate which can be checked online with 100% money back guarantee. I cannot even contact my seller 5 Star Brands since probably they no longer are on Amazon.

I like the size and it is a really comfy fit in my hand. the trigger to light it is easy to pull (even with my arthritis) however I was really excited about the flame lock that claims you can use it for over 30 mins with it locked. mine doesnt work. whenever i try to lock it the flame just stops. I tried before lighting and while lit. it just doesnt work. such a bummer. there is also no button to press to unlock the torch so if it is hanging out in your bag without something on the handle ( it comes with a small black plastic piece to fit over the trigger (easily lost)) it could get bumped and light potentially starting a fire. just be aware.if the torch lock had worked i most likely would have given this torch 5 stars.

Bought this unit for my Mother as a gift sometime ago and within six months it stopped working all together!Whats ironic about this unit is that whoever sets it up (me for example) it only works for! Giving this as a gift it was annoying when it only would recognize things (which it barely did) from my own voice versus my Mothers voice which it had an extremely hard time doing. The lists were ok but they never were that useful to be honest. Also it takes WAY MORE TIME to actually create a list than to write it down.The real reason why I give this a two star rating (and believe me that is generous) is because when you purchase this item it comes with batteries, and for a couple bucks more and so I thought piece of mind i bought the extended warranty. To my dismay the unit stopped working (reasons unknown) and the batteries that were included in the box leaked causing more concern. Upon calling the company to complain and try and get a replacement i find out that battery leakage is not covered by the warranty even if they supplied them, also the replacement fix fee was almost as much as the product to begin with.Needless to say Brookstone and there products lack quality and in my opinion are one heck of a scam company. Will never recommend or buy another product from there again! Do yourself a favor and write down your own lists and save the headache and money!

Beware, this item collapsed on me after one week of usage and broke into several pieces. (I weigh 200 pounds and it is rated for 300!) Fortunately I was just sitting on it and not standing, when it literally pancaked in on itself and broke apart.

It did work for about a week then my printer wouldn't recognize it. I contacted the sellers, and they sent me a whole new set of cartridges with updated chips. The printer started working again, but colors wouldn't come out and anything with color came out streaky. The black seems to be working ok, so I give it two stars for the black and the fact that my printer works now. While I appreciate the sellers trying to resolve it, the color cartridges don't work. So that is disappointing.

2 out of 4; that's how many I bought and did not work. I bought 2 pairs and none of the black ink cartridges worked. Didn't complain because they were cheap, but since I got an email to give an review... there it is.

I see so many positive reviews for this product but mine are garbage. They have a little ink and then go dry. I tried to use these with my students and I don’t see any suggestions on how to get ink to run to the top again. So, so disappointed to buy these for $40 and I can’t get through one art project.

I have the same issue as most other low reviews here in the fact that the lead is sanwiched between slick painted metal sides, so the let slides no matter how tight you get the adjustment screw. I even tried a pair of needle nose pliers to get it as tight as possible and it still either moves around or slides back up into the arm. Would not recommend this for anything useful.

I'm used to gel but reviewers said foam was good too.  I found the foam wrist pad feeling very warm, and my wrist was sinking in more than I life. So back to gel.But the other thing was ugh, the pad part started showing scruffy marked up areas within minutes. I have an optical Logitech mouse that I keep very clean. One plus of a new mouse mat after many years of good service with the old one was that it would look fresh and clean. It was clear this one was going to look rode hard and put away sweaty very quickly.The pad is a very thin lightweight foam-- it tracked well enough, but it is annoying in not just laying down flat right away. It might relax over time, but the under side where it did lay down near the wrist pad is not in any way sticky so it slides a bit too easily on a wood desk top for my taste.This is all probably just personal preferences-- can't say the product is defective in any way, so it might suit someone else very well.

I usually read the reviews, but this had high ratings so I just ordered it.  I would return it except that amazon wants,6.00 to return a 15.00 book, so maybe I can pass it on.  Obviously a,lot of people liked it, but it's not for me.  The print is way too small and the pages feel cluttered.  Of course the big thing I would have known if I had read the reviews is that it is not a full year planner, only 60 days.  I think that is something that should be stated in the short description.  Alas, my search for the perfect planner continues.

Do not buy this; I should have paid attention to another review that said they received a used sharpener.Not only was this item used, when I opened the package [had been taped up] carbon dust and pencil tips in black and multiple colors got all over my hands and clothes. If this is a joke, not funny.
DO NOT BUYYYYY!!! NOT BUILD RIGHT was missing factory whole for the screw to go in  had to make a whole myself READ OTHERS REVIEWS disappointing..
Does not fit WF-3720 as advertised. Not even close numbers don’t match. Complete rip off. Your gambling if they send you what you ordered. This isn’t the first review like this. I gambled and lost...
I haven't seen this many bogus reviews in a while.

This sharpener came with good reviews when I purchased it, but I have been very disappointed with it's performance.  It does get the pencils super sharp, but it constantly breaks the lead off in the machine and then I have to unplug it and try to get the lead out before I can use it again. I would not recommend this sharpener.

Short review.....this product is garbage and my trepidation over the price was confirmed.  It has a glitch in printing where the copies come out a jumbled mess of smudged print along the edges and completely white over about 85% of the center of the page.  I removed the cartridge and had to manually move the wheel that appeared to be stuck, then it prints fine.  Only draw back to that fix is it repeats the problem at random and this morning (for the second time) it ruined an entire batch of coupons my wife prints to buy groceries...in a typical shopping trip she saves between $50-75 per store.  There are limits on how many you can print so we are left with useless coupons that cannot be reprinted....this cartridge has actually cost us more money than we paid for it.....throwing it out and getting a real cartridge ASAP

But be warned! The process of installing the cylinder is easy, but removing the old one is a whole other story. Make sure you have the following:1. Rubber mallet (Hammer if you're desperate and don't mind some marks)2. WD-40 spray3. Screwdrivers (A good set of them, I use Oria)and, if you can get one,4. Pipe wrench.The pipe wrench apparently makes things much easier (I didn't have one and sacrificed lots of WD-40 and time with the hammer). I would highly recommend doing the job with that. And, finally, the job can get greasy and messy. Be warned, and don't wear your good shorts like I did... don't be like me.UPDATE: So it's been a few months, three to be exact. This thing keeps sinking gradually now. I don't really notice it until I get up and sit down again later. What's the deal? Changing from 5 Stars to 2.
Got here and 3 letters didn't light up. If i could rate it a 0 i would. Don't waste ur money!!
These printed a couple of pictures and then stopped working. Would give zero stars if I could.

I started using the pen to mark some articles.  The ink is great and disappears when it drys.  The Red is very bright and shows up well under the UV light.  The Blue not so much and the Yellow is ok.  After about 5 minutes the tip sort of broke down and looked like a mop.  You could not really right with it and then it dried up very quickly.If the tip could be corrected I would give this set 5 stars easily.

I'm looking at my Amazon ink orders and how the cheap but highly functional "off-brand" ink lasts me over 6 months, and then I thought to order a set of the more expensive HP ink which ran out at about 7 weeks, not a cost-effective move.Even if the off-brand ink eventually messes up the printer (which it does not appear to do), it's cheaper to replace the printer than to keep using HP ink. And I agree with another reviewer, that the HP automatic ink refill program is a rip off—unless you want to make it yet another priority in your life to either stay on top of your HP ink use and pages you print with it, or pay HP for all the ink service. Heck, the printer tells you when it's running low, why don't you just order it then?
I do not like the scent.  It's lather is not long lasting.  It does its job as a shaving soap so it gets 2 stars.

Would give zero stars if possible!  Horrible! Save your money! This started making random ink marks, blobs on anything we printed. We took it out and tried shaking it and putting it back in, but still printed random garbage on pages. Put the old Dell cartridge back in and the printer worked fine.  Very disappointed! Will never buy this brand again!

For those who gave it five stars, you were lucky to get a good one. As for mine, the coins always end up  in the wrong slot. Some fell out  in the tray,  sung fell out  on the floor.  there are still few coins  left  in the machine. I don’t even bother to get them out.
This toner does not deliver sufficiently black characters. I would rate the results as a 'draft copy and will probably have to 'bold' the source to obtain an acceptable result!

I received this ink and it's for ASIA PACIFIC which means the printer will reject it and won't work in the United States.PLUS Be very careful if you did purchase this and didn't read the reviews until afterwards and need to return it....Ensure that you mark Product was defective or something and contact customer service.They charged me a $120 RESTOCK fee ....currently in the hassle of getting that back!
Definitely read the reviews. I too thought that I was ordering one box not one refill. 🤦🏻‍♀️

I wish I would have gotten something better instead of going with something inexpensive.  You cannot add your own pencil into this compass.  It mentions a lock, but I'm not sure what lock it's referring to.  The spinning gears don't qualify as locks, in my opinion.  As your lead runs low (which happens quickly), you'll struggle to get a new one put in accurately.  The space is very tight (even when I 'loosen' it) and my leads have broken.  Only giving it two stars because it does what it's meant to do.  If you plan on using your compass regularly, get a better one.  If you only plan to use it a handful of times, you can get by with this one.

I didn't see the previous review which showed this, but this does not fit the classic century. The description is wrong. It is the same diameter as and longer than the barrel, so there's no way this fits the pen.

The one star is for the good clip at the top of the ball.  This was suppose to be for my grandson but the color is so dull and the outside material feels a little sticky.  It just doesn't feel good in your hands.  Actually, it didn't help the stress.  It increased it because it wasn't anything like it should have been.
Item jammed and will not sort on the first time I used it. I usually laugh when reading 1 star reviews and the person complaining about a product but this product is a piece of junk.
I'm a little over 200 and from the way it feels under me I don't understand how it can have a 300 pound rating.

I bought a set of the two compartment meal prep containers to take lunches to work, on road trips, etc. The glass container itself is very heavy and sturdy and easy to clean, but on day one I have two main issues:The lids are a flimsy cheap plastic, on the level of the disposable containers from the dollar store. They warp and bend easily and are the kind of oily feeling plastic that stains and holds smells. The seal is glued into the lid and can't be removed for cleaning so any food particles that get in there will never come out. You can't put these lids in the microwave or oven, though some other reviews say you can freeze them.The divider in the glass container only goes halfway up, defeating the purpose of having it at all. If the container tilts at all the contents of the two compartments spill into each other. The container is awkwardly large and does not fit into most lunch boxes unless you tip it on its side, at which point it's pretty much one container. If I had seen these containers first I would never have bought them and I will avoid this brand in the future. You can get much better containers for less money from several other brands. My Anchor glass rectangle containers from the dollar store are less than half the price and much more functional!

Purchased from OfficeBee.  Mine left grey area of toner across to 1/2" of paper. Two stars because it's not totally useless but no higher since I cannot use it for any prints where a good clean print is required.

I was excited about the pens when they came. The colors are nice, they write very smoothly, and they don’t bleed through the paper in the journal I use. All great things.However, I got them on March 26th, it is April 10th and the black one (that I use the most) the nib on the tip is pushed in. It still writes, but I have to hold it at an awkward angle (almost straight up and down) or it’s very light and/or skips. I do not use a lot of pressure when I write either.So if you are getting these for ocassional use for doodles in a journal or planner, they would probably hold up okay if you were careful. But if you are getting them to actually write with, they don’t hold up wellI went back and forth between 2 and 3 stars but ultimately I feel like any pen should hold up longer than a few weeks.Edit: April 15th. Less than a month and the black pen no longer writes at all. Even if I hold it straight up and down. Seems as though the ink has run out. Changed this to one star.

i don't know how they're getting so many poz reviews (hp envy 4500). i've been a computer tech for 25 years and have changed cartridges a bazillion times. Lesson learned on not buying HP cartridges. Filing for the cost of the new printer in small claims court. Amazon offered a $5.00 credit. How does that compare to the $140.00 for a new printer and HP cartridges for it? I denied the credit so I can win in court.  DO NOT BUY!!!

I think the pictures speak for themselves don't you!!!!??? Horrible product I will never buy this again and I urge Anyone who reads reviews about this product not to buy it seriously you will get ripped off!!!

I wish I could give a minus rating. Unlike most purchases, I did not read all the reviews before I bought. BUYER BEWARE if you intend to PUSH THIS ON CITY STREETS.  As long as you are PULLING the cart or PUSHING IT ON A TOTALLY SMOOTH walkway, this would be fine.  I took this out today for the first time, in the streets of NYC. I fell twice within 5 minutes, when the front wheels locked. The locking can result from a crack or a pebble in the sidewalk. I now have bruised rib, legs, knees and hands and have made an appointment to see a doctor.  I see reviews here which are 3 years old and yet the manufacturer has done nothing to correct?  You can see from the photo, how terrible my fall was - the front of the cart is bent and one of the side wires broke off.  I had a cart for over 20 years which I so regret getting rid of.  I used this for 5 minutes and returned home.

This review is mixed because I ordered two. One was fine but the second one would not click to close so would have been unsafe to use. I returned it to Amazon with no problem. It did come with a one year warranty
Eh, this is ok. Like the rest of the reviews, it doesn't read out weights less than a pound..it's heavy and kind of just eh.

Like other reviewers have said, the bracket holes do not line up. My picture sits crooked on the stand. Really a bummer....and why are they manufactured this way. Seems like a basic thing. So weird! I would not suggest buying.

I received the pencil as a gift.  After reading excellent reviews of its quality, I was looking forward to using it.  Unfortunately, it didn't even last a week of use.  The advancing mechanism for the lead no longer worked and after frustrating attempts to get it going, it remained unusable.  I can't give it any better of a rating than a single star.

ADVICE - Don't buy unless you intend to use them within the 30 day return period.You should check the box as soon as it arrives and return it if you received damaged cartridges.Most of the cartridges in my shipment were damaged with broken tabs just like in the other reviews.These were not damaged during shipping since the box was perfect.I only found this out after 30 days so I had no recourse.

I purchased this along with the Beautique Round Metal sharpener since both got good reviews. But the Beautique is the one I prefer. This sharpener makes the point of the pencil too long. While this might be desireable for some applications, like coloring pencils, it isn't great for my eyeliner pencils as they tend to break.
I would love to review this product but I was charged for it and never received the product!

I gave this two stars because before it fell apart, it seemed to work well enough for my purposes. I'm not a serious crafter, just need sharp scissors around the house for projects and everyday household purposes. It worked fine for that. However, one day with no warning, it just fell apart as I was using it.  Very flimsy, and no way to put it back together. I would not buy this model again.

The box is flimsy, it doesn't sit flat, the latch is attached at an angle and has to be forced over the hasp, and - as another reviewer noted - the corners are not smooth and could cut someone.  The only reason I'm still giving it 2 stars is that it can actually be locked shut with a small (luggage-sized) padlock.  Very disappointing.
