When you go to try to close them flat against the paper, the clip part goes flying off---under great pressure, because it hit a wall about 6 feet away from me! That's why I recommend you wear safety glasses. And if you're sending paperwork to someone with one of these attached, you might want to send them a pair also, so you don't get sued when they lose an eye!And once the clip goes flying off, good luck getting them off, because it's only the fulcrum-type leverage of the outer clips against the binder part that opens them up.Also, when I eventually got the binder clip removed (after hunting around on my hands and knees for the clip), it left a rust mark on my paper. They're brand new, and I'm in an air-conditioned, dehumidified house, so...Lastly, there's the size. When I clicked on this item, I wasn't aware that binder clips came in such a small size, so I didn't pay attention to that part of the description. Shame on me. But be aware that these are teensy little bitty clips, and may not hold as much paper as you're expecting.I'm rating them one star, because of the eye safety issue when the clip goes flying off under pressure, which I feel is a serious danger. There should at least be a warning. You can see from the video that it doesn't just fall off, it's so fast you can't even see it leave. One minute it's there---and a tenth of a second later it's six feet away hitting the wall! I'm not sure what velocity that is, but it's seriously approaching escape velocity for a moonshot.
In my opinion the product received does not match the rating. The mylar's like a dirty window that can't be cleaned. Cutting the loss and disposing of the lot.

This thing is difficult enough to find the right angles (it would help to be an engineer), but my problem was not me after all: the button on one of the leg sections won't pop back out and the leg won't lock.  I can't give a good review because I haven't been able to use it.

4/2022 update - I bought another cartridge from this supplier "Generic" but only later realized through the review system that this used to be called "INK4WORK".  I wouldn't have bought from them if I had known because my last cartridge from them didn't work well.  This cartridge is much different from the standard Brother cartridges - not nearly as deep.  It fits but the print is light.  It's maybe 80% of the darkness of my old toner cartridge which is running out of toner.I bought this toner from INK4WORK and it worked fine, but the printing got very faint after only 1200 pages and it's supposed to be good for 2600 pages.  I opened the plug to check and the toner is almost gone.  The only good news at this point is that I was able to remove the flag gear & spring and transfer it to the original Brother starter cartridge, which still has plenty of toner left in it.  My usage has been mostly just text - not heavy graphics.  I've never had a toner cartridge last so much less than the rating before.

These are pretty terrible. I guess you get what you pay for - but after reading all of the other positive reviews about how well they worked and how easily the ink came out I was optimistic. Some of the pens are better than others, but I don't think it's work it to waste your money. Save it for better pens.

Face is so large and cookie hard to maneuver in rooms along with the fact that it hides  and hard to get to any of the TVs connections  apparently too late to return and is now $10 cheaper posted on line  very disappointed  if there was a 0 star rating it would be 0 star

The space between the plastic body and the blade at the butt end is large enough to receive a substantial cut if the opener were to be grabbed near the middle of the unit.  Poor design.  This addendum  (11-01-17) adds to the already bad news to this super shabby product:  Today I lost my fourth and last "letter opener" to a single page letter, just like the previous 3.  Not  only are these "gadgets dangerous to your fingers as stated in my original assessment shown above, but they snap apart at the most reasonable pressure to open an envelope containing a one page document.  In all my transactions with Amazon this product has to be the most dangerous  (especially to children and older folks) and  of decrepit quality that I am embarrassed of it's purchase.  My only purpose  not to delete my previous rating is to warn people about this piece of dangerous crap.
I checked YT and other sources for reviews and this stuff does not work at all as advertised.  They used chia seeds in the ad to fake the blackheads.  It's made in China.

The bar/dowel that provides support for the bottom of the basket does not stay in place. The bar/dowel is just inserted through the perpendicular bars on the bottom sides and there is nothing to keep the bar/dowel from sliding out of place. Therefore, the bottom of the cart falls/collapses which makes the cart useless. When walking back from the grocery store, I had to stop approximately every few feet to push the bar/dowel in place. I was only able to use the cart once due to this issue. My last resort to attempt to salvage this purchase is to try a butterfly nut on each side of the bar/dowel to see if that will keep the bar/dowel in place. Otherwise, this purchase will be a complete waste. I have never posted a review for anything, but decided to finally post (I got this item several months ago) a review with the hope that it will prevent someone else from wasting their money on this item.

This was on sale, and the idea of real wood vs. particle board was appealing. I should have known better.First, it is small. I knew this going in, and wanted a smaller unit, so no problems there for me, but if you are looking for a lot of storage, I would look elsewhere.Now the problems:On unpacking it, I noticed that the boards felt very light - they are pine, but they might as well be balsa wood. I decided to give it a shot rather than returning it immediately.On the very first step, placing the wheels into one of the bottom support  boards split it in half down the middle. This was while following the instructions to use padding when putting the hardware in. I requested a replacement piece from the manufacturer, which took two 2 weeks.Once I finally got that back, I picked up assembly where I left off. The wood is so soft that you have to be extremely careful not to overt tighten screws (even by hand), because it can drive the screws too deep into the attached boards and cause chips and cracks.The next thing to go wrong was placing the top on. The holes were not aligned correctly and one of the wooden dowels was too thick, so it was a struggle getting it attached. Just applying force to seat the top correctly created a new crack in the top.Attaching the back to the cabinet and the bottoms to the drawers involves driving small nails into narrow strips of wood. These are much too small, and even a slight miscalculation results in the nails splitting the wood or coming out of the side. Again, the wood is much too soft, so splitting chips out even with these tiny nails is a real possibility.Finally, even after making sure everything was square as per the instructions, the cart wobbles, and all of the drawers stick at points sliding them in and out.I like the concept of using real wood but this is just not well designed, not is it sturdy enough. I saw a reviewer is putting their printer on it - I would not trust this unit to bear up under more than a couple of pounds. To be fair, it's only rated for 10lbs on top - which should give you some idea how flimsy it really is.Save yourself some headaches, and get something a bit more expensive - better that than the frustration of assembling this and the frankly poor end result.
I only received 8 cards when description says 10. Now I don’t have enough cards. I should have considered the other reviews stating they did not receive what they bought…
Would have given it a five star but was missing the handle and Rubbermaid told me they did have any in stock

I purchased the 2 pack,  installed the first cartridge and it worked for 12 months, printing 400 pages and it started to produce horizontal lines across page.  I cleaned the drum, also removed cartridge and tipping horizontally back and forth to distribute toner .  Still produced bad lines. Installed second cartridge and worked perfectly.  Description of vendor says it is rated for approx 2000 pages.  I feel this is too high a price for 400 normal text pages.  I will not buy again if the second cart does not last much longer. Hard to recommend!

I originally wrote a positive review, however, this is an update. The first cartridge I used in this 3 pack worked fine but I literally only got 100 prints out of it before it started fading and not printing at all. The second cartridge would only print on half of the page. The third prints fine, but I only just started using it based on the first 2 failing so I do not have confidence that this will hold out any better than the first 2. These cartridges may work but for me it was hit or miss.

I should have read the reviews before I purchased. Rookie mistake. This is basically printer paper that is gold. It is NOT “perfect for weddings” or whatever nonsense the description spouts. I was going to use it for my seven year old’s birthday invites and it’s not even suitable for that. Certainly not a wedding.

I really like these pens.  The colors are great.  The only drawback I've had is that some of them tend to be "scratchy" and don't color as smoothly as I'd like.UPDATE  Right after I posted this review, I heard from the supplier.  In order to make things right, he offered to replace the scratchy pens at no cost, plus I didn't need to return the original set of pens.  I am still waiting for the replacement pens.  That's why I dropped him to 4 stars.  I even tried to get in touch with him via e-mail without any luck.UPDATE #2As of today, I haven't heard anything from this supplier.  I'm dropping them to one star.  I'm stuck with these pens.  Don't waste your time or MONEY!!
Cheap quality I should’ve read the reviews before purchasing these mailers boxes are flimsy!!!!! DO NOT PURCHASE.. boxes are not white

Horrible! Would give zero stars if possible. Right out of the package, there was toner everywhere as if it leaked. Once cleaned up and inserted in printer, would try to print one page and received "Inside paper jam - remove drum & toner unit..." There was no paper jam - ever. Turned printer on/off, unplugged, removed toner, reinserted - numerous times. After 2-1/2 hours of wasted time trying to make it work, ended up having to make emergency run to local office supply store and purchase OEM Brother toner cartridge.Removed this "compatible," inserted OEM Brother - BINGO! No more error, no more problem. Obviously something wrong with this toner cartridge. Will not purchase again.

I like the size, balance and smooth writing.  After years of using the defunct PHD pen, in search of a duplicate, I came across this one.  Why 1 star?  After receiving this, I easily unscrewed to look at the replacement cartridge so I could order more.  There are no threads, grooves, fittings, etc to put it back together.  Sadly, another cheaply made piece of plastic for the landfills.
If I could do ZERO stars I would. These did not work at all!

These are expensive and it (SILVER PAINT) worked great right out of the box.When I started using it, I gave it a 5⭐️review.After all, I do love SHARPIE markers.HOWEVER, after a few months, the tip wouldn't pass paint anymore and the paint simply blobs and drips out of the wick❗️Even if the fine-tip has paint in it, something is plugging up the very end of the tip so that the paint will not transfer onto the item you are writing on.Other reviewers have shared similar experiences.The tip works as two pieces:A thicker paint-absobing cylindrical "wick" fits into the metal cup holding the fine-tip-wick.  By drepressing the tip into marker, paint is suppused to get wicked up and flow into the fine-point-tip where you can use it like a pen.It works very well, AT FIRST.The entire wick-tip assembly became so loose that it easily popped off of the marker when trying to clean it.Shaking; dabbing; trying different angles; nothing would get the fine-tip to smoothly run the paint anymore after less than 9 months of ownership.The marker shakes just fine, and the paint is very fluid.BUT NOW THE PAINT SIMPLY FLOWS AROUND THE BIG WICK AND DRIPS A BIG BLOP OF PAINT DOWN AND OVER THE FINE-POINT.It uses very little paint when working, so it can last for a very long time, BUT WHAT GOOD IS IT IF IT WON'T WORK AFTER A FEW USES?I tried cleaning the fine-point-tip with alcohol.It cleaned up perfectly, it absorbed paint again, but it still wouldn't flow properly through the tip as it did when first purchased.It seems as if the end of the tip hardens and acts like a plug on the paint trying to flow through it.Either way, WHAT IS WRONG WITH THESE THINGS!

It's very hard to "at a glance" see which child is supposed to do what chore. Two of the colors are so close in coloring that it's very difficult to determine who is who. It wouldn't be a problem if you could dictate to your children which colors they could use (and if you didn't need all four colors for four children): however, my three chose their own colors and of course two of them are closely matched. I find myself spending too much time looking at it to try and determine who is supposed to be doing what. If the stars were bigger and of different colors - perhaps this would be a good choice. I also purchased other chore charts which I like much better (they are for each individual child) - but I still need one for those chores that they share during the week.

Can’t give a rating on the product as this is what I received! Damaged box that was taped up, only 7 markers, and two stencils! And now I have to return and wait longer when this was needed for a project tomorrow!
Quite nice, and feature rich.My only issue is that the mouse pad is lumpy and wavy... Moving a mouse around it feels not at all right. If it were flat, this would be a 5 star review.

Took a while for these to get here, but hey, this is the price you pay when you're too lazy and cheap to go to your friendly neighborhood office supply store and get brand new ones yourself.  Some people call that cheap... we like to call it thrifty around here.  This is a situation where thrifty didn't pan out quite as expected...Our black ink cartridge was the only thing that had run out at the time I placed this order, although the others were starting to get low.  Being the savvy planner I am, I decided it would be best to stock up on everything all at once, since printers have a tendency to run out of ink at the most inopportune times and I wanted to have them on standby.  After we replaced the black cartridge, it worked fine for printing 5 sheets of paper.  Then, the lines started.  And they got worse and worse and worse, to the point where you couldn't read anything being printed.  Finally, we reserved ourselves to the fact that it had to be a dud, and we replaced it with the other one.  It now prints gray instead of black... but hey, at least it's printing text that is actually readable (how's THAT for the silver lining in the cloud?).When we tried to replace the color cartridges with these new ones, oh the delight that we were able to experience.  The ink leaked EVERYWHERE.  It dripped on the carpet and stained fingers.  Since this happened last weekend and Easter is this upcoming weekend, I came up with the explanation if anyone asked that it was an accident dying Easter eggs.  Thankfully, no one asked.  I can't imagine the looks we would've gotten considering that we are two grown adults with no young children.  I'm still trying to get the ink out of the carpet and it took a few days for the skin to return to it's natural hue.  We have the same problem with the color cartridges as the original black cartridge - there are lines everywhere from the ink not printing properly.  The silver lining with the color cartridges?  The color is a nightmare to get of the carpet and off the skin, so at least you know it's good quality.I wouldn't recommend these cartridges at all.  There were so many other positive reviews that I can't understand what happened here.  All I know is that we won't be ordering any more of them.

As a miser trying to save money I got this vs the official Brother option, but I'm not stupid, so I read plenty of reviews.  This cartridge worked for about 15 printed pages then stopped.  The printer just blinked error.  I followed the instructions to fix this that others suggested.  This fixed it for a few days, rinse and repeat...  Each time it became harder and harder to get this cartridge to print anything, eventually it just stopped and I couldn't get it to work.  I got maybe 25 pages total out of it.Begrudgingly, I spent triple the cost of this on the official TN450 Brother cartridge...put it in, error stopped flashing, printed out of the gate and has been printing since.
Took a while, but wanted to review after I used. Said HIGH YIELD, but only got 2683 impressions. WILL NOT ORDER AGAIN!
I ignored some bad reviews and though I could make this work, but they were correct. This thing is pretty awful. Even with the correct markers it stains and it will never lay flat.

The overall product was cute.  All but the fluorescent green highlighter on each “flower” was dried out when they arrived. Some reviews we’re negative and others were good about this product, but, I thought I would give it a try and I wish I didn’t. I would not buy again.
No bad review regarding the actual pen. But I received the plastic version instead. Frustrating because this is suppose to be a gift!!

Printer didn't accept this cartridge. On pushing it further in and restarting, it started recognizing the cartridge. However, it says "Low Toner" and the test page came very faint. Buying another brand now.Two stars because my last purchase has worked perfectly fine.

This decal was awful. It did not stick to the wall. I even used glue dots to keep it in place for extra reinforcement and it still curled up overnight and fell off. Total waste of money. I would give zero stars.

I saw the reviews and thought I would take a chance.  Bad idea.  It was a waste of money.  Yes, it was compatible.  My HP printer accepted it and printed for about 5 or 6 pages and then nothing.  Not fading, just nothing.  Completely out of black ink.  Had to go to the store and buy the real thing.  This was a rip-off.

I wish I could give this no stars. I ordered this quill to look great with my Harry Potter things and figured that it would be a good quality quill for the price. While the quill itself looked fantastic, everything else didisappointed me. Most of the nibs were too big to fit in it, all of then except the one that came in it and the finger one. The most disappointing was the ink. As soon as I opened the box and took the ink out, I got ink all over my fingers from it leaking. No big deal, I know ink leaks. However, when I was cleaning off the bottle so it would look nice in my collection, the bottom of the bottle broke and got ink everywhere. All over my Hogwarts t-shirt and my kitchen table. I'very spent hours getting it out if my clothes and the wood table. I wish I would have paid a bit more money for a pen that actually satisfied me.
I can't believe I didn't read the reviews on this product.  It should be more clearly labeled that you are only getting ONE folder.  I can't believe I paid for "two" of these!!!  Very disappointed.

As other buyers have noticed there are certain of these items where the lead ejection mechanism is faulty. The item I received would not work and after reading the reviews in detail this seems to be a fault in design and quality control on this item. Considering its price and the fact that this is not a new technology, faults like this should not occur. Returned item after a day of trying to use it.

I bought this ink because I visited their booth at the Commowealth Pen Show, but they didn’t allow testing of their inks or pens at the show (go figure) and I didn’t feel they did their job selling the product. So I purchased from amazon. This ink does not work well for pointed nib calligraphy. The ink bleeds terribly even in good 32# paper. I also purchased a black one if this brand and it performs well. It is not water fast at all. I also used it in a medium fountain pen (rotring and Lamy) and was also a poor performer.As you can see from the pictures, I compared 4 inks on the back of a good quality envelope that usually takes calligraphy inks quite well. The black Noodler’s ink is perfect, the Bad Belter Kingfisher was terrible.  The Winsor and Newton had a little bit of feathering and the Pelican was ok. I waited 1 minute and then placed one drop of water. You can see the Kingfisher starts spreading right away while the black one kept its fastness. After 1 minute All but the black ink were ruined.I read great reviews of these inks and now I am confused if they are all different formulations and there’s not a lot of description on the box or the bottle.
Will not work in my HP 2055. Just make continuous clicking noises and every paper jams. Wish I could give it 0 stars.

I wish this stamp (for the price your paying for ONE stamp) was better! I hate how when you stamp it, the outside ring also stamps down so that is not just the Star face showing. It has the whole outside ring around it and when I try to clean the outside off of ink, when it re-inks it’s self it just gets ink on it again. It’s not bad quality but the stamp part should be raised up higher.

I hate this planner enough to write a review about it, which I almost never do.  It's huge, but it doesn't use the space well.  Half of each page are mindful prompts, but a bunch of the prompts are very personal and I would not feel comfortable having random coworkers by my desk see. Do you want your coworkers to know "a situation that might stress me out or trip me up"?  No thanks!But aside from all of that, there's one bigger flaw: THERE'S NO SPACE FOR A TO DO LIST.  Ugh, this is the worst, I never thought I'd get so worked up about a planner.

my husband,my adult son  and myself each took approx 30 to 45 min.  just trying to set this in the position i am needing it to be set up in.  they show a picture of  it on a sheet of paper that was  inside the box it came in.  but,  no insructions to help us to get  it set right.  it's a waste of space &  a waste of my time and money!!!  i would not purchase this.  if there was a way to give this product 1/2 a star,  thats all i would give it  !!!!!
No stars.  I bought one of these previously and had no problem. This one I bought showed low toner for 2 prints and the failed as no toner and would not print.  Go cheap, go twice.  Don't buy.

I bought these in June, finally got around to using them.  The quality is subpar, the printed page looks like the ink well has almost run out.  Image 1 below is the last of the ink in my GENUINE HP cartridge before it ran out; Image 2 is the VALUETONER cartridge after a thorough cleaning of the printer.Amazon won't let me rate them NO stars or I would!DON'T WAST YOUR MONEY, BUY ORIGINAL HP CARTRIDGES!!!

Piece of junk and waste of timeToo bad I haven’t read the reviews before I purchased this item. I spent a fair amount of time to assemble the stamp with my custom information. It would not give me a nice and clear impression. The stamp acts pretty stiff when stamping compared to other stamps that I have. I also got my hands dirty when handling the pad as there was ink from both sides. As the saying goes “you get what you pay for"

Not sure why this has such high reviews. It doesn't apply flat and there are HUGE bubbles no matter what I do. Probably has something to do with the fact that the roll wasn't very flat to begin with. I unrolled almost the whole tube and weighed down the edges to try and flatten it some. There were folds in the roll that stayed no matter what I did. Still got 2 stars because its a wonderful idea and the adhesive is so damn good that I couldn't peel it back after placing it without warping the sheeting. Both a good and a bad thing since the whole point is to be able to apply it to basically any surface. I would have liked to lift it back up in small amounts to remove whatever bubbling I could.
Printing is so light I cannot see it!  Awful product!  Even one star is generous .  Did you run out of ink?

I bought this expecting it to be like the multi colour one, that I already have. Nope. The quality seems the same but I'm not sure if I got one with tonnes of flaws or if they are all crap! For the price, this should not be happening. First it arrived with a hole in the product box.. Amazon box was fine. Then i noticed something weird smeared on one side with lots of rust. I scraped and washed most off but there is still alot it where the weld is. Next as i was putting the rollers on the bottom, i noticed the whole pole is completely  bent.. so i had to force the feet in, which wrecked one of the feet. And if that wasnt enough.. as I put the knobs on the drawers, I noticed black flecks inside the plastic of the clear drawer. Very noticeable and is extremely frustrating to look at every day! Oh! And on top of that, one knob is falling apart and sharp.I would not suggest this item to anyone.Maybe if the seller contacts me and replaces the entire thing or refunds me money, maybe then I would change my review.. but right now, if I could give it 0 stars, I would. I am such a upset customer!!!!

I really don't know why people write favorable reviews about these pens.  They are horrible.  When writing the ink does not dispense consistently out of the pen forcing me to re-write some letters.  I don't write a lot of reviews, but my annoyance was so great that I just had to log into to my Amazon account and write this review.

Pretty sure I can’t return it since I opened it but it’s crap. I have a business and need labels and I saw all these great reviews. But apparently the ink doesn’t make purple? I don’t know . It came out blue....annoying

Not sure how to rate this...the envelopes that arrived clean n not crushed are great but that might be about 100 out of 500 I purchased!  The 400 that are blk from dirt or crunched look unusable. I'm very surprised at the lack of quality control from Amazon!

I regret that I bought it without reading the reviews. How on earth a person buys a product which is said to be causing cancer! The description of the product should have included this information. It is a mischieve to send it with a scary warning after we spent our money. Amazon should have to remove such products.Though the money is small, the seller should refund our money.

I purchased this replacement Value Combo because of the favorable reviews.  I now regret my decision.  The replacement toner cartridges not only did not work well with our brand new Brother MFC but may have also damaged the machine (it is now emitting a loud knocking sound) and jeopardized its manufacturer's warranty (according to Brother).  My desire to save our non-profit organization some precious dollars has produced the opposite result. I strongly recommend that the product be pulled out of the Amazon market so that other potential buyers are not victimized.

This is the biggest hunk of junk. Don’t waste your time OR money….and by time, I mean HOURS. This comes in about 1000 pieces. The screws don’t screw in correctly, the directions are terrible, and even with two people, we couldn’t get it assembled properly. I finally gave up after a couple of hours. I’m worse off having even tried, as now I’mFrustrated and exhausted. What a lousy way to have spent my Friday evening. I don’t even know how this company can feel good about selling such nonsense. Zero stars for this item.

I like the intentionality that this type of planner can support, but there are too many mistakes and poor design desicisions to have this work for me ... so I’m heading to other alternatives on the market.This is not a yearly, weekly or monthly planner. It is only focused on looking ahead each day. There are sections for weeks and months but those are retrospective and not forward-looking.The weekly review has many very detailed questions that are phrased, oddly, in reference to “today” versus “this week.” It appears to be a quality-control oversight. Also, the detail level of those questions are indeed more appropriate for a daily review than a weekly review, so it looks like they’ve taken a daily review list from another iteration of the design and slapped it into the weekly review section.As other reviewers have said, there is a lot of real estate on each page dedicated to the daily schedule, while the other areas are quite cramped, and the daily schedule only goes up to early evening.The difference between “Today’s Top 3 Goals/Priorities” and “Tasks that Absolutely Must Be Done Today” is not clear. The author has a video where he addresses this and criticizes those who could be confused by this, going on to give a very vague and not really credible description of the difference.When I contacted the company’s customer service email about some of these issues, they were evasive and pointed me to a facebook group of “Brandon’s Students.”Finally, I’m not a big fan of self-proclaimed gurus who are marketing their stuff by saying “you too can be as productive as me.”Onward to Panda Planner Pro or another option. I may even take some of the more useful questions from this planner and some of the features I like from other planners design one for my own use.

I got these phones just 3 months ago, and although the phones show full battery, after 1 or 2 short calls, the readout says "recharge for 7 H(ours)".  Worse, if you switch to speakerphone, you likely lose the call due to the handset going dead.  The concept of the phones is good, but if I have to buy replacement batteries already, I will not purchase another Panasonic.  We got three phones for a good price, thus I cannot simply rate these as 1 star, but they have thus far shown to be very inferior to the really old Uniden phones we had for 6 years.

I love the shape, the height is perfect for my wrist, and it works when it stays in one spot.The problem I'm running into is the two lines of non-slip material is practically insignificant. After so many times of the unit getting knocked onto the floor, the plastic portion is bent enough that those lines aren't even touching the table anymore to stop it from sticking. I haven't had time to write a review or I would have mentioned this sooner. I'd rather have the beanbag wrist support I had before this one, though it would slip off there wasn't anything that would crack, the cloth just wears out that I can tape until I can get another one. This unit is all wrong for taping it back together with how it's put together and the materials and how much pressure it'd take to push the material back into shape, it would take two people to repair it.

So I have had this desk just over a year  I wanted to wait and see how it was before leaving a review. Initially I thought it was great seemed sturdy and well made. After some use, I first realized it’s awkward, and I have a laptop and a small speaker on top, it was to much for this desk. It was top heavy and when I went to move the desk I had it tip and crack my laptop. The second issue is the wheels have not held up at all, at the 5 month mark two wheels were pulling away from the frame making it extra wobbly and even more top heavy, the other two queen at the 12 month mark are pulling away, one has come off completely. If you planning on moving this desk around don’t!! If you have anything other than a tablet to put on this desk I wouldn’t recommend it.

I have been collecting magnets for years and finally decided to put my collection on the wall, so I ordered this "magnetic" wall chart.  It came with various different means with which to affix it to the wall and I opted for nails, the simplest I thought.  Having affixed the chart to the wall I started to place my magnets on it.  Little or light ones were fine, if a bit lightly held, but anything larger than 1.5" just slipped directly down the wall, onto the floor!  Utterly, utterly pathetic and entirely unfit for the task.  Don't bother.  I wouldn't even give it one star, but one is the minimum!
I failed to respect the ratings that others had already given this product. You get less than what you paid for it.

I am pleased with the quality of the writing on these pens.  No problem with ink having any flow issues.  I am sad about the fact they will randomly fall out due to gravity. I am so sick of loosing these pens randomly throughout my day. Very disappointed in this product, I wish I could give negative stars on this one.  Easily worst product ever purchased on Amazon.
Beautiful pens but the ink is gone with one paragraph you write. It would be a 5 star if the ink would last longer. It is used more for decoration.

I purchased this (these 4 toners) in October 2014 and by January, I asked for a refund. I could not figure out what was wrong. I thought it was my printer. I'm a techie so I troubleshoot things a lot. Before I point elsewhere, I always look to see what is it I could be doing incorrectly. For starters, when I first got my toners, everything worked fine. But in December, my kids started to complain about the quality of the printouts. When I sat down to look at it, sure enough, the quality was really bad. I could barely read the black and the yellow highlights were almost faded out of the picture.I reinstalled each toner carefully figuring something could have gone wrong. Did not solve the issue.I checked my SMART Panel and all were showing almost full.I was very confused. So I decided to look at the reviews and that is where I saw  several folks pointing out the quality of the toners.So I got a refund and returned the item. I was trying to save money but maybe I got what I paid for.

perfect size for the job I needed it for.  Leaky sunroof on my car.  placed it on the roof of the car and it looked great.  Trouble was I dont think that the product is UV rated or protected.  In a single afternoon it began to break up and crack apart.  Didnt last a day in the Florida sun

Pros:1. It is made of wood.2. Great for a DYI project!!!3. it is technically a drawer.4. It is very aromatic!5. You are saving those rejected wood scraps from your lumber yard!Cons:1. By made of wood, it really means the rejected wood pieces from the lumberyard. You know when you pick up lumber from your local place and you toss out a bunch of those pieces, those get marked down and the worse gets left behind, yep those pieces. You will be hard pressed to find any piece that is not full of knots and warped in some way (and leaking a bit of sap, how authentic!). At least they picked the lightest, softest, and easiest to break or split wood they could find, to save on shipping costs of course.2.  If you thought you were buying a ready to assemble drawer, well you might be disappointed. For instance they really don't tell you about all the tools you will really need: A good drill with a screw driver attachment, a square, glue, a couple of hammers, some extra nails, two or three good grades of sand paper, two cans of clear coat, and a good amount of patience. This would have been better described as a DYI kit, and by DYI I mean drill your own holes and figure out how to put it together yourself. I know there are some 5 star reviews out there... but I am not sure how this made them that happy... maybe they got it free or something.3. There appears to be ZERO quality assurance since about 40% of the holes they did actually drill were in the wrong spots making the simple task of hammering in the cheap plastic drawer slides, yep for that real wood experience they couldn't afford to toss in real drawer slides. But hey good thing I was able to fill that hole and re-drill another one! I really don't think that any of this was sanded, or I am just very unlucky with finding stray splinters.4. If you were expecting this bad boy to be painted, you are missing that true 100% wood DYI experience! More like one coat of spray on black primer. Combined with the unique softness of a true hardwood like pine even slight dings bring out the true rich tones of tan.5. As an extra bonus you get a fancy big sticker on the back piece of... particle board that refused to let loose without a ton of scraping and adhesive removal (at least they used glue here). Apparently that sticker is very important as it reminds you that the drawers cannot hold more than 10 pounds.In conclusion, skip the real wood experience and buy a drawer that yes, might be made with pressed wood, but also comes fully finished with mechanical drawers and doesn't leak sap!

I wish they would have put photos of what the inside of the book looks like in the description. I wish I would have looked at the reviews prior. There is not enough space for planning out each day if you are putting your work tasks. Biggest downside is I don't think it is practical to answer the 10 questions they lay out every morning and 7 questions every night. I honestly found it overwhelming and demotivating. Not going to use this book sadly. I have used the Full Focus Planner in the past and am going to go back to this one in case you are looking for something more compact and focus driven.

I need a plan book with more writing space and that is exactly what this book offers.  I only gave the book two stars because the page for Friday is a fold-out page that is clumsy and awkward.  This fold-out page is not shown in the picture of the product.  I would not have bought this had I known that Friday was not part of the book.

At first, this gem got five stars. It did its job, I liked the angles of adjustment degree dial on the side and was lightweight and well made. I gave it to my mother and eventually it became mine again.The bad: the very same dials (look for silver marker in photos at the joint by the tray) that easily allow adjustment are made of plastic. There never seemed to be a problem aside from it sounding creaky sometimes. One day I set it down and it finally cracked.The rest of the stand is kosher. It's 90% metal but the right dial being broken makes it useless. I can try to glue it but it would be forever stationary in that one position. It only lasted one and a half years. That's not cool. My review went from five stars to two. It would've been one but it DID work until ... that day.
Item is stained. On the edge.  I will keep as the way I am hangout it you shouldn’t see it. I will say o purchased even though another reviewer said they received one stained

This seemed like the perfect cart, and all the reviews were great.  But last night I used it for the second time ever, and it completely fell apart.  I was bringing groceries home; 8 blocks or so...first the front left wheel snapped off.  The plastic snapped off...there was no way of putting it back on.  I continued on, and within a block, the second front wheel snapped off, throwing me forward over the cart.  Groceries everywhere, me on the ground. Had to roll it home on the back wheels, bent over because the handle isn't high enough.If this had happened years into owning it, sure...wear and tear.  But the thing was brand new.  Yes, it was full of heavy groceries, but that's what it's made for!  I'm spry enough that I didn't get hurt, but it's legitimately dangerous for someone who might not bounce back from being thrown over a cart onto the pavement.
Neither of the ink packs worked. Should have paid a little more for Brother ones. Only gave one star because it wouldn’t let me leave it at zero.

This scale was purchased to integrate with WorldShip so that we wouldn't have to type in the weight of every single package. The integration went fine (a small "hack" in a bin file had it up and running fast).But, there's one major problem with this scale - it doesn't display accurate weights. The manual states that accuracy can fluctuate +/- 4 oz, which is a problem in itself for shipping purposes (since everything rounds up for billing), but the variances are far greater than 4 oz. The heavier the package, the more the variance. We've run into instances where the weight displayed was more than 4 lb off. That might not seem like a big deal at ground shipping rates, but a difference that high when using an air service and shipping to a residential address can result in tens of dollars in shipping rate differences.After about a month of 20 page shipping company invoices with rate adjustments due to inaccurate weights, we promptly tossed this thing in the trash.
I enjoyed the size. Just wish it work longer than a week for me. Judging by the other reviews, I may have gotten a rare dud.
Very overpriced. Can buy one from China for 0.75 RMB (less than a quarter). Giving it two stars because it is a great eraser. Erases everything perfectly.

I normally only write reviews when I get a truly bad product. This is one of those reviews. This product is very confusing to assemble. The hanger itself is made of aluminum and bends easily. The screws got stripped and I had to use some gripping tools to get them out. The aluminum bent and I had to pound it back into shape with a hammer. All around crappy product. I would have been better off with a piece of wire coat hanger.

I wanted to like this white board, given all the 5 stars reviews. First, two of the markers came dried up- only the red one was useable. Then, the red marker left behind a stain, so now the majority of the board is tinted a pink hue. Not sure if it was just mine as everyone seems to say in that theirs left no stains in their reviews. I am disappointed.

When the product did not seem to be working well I opened up the casing to find that the majority  of the highlighter's ink had dissolved. I checked all 5 of them and found this to be consistent throughout. Although, even if the ink were full I am not confident that these particular 'pastel' highlighters would not work well. The ink is very light in color (and while this may be expected from pastels) this seems counterintuitive to the purpose of highlighters in the first place. 1/5 stars because product arrived in poor condition and does not appear work well, even if it had arrived new.

I rarely write a review, but I do for this piece of junk. DO NOT BUY it. I used it for a few times and it broke. The top part came off, I couldn't put it back together, see the picture. It poorly designed. I have to buy a different one to do my work. I am going to ask for a refund.

So I know this is advertised to bring out the dirt and crud in your pores and I knew after reading reviews that wasn’t going to be the case. However I didn’t realize this is literally a mint julep face mask in a snazzy, easy to apply bottle. Save your money and just buy the $5 bottle that comes with 4x the amount of product. I will say, the application is almost mess-free, but you still have to use your finger to get to hard to reach areas like next to your nose. It’s a waste of money.

Nice book. Hard back book.** my first page top left corner is torn or ripped and you can’t read what the page poem would say.  See my 2nd picture. This is the reason I gave 2 stars. I don’t want to send it back.**Which makes it kinda “stiff”. Also would give you good hard surface to color.When you think of a journey (Cheerful Journey, book name) things happen in order. Snowmen in the book (cute) but before the scarecrow (also cute). I think should be sorta in order of seasons or calendar order. Pages are just random order.

This stool broke in the first few days we used it. It says it holds up to 300 lbs but that isn't true. My son is 6' 185 and when he stepped on it the middle broke. Very dangerous. Piece of junk. Don't trust advertisement.The company promptly wrote to me after I wrote this review. I didn't contact the seller, just posted the review.  The customer service must be getting better and I appreciate the prompt response!

There were a few Smash accessories I wanted and I bought a kit that came with most of them and a few extras, including a "free" larger book.  I say "free" because the kit cost less than buying the accessories I wanted individually, so I looked at the other items as freebies on top of a good price.The Smash Swatch Tape was one of the items I wanted to add some variety to the black polka dot tape, which I love.  Now, I'm glad I got the swatch tape as part of the kit and I consider the cute clips part of what I bought and the Swatch Tape a freebie so I don't feel bad that I threw it away.  As was true with several reviewers here, the tape stuck to the next layer, ruining that layer and split apart as I tried to take it off the roll.  VERY disappointing and very poor quality.  I expected that the Swatch Tape would be the same material as the black dot paper tape.  So I pitched the useless roll of Swatch Tape and I'll buy Trendy Tape from Queen and Company dot com.  But so far, this has been the only Smash brand product I've wanted and not been happy with.

How am I supposed to know how to use this thing with NO instruction booklet included? To me this is like a computer science project. Now the needle doesn't stay locked in place since I don't know how to do that either. There is no way I am going to remain an unsatisfied consumer thinking I wasted $13 like some of the reviews I see here. I am returning this thing to the seller for a refund!!

Like so many other reviewers, I was anticipating traditional greeting cards with envelopes - should have read the reviews BEFORE Iordered what turned out to be POSTCARDS - not at all suitable to mail to distant places.  I will use these POSTCARDS as gift tags - theimages are beautiful.

I wasn't quite sure what to expect from these, for the price.  But this is a case of paying a premium for a name, not for anything physically worth it.These are just your normal, standard notebooks, with cardboard covers that will bend and crease and wear just like any others, marring the pictures pretty quickly in any normal school use.  Seeing what my 11 year old son ends up with for his notebooks and folders in the course of just a month or two, these wouldn't make the grade.New, they do look nice.  Bright colors, well done, no blurring, the print job is excellent.  The paper is pretty standard, perforated if you prefer the clean edge rather than the ragged one you get just pulling out from the spiral.But others have already pointed out how much cheaper these can be found singly, so the three pack is definitely not worth the price.And if these are going to go to little kids, which is the most likely candidate since these are kind of "kid" quality art being Star Wars Rebel cartoon images (i.e. you won't get an adult Star Wars fan using these for anything), then these really won't have much of a chance at longevity.If you need notebooks for your kid for school, these aren't the ones I'd pick.  If you need something for around the house for them though, something that won't be in and out of backpacks and desks and lockers, then these may hold their form and looks for a while.  But I'd definitely not use them as ones getting packed back and forth each day
My first review on Amazon after ordering for years... Toner cartridge ran out in 5 days?  I barely printed...not good.  Spend a few extra bucks and get one that works

I bought these XL cartridges a month ago as my ink was getting a little low.  I installed them this morning and the Magenta and Cyan cartridges are just over half full, and the Yellow is about 80% full.  It appears these are not OEM cartridges rather refills.  Since it has been a month I cannot return... hopefully the supplier will read this review and offer a remedy for this disappointing situation.

I just cannot understand how this pen is rated so highly.Like others I bought the pen based upon the many glowing recommendations for a beginners fountain pen.Overall the writing experience is v poor:(i) the fine pen nib continually runs dry. I am using the converter with Lamy Crystal Black Ink.There are no air bubbles in the converter and I have to violently shake the pen to generate ink flow and end up with ink blots on the paper(ii) Super scratchy. I am mean ultra scratchy. The idea of the fountain pen is to glide over the page effortlessly.This is made worse by the tendency of the nib to run dry.(iii) Posting the pen.When writing the pen feels more balanced when the cap is fitted to the back of the pen. However it fits v poorly. Not nice and snug at all.It either ends up rattling on the end of the pen as your write or you have to post it so tightly it is difficult to get off when you are finished.(iv) The paint is so thin any small scratch reveals the shiny aluminium underneath.This is especially noticeable  at the end of the pen because you have to press so hard to firmly post the cap it wears the paint from the end of the pen.The Lamy AL Star is one of the most expensive beginners fountain pen but the experience and build quality feels v cheap and nasty to me.

It looks great coming out of the box.  However, as I started to assemble the desk, it was noted that there were several missing holes that were not pre-drilled. I did see this in other reviews before I made this purchase. But I assumed that these might have just been a few mistakes in the factory process. I guess I was wrong, and that the problem persists with many of the products that are shipped, at least it was the case with mine.  If you receive an item with the pre drilled holes , the desk may be good.  I tried to adapt and drill the holes myself, but because of the threading that is needed for the screws, it didn’t work properly.  Returned item and received a full refund.

I wish I had read the reviews before purchasing.  Like others I ordered the 3pks of 6 pens and only received 3pks of 5 pens.  I really needed all the pens for gifts I am making for nurses week (54 nurses) so now I have no choice but spend more money getting what I need. 😞

Does not hold up well on city streets. Gets caught on the slightest bump on sidewalks. Based on previous reviews I thought this would be fine, but I find myself stopping whenever there is a slight bump. Today it stopped on a completely flat surface, and I almost tripped over it. I regret purchasing.
The ink did not fit my printer ever though they said it would replace the Cannon ink.  Don't buy.  Don't like giving it one star because doesn't rate that high.

It was probably innocent error, but I only received one of these and I ordered two. I found another place to order two at once so I ordered those and entered a return and added the comment that I was only sent one. I sent in the return with a note that I am only returning one because I received one.  This week I got an email that I was being un-refunded because they only received one. Argh! Having difficulty figuring out who to talk to about this so maybe this review will help me get to the right person?

The review got 2 stars because:1. For the innovation of the product and 2. for their nice customer service.But as far as the product itself, it's not the best use of my money and I wouldn't recommend it to a friend. I received the folio and noticed that the pen loop was very large, it can hold 2-3 pens before it starts to stretch and it can hold 6+ pens (I put 5 in there and there was room for a 6th, I just didn't have that many on me). When I contacted customer service they said that this was the intended design and that pens clip to the outside.I've never seen a pen loop in a folio case require the pen to be outside of it, poor design if you ask me. Please post more pictures indicating the intentional use of this loop on the posting.Along with that the one side is starting to bow on me. I'm afraid to try and bend it back to correct this because I feel it may crack whatever is inside of it.It's just not a quality product.

Got this as a gift for my mom who has arthritis and has been having a difficult time writing with pens lately.  She wanted a "fat" pen. The reviews for this pen look good and the fact that it is commended for ease-of-use by the Arthritis Foundation made it seem like this would be the pen for her.  She thought it was a pretty decent pen that was more comfortable to hold and use compared to the pens she's been using.  She likes the purple/blue color of the pen and the quality of the ink, but it started leaking after only a couple of uses.  And I'm not talking about writing letters or something like that- she hardly used it.  There's ink everywhere.  The pen is unusable at this point, so the pretty aesthetic doesn't help much.  Disappointed.
Something is wrong with the color cartridge. Had to take it out just to get the printer to print. So no color printing. 2 stars only because of the price.

I find the other reviews incomprehensible, they say things like keeps a sharp point and almost scratches the paper, exactly what I was expecting.  But even though these pencils have 2H on them, they seem like 2B to me, quite soft.
Not pleased that it's made of cardboard. Not dealing with returning it, just wish I had read reviews before purchase.

I bought these fake "HP" cartridges and they work like absolute garbage!!! The print quality is awful and sometimes one or more of the colors don't even work. I'm just glad they haven't screwed up my high-end HP printer!Amazon was great and I was able to return them and I have order true HP cartridge from Amazon to replace them. However, given the other bad reviews (which I've just read not, but too late!) Amazon should ban this merchant.

Bought a 5-pack of these a few months ago. The first three I tried would not write -- the ink cartridge had dried up. The two extra replacement cartridges were capped, so they worked. As another reviewer stated, you can't always tell which end the tip will come out of -- and unlike the Ion, they will open in your pocket.

I asked my daughter to order me a RETURN TO SENDER and an ADDRESS SERVICE REQUESTED Rubber Stamps from Amazon last week. I had the pleasure of sitting down and reviewing my receipts for both items today, shipped seperately of course, and was a bit baffled. Both of these items were sold for a reasonable price for about $7. Here's where my anger lies: Amazon sent me the ADDRESS SERVICE REQUESTED Rubber Stamp and the shipping & handling was free...and "NO" to all of the website sleuths out there; it WAS NOT part of any large purchase over $25 including free shipping. However, this company that my daughter purchased the RETURN TO SENDER Rubber Stamp from chose to charge her/me about $6 for shipping & handling alone. It weighs about as much as two loaded envelopes and took over a week to get...so you tell me where this fee is justified!!! Yes, in the future I will manage all Amazon purchases on my own, a lesson has been learned. My only intent with this review is to warn others of certain unfair, greedy S&H fees vendors like to tack on...an advise them to be more aggressive about saving money that they work hard for everyday.
I should have read reviews before I purchased this. Bought the required staples, but the stapler jams every time I staple anything. Definitely would not recommend this stapler.

these do not stick!!! pay the money and get better quality. I am shocked that people have given this good reviews. I don't always review things, but when it is a product that does not work , then I try and let people know.  Pay the money, and get better quality sticky notes.

I wanted to love these pens... I really did. The price was so incredible, when I ordered them. I read so many other reviews, but thought, hey, if I dont like them, it's less than a $20 bill, right? I ignored the negative reviews and ordered anyway. One swipe, and I knew these would not be suitable for beginner to intermediate hand lettering. Not even a little bit. I played with them (along with some water) for about an hour, and that was it. They were frustrating, and I knew they weren't for me. So, they were passed on to my daughter, who has dabbled in water color painting lately. I had no doubt she would love and want to keep them. Even SHE said I should return them. And so I shall. Why? Briefly...First, the results differ from pen to pen.  One pen might write fairly dark. The next will be nearly dry. And on and on. Second, the tips are literally brushes, not nylon "brush" tips. They're impossible to control for hand lettering, unless you're a pro. Third, bristles were loose and/or falling out. And less important, but still a factor --the packaging, as some have mentioned, is terrible. And on top of being awkward and flimsy, the outer sleeve of mine arrived broken and somewhat mangled. This is possibly (read: likely) the fault of the shipping facility, so that did not factor into my rating.  Don't do what I did, in ignoring the other reviews. Save yourself the hassle of returning, and the frustration and disappointment!!!

Color Cartridge came pink color cover came out and was filled with some sponge..  Useless product and I have not used once..  Unfortunately, I didn't open the cover for long time as i bought as for spare..  Once I open Color cartridge was not printing and saw that the Pink cover was loosened and came out..  I am unable to return as the it was sometime back I bough this..  I am unable to rate in negative..  Wasted my hard earned money..  Never buy this and waste our money..

I ordered and have been using these cartridges for several months, now.  Initially, all of them worked fine.  But I began to see streaking in the colors that I printed, which was unaffected by running a cleaning cycle on the printer, changing paper, changing print quality, etc.  After some quick research online, I learned that a common cause of this is cheaply made toner cartridges.  After changing the cartridge, VOILA!  Smooth printing again.  I gave this two stars instead of 1 because, so far, two of the four cartridges (yellow and pink) are still functioning appropriately - it was the black and cyan that got streaky.  Regardless, I won't be buying again.

This is a scam, they came with mylar package but it was already open and resealed. its not even 50 bags..its less and the plastic is old and its poly comic plastic bags. it had the right label on the front, but again this was a scam..do not buy...they were sealed in another green bag and the mylar package was inside. I just opened these thats why I didn't write review until now...I'm super pissed.

I have bought 3-4 of these over the years. This one is junk; operates roughly causing the ink to smudge, font is too small, and the ink ran out much more quickly than previous products. Of these the small font is most aggravating. Look for one bigger.I usually don't give 1 star ratings, as there is often something redeemable in a product, but this one actually should be zero stars.
I usually do not write reviews, but this time I had to. The cartridge did not work for my Brother MFC 7860dn. It was twice smaller than regular cartridge. I would not buy again!

Based on the reviews, I bought this contact paper to stick onto a wooden table. The paper stuck okay to table. However, what is most disappointing about this product is that the dry erase marker is leaving marker/shadows on it. Every dry erase marker is leaving color. Even if the numbers/words are erased soon, it still leaves that color on the paper. I would recommend looking elsewhere if you want something that is going to come clean when you are using it.

Toners arrived poorly wrapped inside a bag(one for each). There was too much loose toner inside eah of the bags. I bought this because it wasn't that much of a gamble. If your on a budget stay away from buying this.I posted this review because I couldn't get a response from the seller.

read reviews thought it would be great scale my 6 year old daughter on keto diet for her seizures so scale we were using still worked but I wonted a better one so I bought this one at first it seemed great till I notice that my daughter urine test strips were getting lighter and lighter she was getting knocked out of her keto state and didn't know what was happening till started checking the scale with a different scale and seen it was not accurate at all. SUMMARYBottom Tube (#3) was cut too longWe're looking for support. I am a highly technical person and after an hour of troubleshooting, I have determined the "Bottom Tube" (#3) was cut too long.1. The Amazon Image shows the bottom tube measuring 17.9" - while photo evidence shows the tube is 18.3" (See image uploaded with review)2. The Instructions, Step 2, Shows Pols (#6) sticking out (longer) than Bottom Tube (#3) - while video evidence shows the pole does not stick out (shorter) than the Bottom Tube (#3) (See image uploaded with review)REQUESTION SOLUTION:Immediately ship us the correctly sized Bottom Tube #3Contact us. Thank you!

I feel bad giving only two stars since the unit feels strong, but the unit I received had only two of the thickest screw which the documentation clearly states should have four of them... and this is the size screw my TV requires. So it's not very sturdy and I am constantly nervous now.Maybe after reading this they will send me new screws and I can update the review accordingly.

I bought Liquid Bearings to use on my computer trackball.  When my trackball was new, it rolled perfectly.  Over time I've had to exert more effort to get the ball rolling, which results in jerky movement.  The manufacturer no longer makes my trackball or sells replacement parts, so I thought I'd lubricate the bearings to see if it would help.I first tried skin oil (like from my forehead).  It only helped for a few hours.  I had the same result with olive oil, coconut oil, teflon gun oil, and even polishing the ball with RainX.  Nothing seemed to work for more than a few hours at best.  I even made sure to thoroughly clean the ball between each test.Enter Liquid Bearings.  It received a lot of great reviews and they mention on their site that it's good for arcade machines.  Since many arcade machines have trackballs, I thought it might work.It doesn't.It didn't help at all.  In fact, it made it much much worse.  It also smelled.  They claim it has no odor, but it does.  It's not overpowering, but it's there.Since every other oil I tried worked better, but since it may still be useful for oiling hinges or other stuff in the future, I think 2/5 stars is what it deserves.  Based on reviews, it seems to work well for machine parts that rub on each other.  It just absolutely sucks for trackballs.

I ordered this for my parents and when received, they called to tell me that they got a "used" one and that the machine did not work. It rejected both fake and real bills. When called for tech support, the people continued to transfer them from number to number, and when finally tired of that and asked for refund, they continued to volley them from number to number, only to have the operator tell them that they will "call them back", which lead them to never calling them. My parents are now returning it to get their refund. I bought this from their website, but there wasn't a review board. Don't buy this, and this company's service is terrible, it was as if they were trying to rip over 200 dollars from my parents by delaying the direct call to a direct solution. Don't have purchase from this company. If I could, I would have given them no stars, because their service was just overall terrible.

I purchased this item in an effort to keep the original chair wheels from scratching the wood floors in our home. They started off great, but about a week or two ago one of the wheels rubber cracked and fell apart. You can tell it was a manufacturer's defect. I contacted SunniDog and initially, they were very helpful and promised to send me a replacement. I provided my address as they requested, however, they have never responded to any followup communication. I have tried to contact them again over a week ago and they still haven't responded. I will update this review if I ever get the replacements.

Product would not work in my Epson xp-440 printer....returned...according to other reviews Epson firmware update has eliminated ability to use cheaper remanufactured ink cartridges...will be dumping printer and never purchasing  model again...

We bought four of these. Two of them are great, but we sent back the other two due to the edge not lying flat. I'm going to wait a month or so and see if 3M finds someone else to manufacture them. If the next purchased one lays flat, I will change my review to 5 stars.

I purchased this item and the warranty is for 90 days (3 months). At 3 months and a few days it stopped working. I tried all the things recommended to fix it. They all failed.I phoned the company and was told the same thing obtech (see this persons review) was told.We can't fix it, we can't repair it, even at my expense. But they will give you a code to get 20-30 bucks off a new one.This item is fun and nice once you set it up, but the warranty is something the company needs to fix.At best a minimum of 1 year from date of purchase if it fails due to no fault of your own.This item was never dropped nor damaged.3 months, 100 dollars. 30 bucks a month for a grocery list.  :(I'd also recommend Amazon take this and any other "smartshopper" grocery list off their selling list til the warranty warrants buying it.Beware !!

I read some reviews saying it was easy to break, but more reviews said it was good so I took a chance. I’ve had it for a month and it literally just fell off my desk and onto carpet. The clip and the spring holding it to the board broke off so it’s no longer of use and I have to buy another one. It’s the first time it’s fallen so I was sad to see it immediately became unusable.

When trying to activate I could not.  Called ooma support.  They told me unit had charges on it  from previous owner.  I could not activate it till all charges where paid up.  I asked what charges where.  They told me to pay charges and then when they activated the unit they would tell me  the charges and after they had my CC number.Customer service rep. could no understand why I would not give him a open CC number.I asked for a supervisor and he hung up on me. I loved the product; however I was spammed by continuous emails asking for a rate this product which I found exceptionally annoying and frustrating.

I trusted the good reviews and ignored the bad. Well, what a waste. This toner lasted no more than a week. I did a get 200 pages or so out of it, but that's it. I even set it inside the original Brother brand holder for the toner.DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY. Just spring for the real thing.
These work great for the Pilot Colleto. +5 stars for writing experience, -2 stars because they run out very quickly, and -1 star because they’re expensive for what you get. Overall 2 stars

This is a seriously tiny cart.  It is very easy to put the wheels on, so that's why I gave it 2 stars.  It does not, however, carry much of anything.  Not good for laundry or groceries if you shop for too many things.  I realize this is my fault because I looked at a lot of carts and did not have a good sense of the size.  It would be very good for a little old person who cannot carry anything at all.  Or someone who would just shop for 6 things and wanted to push a cart instead of carry a bag.Also, it is made in China and the wheels smell like gasoline.

I had high hopes for this planner, and did extensive research prior to taking the plunge to the Cossac planner from Erin Condren, which has been my stalwart partner in productivity for many years. Unfortunately, despite having the exact layout that I’ve been looking for (separate monthly, weekly, and daily sections) and the exact daily agenda design that I wanted, this planner is incredibly disappointing. The pages are so thin that even the lightest pens bleed through. Unless you write in pencil (with a light hand) this planner is likely not for you. I’m using standard Flair pens, not permanent markers and I’ve never had them bleed through a planner like this. I was all in for this to be my perfect holy grail planner and instead, I’m angry because I wasted 20$ on a planner and then wasted planner stickers in it before realizing how thin the pages are. If I had not already written/used stickers in it, I’d be asking for a refund.If I could give 0 stars I would. Ideal layout is 100% overshadowed by crappy paper.

Note pad arrived with the magnetic strip adhered on the cardboard back at the geometric center of the cardboard (unlike some that I see in the reviews where the magnetic strip is positioned along the top edge of the back).  This makes the note pad useless to hang on the fridge since the cardboard is too light to remain flat against the fridge due to the weight of the pad (at least the magnet does its job).  Two stars.  Decided to tear the cardboard back off and keep the note pad on the counter.
Like others I used this in the past with 5 star results.  The quality is gone.  Print so light it's not readable.  Pages falling out.  Didn't make it half the year.

My daughter loves this calender and looks forward to updating it every month. However as a parent this product was shipped in bad shape. I should have had Amazon send another. This had to have been sitting around the warehouse for a few years. The boards themselves were very warped. The magnets with the years on them were for years 2009 - 2013. I bought this in 2011. A few weeks after getting this for my daughter we bought one for a friend as a birthday gift from a local store. The boards were nice a straight - no warping and the magnetic years started at 2011. The identical item but in much better shape. I guess I blame Amazon for sending something out that was in bad shape and apparently sitting around for a few years. If not for it being old and in bad condition I would have given it 5 stars.

The clips themselves are really nice but my pack was missing one. Wasn’t until close to the end of the project that I noticed. Now my project is incomplete and I still need a single clip but can’t buy just one. If the product had come as advertised with the correct number of clips would be 5 stars.

I really did not enjoy working with these pencils. I found them really chalky (pieces of lead were breaking on my page), the color didn't fill in or build up easily, and I personally did not enjoy using a triangular barrel. I honestly prefer Crayola over these, which are cheaper and easily found in most stores.I also found that the wood on these were very soft and would just peel back from the lead. I'm not sure if that affects anything, though it was odd.Overall I really did dislike these pencils.  I hate the page I started so much that as of now I don't plan to finish it.  I would never buy these again and I would not recommend them.  The pictures I added show some fine detail that I used gel pens for,  but mainly it is just the use of these pencils.  I hope you find this review helpful.
The ink quality is good, but mine broke the first time I used it. Will have to get it replaced before updating my review.

I love Amazon Basics in general, and I rarely submit reviews unless I feel very strongly about the product in question, but this purchase represents one of those very cases. All 500 envelopes have proven useless after discovering, like some other reviewers, they are each and every one sealed in the box. I tried opening 4 or 5 gently, threw a handful of 20-30 onto the ground in frustration, calmed down, grabbed another dozen or so, and tried more experimental methods, like heating the glue with a hairdryer. Now another 20-30 have been Gronk-spiked to my office floor. I regret to say, the entire supply is a loss, unless one counts their use as a victimless target of rage a catharsis of some value. I don't.

0 STARS......Packing and shipping FAIL. I would not purchase another product from The Hillman Group again if they screw up something as easy as putting 2 stickers in a box. Its the principal of it.  This was my first disappointing experience using Amazon...

It was a cool looking calculator for very short money so it got two stars for that. But the display was very hard for me to read. Then after a few weeks the display lost parts of the numbers. But it didn't cost much so I didn't bother with return, and just tossed it. Oh well.

I am a teacher. Like many other teachers I find myself buying my own materials with my money knowing I will never see that money again. For that reason, I want what I buy to do the job advertised and to do it for a long period of time. This product arrived with a crease the entire length of the grid. No matter what I tried I could not get rid of the crease. This product will NOT static cling to a whiteboard. I gave it two stars because it is still a good tool to use for teaching. It is large enough for all my students to see and it is easy to erase. I have to tape and untape it frequently to/from the board which has caused damage and this will not last long. The company was sure to send a product catalog with this purchase. Based on the failures of this product I will not be using this company again.
Very disappointed in this ink.  I can’t even use it the color is so bad.  I didn’t even want to give it one star

One of these cartridges worked for a few pages, then I got a message saying the cartridge was not compatible with my printer. Another color ran out after only printing a few pages. I have purchased cartridges for lower prices than these that worked satisfactorily. If they worked reliably, I could give these a higher rating. Fortunately I found these problems while a refund was still available, so there's just the minor annoyance of shipping them back.

After looking through the description and reading the positive reviews, I was sold on this product and was excited.When I opened the card though, I saw what I perceived to be as dust on the inside.  But it had a green tint to it so I looked at it more carefully and it was all around the card and on the sleeve.  It turned out to be mold. 2 weeks ago I ordered this set. One cartridge failed and the company is making me jump through multiple hoops just to get my money refunded. Based on the reviews, this product is not anything to buy. Stay away from them.

Prints fine, fits fine, as it should at nearly the price of the printer!  The product is virtually flawless.  It does everything it claims and, as such deserves to be "liked"  I also really like most Canon products in general.  My rating is a protest against printers becoming  a vehicle for selling ink at exorbitant prices.  This is not limited to Canon. the printer becomes throw away, the ink is the drug.

Definitely NOT 80 lb. paper as listed. Yes, the color is pretty, BUT the paper is flimsy, thus I had to back up every piece of paper with another piece of cardstock in order to make the banner letters....so essentially it doubled my work. One corner of each paper in the package was slightly bent. BOTH of these issues are mentioned by other reviewers (which I should have read before ordering!) I read the reviews and figured people were over reacting about the smell. They were not! After using the product my arms smell like the pad through my shirt. I was only able to use it for about 2.5 hours before I began to get a sinus headache.The pad is a nice size and thickness however it does not smell like any other rubber backed mouse pad I have.Buy this with EXTREME CAUTION!-well unless you don't have a sense of smell.
The planner was only stapled to a paper insert; it ripped out of the case with gentle use.How can this have received 4.5 stars??

My initial review was as follows: They work great, and I really like that they make it easy to recycle the used cartridgesSince then, however, one of the cartridges has stopped working. I like Brendon. But this planner is a letdown. On the daily pages, it has TEN morning questions! And they are the same every morning. I think it might have been more effective to rotate through 2 of those per day for the week. And then there are six additional questions for evening. Again, same questions day after day. These two sections take about 40% of the two-page daily spread. Way too much, in my opinion.I do however like the weekly two-page weekly review. I'll keep the planner just for that.To me, this is not a planner. It's more of a prompt journal with a calendar awkwardly stuffed in the middle.

We loved this pencil sharpener until it quit working after 5 months. When I plugged it in today it would not even turn and I made sure the outlet was working. If the sharpener would last longer I would have given it 5 stars. It sharpens pencils better than most and has more power. It's possible the unit I received may have been a lemon.  It's a nice looking case; retractable handles, stylish, plenty of compartments.  I gave only two stars because of experiencing a problem within two days of using. I've used this product for over a year on a daily basis. Over this time period, I must have gone through maybe 1,000 or more of them.  Based on my experience, this product has 30% defective rate, meaning that 3 out of every 10 are not useable. This is an extremely high number and not acceptable.  The common problems I see include visible scratches, imperfections on the plastic, and dirt on the surface. Every time I toss them away, I am literally tossing money into the trash bin.  I will continue to use it for now until I can find a better product from another company.

Wow. I never review products on Amazon but since this is such a scam figured I’d warn future buyers.
