The following is my review for this brand's toner that I purchased with the drum.  Since the drum and the toner work together and I can't pinpoint which of the two items (or both) are causing my issues, I'm simply copying and pasting my toner review here:"I felt compelled to write this review:  Sometimes when a see a couple of negative reviews, but the majority of reviews are good, I decide to take a chance and purchase.  This was the case here, but it was a mistake.  The other negative reviews regarding leaking are absolutely correct.  Here was my experience:I saw this brand on sale when it was the "Deal of the Day."  I have a Brother MFC-8950DW, so I purchased the matching toner and drum unit.  At first, the printing appeared nice.  However, the toner smudges VERY easily.  So, when I went to scan various documents, the toner smudged and I had to reprint almost 100 pages and then rescan them.  This wasted about 30 minutes of my time.  However, the worst happened a couple of days after installing the toner and drum...the toner began leaking.  There were blotches of toner over the paper.  Based on another reviewer stating that the leaking ruined his printer, I quickly removed the toner and drum and replaced it with the original drum and toner I had, since there was some life left in them.  The blotches continued for the next 5-10 pages or so, but then stopped...thank goodness!When packaging up the toner and drum to return to Amazon, the toner leaked out and covered my hands.So, if you are on the fence like I was regarding this company and their printer accessories, do yourself a huge favor and don't make the same mistake I did by taking a chance.  Stay far away!It's too bad because the Brother accessories are so overpriced.  I tried another off-brand toner with the Brother drum (this is the toner I was aiming to replace), but the printing is much lighter than the Brother toner.  At least it isn't leaking, though.  So, I still haven't found off-brand Brother accessories with quality equivalent to the Brother accessories.  At this point, I'm thinking about ponying up the money for the Brother-branded items since right now I'm paying the price of wasting my time and dealing with cruddy-quality prints in exchange for saving some money up front on the items themselves."

They need to change the picture... I didn't see the reviews until after I ordered. You get one tube with 5 small erasers. The box looks like 12 tubes, but that is misleading. I could have gotten the eraser on top of new pencils with lead for the same or cheaper price elsewhere.
Read the negative reviews. This does not hang on the wall for very long. It is cheap and thin and a waste of money.
Misleading advertising.  It is for one refill only not the Box. You shouldn't have to go through all the reviews to get this information. They should show one refill in the picture and nothing else.

I was incredibly shocked by how terrible this product turned out to be. Three of my markers will not open , and the one that did barely wrote on the "board" (a thin sheet of cardboard with a dry erase sheet glued on), one of them had black sticky streaks all across it, and another had a peeling/broken boarder. They are tiny bits of garbage. I realize how little I paid for them but the quality is abysmal-even at this price. One star for very fast shipping.
It’s not advertised at all appropriately, but that’s my fault for not reading the other reviews. It’s gray graphite and not at all red or colored lead. I’m extremely disappointed

I have a 3170CDW and decided to try this brand of toner. I won’t buy it again. Like other reviews, the toner cartridges leak toner (powder) in the printer and the printed pages have streaks all over the place. I’m going back to my previous purchase from Inktoneram which is also an “Amazon Choice”. I have also had Linkyo brand which has been good.

All the answers to the starred questions are true. Give this a week and everything begins to break and fall off and becomes garbage. When your mother is sick and her little pager begins falling apart she becomes upset.  Anyone who is a caregiver can understand when they get upset another set of problems arise.
The top of the pen broke with very little use. I’d like a replacement but am unsure how to go about getting one. If I can get a replacement I will update my rating.
If I bought this sharpener "new" I would have rated five stars all the way but.....being used it doesn't sharpen the top blade of the scissors very well.
If possible I would give this 0 stars. Very flimsy and pieces keep coming off! I submitted a complaint to the 3m company.
Not sure why there is no review of this, the product is of good value, but the off gassing is really terrible.

See the UPDATED review at the end after 7 week of useUpdated review after 7 weeks- To our disappointment the floor of the table cracked at one corner. Thin laminate could not handle stress under regular use and failed within two months. I am going to replace it with hard plastic sheets that you get in arts store.Original review after 7 days - This is a light weight desk with a good quality. It would be great if its made little inclined , may be 15 degress angle , so kids can use a right writing posture using this table.

I love rolleer balls and this brand had a solid review and I have had what I assumed was this kind before. What I like about the bold free flowing oe. Is the the smooth lines and ease they write with.  I am writing fast and need that to remain legible without breaking my stride. I also use these pens for art which includes watercolors that need definition and cartooning. They can be a joy to use. These werw not as bikd as I hoped and the ink tended to stagger early in. What makes me angry however is how quickly the ink ran out. This is a common issue with pens today. I don't pay $3 for a own to write a couple letters and throw it out. I can't say how far these pens are supposed to go but I do know I didn't even have thechance to leave the llids of so they'd dry. I remember when one would go for an entire spiral notebook and never skip or drag. So the search goes on
There are so many good reviews of this product and I genuinely don’t get it.  This compass is a super lightweight flimsy tool.  Not impressed.

I'm sorry to give such bad review. This cover smells very much like chemicals. I went through a lot of efforts to get rid of the smell including soaking it in vinegar, airing it out for more than 2 weeks, cutting off parts that I thought caused the smell. Customer Service was great and helped my through this issue in a satisfying way though. I do not recommend this cover.

I finally opened this a few weeks ago after my mom passed. I ordered it with the intentions of copying all of the family pics & slides to share with the entire family. Mom got sick & I had no time to start the project until a few weeks ago when she passed away. This particular one appeared to be used although I didn't see anything about that in the post, the reviews were very good but the quality of mine is terrible. I ended up having to use the copy store to get clear digital images for the obit and funeral slide show. My return window has long passed & that's clearly my fault, but if you order this try it immediately incase yours is as bad as mine. I just ordered an Epson Perfection V39 Color Photo & Document Scanner (hoping it's as good as the reviews)  to scan the pics & and will use a local company to scan my slides & negatives.
Not worth the money. It is very small and I cannot use it for what I ordered it for. Not impressed. I hate it.It's only getting a one star because I can't give no star.

The stamp after a few times will not retract back into the stamp pad.  I am disappointed to say the least.  It worked fine the first few times, but now, I have tried every way I can think of, but it will not retract.  I followed the directions on the stamp and squeezed the red buttons without success.  I bought two of these with different information.  One works fine, but did not follow the left alignment that I thought I ordered.  Unless the company replies to my review and assists me with fixing the stamp, I will not purchase another one from this company.  If the company does reach out to assist, I am always open to correcting an issue.

Bought the "Valuetoner Remanufactured Ink Cartridge Replacement for Epson 802XL 802 XL T802XL to use with Workforce Pro WF-4720 WF-4730 WF-4734 WF-4740 Printer (Standard Black, Cyan, Magenta, Yellow, 4 Pack" on Amazon (which is now listed as no longer available) from this company. Today, I put the yellow in and the printer would not "recognize" it and the printer would not work! Was in a rush to finish a project. Went to Office Max and they recommended never buying a remanufactured cartridge for Epson printers and noted they could actually damage your printer. Unfortunately, I learned these wouldn't work in my printer after the return window had closed. SO DISAPPOINTED! As a small business owner, this was a BIG WASTE OF MONEY!!! Buyer beware!!! I am rarely disappointed with an Amazon product, and have used remanufactured cartridges with other printers with no problems in the past. These are NO GOOD! I wish you could give zero stars in a review.

Wish I could have given it better stars but when I sat down to fill goody bags I was short one pencil. They only gave me 23 NOT 24 which I paid for and needed as there are 24 children in the class. Ugh. Off to the store to buy a different package for just one pencil.Don’t waste your money. The people can’t count when packaging. 😕

unfortunately, I had to change my initial 5-star review to a 1-star review. I have 12 types of pen refills, none of which fit this pen. I purchased extra fine G2 refills to go along with the pen because it is explicitly stated in an answer provided by the manufacturer about refills that G2 refills work for this–they don't. I'm not going to scour the gd earth for refills, so this will sit in a drawer until the end of time once the ink runs out. I would jam it directly into the designer's eye if presented with the opportunity.After further investigation, it turns out that this isn't even brass. It's some other lacquered metal. The tube is magnetic—I noticed this by happenstance when a whiteboard magnet I had in my bag stuck to it—brass shouldn't be. I scratch-tested the item to further verify, and discovered silvery metal just beneath the buttery veneer of bs.
These are so small and light, totally useless for stopping books from sliding down. I don't believe people would give them 5 stars.

Please, please , please save your money and do not buy ink off of Amazon. When I first installed this ink, my computer {HP APP} stated that the Magenta color was used previously. I printed just a few pages {7-10} of a combination of black and colored pages and already all 3 colors are 50% depleted. At this rate, a few more pages of printing and I will be totally out of color ink. Amazon needs to crack down on these sellers repackaging HP ink. I will trust Walmart next time or better yet HP's website for my next purchase of ink!

If you actually had a 0 rating, that is what I would give these toners.  They are terrrible!  Do not work.  Had two I had to throw away and the others lasted half the time, write super light.  The box and plastic is the $$$ you paid for.  BUYER BEWARE!!  Not worth your money or time.  Stick to inkjetsuperstore.com!!!
Cost me 30+ dollars but did not last even 9 months :(Wish there was a STAR rating below 1-star !!

The item came to me damaged and missing parts. I tried to call the manufacturer to no avail. Just voice mail and when I pressed 1 for customer service, the message was that person did not accept voice mail messages.Mega Brands is the company who makes this and I think they are horrible in fulfilling an order and being reachable by phone.To make matters worse this was a Christmas gift.Save yourself grief, do not buy from this company, ANYTHING!!!I would have given ZERO stars if I could.

Bought this based on ratings but it was not clear until the package arrived and I opened the lid and there was a sticker at the bottom that says "WORKS ONLY WITH STRETCH-TITE WRAP".  This disclaimer should be at the top of the description.
Ok thought it would be bigger and not as chipped. Other reviews were so great this is to many dollars for this size.

Extremley disatisfied;I purchased two orders of this combo deal and as I was burning through the first pack - sealing my cards, I found out in my second pack that my second order of penny sleeves was not admittied!Unacceptable how unreliable this one order has caused me to feel towards this company and all of Amazon.Nowhere to be found where my penny sleeves, as are the rest of the stars for this review!

it has 1 star because i couldnt give it zero, used in the garden 4 times and is completely wrecked - i weigh 140 lbs so god knows it may only last 1 day for anyone 200 lbs + - not fit for purpose - dont waste your money
I waited a could months to write this review to see how they help up. They were cheap and broke easy.

Purchased this item hoping to save some money, but I was mistaken.This cartridge actually printed only  25 sheets or less, my advise don't buy it, you will regret it.Definitely not recommended, if could rate ZERO stars or less than minus 1 stars will be more accurate.

The setup process was smooth, the unit integrated nicely with my network. Call quality is good, perhaps a bit tinny but better than expected. However, the service is not that great of a deal, overall. I paid for the equipment upfront, I pay about $6/mo in taxes and, to get the essential call-blocking features, I have to pay an additional $10/mo. The basic service isn't compatible with Nomorobo so there is literally no soft-option for call blocking with Ooma basic and that is really aggravating. I'll have to cough up more monthly fees or buy another piece of hardware. All considering, there are other VOIP providers who would have made more economic sense. Several well-rated VOIP competitors cost around $8/mo, offer call-blocking bundled in and provide the hardware free-of-charge.

One image on the item clearly indicates that there are 25 covers in a box - I thought I was buying a box of 25 covers.  Very disappointed with this purchase - not 25 covers and not sturdy.  I guess I should have read the reviews.

I regret buying this. I was swayed by the other reviews and was certain it would handle the New York City sidewalks like so many other carts do. But literally, the first time I tried to use it, the wheels kept coming off. I had to stop and put them back on about 15 times, and they would only stick for about 30 feet at a time. The mechanism for holding the wheels on is very flimsy; it was just a bit of plastic and a pin, and once those broke it was completely unusable. I'm depressed I even wasted money on this thing. I really would not recommend buying it at all. When it came apart at a busy intersection, I abandoned it because I couldn't take it anymore.

Would prefer to give it no stars.  A piece of junk.  Do not waste your money.  Pre-drilled holes did not match up and the metal connectors are made of a soft metal that they bend.  Don't bare any weight on this as it will topple over if it doesn't break beforehand.
It is basically a bumper sticker. Shipping alone was worth more than the sign. 2-stars because it arrived in good shape and was more or less what was advertised.

This was my second one of these and now I am fed up enough to write a review. The product is a great idea overall, it is just not durable. The metal line and the sturdy feel are great, but the reeling component (the most important part) has broken quickly and often. After numerous repair jobs, my second one of these finally crapped out and I am done with them. The cheaper ones with thin string line last much longer. Do yourself a favor, save the money and frustration, just buy a cheaper one.

So I've only had two letter openers in my lifetime.  The long one where you just slip under the flap and this one.  I lost my long one so I needed another one.  This isn't a good replacement.  Not sure if people are getting this cheap thing free, but it would be good if you could read reviews and get honest opinions.  When you put it under the flap, it's good but along the way, pieces of paper flakes fall on the floor and when you get to the end of the envelope, it doesn't glide all the way, you have to force it to the end.  Gonna return this thing and go back to the long one, which also won't cut my finger in an accident.
awful. I ordered it b/c reviews said it came flat.  It did not.  It is also thin and develops dents you can't roll out of.
This review is based on adhesion and strength. Neither are up to par. We attempted to use this to hang a sign on a metal frame. The sign fell along with the adhesive.

I would never have thought I would have to write this review. I love this company, and I have ordered their beautiful calendars for many years. No more. As I was filling in the early part of 2018 and looking through the rest of the pages, I noticed that all the Jewish holidays were missing. I wrote the company, thinking that surely that was an oversight, since many holidays not even celebrated in the U.S.were listed. As I never got a response from the company, I called them. I thought surely they would need to do a reprint. I was told that I got the Catholic calendar, and that is the only calendar without the Jewish holidays. Now this particular calendar has Bible verses (which is the main reason I ordered it), from Psalms and Proverbs as well as the New Testament. I was floored at her answer. I said that Scripture verses are not exclusively Catholic, and that I am not Catholic or Jewish either, but I am appalled. She said they make over 70 calendars and that this is the only one without the Jewish holidays. I told her that she was not making this conversation go any better,  that I am the wife of a Messianic Jew, and we are both shocked and appalled. Anti-Semitism has no place here. From now on, I will choose another company.

I purchased two of these cartridges a little less than a year ago, so this review speaks volumes about the longevity of this product.When I initially installed and started using this product, I would have given it five stars in a heartbeat. It worked great for about 4 or 5 months, but then the issues began. I started getting streaking toner and what looked like low toner levels (after ~400 pages). I am a tech savvy grad student, so I did all of the troubleshooting including cleaning the cartridge, shaking it, reinstalling, etc. The cartridge had most of the toner remaining in it, but I could not get it to print without issues. Nothing worked.I finally gave up and installed the second cartridge. It worked like a charm......for about 4 or 5 months. The same issues with streaking and light printing started occurring with this cartridge as well. I print about 1000 pages per year, so these two cartridges should have lasted (theoretically) 5 years. In reality, they lasted less than a year.If you do the math, the price per page is equivalent to the Brother cartridge, which is disappointing. I am about to purchase a different set of non-oem cartridges to see if they work any better. I'll leave a review on those in a year or two!
SAVE YOUR MONEY THIS DOES NOT WORK AT ALL. I SHOULD HAVE TAKEN THE ADVISE OF THE OTHER REVIEWERS ON HERE.

ten months ater purchase & installation, I am throwing in the towel. This replacement cartridge never printed in full black text. I am sick of gray text and will have to pay the big bucks for a real replacement. I am surprised this got good reviews from anyone, so maybe mine is a dud. We tried shaking the toner cartridge (age-old trick) and reinserting it a few times, but it just prints documents in medium gray.
I gave it one star because it was not correct cartridge for my printer.  Mine takes a CLI-8C.  I guess my fault but feel the manufacture should not have two cartridges with similar numbers

Bought it twice and  two times the line broke. The first time I thought maybe a bad reel. The second one didnt even last a month. The reel casing is metal instead of the usual plastic reels but the line is weak and it breaks. You just end up getting stuck with a heavy duty reel and a completely retracted line therfore rendering the reel useless. Maybe could be used paper weight but I am sure that is not the reason you are reading this review. Someone needs to revisit the design and use a different material  for the line instead of the flimsy one being used now. Only then it would be a heavy duty reel.

I got this for my grandchild and she could not use chalk on it because it looked like it had wax on it and one side broke so needless to say the trash dumpster received another product.unfortunately you have to make a rating on this produt but the one star should be a zero star.

I'm only going to give 2 out of 5 stars. I counted the tabs to make sure I had over a 1000, which I did. While counting, i found random junk such as part of a can, a nail, a hair clip and some hair. I can assure you my hair is not short and black. There was 1004 silver tabs, 19 big random tabs, 92 colored tabs and 2 broken can tabs. I read in the description that these would have been washed prior to being sent. My fingers say otherwise. Please remove that part of the description if you aren't going to do it. If you don't care about size,color, dirt or the danger of nails, these are the tabs for you.
Didn’t buy it but it’s in my shopping list review?!
I had not seen the other negative reviews.  But this cartridge dod not have the locking tab, so my 2280DW printer could not recognize the cartridge.

I thought I'd try to save a few dollars and get the "remanufactured cartridges", BIG mistake, I have the epson 446 and it has poor print quality and prints all of my pictures with a green/yellow tint, I wish I would have read the reviews first, instead of after my purchase, lesson learned, hopefully this review will help someone else, just spend the extra few bucks and get the actual epson ink

Unfortunately, I forgot to look at the reviews before my purchase. Spent hours putting it together only for the drawer to get stuck. The drawers do not glide easily and it is not a user error. I’m just disappointed I wasted so much time putting it together to have take it apart and return it. Time is money!

There is a great deal of difference between "Remanufactured" and simply filling an empty cartridge with ink. I do not believe that this company knows the difference. I  bought two cartridges. I tried both of them 3.5 months later. BOTH of them had dry and crusted ink between the printhead and stuck onto the rubber sponge in the holder. It was stuck SO hard that in spite of very slow removal, the printhead ripped the rubber sponge and tore part off. I wrote an honest and sensible letter to the manufacturer and told them of my difficulties. I was met with a FIRM "Those cartridges are only warranted for 90 days. You are over that. I'm sorry, but there is NOTHING I can do for you." Allrighty then! So much for THIS company and the member of their "customer satisfaction TEAM."My experience with MANY different printers and cartridges are that on a new sealed cartridge that is as old as 4 YEARS out of date that the cartridge performs PERFECTLY. One would think that a genuine REMANUFACTURED item would work out of the sealed container at LEAST 6 months later. Not so on these worthless items. It is difficult to believe that the company would not at least offer me a replacement set after I returned these. They refused to talk about these cartridges any further than they already had. Take a peek at the one star ratings. There are almost as many 1 ratings as 5 ratings. Perhaps they have two shifts? One shift with someone that knows something about refilling or REMANUFACTURING and one that is told to "fillerup".  You decide. I am relating ONLY my personal experience with this company.

The area that the laptop rests in is metal, so if you have a Macbook like I do, your metal edge will rub against the metal of that area. I am referring to the bottom section underneath the lip.Otherwise I'd give this 5 stars. It's light and seems pretty well made. A bit awkward to adjust, if you plan on using it in different places and positions it could be a real pain to adjust constantly.

They work and they are regular pens nothing special. I rate them low because of the hype that they didn't live up to. I also don't like the way the ink clumps up on the tip and I have to clean it off before use. Some of the pens are worst than other so this just adds inconsistency to mix. So for less than a buck it will do but I have owned better for the same or less cost.

If I could give it 0 stars I would! Missing the needle so it's worthless. I ordered it to make tagging for a consignment sale easier. I ordered it early so I'd have it when I needed it. Just opened it to start tagging and I can't use it and since I was so on top of my game by ordering it early I can't return it. So in summation, it's a piece of crap, don't waste your money.
Clearly, everything Casper says above is correct. This is either a mistake or an intentional attempt at a rip-off. Should be ZERO stars. STAY AWAY!!!
NOT WORTH EVEN 1 STAR  . I only recieved 1 pen not 12
Dont believe the claims - Cartridge rejected by printer. Would give zero stars if possible.
I was sent silver age bags repackaged as modern bags. false advertising and bad salesmanship.  I am not happy with my purchase. There should be an option for zero stars.

I have a Kodak ESP9250.  The ink is low quality, barely prints on the paper if it prints at all. The Color Cartridges had no Magenta at all on top of barely printing. I can't believe Amazon allows this to be sold on their site. I buy a lot from Amazon and I am very dissatisfied with this product. Wish I could give this NEGATIVE STARS

As with every other review, I wish I would have read the reviews first. The picture makes it seem like this is 2 different posters but it is 2 sided so you can display both. It makes no sense why this would even be like this. I never would have paid the money for this bad I known.

I bought this in spite of the bad reviews as it was the only plastic file cab I could find.  Sterilite used to make a great one, but they discontinued it.  As others have noted, it tips over when you open it, which makes it hard to close again.  It is OK for just a few files, or maybe if you took off the wheels it wouldn't tip.

I've purchased several sets of nylon brush tip markers and these are by far the worst.  Im so disappointed and I've already set up the return.  Im uploading a photo to demonstrate my primary issues.  The first is most easily visible: the brush tips split apart.  Add that to the fact that some of the markers aren't very "juicy", and you get markers that aren't consistently useful unless you plan to blend them with a water brush every time.My biggest complaint is the ink.  It's terrible.  I swatched every color in the box,  and while some blend well,  many do not.  I read other reviews that said you have to use specific paper with these markers...i tried both the Strathmore 90lb watercolor visual journal paper and the Strathmore Bristol Smooth surface paper.  The performance was better on the smooth surface paper  (which is not the point of watercolor markers), but even then some colors like A188 wisteria purple just wouldn't blend. Don't waste your time or money on these.

I should have minded the reviews.  same thing happened to me.  I like the way the pen writes and looks. The problem is that when i put the cap on, it bent a thin guide bar in the cap that bent and i couldnt close the cap again. It Its a shame because I really like parker pens and its such an unnecessary problem and design flaw.

From the photos and reading reviews I was under the assumption that what I was buying was a quality dry erase calendar....what arrived was nothing more than maybe 1/2" thick and weighed hardly anything at all. Basically all you are purchasing is a very thin piece of cardboard with handful of accessories and the possibility of some functionality. Does not come with any kind of hanging device other than some 3M PERMANENT hanging stickers. THESE WILL TEAR PAINT FROM WALLS, you have been warned. Will be sent back to Amazon first thing tomorrow and I will spend a few dollars more for a board that's going to last a little while.

There is no measurement, which is fine, but at its widest point it makes 7.5" circles, not 8" circles, so if you're looking for a true 8" compass, look elsewhere. There are caps on the ends of of the center screw that prevent it from going to 4". When I remove those caps and put it to 4" the whole thing literally falls apart. It comes in a nice zip closure package and looks presentable, if using it for 7.5" or less it's acceptable. Hence, 2 stars. Not quite as advertised, but decent enough for what it is.

Ill admit to not having too much experience with fountain pens, but no pen should be this hard to write with.  The first time I received this it was completely dysfunctional.  The ink that came with the pen ran to the point of leaving a small puddle on my desk after leaving it unattended for five minutes.  My own noodlers ink however simply did not work at all.  After I got a replacement for this one thinking that it was just a one time thing I was only partially right.  While the provided ink still dripped like a water faucet my noodlers ink worked after almost thirty minutes of coaxing.  Since then I have only refilled it twice but it has never smoothly gone through a full cartridge without drying out for no plain reason.  I have a cheap little plastic fountain pen that so far works without fail and uses the ink cartridges that this pen couldn't without issue.  Based on other reviews I would say that my pen just has issues.  While it doesn't work like it should, when the ink does run nicely it is a great pen that I love to use... right up until it stops working again.
Finally, I realized that to save money and frustration review products hands on. Stop wasting my money on junk. Look for other options.

My wife has used this cart for a year now.  We are aware of the other negative reviews that said the cart can easily tip over on any uneven surfaces and we were careful about it.  However, last week, when my wife was returning home from a grocery trip, the front wheel tripped over a small uneven part on of the sidewalk.  She fell forward and landed on top of the cart.  She severely injured herself with large bruises on both legs.  I wasn't there and she was left by herself to limp back home with a cart full of groceries.  This cart is good when you're at the supermarket with level surfaces, but it can be treacherous when you use it outside.  Any small bump on the sidewalk would stop this cart and there'd be a good chance you'll stumble or fall.  We're not going to use this anymore and I'm going to look for a better alternative.

My mom bought this for me for Christmas, and I'm very disappointed. I had read the reviews and thought this would work really well for me. Right out of the box, one of the screws holding the leg to the desk fell out and would not be screwed back in. A few weeks later, the same piece fell out of another leg, rendering the desk useless. I'm really bummed out because I really wanted this to work for me, but I ended up throwing it away after only using it a few times. It was a great concept, but it just did not live up to what I had read about it. Overall, I would not recommend this desk for purchase.

This planner is infuriating. Did anybody in the design team realize that they should have put  “Month Ahead At A Glance” in the front of the book and then the “Monthly Review” at the end of the month. And the same layout for the next 30 days.Some of the things the ask you to record are repetitive. There’s also no section for just random notes you may need. It needs to be simplified.I appreciate what the book says but from a design background/perspective I can’t get over the layout. I wanted this book to feel like it was MADE FOR ME. This feeling that just hits my heart and makes the book feel like my personal assistant but they honestly dropped the ball.I really wanted to like this book. I hope someone from the design team sees this and makes a 2.0 version. I would buy it then I think. Unfortunately I already started writing in it before I realized it so I can’t return it. Maybe I’ll just make a copy of the month ahead and staple it to a page in the front so the book will work then. Idk.

I get bands from the bank all the time and decided to buy my own. The printing on the bands seemed like the company ran out of ink as they were printing these bands and the lines on the bands were not evenly spaced. I'm giving this product a star because at least the adhesive works. The picture I attached shows you the bands I bought from amazon vs the "official" bands banks use.

I opened the first cartridge and spewed ink all over my beige  carpet as well as all over my hands.  I printed two pages.  Neither printed well.  I started to print again today - my printer told me the ink cartridge needed to be replaced.  I took out the second cartridge, this time holding it over my computer desk - I now have ink splattered all over my desk, as well as some papers I was working on.  Oh yeah - my hands are covered again.  All I did was remove the orange tray they are shipped in.  I am beyond angry.  The one star rating is way too high.  I don't think there is anything that will take the ink out of my carpet.  When I tried to blot it up it just spread around.  If you buy this garbage my suggestion is to be VERY careful when you take the packing tray off.  Unless you don't mind having everything splattered with black ink.  And two pages per cartridge,  Give me a break.

Only reason why I am giving it a 2 star is because it worked right out of the box and installed pretty easy.  The trouble is that after no more than 5000 prints, it's now printing light vertical stripes to light streaks up and down in 3 column on every page.  It turns out that this is a COMMON problem reported by many Xerox ColorQube customers.  They walk you through a process of cleaning, running cleaning page, we even replaced the maintenance kit, check the debris tray.  We have done everything!  This printer is a piece of s***  People beware...again this is a common problem as we discovered but it's too late to return.  Oh, well now we've learned.  I honestly think they should recall this printer and swap out customers devices with newer & working Xerox color printer.  I have been loyal Xerox customers for over 20 years and now we're surprised to find these qualities is not representative of what the company and the brand have always stood for.

I almost cut myself putting it together.  The center pin and one blade broke on the first use. It left a jagged and obvious patch.  The only reason I am giving it one star is that I can't give it no stars.

I wouldn't buy this again.1.  The instructions don't tell you how to dump the shavings.  (You squeeze at the right place on the shavings bucket -- that's on upper corners.  There are no markings there -- you have to know.)2.  It doesn't work on normal size round pencils.  The hole is fractionally under 8mm so the 8mm ones (common colored pencils made in metric system countries)  have to be forced in using two hands and it's all but impossible to turn the pencil while sharpening as several reviewers recommend.In theory you could use a rat-tail file to slightly enlarge the cover and inside holes.  In practice the switch that turns the thing on sticks into the inside hole so if you file down there you'll likely disable the thing.Might be okay if all you have is the (smaller)  standard hex leadpencil.
I printed approx. 40 9x11  pages of  my toolbox inventory and got the low ink message!!!! Not near 315 sheets guys! Never again will I buy Ink online!  Your lucky to get 1 star. What a scam!

Purchased 2/7/15, date of review 3/23/15.  Wish I would have read other reviews before purchasing.  This sign is not 24X14.  It is 21X12, which is perfectly fine with me.  For the first few weeks I was happy with the overall functionality of the sign.  I like that is is oval and that the blue lights will create a movement to catch people's eye.  However, less than 2 months after purchasing the sign, it has malfunctioned.  The red lights do not stay consistently bright.  Sometimes the O and the P are dim while the E and N are bright.  Other times, the E and N are dim while the O and P are bright.  The chain that came with the light was not long enough for my situation, but I purchased a chain at a local hobby store that worked great.  Now, if the sign would just work properly, I would be happy.  Contacting the seller today to see what they are willing to do.  I will update this when I see what their response is.UPDATE 4/10/2015.  I was given a refund by Amazon for the 1st defective light, in late March.  Stupidly, I decided to give the light another chance, but from a different seller (as advised by Amazon).  The 2nd light, which was received from a different seller was received not working.  It also had 2 letters that would not light.  That seller sent me a replacement (making this my 3rd one!!!) and it was GREAT for a WEEK!!!  After just ONE WEEK,  the blue lights around the letters STOPPED WORKING!!!! I do NOT recommend this product!!! It should be BANNED FROM AMAZON!!!  Today, I had to file a complaint with Amazon due to the poor service of the company involved.  Guess I will be purchasing a sign locally for over $100.  Guess the old saying is true, "You get what you pay for!"!!!

To echo prior reviews, it is a gamble when you order these, as to how many cartridges will work for the long term.  The review should probably be 2.5 starts, since these are just okay, and we continue to order them despite problems.  I have purchased these several times through my prime account and through our office account, and have occasionally had the entire package of cartridges work, but more often one or two of the color cartridges fails / leaks / streaks or stops being recognized by the printer.  Occasionally the problem occurs right away after installation, but more often than not the problem crops up about one week into use.  LD is mostly pretty good about replacing a defective cartridge, but sometimes because we order the larger packs, we don't install the cartridges right away.  So, while the price is great (about a third of the OEM), the savings has to be balanced against the time lost to fiddling around with the cartridges and trying to clean them and get them to keep producing; the time lost dealing with replacing the cartridge(s); the time lost while the HP printer pauses and goes into cleaning mode (sometimes two or three times on a 100 page copying job); and the frustration of having the printer become useless when we have critical color print jobs.
DO NOT BUY IT, IT IS NOT AL-STAR.My pen has a plastic body, not aluminum as advertised. IT'S CHEATING!
